campaign.story:
Hello Potential Backers! Welcome to the Campaign to fund Swords of Cerebus In Hell? Hardcovers Volume 1 and 2!
I'm proud to present the Hardcover editions of Volumes 1 and 2 of SWORDS OF CEREBUS IN HELL?. Swords of Cerebus In Hell? is the ambitious monthly reprinting of the entire run of Cerebus in Hell?!  Each volume will collect 4 issues. There are currently 10 volumes planned, with more to come next year! With your help, there can be Hardcover editions of every volume! 
Swords of Cerebus In Hell? Volume 1 collects issues #1-4 of the original CIH? mini-series.  
Swords of Cerebus In Hell? Volume 2 collects the first four CIH? one-shots: Batvark #1: Aardvark Comics #1: Strange Cerebus #1: The Death of Cerebus in Hell? #1.
These Hardcovers are limited to 150 copies and will not be made available at retail. 100 copies of each volume are being offered here. The remainder will be used to replaced lost or damaged books, if that need arises. Books remaining after that will be sold on future Swords of CIH? campaigns. (After this campaign has been fulfilled and everyone is satisfied. Naturally.)
Volume 1 has arrived and is ready to go as soon as the campaign ends! Volume 2 should arrive before the campaign is over.
Each book is individually numbered.  If you have a CAN's number between 4-150, let me know, and I'll be delighted to send you that number (If it's available. Sometimes the digital numbering processes skips numbers and repeats others.)  Otherwise, books will be sent on a first-come first-served basis.
Each book has a dust jacket with black gloss cover underneath.
Stretch Goals!  
 $3,000- UNLOCKED! A trading card will be added to each volume! (You get two copies of the card if you order both books.) 
$6,000- UNLOCKED! A second trading card will be added to each volume! (You get two copies of both cards if you order both books.) Additionally, this will open up a new tier: "Trading Cards" which will allow backers to purchase additional sets of the cards. 
$9,000- UNLOCKED! An exclusive tip-in book plate signed by Benjamin Hobbs will be added to all books. Each volume will have it's own unique bookplate. 
$12,000- UNLOCKED! A third trading card will be added to each volume! (You get two copies of all cards if you order both books.) 
$15,000- UNLOCKED! A forth trading card will be added to each volume! (You get two copies of all cards if you order both books.)

Please note: the art on the trading cards is still in progress.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The first volume has already arrived. It's ready to ship when the campaign ends.

The second volume is at the printers right now, and should arrive before the end of the campaign. It too should be ready to ship as soon as the campaign ends.

The biggest issue that might arise in the numbering. Occasionally in the digital numbering process, numbers are missing or repeat. I can fulfill specific numbers between 4-150, if they are available.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
A GIANT THANK YOU to everyone one of you! Without your support, this campaign would not have been the success that it has been.  

Surveys have gone out, so if you haven't yet filled one out, please take the time to do so! Thanks to everyone who filled them out already!

Greetings Everyone! 
Volume 2 has arrived from the printer!

Hello Everyone!
Thank you for your generous support in this project! We've unlocked the fourth stretch goal, so every volume will now have a DANTE Card as well as CEREBUS and BATVARK! (Two of each if you backed both volumes.) 
The third stretch goal, the bookplate, is well underway.  Here are the current mock-ups.

Hello Everyone! Thank you so much for your tremendous support! 
The first three Stretch goals have been unlocked! That means that every book comes with 2 trading cards: Cerebus and Batvark! (The two volume sets come with two of each.) And every volume will include a bookplate! I'll post mock-ups of the book plates in the coming days.
I've added two new stretch goals!

campaign.story:
What You Will Learn:
Learn the skills you need to design your own models for 3d printing using Blender, a powerful 3d modeling software application that is free and open source.
Bring your ideas into the physical world by designing in Blender for 3d printing.
Render your designs using Blender's advanced render engines to visualize your projects before you print.
Export your custom 3d models to Cura to prepare them for 3d printing.
Learn to design your own unique creations from the initial idea stage to a complete finished 3d model.
Blender Workspace:
Course Description:
There are many great 3d models available to download online for 3d printing, however having the ability to design your own objects opens a whole new world of opportunities for 3d printing. This is what makes 3d printing really powerful: being able to think of something you want to create, and being able to make it in the real world.

Prerequisites:
No prior 3d modeling experience is needed to take this course. It is designed for both beginners and intermediate level designers.
Basic computer skills. 

Featured Course Project
Learn how to make this 1:65000 ratio gearbox that I used in this YouTube video:
Course Outline:  
Blender for 3d Printing - Course Projects:
Phone Stand
Gearbox
Succulent Planters
Household / Workshop Designs

Course Instructor: 
Blender Course Features:
  Access your online video course on www.3dprinteracademy.com

Teaching Style:
Hands on project based
Learn by doing
Practical Applications

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my 5th Kickstarter Campaign for 3D Printer Academy and I have successfully delivered on each campaign with satisfied backers every time. My website is fully built out with my own custom e-learning backend that works great. I have a strong following on Instagram: @3d_printer_academy and my Youtube channel is growing consistently. I will continue filming videos during the campaign with the goal of completing all videos by the end of the campaign. Course outline subject to change. Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or concerns and I will be more than happy to help. -Steven

campaign.story:
NEW!
 Last Minute Stretch Goal! $90,000
SPECIAL ONE OF A KIND PERK
FOR A LIMITED TIME
If you pledge more than $2,500
In addition to the perks you pledge for, you'll get a Special one on one producer apprenticeship with David Bartlett on the set of Space Command.
Producer David Bartlett will give you one on one instruction and inside information on how a film or TV show is produced while seeing it happen on the et of Space Command
Answering of any questions you have
Meeting creators Marc and Elaine Zicree, some of the actors and key crew personnel during and after the shoot
Plus you'll get two tickets to the World Premiere of Redemption at the Grauman's Chinese Theater in December!


 Just Added - NEW PERKS! 
 An AVATAR of You in Space Command!
VIP Red Carpet Premiere of Redemption!

 BRAND NEW - Add-ons! 
We now have Add-ons! These are perks you can add to your contribution individually and in addition to the other perk levels. There are many to choose from and include virtually every perk we offer! Can't decide which perk level you want? Now you can get both! Want and extra Patch added to your Patches perk? Now you can get that added on too! 
TO GET YOUR ADD-ONs:
Simply choose any perk level (even our "$1 Create Your Own Perk Package") and before you check out, you'll be given your Add-on perk choices. Just click the Add-ons you want (there can be as many as you want) and it will be added to your cart. Keep in mind that physical add-ons need to be attached to a physical perk, so if you want a digital item and a physical one, get the physical one as a perk and add-on the rest. (FYI: the Create Your Own Perk Package is listed as a "Physical Perk")



We will be delivering all electronic perks one month after Kickstarter delivers us your information, and we will be delivering all the physical perks one month after that.*
*This does not include those perks listed below with special circumstances. 
PLAY

 Space Command is a hopeful vision of the future, a science fiction TV series starring legends of sci-fi and the silver screen such as Doug  Jones, Nichelle Nichols, Robert Picardo, the late Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Armin Shimerman, Barbara Bain, Christina Moses, J.G. Hertzler, James Hong, Bruce Boxleitner, Michael Harney, Ethan McDowell, John Hennigan, Faran Tahir and many more big names to be announced soon!
This epic series covers 180 years in the lives of four families, and is written, directed and produced by Marc Scott Zicree, who has writing credits on dozens of shows over the past 40 years -- Star Trek: The Next Generation, Deep Space Nine, Babylon 5,  Sliders, The Real Ghostbusters, Smurfs, He-Man, as well as the bestselling Magic  Time trilogy of novels, Guillermo del Toro’s Cabinet of Curiosities and the Twilight Zone Companion.
Season One Consists of an Audio Play Prequel, six two-hour stories split into Twelve Filmed One-Hour Episodes, and a special Two-Hour Episode that all form a larger arc. So far, the Audio Play, the first three One-Hour Episodes, and the Two-Hour Special Episode have been shot – with the fourth episode currently in pre-production!

Here are some of the Perks available in this Campaign!
Just Added - NEW PERKS!
DVDs and Blurays
 Greenlighting Yourself!
Just $187 gets you an Autographed advance galley copy, the Greenlighting Yourself T-Shirt, AND an exclusive Group Call with Marc to ask for advice or any questions you might have!
Get this T-shirt as an add-on or part of the Greenlighting Yourself perk!
And speaking of T-Shirts, see below! \/ \/ \/ \/
Get any of these as a Perk or Add-on or get all 5 at a substantial discount!
Play an Alien, Keep the Mask! [UPDATE!]
Cloyd has been taken, only 1 Alien (Gidney) left available!

 Marc's Star Trek Dossier! It's so big, we split it into 3 Folders! Get them all as a stand-alone reward, as part of the Ultimate Star Trek Fan package, or individually as Add-Ons!
Great Classic Perks
Space Command Souvenir Pin - Get one with every level that includes physical perks!
Space Command Insignia Patches, get Gold, Silver, or One of Each!
Samples from the Rare Twilight Zone Bundle
Film negatives from Marc Zicree's Interviews!
a RARE color production still from "Time Enough at Last" autographed by Burgess Meredith
SAMPLE PAGES OF THE STAR TREK/SCIENCE FICTION SCRAPBOOKS FROM 1966-1969
Dozens and dozens of pieces of 50 year old history. These are a real blast from the past!
Notice the date? January 12th, 1968. This is only one third of the letter that is included.
 Comic Book Cover Art
Issue #1 (Available now)

Mira Furlan Special Edition Issue #2 with Cover Art by Tehani Farr


Issue #3 (Coming Soon)
3D Printer File for Paladin Model
 Four Hours of Space Command Are Finished – And Can Be Yours Now! 
These include:
1. UNITED PLANET – The Space Command Prequel Audio Play, starring Doug Jones, Michael Harney, Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Ethan McDowell, Bruce Boxleitner, Bryan McClure, Aungelique Scott, Nathaniel Freeman andVictor Manso.
2. REDEMPTION, Part One – The Space Command Pilot, starring Doug Jones, Michael Harney, Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Ethan McDowell, Bruce Boxleitner, Bryan McClure, Nathaniel Freeman and Victor Manso. Available as an HD download.
3. RIPPLE EFFECT, Hour One – Shot entirely during the Covid-19 Pandemic, our stars shot their own scenes in their own homes with their own cameras! Stars include Neil deGrasse Tyson, Nichelle Nichols, Doug Jones, Michael Harney, Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Ethan McDowell, Bryan McClure, Aungelique Scott, Nathaniel Freeman and Victor Manso.
4. RIPPLE EFFECT, Hour Two – As above, shot by the actors in Los Angeles, upstate New York, Northern California, Atlanta, Portugal and Saskatchewan!
In addition, REDEMPTION PART TWO has been shot and will have its 900-plus visual effects shots completed very soon, possibly by the end of this campaign!
Beyond this, the next episode, FORGIVENESS PART ONE has been shot and is in post-production, with our studio prepping FORGIVENESS PART TWO to be filmed in the next few months!
Still from our Prequel Animatic, "United Planet"
 Space Command Forgiveness part 2 
Space Command Forgiveness Part 2  is the fourth episode in this epic science fiction adventure series. Some principal photography has been completed thanks to our last campaign. This campaign is to help fund the remainder of its shoot at our Space Command Studios.
Recognize any of these names?
Marc Zicree holding a copy of The Twilight Zone Companion
Space Command stars include many,  many science fiction legends, past and present!  
Star Trek Discovery, Shape of Water, Hell Boy, Pans Labyrinth
Babylon 5, Lost in Space, Star Trek Deep Space Nine
Star Trek: Voyager, The Orville, Total Recall, Stargate
Babylon 5, Tron
Project Blue Book, Orange is the New Black
Doom Patrol, The Gifted, Teenage Bounty Hunters
Babylon 5, Lost
 STARRING In SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS... 
Big Trouble in Little China, Seinfeld
Star Trek, Iron Man, Elysium
WWE Superstar, GLOW
 Featured In Ripple Effect...
Star Trek: The Original Series
COSMOS
A Million Little Things
Star Trek Deep Space Nine, Buffy the Vampire Slayer
Space 1999, Mission Impossible
Star Trek Deep Space Nine, Voyager, Enterprise
Additional Stars
Space Command also has a group of incredible up-and-coming Hollywood actors in starring and supporting roles. Here they are: 
Don Baldaramos, Sara Maraffino, Nathaniel Freeman, Victor Manso
Dallas Malloy, Bryan McClure, Barbara Lee Bragg, Ryan T. Husk
Coley Speaks, Elle Sonnet, Justin Sorvillo, Jelena Mrdja
Marc and Elaine Zicree, co-directing on the set of Space Command
Marc & Elaine Zicree have written and  produced hundreds of hours of series TV, pilots and feature films for  most of the major studios and networks, including Paramount, Universal,  Disney, Sony/Columbia Tri-Star, MGM, Warners, Castle Rock, New Line,  CBS, NBC, ABC, Fox, WB, UPN, Showtime, PBS, Turner, USA Networks, Syfy,  Discovery, Nickelodeon, the BBC, Marvel, Scholastic, ITV and NPR. Among  their credits are classic episodes of Star Trek – The Next Generation,  Sliders, Babylon 5, Deep Space Nine, Friday the 13th – The Series,  Smurfs, Superfriends, He-Man, Captain Power and the Soldiers of the  Future, The Littles, Forever Knight, Liberty’s Kids and The Real  Ghostbusters, among many others.
Marc and Elaine’s work has been nominated for the Hugo Award,  American Book Award, Humanitas Prize, Nebula Award and Diane Thomas  Award, and has won the prestigious Hamptons Prize, TV Guide Award, Rondo  and Saturn Awards. In 2014, Marc was named a Writers Guild Diversity  Honoree.








 A word from creator, Marc Zicree:
"As a kid I loved STAR TREK, TWILIGHT ZONE,  OUTER LIMITS, FORBIDDEN PLANET and grew up to write for such great  shows as STAR TREK – THE NEXT GENERATION, DEEP SPACE NINE, BABYLON 5,  SLIDERS and more.
I often hear fans say, “Why are there so  few good sci-fi shows on TV, and why do so many go south?” I can tell  you – frankly, most of the network suits just don’t get it.
But you and I do.
So when I recently got the idea of creating  a new show inspired by the sense of wonder and possibility science  fiction gave me as a kid, I realized I didn’t need a network or studio  to make my dream come true -- just Kickstarter and you.
Thanks for making it happen."
Where are we now?
This is the progress of the Space Command epic series. Episodes are coupled, into two-parters. For example, episodes one and two are coupled, three and four are coupled, etc.. Each episode is one hour, divided into two 30-minute chapters.
EPISODE 1 - SPACE COMMAND: REDEMPTION PART 1
completed, and released!
EPISODE 2 - SPACE COMMAND: REDEMPTION PART 2
principal photography completed
postproduction is funded and nearly complete!
EPISODE 3 - SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS PART 1 (Chapters 1 and 2)
principal photography completed
postproduction, editing, VFX, are being completed
EPISODE 4 - SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS PART 2 (Chapters 3 and 4)
principal photography scheduled
our goal here is to fund production of the 4th chapter
EPISODE 5 - SPACE COMMAND: THE GREAT SOLAR WAR PART 1
coming soon...
Concept Poster for The Great Solar War (Episodes 5 & 6)

Concept Design for Alien Control Room
Faran Tahir as Kasan
James Hong as Elder Michael
John Hennigan as Combat Synthetic
Captain Kemmer (Ethan McDowell) and the Crew of the Paladin
Spaceship Corridor on Red Alert
We cannot do this without you. You can support us  financially, or just by helping us spread the word. Here are additional ways you can help:
Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or any social media
Emailing the campaign to your friends
Follow us on social media and keep the positivity going on our pages
But rest assured, every dollar secured will go to completing Space Command!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Raising funds via crowd funding is very difficult. But we are confident in our product and confident in the support of the fantastic fans of the science fiction community. Together, we can make this series come to life! We will make every effort to fulfill all perks, but keep in mind it might take longer than expected.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Star Trek Super Fan Bundle
support.descp:
Select digital rewards above, plus:
You'll get Two downloadable Star Trek Scrapbooks, created by Marc Zicree! These TWO SCRAPBOOKS are absolute historical gems (images are in the story section). These are collections of Star Trek/sci-fi pictures, handwritten letters, autographs, newspaper clippings, and magazines articles from 1966-1969!! All of these images were collected by Marc Zicree 50 years ago and kept safe in these scrapbooks since then. Every page of these two scrap books will be scanned and sent to you along with a note about it all from Mr. Zicree.
You'll also receive a digital VIDEO of Marc going through the Scrapbooks and sharing memories with Nichelle Nichols on the set of Space Command.
We'll also send you a digital STAR TREK TIME CAPSULE which includes a bundle of videos, papers, etc.. from yesteryear.
Lastly, you will also get a "THANKS" CREDIT in the end credits of Forgiveness Part Two as well as on IMDb!
(If you don't have an IMDb page, we'll make one for you!)

Scan of Star Trek Scrapbook Vol. 1

support.title: AN AVATAR OF YOU IN SPACE COMMAND
support.descp:
This is a rare chance for you to be in a Space Command! You could wear a uniform, be a Synthetic or another type of human and more!
Award-winning Visual Effects Artist Joe Lawson (The Lord of the Rings) will create an avatar likeness of YOU to be placed in potentially several episodes, so you could be in many scene in the Space Command saga! You could stand next to the Paladin, explore the surface of Callisto, walk the streets of Mars, or find yourself abandoned in space to float for eternity. We will also give you the master file for your own use, for printing and signing copies in 2d and 3d for whatever you like! After the campaign is over we will give you full instruction on how to proceed. Then Joe will create your avatar, send you the assets as a Blender file (a free program), and voila!
Be a unique part of Space Command and become an animated avatar today! (this perk gives Space Command LLC the right to use your likeness in all future productions without compensation or credit)
INCLUDES:
An Avatar of You in Space Command
Donor's Only VIP Group

support.title: VIP Redemption World Premiere Passes
support.descp:
Attend the red-carpet world premiere screening of Space Command Redemption!
You and a guest are invited to the world premiere screening of Space Command redemption at the world-famous Chinese Theater in Hollywood, California. You will be walking the red carpet, getting your picture taken, and attending the pre-premiere reception. You will have an opportunity to meet co-creators Marc and Elaine Zicree as well as some of the attending actors involved with the film. You will then watch the screening in the world-famous Chinese Theater and attend the after-party reception as well. *
This is once in a lifetime opportunity, as there will only be one first Hollywood premiere of Redemption episodes one and two!
Includes:
• VIP red carpet
• Preshow VIP reception
• Meeting creators Marc and Elaine Zicree
• World premiere screening of Redemption parts one and two
• VIP after screening reception
• Donors only VIP group

Want to be in Space Command but just can't make it out to LA? Get this perk and you'll get a Virtual Speaking Role. You'll film yourself AT HOME in front of a green screen or even on your couch and we'll put it in Space Command! You'll have a one-line speaking part. We'll work with you and give you the script for your scene and all the instructions you need. You'll even have a directed session to rehearse your line via Zoom! Plus we'll give you a Character Name and put you in the Credits and on IMDB! You'll be able to say, "Hey, that's ME in Space Command!" We'll also throw in the complete Script for Redemption and Forgiveness!
INCLUDES:
Virtual Speaking Role in Space Command: Forgiveness
PDF of Redemption and Forgiveness Scripts
Character Name in Credits and on IMDB for Ep. 4
Donor's Only VIP Group

Plus, a copy of the Forgiveness Script Autographed by Cast and Crew, Behind the Scenes videos, Autographed Blurays of Redemption AND Forgiveness, and SO MUCH MORE!

updates.update_userinfo: Less than 2 hours left, LAST MINUTE STRETCH GOAL
updates.update_content:
With less than 2 hours left, we've decided on making a last minute stretch goal of $90,000 and to help us get there, we're offering a one-of-a-kind BONUS perk:
From now until the end of the campaign,
If you pledge more than $2,500
In addition to the perks you pledge for, you'll get a Special one on one producer apprenticeship with David Bartlett on the set of Space Command.

There are only a few hours left in the campaign and we've made our goal. It was a bit scary there for a bit, but we knew you all would come through because you are the best fans. For those who are new, welcome to the Space Command Crew! And for those who have been with us for a while, Thank You for being with us and helping us make an amazing show. 
Here's a video from Marc:

We are at the end of our Campaign and we are almost there!
Today only, if you contribute to a perk of $400 or more you'll also receive two free VIP passes to the Red carpet Premiere screening of Redemption Parts 1 and 2 at the World famous Chinese Theater.
*Does not include travel or lodging, only valid for new contributions or adjustments on June 3rd 2021

updates.update_userinfo: The Mighty 300... Backers that is! And Every Perk Listed
updates.update_content:
We are now over 300 Backers strong and over 90% funded with just 30 hours left. It really is going to be a photo finish. If you know ANYONE who loves Sci-Fi and wants to see more hopeful and less pessimistic shows out in the world, please share this campaign with them. 
Also,  there are a LOT of perks, and that might be overwhelming and possibly confusing, but here is Marc with video going through every single perk.

updates.update_userinfo: Nearly 90% and Testimonial from Doug Jones
updates.update_content: We are just $300 away from 90% of our Goal! And less than 2 days away from the deadline, which means it's going to be a nail-biting photo finish. Will we make it? I think we will! And our very own Doug Jones of Star Trek Discovery fame is rooting us on...

updates.update_userinfo: A message from Marc and Elaine
updates.update_content:
Thank you to everyone who's contributed so far and especially those who've increased their pledges! 
Here is a quick message from Marc and Elaine about why they want to make Space Command.

There are only a few days left in the campaign and we are closing in on reaching our goal with nearly $11,000 to go.  If you haven't checked out the campaign lately, now's the time as we've added many new perks over the past week, so you might want to up your pledge! 
Here's a message from Marc:

updates.update_userinfo: Three Days Left, Two NEW Perks!
updates.update_content:
We've just added two great new perks to the campaign, one of which has NEVER been offered before! 
First, as we are preparing for the release of Redemption Part 2, we are planning a World Premiere event of the full 2 hour Redemption Story at the famous Grauman's Chinese Theater in Hollywood!

updates.update_userinfo: Less than 20% to go and Sneak Peek of Episode 3!
updates.update_content:
Hey guys, we are now over 80% of the way to our goal. That's less than 20% to go! Thank you to all who've pledged so far and special thanks to those who've increased their pledge! 
As a thank you, here is a sneak peek into Episode 3, the first part of Space Command: Forgiveness.

project_data.project_name: Space Command Forgiveness: Chapter 4

campaign.story:
What You Will Learn:
Learning the grid
Editing 3D shapes
Using the ruler
Hole shapes
Duplicating objects
Understanding patterns
Shape generators
Importing and exporting
Brick and block mode
Creating a circuit
Requirements:
No previous experience needed - We'll teach you everything you need to know.
A Mac or PC computer with access to the internet.
No paid software required.
No download required
We'll walk you through, step-by-step all you need to know.
Course Description:
3D design in CAD software doesn't have to be complex with Tinkercad. In this course you will learn the concepts of 3D editing in Tinkercad. This course will explore the tools and features of Tinkercad from the basics to the advanced. Tinkercad is great to start from scratch or to use with existing 3D designs and both approaches are covered in this course. This course will help you whether you are a beginner or an advanced 3D artist.
Coures Curriculum:
All videos are complete and ready to be delivered as soon as the Kickstarter is complete. Course is 2 hours and 44 minuates long. 
1. Introduction - 1:41
2. Getting Started - 1:26
3. Learning the Interface - 5:22
4. Moving Around - 6:43
5. Perspective vs Orthographic - 3:25
6. Snap Grid - 3:41
7. Moving Objects - 7:42
8. Scaling Objects - 3:41
9. Shape Controls - 8:29
10. Rotating Objects - 4:55
11. Selections - 4:30
12. Workplanes - 5:16
13. Using the Ruler - 11:31
14. Grouping - 4:42
15. Working with Holes - 4:21
16. Align and Mirror - 4:49
17. Color Options - 3:37
18. Copy and Duplicate - 5:31
19. Linear Patterns - 2:13
20. Circular Patterns - 3:59
21. Scaled Patterns - 3:08
22. Shape Generators - 3:42
23. Shape Tools - 6:04
24. Shape Intersections - 3:00
25. Create Shapes - 7:54
26. Splitting Models - 4:50
27. Make a Model - 6:23
28. Rotating Objects - 5:03
29. Importing SVGs - 1:40
30. Import a STL - 1:22
31. Export Models - 2:52
32. Send To Feature - 2:36
33. Projects and Gallery - 3:52
34. Brick Mode - 3:13
35. Block Mode - 2:54
36. Tinkercad Circuits - 6:55
37. Thank You - 0:50
Sample lecture:
About Me:
My name is James Leiske and I’ve invested years in learning the fundamental theories behind what I teach. I'm a zealous teacher that strives to bring students to a high level efficiently, with simple, easy to understand concepts, built on rock-solid theory. When you learn with me, you’ll learn well, and learn efficiently. That’s my promise to you.

campaign.story:
The Luxury Chess Collection for 3D Printing includes four high-quality chess sets. 
There are separate files for FDM (filament) and DLP or SLA (resin) printers. The filament files have reduced overhangs so that apart from the knights, none of the pieces need supports. The resin pieces are all pre-supported and include solid versions for printing in transparent resin.
Note - these are digital files for printing on your 3D printer, not physical chess pieces. If you want to buy printed pieces visit 3dprintedchess.com after the campaign ends where you will be able to purchase printed sets from the commercial backers.
The Latvian set. Printed in resin with satin-black finish and wood-filament PLA.
Fans of the Netflix show The Queen's Gambit may recognize this set - it appears in the final episode of the series where Elizabeth Harmon played against Vasily Borgov in Moscow.
A Latvian set as seen in the final episode of The Queen's Gambit.
This striking, minimal design originated in Latvia and was popular throughout the Soviet Union around the 1930s. Its sleek lines still look modern by today's standard. The wide, flared bases make the pieces very stable and a pleasure to play with. An excellent set for rapid games as the pieces are sturdy and resistant to toppling over.
The Staunton Set. Printed in resin with high-gloss black and ivory finishes.
The Staunton design has been the international tournament standard since 1924, however it was designed in 1849 and has defined the look of modern chess sets since then. Before the Staunton design chess pieces typically looked like this:
Typical early 19th century chess pieces.
The Staunton re-design made chess pieces more affordable and more durable, bringing chess to a larger audience. No chess collection is complete without a Staunton set. 
Staunton pieces printed in marble PLA filament.
The Zagreb set. Printed in red-copper and bamboo-wood PLA filament.
The Zagreb set is a variant of the famous Dubrovnik design which I sold in my previous Kickstarter. A distinctive feature of the Zagreb set is the alternate colored finials on the King, Queen and Bishop. The STL files have separate finials so that you can easily print in two different colors and glue the finials in place. If you don't have a resin printer then metallic filaments such as red copper or green bronze make excellent choices for your dark pieces.
This video shows how the Zagreb knight was sculpted:
 All of these pieces are made in Blender and are exported at high resolution so that your prints will be smooth and detailed.
The Ecliptic set. Printed in translucent resin and bamboo-wood PLA filament.
The Ecliptic set is an original design, created specially for this Kickstarter campaign. It takes inspiration from the 1987 video game R-Type:
One of R-Type's power-ups is an object called the bit, which consists of a sphere encased in a rotating hemisphere. This motif formed the basis of the pawn's design, and the hemispherical collar is repeated on the king, queen and bishop but with a taller head extending out from the collar.
Ecliptic set printed in transparent resin.
The Ecliptic pieces have been designed to form an elegant but also playable set, with instantly recognizable shapes and a modern, clean appearance. It is not an ornamental or decorative design, like many other 3D printed chess sets, rather it is meant to be played.
The pre-supported resin files let you start printing right away, but if you prefer to do your own supports, unsupported versions are also provided.
There are 139 STL files in total in the collection.
To complete your pieces you can add weights and then attach felt to the base. This video shows how it's done.
Resin pieces look great when painted and then given a coat of gloss varnish. This video shows how to paint your resin pieces as well as how to get perfectly clear transparent prints.
The "Luxury Chess Collection - Early Backer" and "Luxury Chess Collection" tiers are non-commercial tiers, meaning you can print sets for yourself or print sets to give away for free to your friends and family, however you cannot sell your prints.
Note - none of the tiers allow you to sell the STL files. The files remain copyrighted and cannot be sold or redistributed.
If you wish to sell chess sets that you print then you can purchase the "Commercial Tier - Early Backer" or "Commercial Tier". The commercial tiers include the same STL files and grant you a license to sell your prints. Commercial backers will also be featured on 3dprintedchess.com - where customers looking to buy a 3D printed chess set can find vendors in their region. After the Kickstarter campaign ends commercial backers will be asked to provide a link to their store (such as an Etsy or eBay page) and a thumbnail image for their listing. Vendors will be grouped by region on the website so buyers can minimize their shipping costs by finding a local seller.
Advice for commercial backers.
 How much should I charge for a 3D printed chess set?
I recommend that you charge no less than US$100 per set with filament pieces, and that you charge significantly more for sets with resin pieces (double or triple your price for filament-only sets). It is up to you to determine the exact price customers in your region will accept, and also your price will vary depending on the cost of materials and the number of printers you own (which can reduce your production time). You should also charge around $100 more if you are doing the weights and felts yourself.
Do not try to compete on price with cheap, plastic molded chess sets. If a customer wants to spend less than $100 then politely suggest they should look at molded plastic sets instead of a 3D printed set.
 Why would someone spend over $100 on a 3D printed set when they can get hand-made wooden sets for around $200?
3D printing offers two main advantages over cheap plastic and hand-made wooden sets:
 Rare sets. Nearly all cheap plastic sets are Staunton style. To get a Latvian or Zagreb set will typically cost over $300 and they are only available in a few varieties of wood. 3D printing brings rare sets into a reasonable price-range.
 Personalized sets. 3D printed sets can be customized to the buyer's requirements. Instead of being limited to the wood and felt choices offered by the stores, a 3D printed set can be made in a variety of colors, finishes and weights and can have any color felt base. This makes them great gifts because they can be tailored to the taste and preferences of the recipient. 
These commercial licenses are perpetual and royalty-free, which means your license lasts forever, you only pay once and do not have to share a percentage of your sales.
Instagram
Take a look at my Instagram page to see some behind-the-scenes shots of the development and painting of these chess pieces. Conor O'Kane (@cokane) on Instagram.
Thanks
I'd like to thank a few people for helping me with this Kickstarter.
 Jaxon Lee Rose - Kickstarter and web design advice.
 Christian Schladetsch - Chess consultant.
 Lauren Clinnick - Kickstarter tips.
Angephalange Nails and Pastel Storm for help with the photographs.
And thanks to my family for tolerating a house full of chess pieces for the last few months!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All these pieces have been test printed so you can be sure they will work on any filament or resin printer. Pre-supported resin files have been tested on a Phrozen Shuffle using a variety of resins. Performance on your printer may vary, so if the pre-supported files don't work perfectly you also have the unsupported files which you can support yourself.

Files will be delivered via Gumroad shortly after completion of the campaign.

Delivery via an established digital store like Gumroad offers many advantages:
1. No bandwidth limit - everyone will be able to download their files as soon as they become available.
2. Online backups - you don't have to store all the files on your computer. If you only have a filament printer, you can delete the resin STL files. And if you get a resin printer later, the files will always be available from your Gumroad account.
3. Instant updates - if I upload improvements to these sets I can notify all owners and you will immediately get access to the new versions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
This update is just for commercial backers. The store listing at 3DprintedChess.com is now live.
http://www.3dprintedchess.com/buy-printed-sets/
Please check your store link and confirm it's working correctly.

By now some of you will have attempted prints and you may be wondering what's the best way to support the FDM knights. The other pieces don't require any supports, but because the knights have an overhang for the horse's mouth, and sometimes for the mane, some supports are required. In this update I'll show you how I supported my FDM knights and give you some general tips for getting the best supports on your printer.
TIP: Don't print the entire piece until you know the supports will work!
Your first support attempt is likely to fail, so don't waste 2 hours printing an entire knight only to have it fail at the end. Lower the model into the print bed in your slicer, so that the print starts at the supported area. This way you can test different support layouts and print orientations quickly.
Las Vegas 3D Prints have shared a fantastic work-in-progress photo on Instagram:

Thank you everyone, he's a quick update to explain what's happening now.
The campaign is complete and fully funded, so Kickstarter are currently processing all the credit card payments. Once that is done (it typically takes less than 2 weeks from the end of the campaign) I will email you all the download details.
If you don't have an account with gumroad.com yet, go ahead and make one so you can download the files as soon as your payment is processed. You will use a 100% discount code which I will include in your email so that you can download the STL files from Gumroad for free.

This is the final day of the campaign. Thank you to all the backers. If you haven't already got an account with Gumroad, sign up here: https://gumroad.com/
After all payments have been processed the files will be delivered via Gumroad, so if you make an account now you'll be ready to download them straight away.

Once you have some luxury chess pieces printed you'll want a nice board to play on. Here are some boards I've collected over the years. While it's possible to 3D print a chessboard I've yet to see one that has a smooth playing surface and looks professional, so I'm only recommending traditional (non 3D-printed) boards for now.
Budget/portable boards

As commercial backers you probably already have an Etsy store and Instagram page where you sell and promote your prints to buyers, and you may have regular customers for your cosplay props and miniatures. But selling chess pieces is a different market, so here are some tips for finding new customers who want to buy 3D printed chess sets.
1 - The Chess Books & Equipment forum on chess.com
Many online chess players also like to collect high quality pieces for over-the-board play. Chess.com is the largest community of online players and you'll find plenty of customers there. I recommend printing a couple of complete sets and posting photographs to show buyers what you can make.

campaign.story:
As the PrintABlok battle rages on, a new opponent emerges from the wild to join the fight. It's PrintABlok:Beasts the new construction sets for your home 3D printer. 3D print and build your favorites, or mix and match parts with other sets to invent your own awesome creations.
3D Printers are awesome. But they have trouble printing common interlocking building blocks. PrintABlok was my answer to this problem, creating a building block for 3D printers that would just work.
And PrintABlok is remarkable because it can't be mass produced. it can only be made with 3D printing. It takes advantage of the unique strengths of 3D printing to make something that can truly democratize manufacturing and fulfill 3D printing's promise to the world!
And it all starts with a simple little cube.
Print by Orson
The base PrintABlok set, all you need to get started with PrintABlok, is available on major 3D printing repositories now, and can be used like three-dimensional voxel building blocks.
But, PrintABlok is more than just the base blok, and if you really want to build on it, you're going to need... accessories.
Print by PatrickW
The first accessory pack, PrintABlok:Mechs, debuted last year on Kickstarter to great acclaim and success. This year I'm introducing a new expansion...
This Kickstarter will see the creation of an additional library of awesome assets to add to the PrintABlok library and can be used to build anything you can imagine. New articulated connectors with animal-based decorative elements that can create new ways to play.
An example of a few of the new sets you'll receive.
You decide!
The more the campaign raises, the more new bloks will be developed and the more new sets will be added. And best of all, you have a voice in deciding what the new sets will be!
Upon funding completion, the first 2 sets will be added to the rewards, the snail, and lion, and a new kit will be added for ever $500 threshold we reach after that. Some will be decided by "You're the Boss" backers, and some will be decided by popular vote.
What do you want to see added next?
If you've been a part of one of my campaigns before, you know it's an interactive experience with you getting to choose what I'll work on next, setting the course and scope of this project through frequent updates, polls, and livestreams.
So buckle up, because a 3DPProfessor Kickstarter is more than just a fund raising drive. It's a thrill ride!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
3D models will be created during the campaign, so delivery will be made just as soon as Kickstarter clears the funds. A wildly successful campaign may have some delay if there are models left to work on at the end, but that will be cleared up quickly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
These designs will ship to the world digitally, and can be used for years to come.
Reusability and recyclability
3D printing generates less waste than traditional manufacturing and can, depending on the material, actually be a carbon negative process.
Sustainable materials
The most common type of 3D printing material, PLA, can be made from plant based starch.
Environmentally friendly factories
When you have a 3D printer, you are the factory.
Sustainable Distribution
Can't get more sustainable and eco friendly than digital.

updates.update_content: All backers should at this point have the relevant links to the 3DPProfessor shop and coupons for their rewards in their message box.
If you backed at higher than the $10 level you should have an email with a coupon code and a link to the appropriate listings on the 3DPProfessor shop for your first round of rewards.

Words can not adequately express to all of you the profound gratitude for this entire experience, but especially for what ended up being a run to the finish line that I did not expect. Much of what will be covered in this post was also covered in the livestream, which you can watch on YouTube.
In that last hour we crossed $5k, including a new $100 backer.  What a ride!
So what's next?

Join us on YouTube. 
Because of the weirdness of Kickstarter, PrintABlok:Beasts end at 12 minutes past the hour. Not on the hour, 12 minutes pasts. I don't know how I did that, but we'll make it work.
The plan will be to some 3D modeling, and make some short and long term plans. Doesn't that sound like fun?

updates.update_userinfo: Shark with lasers and elemental attacks joins the Beasts!
updates.update_content:
With the Kickstarter counting down hours now, I was surprised to discover that we just crossed $4k and 200 backers while I slept! Wow! I should sleep more often. 
This means I'll be working on at least one more set, and as chosen by another $100 backer, the next set will be a wolf. Good time to start working on it, because I just finished...
Join me Saturday morning for the next PrintABlok modeling live stream!
Just as last night's live stream ended the T-Rex parts I was printing also finished. It snapped together brilliantly, and the final result is an amazing model set.

campaign.story:
We deliver curated spice kits and relishes to your door so you can make iconic Southeast Asian dishes to feed friends & family. All you need to do is provide the protein & veggies and follow our step-by-step recipes. Shipped in Homiah’s gorgeous gift-ready boxes. 
Click here for ingredients and nutritional information. 
Want an even deeper dive? That's okay, we got you. Click here. 
Want to keep things simple in the kitchen? Homiah is the perfect solution. The active cooking time for all Homiah dishes is under 20 minutes. We provide step-by-step, foolproof recipes that include variations and suggestions for dietary restrictions. Scroll down for a sample recipe card. 
Southeast Asian cuisine is the original global cuisine. Centuries of immigration and spice trade has resulted in a rich and diverse culinary tradition, with dishes such as laksa and rendang voted as some of the world's most delicious foods (CNN Travel). We're helping you stock your Southeast Asian pantry so you can skip straight to cooking with spice kits blended to personal family recipes. 
Homiah supplier, Eastern Shan Region, Myanmar
Homiah sources directly and fairly from local communities in Southeast Asia. We work with a collective of small producers and farmers in Malaysia and Burma, helping them earn fair compensation and move beyond long tail supply chains. We're particularly proud of our work creating new income streams for a collective of farms in the Shan State of Burma by enabling them to sell laphet (pickled tea leaves) outside their local region, something that would otherwise be impossible due to political instability.
We wanted to evoke the culture and art of Southeast Asia, alongside its amazing cuisine.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No project is risk-free and there is always a risk of delay. We've worked buffer into our timeline but as we are importing products from Southeast Asia into the US, there may be delays with paperwork, cargo shipping or clearing customs. In 2021, there have been serious shipping congestion and delays for shipments from Asia to the West, in particular through the Suez Canal. We see this as frustrating and challenging, but at the same time recognize that shipping goods across the world is an incredible human feat. We will work our hardest to be transparent and communicative during the various steps of the production and export process. 

Moreover, we source our Laphet (Burmese Pickled Tea Leaves) directly from the Eastern Shan region of Myanmar (Burma). As of Feb 1st, the country is undergoing civil unrest and instability. While the local farmers and producers have been incredibly cooperative, they are unable to guarantee that ongoing internet blackouts, strikes, and violence will not affect normal business operations and trade. We are doing our utmost to deliver all components of the pantry box but would like to assure backers that we will compensate the value in the case of any unfulfilled items.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
We've been hard at work!
We're glad things have improved in America but are heart broken by the soaring Covid cases and low vaccination rates in Southeast Asia. The resulting lock downs and interstate travel bans have resulted in complex logistical issues for Homiah to work through. That being said, we're making the best of the situation. We're almost through with getting all our facilities in Southeast Asia FDA approved and cleared for import to the USA. In addition, through airmailing, WhatsApp calls and sheer creativity, we're finalizing recipe formulations and are on track for the planned production date.

campaign.story:
16+ Measurements,  100+ Schematic Symbols, Component value calculator, 132+ SMD Footprints, 8 Laws & Theory, PCB Design help.. + More!
The Most complete Electrical Engineering reference cards to date - Better than your collection of PCB Rulers!

What Is CheatKard?
Electrical Engineering CheatKards are durable, gold plated reference cards for use by Engineers, Tech Heads, Arduino Enthusiasts, DIY'ers and more.
CheatKard is a credit card sized companion you can rely on for accurate and useful information.
Gone are the days of trawling through an abundance of varied search results and forum posts to find the answer you need or flipping to page 102 in your chunky Electrical Engineering textbook. CheatKards are small, lightweight, with concise, accurate information and references for you to use whenever you need them. 

The Kards
Key-ring:
Gold carabiner style key-ring
Cover:
Front - Gold plated lettering and key-ring hole
Back - The back is blank and can be used to write your name or other details
Measurements Card includes:
AWG wire gauge/diameter/electrical resistance, Font sizes, Surface mount (SMD) pin pitch gauge, Through hole (THT) pin pitch gauge, 1mm/1cm square, trace width/amp gauge, Ruler (CM & INCH), Electrical/Number/Units conversion & PCB copper thickness
Common Schematic Symbols Card includes:
Front - Power Sources, Ground, Diodes, Resistors, Capacitors, Inductors, Optoelectronics
Back - Transistors, Transformers, Logic Gates, Others (Relay, Opamp, Motor, Crystal Oscillator etc)
Component Values Card includes:
Front - Resistor Bands & Color Codes
Back - Capacitor Codes (Ceramic & Electrolytic)
Common Footprints SMD Card includes:
Front - 01005, 0201, 0402, 0603, 0805, 1008, 1206, 1210, 1806, 1812, 2010, SMC, SMB, SMA, SOD128, SOD80C, SOD123, SOD323, SOD523, SOT883, SOT723, SOT416, SOT665, SOT563, SOT666, SOT353, SOT323, SOT363, SOT143, SOT663, SOT23-3, SOT23-5, SOT23-6, SOT23-8, SOT89, SOT223, 1612, 2012, 3215, 2520, 3225, 4520, 5032, 4x 0201 array, 4x 0402 array, 4x 0603 array, 4x 0805 array, 4x 1206 array, MicroMELF, MiniMELF, MELF, HC49, Capacitive Touch Switch, 2MM POT, 3MM POT, 5MM POT, DPAK/TO252/SOT428, D2PAK/TO263/SOT404, D3PAK/TO268
Back - Panasonic A/B/C/D/E/F/G, CD10, CD7, CD5, CD4, CD3, EIS 3216-12/EIS 3216-18, EIS 3528-12/EIS 3528-21, EIS 6032-15/EIS 6032-28, EIS 7260-38, EIS 7343-20/EIS 7343-21/EIS 7343-43, SOP/WIDE SOC 1.27MM, TSSOP (TYPE 1) 0.5MM, SO/NARROW SOIC 1.27MM, TSOP 0.5MM, TSSOP (TYPE 2) 0.65MM, SOIC 1.27MM, SSOP 0.65MM, MSOP 0.5MM
Common Footprints SMD 2 Card includes:
Front - QFP 32/48/64/80/100 0.4MM/0.5MM/0.65MM/0.8MM, QFN 16/32/48/64 0.4MM/0.5MM/0.65MM/0.8MM
Back - BGA 0.4MM/0.5MM/0.65MM/0.8MM/1.0MM/1.27MM Square Grids, BGA 0.4MM/0.5MM/0.65MM/0.8MM/1.0MM/1.27MM Equilateral grids
PCB Design Card includes:
Front - VIA size gauge/Size (MM & MIL)/Amps across copper thicknesses, Copper thickness conversion, Trace spacing vs voltage (Volts/internal layers MM/external layers MM/external uncoated layers MM), Font sizes in MIL at 8% & 20%, Trace width gauge and amp capacity, Ruler (CM)
Back - PCB layer makeup for 1/2/4 layer PCB, ENIG & Tin plating finishes, Panelization (Mouse-bites/V-cut), PCB thermals explanation, Meanders explanation, PCB finishes, Ruler (INCH)
Laws And Theory Card includes:
Front - OHMs law, Resistors in series, Resistors in parallel, Capacitors in series, Capacitors in parallel
Back - Kirchhoff's law (First and Second), Coulombs law, Faraday's law, Lenz law


 Built To Be Used.. Built To Last! 

A Tree Planted With Every Set!
We wanted to do our bit to help, and what better and more universal way to help the planet than by planting more trees to combat global warming! A percentage of profits from every CheatKard set that you back will plant a tree in one of the worlds forests.

The Creation Of CheatKard
Little did we realize that back in 2018 we had invented what would become CheatKard when we designed the first Nerdonic PCB business reference card,  created with an aim to give clients and customers a more relevant business card compared to generic paper cards so they could see a glimpse of the world behind Electrical engineering.
Many clients and fellow tech nerds loved the idea, with friends of clients who were interested in tech asking to get a business card too, simply because they thought it was cool to have.
Image: One of the first reference based Nerdonic business cards from 2018, some aspects of the card still lives on within CheatKard such as the pin pitch and trace gauges
From there we experimented and decided to make it into a product. Shortly after the first designs we used our contacts in other fields from photographers, doctors and surgeons, scientists, designers, mechanics, and more to help us design useful CheatKards in a wide range of categories!


More To Come!
We’re working hard to finalize our Cheat Kards for a huge range of other topics, Electrical Engineering is just the start!
Teaming up with respected professionals in their respective fields allows us to ensure nothing but the most accurate and useful information on all of our cards. 
We have already started developing add-on sets for Electrical Engineering including information on Radio Frequencies, PCB Antenna design, Certification help and more!
As well as that we also have many other CheatKards being developed and on their way including sets in Computing, Adobe, Photography, Science, Medical, 3D Printing, Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, DIY and much more!

As a way of thanking pledgers for their support, we are currently offering a set of limited edition cheatkards, exclusively for Kickstarter backers. These limited edition cards are available in the classic Kickstarter green with gold plated accents, as a little nod to Kickstarter.

Specifications

The Rewards


Add-On Items
Custom Text Engraving
Have your CheatKard set custom engraved with a message or name of your choice on the back of the cover card! Great for birthdays, gifts, or just to mark your name/brand on them so you know which set is yours
(you will be asked after the campaign what text you would like to be engraved)

Hand-Made Leather Sleeve
Keep your CheatKard set safe, protected and held tightly together in this hand-made and engraved leather sleeve!

+1x Extra Electrical Engineering Set
Add additional Electrical Engineering CheatKard Sets to your pledge!

Tracked Express Shipping
Upgrade your shipping to get tracked and express shipping


Stretch Goals!
Stretch goals are targets to reach to introduce new stuff into the campaign!
Help us reach the targets and every backer will receive these stretch goals, for free, in their orders!
✔️ £50k = CheatKard Screen Printed Lanyard 
We reached £50k!
Every backer will get a custom CheatKard lanyard included in their order!
(x how many sets they have ordered - 5x sets gets 5x lanyards)
Keep your CheatKard set safe and with you at all times while working! Completed with a gold clip to match the CheatKards gold plating, you'll never need to dig in your pocket or back for your CheatKard set!
✔️ £65k = CheatKard Magnifying Card 
We reached £65k!
Every backer will get a custom CheatKard magnifying card included in their order!
(x how many sets they have ordered - 5x sets gets 5x magnifying cards)
Eyes not as good as hey used to be? Use this magnifying card to see your CheatKard information better or to take a closer look at PCBs and their components


 Project Timeline

Shipping
To make sure everyone has access to the information on the CheatKards, we are proud to offer worldwide delivery!
Please note: Depending on quantity and your location, buyers may be subject to import fees that are out of our control.


Press
Find our Press & Information Pack here: Press & Information Pack Download
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although challenging, the Nerdonic team pays extreme attention to detail all throughout the research and design process, ensuring each card is legible, useful, accurate, and stylish. Thanks to our collaboration with industry-leading professionals and valid research methods, we are more than confident that all of the information on our Cheat Kards is the best it can be.
 
We work alongside a reputable local manufacturer to ensure each and every card is up to our high standards, before applying the final touches in house by hand. Materials and processes used will always conform to our technical specifications, quality, and safety requirements. 
 
Despite our best efforts, there is always the slight chance that we would face hurdles with delivery and shipping times amidst the current global Covid-19 situation. We will try to provide updates as regularly as we can, to avoid any concern regarding order statuses.
 
Should you have any queries or feedback, please send an email to kickstarter@nerdonic.com and we will do our best to reply as soon as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
These cards are waterproof, flexible and can survive the extreme temperatures from -200c to +200c
Reusability and recyclability
We have designed and will use recycleable paper packaging
Environmentally friendly factories
During production waste materials are recycled as much as possible
Something else
We are committed to plant a tree for every set sold once the kickstarter has ended and this can be seen publically

campaign.story:
10+ Awesome Mechanisms To 3D Print At Home
With the boom of digital technology, our need for the complex mechanical machinery that made up much of early 20th century production diminished.  There is a simple beauty in these complex mechanisms, however.  This project brings some of these awesome, marvellous mechanisms to life with easy to print and assemble 3D models that you can make at home.
Get a bundle of 10 (or more) 3D Printable mechanisms that can be displayed as cool pieces of art or as demonstrations of the beauty of complex mechanical design. Each design is modular and can be assembled without the use of additional tools!
Videos:
PLAY

PLAY

10+ Artfully Designed Mechanisms for 3D Printing:       
Modular Design.
Each mechanism attaches to our modular base, making it quick and easy to swap out components, or try out different mechanisms.
Fully Automatic.
Insert a standard battery pack into our "battery module" and an electric motor into the motor mount to make your mechanisms fully automatic. 
No Supports Needed.
Each component is designed to be 3d printed quickly and with ease with no supports! Choose from our collection of mechanisms ranging from simple to complex.
 From Simple Designs:
PLAY

To More Complex:
PLAY

PLAY

Required Hardware:
6V Electric Motor:
Available on Amazon.com: https://amzn.to/3sAV4E0

Battery Pack:
Available on Amazon: https://amzn.to/3rBTvnN


Online Reviews:  
Who we are:
Jay is the owner of JBV Creative. He has a passion for Art, Engineering, and sharing his designs with the World.
www.JBVCreative.com
Instagram:
@JBVCreative
YouTube:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSksodwjNeOQ3Oywr1G4Nag

Partnering with: 
Steven Wolfe from 3DPrinterAcademy.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks for this project are low. Most of the mechanisms have already been designed and tested. However, due to the nature of 3d printing, individual results may vary. We are designing the mechanisms to work with any 3d printer but due to various individual slicer settings some post processing may be required after 3d printing. (This is not unusual for 3d printed objects) We highly recommend having your drill bits on hand, some sand paper, and your hot glue gun ready just in case a part does not print perfectly. If you have any questions or concerns please reach out and I will be happy to help!

-Jay 
Owner of JBV Creative
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Files are Ready to Go - And you thought it was just another Tuesday!
updates.update_content:
We decided to use My Mini Factory to fulfill your files! The redeem links for the project have been sent to all the backers by MyMiniFactory. This will come in the form of an email with instructions on how to redeem their files.   If you did not see an email, that might be because:
1. The email is in the 'Promotions' section [Gmail user]  
2. You received the email on different email address [Kickstarter email is different to your MyMiniFactory Email]

Thanks to all of you for making this campaign exceed our expectations! As promised, we had a really awesome idea for the last stretch goal; The Modular Gear System.  With multiple gear options, you can mix and match different sized gears to create different gear ratios.  The possibilities are endless because you can print as many or a few as you like!  This system is compatible with all the previous mechanisms so you can attempt the ultimate challenge of chaining all the mechanisms together.  
Meta Note - We will be 'shipping' the downloads within the next couple weeks- we just want to measure twice so you only have to print once.  Stay tuned for the next update!

updates.update_userinfo: Big Plans for our Next Stretch Goal!
updates.update_content:
As our campaign is entering it's final stretch (see what I did there #dadjoke), we decided to set our next stretch goal to $5500 CAD!  We have some really awesome things planned for the stretch goal that we know you are going to love- so gear up (that was a hint) and if you know anybody that would be interested in this project, help us get to our stretch goal by sharing this project with them.
You all rock!

We can’t express enough to you how much your support means! To show our appreciation, we’ve created some additions to add some more fun to the mix. This stretch goal has unlocked a couple different ways to connect your mechanisms together. One is a 90 degree adaptor and another is an inline adaptor. This way you can get more out of a single motor and share the love across multiple sculptures.

To all our backers- Incredible news! Thanks so much for your support- we have officially reached our initial goal and this project is now dubbed as funded 😀😀 Without all of you, we wouldn’t feel the same empowerment to bring our ideas to life.
We are thrilled and humbled by your support, and we’re not done yet!
If we raise just $1000 more, we will unlock our stretch goal with some more great mechanisms including a modular gear system so you can experiment with different gear sizes and ratios.

campaign.story:
We created the LumiCube to allow people interested in technology to focus on creating and experimenting, and bring their ideas to life. Let us tell you a bit about it...

WHAT IS IT?
We think of the LumiCube as the ultimate Raspberry Pi kit. Perfect for beginners and enthusiasts alike. It takes the Raspberry Pi, a powerful mini computer, and combines it with a whole range of electronics and sensors, from a speaker to an accelerometer all in a 10cm cube - the perfect playground for your creations.

WHAT CAN IT DO?
Most of your day-to-day devices, like your phone, alarm clock, and voice activated home assistant all have the same basic electronic components. So we thought why not put them all together with a mini computer and make it completely programmable. That way you can build whatever you want, exactly the way you want it.
With so much at your fingertips, let your imagination take the lead.

WHO IS IT FOR?

LEVEL UP YOUR ROOM
Keep updated with important events thanks to its built in WiFi. Unlike other tickers you can connect to any feed you want. Whether you're on Discord or Mastodon, or investing in the most niche of cryptocurrencies, get the updates you care about.
Or if humans are your thing, use it to message your loved ones!

MAKE SOMETHING INTERACTIVE
If you choose the Screen Add-on you can use light levels, hand gestures or buttons to control the cube. If you choose the Interactive Add-on you will also be able to make it react to movement or rotation, to give your projects an exciting interactive element.

PERFECT FOR YOUR DESK
Whether lit up, or just sitting quietly, the LumiCube is small enough to sit on your desk, and look great whilst doing it. Use it to notify you of important events, automate routine tasks, or help you focus by providing some background sounds.

AWARE OF ITS ENVIRONMENT
The Interactive Add-on features an environmental sensor, so you can monitor your home or office environment. Plus it automatically records the values of all its sensors over time, so you can look back at the temperature, humidity and air pressure variations of your space.

MAKE PROGRAMMING FUN AGAIN
Every part of the LumiCube is programmable, using our browser based coding environment. We’ve worked hard to remove any complexity, so you can achieve real results with just a few lines of code. Sometimes modern technology can feel overwhelmingly complicated – with the LumiCube we set out to make programming fun again!

WE GAVE IT TO SOME FRIENDS...
... and despite some of them not knowing Python, within minutes they had it displaying an abusive message. Then they ran the rain animation and decided it was more fun to rain fire, so changed the colour to red. After that they modified the autumn tree scene, and changed the colours to white and grey for a winter tree, and made it drop leaves when it was shaken. During this time they also managed to Rickroll each other. So we think it's fair to say it's pretty easy and fun to get started.
PLAY


WELCOME TO INTERACTIVE CODING 
Coding for electronics used to be a mysterious process, but the LumiCube comes with a dashboard so you can see what matters all in one place, all to support your creative exploration.
View the state of your cube in real-time – no more guessing, as you can see every value, and plot them on a graph.

WANT TO LEARN PYTHON?
You don’t have to be a Python expert to use the LumiCube – in fact we think it’s a great way to learn. Unlike learning programming on a blank computer terminal, the LumiCube gives you some fun projects to play around with straight away. All of those built in apps are just code that you can modify and play around with. Plus we include a project booklet to introduce the basics of Python and guide you through some of the built in apps.

NO CODING NEEDED: LOADS OF BUILT IN APPS
Just select one and click run. You can still see the code and tweak it in any way you want.

COMMUNITY OF LUMICUBERS
Share your projects with your friends, or take inspiration by running super cool projects by LumiCubers worldwide.
Collaborate to make something beyond the reach of one person (unless you're the guy from StuffMadeHere!)

SO MANY POSSIBILITIES
 The LumiCube has dozens of inputs and outputs, which can be combined in any way you want:

WHAT WILL YOU CREATE?
Maybe a musical cube that reacts to the beat?

MORE THAN WE CAN FIT ON THIS PAGE
All our software is open source.
REST end-points for all the electronics, so you can use any language you like from any machine!

PRICING
Please note:
The LumiCube needs a Raspberry Pi 3 or 4 to work. If you don't already own one select the Raspberry Pi Add-on.
There are 50 cubes with a 20% discount, and 150 with a 10% discount. So get them whilst you can!

TIMELINE
June 2020 - Work on the first LumiCube prototype begins
December 2020 - After dozens of prototypes and some serious development an Alpha version is completed
March 2021 - Kickstarter campaign launches
April 2021 - Kickstarter campaign finishes
May 2021 - Case and electronics finalised
June 2021 - Manufacturing starts
July 2021 - Software finalised
August 2021 - Extra time for any manufacturing issues
September 2021 - LumiCube shipped to backers


PLUG & PLAY ELECTRONICS
Our journey began with creating plug-and-play electronics modules. We felt creating your own electronics projects was too frustrating. From cryptic datasheets, and fragile bread-boarding, to fruitless searching for drivers on the internet. 
So we created a system of electronic modules that could be just plugged together, starting with modules for LEDs, buttons, screens and a range of sensors. We then thought: why not put it all together in a nice case? And so the LumiCube was born. The perfect platform for loads of interesting projects.
For us, the LumiCube is just the beginning. We hope to soon start selling the modules separately so that other people can just as easily create their own electronics projects. Want to add servo motors to your project? Just plug in the servo module. Want to detect distances? Plug in the distance sensor.

OUR MISSION
We are two friends on a mission to bring the joy of tinkering with technology to as wide an audience as possible. We are developing an environment where anyone can create their own electronics and it's super simple to program. A system that is simple enough for teenagers to create the robots they always imagined, but advanced enough for researchers to use to automate lab work.
 Pros at work!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are two engineers who have over 20 years combined experience working in software and electronics. We haven't just created a prototype, we have gone to the effort of producing a close to finished product ahead of our Kickstarter campaign, to ensure there are no major engineering issues with the design.

When it comes to physical products there are always risks, but we have gone out of our way to design the LumiCube so it can be easily manufactured. The case is laser cut acrylic meaning it is perfect for small scale batches or mass manufacturing runs. We could even do it ourselves if we need to. As for the electronics, we have been working with a manufacturer for over a year, and the designs are almost finalised.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
We are fully committed to reuse. Our electronics are designed to be modular. This means if any component has an issue you can replace just that part, unlike most designs where all the electronics have to be scrapped. What’s more you can even reuse each component in future kits or projects, as our entire system is plug-and-play.

updates.update_content:
So it's been another busy month :)

Case design
At the end of last month we sent off all the design files for production of the LumiCube. The manufacturers have reviewed it all and so far there are no issues, which when it comes to engineering is a rarity!

We hope you have all had a good month :) It’s been a busy one for us, putting the final touches to the case design and the circuit boards. We’ve actually quite enjoyed getting back into the engineering side of things, after the wild ride of the Kickstarter campaign!
TL;DR – Our new and improved design has been delivered to our manufacturer :) It turns out we’re not immune to the dreaded chip shortage :/

Progress

Thank you all so much for your support! This has been incredible experience for us. We weren't really sure what to expect from our first campaign, so this has blown us away. This level of funding allows us to deliver an even more refined product, which we are super excited about. We shall be aiming to give you monthly updates of our progress. Please do ask questions or give us feedback on features, manufacturing, user experience, well, anything really.

Pre-order on Indiegogo

Just a quick update before the campaign finishes on Friday Morning.


Shipping
We are planning to ship from two warehouses. One based in the EU/UK and one in the US. This means if you are in the UK, EU or the US you won't have to pay any customs or duties. If you are outside these areas you may owe duty and taxes based on your local regulations. We did look at what we could do about this but it seems there are not very many other options, which explains why this is pretty much the standard for Kickstarter campaigns.

Competition
Less than 10 days left, so please do share with your friends!
We thought it would be nice to get the LumiCube voice recognition to wake up when it hears its name. To do this we needs lots of audio clips from different people, so we are running a competition on Twitter.

OK, this more like a two thirds of the way update, but we've been so blown away by the response we've been holding off on the updates in case we jinxed it and people felt like we were spamming them. Several people have since reassured us they would like updates plus we would like to mention how things are going and how much we appreciate every single backer.

Injection moulding

Thank you so much everyone! The response so far has blown us away and we are so grateful! We've been thinking hard and we really want to get as many people involved in the LumiCube community so we've decided to offer a new 5% discount reward at £85. If you've already backed the £90 base cube don't worry, we know who you are and we'll make sure we refund you £5!

Hope everyone is having a good start to the week and we are both very excited at the thought of what people will do with their LumiCube!

updates.update_userinfo: We are fully funded in under 12 hours!
updates.update_content: Thank you all so much for bringing this to life!

campaign.story:
We all know a dog or a cat who can't stand bathing. They squirm around as soon as water touches their fur, spiraling into a freak-out, barking and yelping until the entire bathroom is a mess. Most pet owners, in response, avoid bathing their dogs and cats as regularly as they would like to and as regularly as they know they should. Although this is far from ideal, it seems preferable to trying to work through the chaos that bath time entails.
Here is the thing: it doesn't have to be that difficult. There is a way to make bathing simple, straightforward, and stress-free, eliminating the obstacles inherent to the process once and for all.
 After years of experience in cat parenting and grooming as well as general hygiene science, we have devoted ourselves to solving the challenges of your pet's bath time once and for all. 
By the active ingredient, a mature Japanese technology widely used in the food and makeup industry, our pet grooming gloves can sanitize the skin and mucous membranes without any toxic ingredients and residuals.
That's right: HICC GROOM!™ Pet Grooming Gloves are totally pet friendly and non-toxic. It takes effect right after you open it and can make an impact on health and hygiene in a strikingly short period of time.
This means that from here on out, you and your pet can look forward to the grooming process. Never again will you associate grooming with stress and frustration. Instead, you can feel confident that once a week, once a day, or whatever frequency you choose to groom your cat or dog.
After a surgery, backing home from outside, traveling around, or an indoor SPA, HICC GROOM!™ Pet Grooming Gloves are introducing a new level of convenience and efficiency to pet grooming. The miracle essence is molecular bionics without toxic, fragrance, and alcohol. It is safe to lick and guess what? It is quick-dry! No worry about drying.
In order to stabilize the ingredients to perform maximum function, HICC GROOM!™ not only manufactures in the sealed aseptic production laboratory, but also keeps the molecular bionics essence and the gloves in separate packs. Just by a soft squeeze, the essence will be absorbed by gloves. Easy to carry, easy to use, clean your pets as you go!
Instead of hiring someone else to wash and groom your furry friend, you can take charge of the entire process yourself. This means that rather than making bath time a chore or an errand, you can make it a bonding experience. Your cat or dog will be happy that you have chosen to do this yourself.
Right now, we are turning to you for help raising the funds that we need to move HICC GROOM!™ Pet Grooming Gloves into mass production. 
Our fundraising goal is $8,000, which will cover the costs of manufacturing our initial run of Pet Grooming Gloves. Experienced in supply chain and logistics, we are operating out of New York, which means that we can distribute across the US rapidly once we go live. 
To say thanks to everyone who makes a contribution to this campaign, we are offering some exclusive rewards, including early access to HICC GROOM!™ Pet Grooming Gloves and discounts on extended subscriptions on our gloves and other HICC™ products.
Contribute now and do your part to get HICC GROOM!™ out to pet owners everywhere.
Beyond making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can show your support for HICC GROOM!™ by sharing a link to the campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. The more people are aware of what we are doing, the smoother the next few months will go for us. Any pet owners in your life – make sure that they know what our pet grooming gloves do and what makes them different.
We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for taking the time to read about what we are doing.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Because of our experience in manufacturing and supply chain, we do not foresee any challenges so daunting that they would prevent us from launching HICC GROOM!™ Pet Grooming Gloves in a timely manner. If we do run into any serious difficulties, we will send out an update. You can count on us to remain transparent throughout this process, letting you know about all of the progress we are making. We want you to feel like you are a part of this process – and to know that at HICC™, we take health, hygiene, and wellness very seriously.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
