campaign.story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS 2 BOOKS WITH A TOTAL OF 4 EDITIONS TO CHOOSE FROM:
THE LIMITED EDITION VERSION IS SIGNED BY BARON AND RUDE AND COMES WITH A SLIPCASE AND IS SHRINK WRAPPED. THE FINAL COUNT ON THE LIMITED EDITION WILL BE DETERMINED AT THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN BASED ON FUNDING.
WHAT'S INSIDE
REWARD BREAKDOWN
I WANT IT FOR CHRISTMAS
For those of you who want all the extra stuff you ordered right away  or are giving the extras or the books as gifts we are giving you the  option to have your order shipped early!  We are also including a set of  10 Santa Cards AND a certificate you can give as a gift!
Set of Christmas Cards and the Certificate included with the "I Want it for Christmas" add on or the Art Edition Books.
STICKER AND POSTCARD - UNLOCKED
4x6" Sticker and 5x7" Postcard - UNLOCKED
 PRINT SET - SO FAR 2 PRINTS UNLOCKED!
Prints are signed as a SET so just 1 signature add on to have all the prints signed
Posters are sold as a SET, FREE with hardcover books and only $40 for paperback levels. The level with 5 paperback books also receives 5 sets of prints along with the other extras!
CHALLENGE COIN  - UNLOCKED
The last coin was so amazing we decided to do it again.  
Challenge Coin - UNLOCKED
 PENCILS ADDED TO THE 3 HARDCOVER EDITIONS - UNLOCKED
Your hardcover edition is now a THREE in ONE art book!  Full color art, pencils AND inks in one oversized edition!
To the Exceptional People who continue to support NEXUS
Five years ago, Rude Dude Productions reintroduced something that the world of publishing had thought virtually extinct; the full-page Sunday newspaper adventure strip. For a while, I’ve been asking, “What happened to the American comic strip?” Reduced almost microscopically by the 1970’s, I’ve wondered the same. So, with no one limiting us but ourselves, we began adapting the award-winning Nexus comic book into a Sunday newspaper strip. With over 100 individual strips drawn on 13” x 19” bristol, we printed these new Nexus adventures, four strips at a time, to the exact size of an actual newspaper. For subscribers, we mailed them directly to your front doors.
Though the strips have been finished before we even began printing, the paper itself lasted only 7 issues. With the many strips that never saw print, we’re happy to finally announce that the entirety of these Nexus strips will now be published in one massive collection, which we’re offering in two ways:
 1. As an oversized Deluxe Hardcover 
 2. And in the traditional-sized Trade Paperback 
Those of you who subscribed to the Nexus comic strip when they were released in 2016, hopefully saw something more than just an exciting read and old-style service. It was the return to something that people hadn’t seen since the 1950’s. For 60 years, everyone from Wall-Streeters to Dust-Bowlers looked forward to the Sunday comics section, and every newspaper stand in America and around the world carried it.
WHY THE COMIC STRIP FORMAT?
Mike Allred's granddaughter reading the full size Nexus Comic Strip Newspaper!
How many of you miss the simple excitement from these bygone years, and wished it would return? As two creators that entered the comic field in 1981, publisher and artist Steve Rude, along with partner and Nexus creator Mike Baron, wanted to move our industry forward by returning to something that made the popularity of comics what it was. It was time for someone to revive the excitement of the Adventure strips, and we’d begin by adapting it to our longtime creation Nexus. 
Other than a few tried and true strips of yesteryear, such as Prince Valiant and the Phantom, the full page format that comic strips once enjoyed doesn’t exist. The syndicates that still own them have little interest in promoting anything old or new.
Far Side creator, Gary Larson, when asked about the enjoyment people got from reading his zany strip, once told us, "Well, it's not like the people who draw comic strips are curing cancer or anything."
For a long time, I thought about what Larson had said. Here’s my conclusion:
While everyone goes through their daily paces, dealing with everything life throws at us, there are still things, often during the briefest passing moments, that might still considered miraculous. Anything that might temporarily lift our spirits, help us forget life’s trials, and give us a chance to dream again.  Along with that might be having something to look forward to.
The weekly comic strip adventures of Nexus is our humble offering to that belief. For those subscribers who wanted to know how the story finally ends, or to the many who have been reading it online at Patreon.com/steverude, these strips are now available.
Look for the Nexus adventure strips now in deluxe hardcover and those always popular TPB’s.
Into the light and forward to the future,
Steve Rude
Artist and publisher
=================================================================
To streamline the design process and give more interest to both versions, we have 2 different designers working on the Hardcover and Trade Paperback versions!  
They also have different contents with the Deluxe Hardcover being more of an ARTISTS EDITION and the Trade Paperback featuring extra stories.
=================================================================
WHAT'S INSIDE:
 DIGITAL AND PRINTED COPIES WILL HAVE THE SAME CONTENT

Nexus Origin and the Fully Painted Sundra Story are extras included for the TPB only.  We do not have them in the Deluxe as we were trying to keep the page count down.


 SHIPPING
Shipping will be calculated during checkout so we can better deal with added on items and customized packages.  See table below for estimated shipping costs.  You may choose to increase your pledge by the estimated amount if you do not wish to pay via BackerKit during checkout.  We are happy to refund excess postage that is prepurchased.
USA Shipping will be FREE
ADD ONS - BETA TESTING IN KICKSTARTER
Kickstarter is beta testing an ADD ON feature.  Add ons will show up DURING CHECKOUT after you choose your pledge level.  All add-on's will transfer over as items already in your cart with the exception of signatures.  (See below for more information on signatures)
SIGNATURES
          Mike Baron will be flying in to sign with Steve this time around.  Signatures are PER ITEM.  $5 Baron, $5 Rude, $10 Personalized.  Limited and Art edition books have the signed plate includes so they would just pay the $10 Personalized fee for us to unwrap the book and have it personalized.
          When you pre-purchase a signature, it will show up as a CREDIT when you check out once the campaign ends.  During checkout we will ask for each item...
$0 Unsigned
$5 Signed by Rude
$10 Signed by Baron & Rude
$15 Signed & Personalized by Rude
$20 Signed & Personalized by Baron & Rude
We will be adding art daily. There are over 90 pieces of original art to add.
 BOTH VERSION HAVE DIFFERENT DESIGNERS
Aside from having different content, both books have different designers, making each book unique.
HARDCOVER EDITION - 3 OPTIONS
PLAY

 DELUXE INCLUDES BOTH PENCILS AND INKS!
Basically giving you THREE books for the price of ONE!
THREE BOOKS FOR THE PRICE OF ONE! (Pencils are a STRETCH GOAL)

(1) DELUXE EDITION HARDCOVER - UNSIGNED VERSION
(2) LIMITED DELUXE EDITION - Same content as the deluxe edition, but with a signed plate signed by both Steve Rude AND Mike Baron.  It also comes in a slipcase and it will be shrinkwrapped!
Steve and Baron signing the Capital 1 Gulacy Cover (This is also signed by Gulacy!) Available as an ADD ON for $40!
(3) SUPER LIMITED ART EDITION - Limited to only 10 copies.  It will have the same signed plate, and will also have an original art page sewn into the book.  Art is random, it will be a painting by Steve of a character from Nexus.
TRADE PAPERBACK VERSION
This affordable version is a standard trade paperback size of 6.5" x 10" and 176 pages!
 GET A BONUS WHEN YOU ORDER THE SET!
When you order the set we'll send you an MP3 of the Nexus Flexi Disc that was originally found inside Capital City Nexus #3 PLUS and MP4 video of side 1.  Here's a sneak peak:
PLAY

THE BUDGET
Comics cost around $600 per page not including the designer, printing and shipping.  For this 90 page comic that was a whopping $54,000 that we've already paid out of pocket!
We break even at $150,000 before fees.  
WHAT DOES FUNDING SUCCESS MEAN?
If we can successfully reach $150,000 in funding we can recoup our costs AND fund the next book! 
THUNEWORLD - COMING 2021 WITH YOUR HELP
PRINTING TIMELINE
Kickstarter pays 2 weeks after end date and that is when we are able to submit files to the printer.  From there we anticipate 10-12 weeks for approvals, printing, and shipping.  That puts us with a ship date of March.
WANT EXTRA ITEMS FOR CHRISTMAS?
-You will receive a printed 5x7 certificate for each book you ordered
-You will also receive a digital version
-You will receive a set of 10 cards with envelopes
-You will receive your order (without Gourmando books) shipped to arrive before Christmas
-The books will ship when they arrive in house, anticipated March 2021
5x7" Certificate when you choose "I Want it for Christmas"
Set of ten (10) 5x7 greeting cards when you choose "I Want it for Christmas". Order Extra sets for $10
Close up of Santa's Wish List
Back of card
We are offering to ship all in house items (basically, everything except the actual books) in time for Christmas for a small fee of $25 US, $45 Canada or $55 Everywhere else (inclusive of shipping).  As a bonus we will also be including a special set of exclusive Santa cards! 
This image was originally done as a "Smoking Santa" for Horizion TV for the show "The Right Stuff".  Steve's not a fan of smoking so we printed Santa (sans cigarette) on bristol and he painted in an alterative that's much more attractive for santa!
The original SMOKING SANTA is available for purchase for $3,000 (add on)
Extra sets of cards are available for purchase for $10
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Printing delays is always our biggest challenge. We try and work extra time in, but delays happen. We keep updates coming to let everyone know what the hold up is so check updates often!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Nexus: The Coming of Gourmando Oversized Hardcover Preview with Steve Rude
updates.update_content: Steve filmed a special sneak of the hardcover yesterday.  It's a pretty amazing book and one that he is extremely proud of.  We started the journey with this book is 2015!   The 10-pound hardcover will only be sold through us.

SHIPPING UPDATE
We looked into every possible option for the books and in the end the only affordable option was to have the books shipped here then ship them out.  That cost is $5,000 + taxes/duties.  It would be approximately $80 per book to have even a small portion of them air shipped here or approximately $21,000 (yes, twenty one thousand dollars) to get the presale orders here early.
SHIPPING TPB BOOKS NOW - USA

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping: Current Situation in Hong Kong
updates.update_content:
Just a quick update - I just received this message and am awaiting a quote on getting our hardcover books from Hong Kong to the US.   Even though I had requested shipping to Arizona, the printer only quoted me to Hong Kong.
CURRENT CARGO SHIPPING SITUATION
Dear Customer,

GOURMANDO TPB UPDATES
We are down to what should be the last 50 books.  We sent 100 more out today and should have the balance done by the end of the week.  If you ordered a TPB ONLY (no hardcover book) and you do not receive a tracking number by the end of the week please contact us and we will look at your order.
GOURMANDO HARDCOVER UPDATE

We finally received color accurate proofs from the printer and Steve says the pages are beautiful so we approved the printing.  The increased size is going to be amazing!  The book is big with a nice thick covering on it.
I have an email in with the printer to determine when the book will be arriving in house.  I'll pass that along when I have it.

updates.update_userinfo: Gourmando Digital Deluxe Updated / TPB Update
updates.update_content:
GOURMANDO DIGITAL DELUXE DOWNLOAD
If you are receiving a DIGITAL copy of the Deluxe Hardcover we have updated the file.  It's still a huge PDF at 74 mb.  To access the PDF please log into Backerkit and you may access all your downloads there.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
As orders are shipping one issue we are having a few issues because many backers did not realize their add-ons did not sync to checkout correctly and their purchase came over as a credit.  Here are the issues I am seeing:

If you've missed our previous livestreams you can catch them on YouTube or Facebook:
YouTube: www.SteveRude.com/youtubelive
Facebook: www.SteveRude.com/facebooklive
Mike Baron will be here in Arizona over the weekend enjoying some sun and signing the Gourmando Trade Paperbacks.  We will be livestreaming, likely randomly, over the weekend, as well as our weekly livestream at noon on Sunday!  Join us, feel free to ask questions.
Livestreaming at 12:00 PM PST, Sunday, April 11, 2021

campaign.story:
The Secret Indian Restaurant
Discover the secrets of super quick and fresh ‘Indian restaurant’ style food...
Overview
There’s nothing more addictive or satisfying than eating your favourite curry, but Indian food cooked at home never seems to quite reach your expectations, and there’s a good reason for this....Indian restaurants and takeaways all over the world have closely guarded secrets - that is until now!
Being able to replicate and in some cases improve on your favourite curry house classics is only a dream for most, but armed with the correct information its easier than you think.
This book aims to breakdown and simplify what initially feels like a daunting task by explaining how restaurants and takeaways can produce stunning classics in what seems like an impossibly consistent and speedy fashion.
Learn how to cook the familiar classics, some hidden menu gems and all the exciting starters, sides and treats which will blow you away. Not only that, your family and friends will think you ordered a takeaway...my challenge to you is to cook and serve a restaurant and takeaway standard meal for friends or family, and wait for the compliments before breaking the news, that you made it!

Why and why now?
Given the world situation with restaurants closing and restrictions and no end in sight, more and more people are looking to cook interesting, fresh, new foods at home.
Restaurant style curries are a hidden secret which many people would love to uncover and with home cooking on the rise - now is the time to to learn the secrets of your favourite curry...I for one have enjoyed the unexpected time I’ve had to experiment and explore in more depth the great recipes I've learnt and cooked for over 30 years.

About The Author
Brought up in Yorkshire (north of England) and living in the Midlands (the birthplace of the Balti and the location of the famous Balti triangle) for several years, as well as training as a chef and running my own restaurants around the world, I have a unique insight into the passionate world of Indian restaurant cooking (know as BIR in the UK - British Indian Restaurant).
Living in Leeds, Bradford and Birmingham for over 25 years, I was naturally introduced to a plethora of different Indian restaurants from a young age. Bradford and Birmingham in particular has a large Asian community and naturally a vibrant Indian Restaurant scene to accompany...I’ve been in them all; Michelin starred curry house, 5 star hotel Indian restaurants, right down to the rough and ready places where I’ve eaten with the staff after hours at 3am.
As a trained chef you often get addicted to finding out everything you can about certain types of food, and also trying to get as close to the original as possible....for me this happened with curry, but unsurprisingly I first gravitated to old authentic Indian cookbooks, and whilst these are great and you feel like you may be understanding the traditional cooking techniques and flavors, this simply wasn’t the type of curry I was experiencing in any of the curry houses around the world - these are something else...and it's this that now has my undivided attention, and is my current fanatical obsession...the Indian Restaurant Curry.
I want to share this amazing food with all of you right now...
What sets this book apart?
In short; simplicity, layout, nutritional information, and the recipes are crafted by a restaurant chef. All this means important factors regrading layers of flavour are as important as the look of the dish.
Each dish has been developed over a long period of time and tested by cooks of all levels, from novices, students, all the way upto Indian Restaurant chefs which means I have been able to write and present each recipe in such a way that all levels can cook each dish easily and quickly.

Simplicity
The recipe directions (method) are short and to the point (actually bullet points) and the ingredients are grouped together (i.e. dry spices, wet ingredients, etc) in such a way that as much as possible ingredients can be pre mixed or prepared so they are added to the cooking method in one step. For example, a dish which uses 12-15 dry spices in varying quantities, can be pre-measured and readied (Mise en place) in a container, ready to be added at the correct time, in one addition.
Layout
All ingredients are in bold in the short method steps which means they can be navigated quickly and easily, even during the short cooking period. Each dish will also have a quick reference for heat, and a QR code if a video is available to accompany it. Also, to make it even easier for the reader, each recipe will have the quantities for 1, 2 and 4 people (many ingredients do not factor up so it’s important to show how to cook for more people) - this is also unique to this BIR style book.

Nutritional
Each recipe has diet and nutritional information, so people following a Keto, Vegan or vegetarian diet can see immediately which ones are suitable or how to adapt the recipe to suit them. No other BIR style Indian cookbook has this information.

Crafted
Each recipe is developed from a base recipe, which generally comes from traditional cookbooks (to gain knowledge of the original origins of each dish and the methods used), and then research follows the modernisation and adaptation of the dishes in the current restaurant setting. Once the ingredients and basic tastes are established, each recipe is remodelled using a chef’s knowledge to maximise the subtleties and layers of the sauce, and then placed in the framework of the style of cooking. Next step is to simplify the dish to a point that makes cooking it, quick, easy, and enjoyable without compromising the taste and presentation of the final product. 

Book feel
The book will have beautiful full colour pictures for each dish, as well as using photos in the cooking steps to reassure the reader they are achieving the right results. The feel will be modern and premium. The best food photographers and cookbook designers will work their magic to form a beautiful feeling book.
Chapter Description/Outline
As the techniques for cooking restaurant style food will be new to most people (although actually very simple), the first 25% of the book will be dedicated to explaining about how to use the book, techniques and equipment - all of which will focus on simplicity so as not to confuse or overwhelm the reader and be accompanied by lots of beautiful instructional photos.

Foreword
Introduction
Why this style of cooking is fantastic, how its cheaper, fresher, and healthier than you think. A look inside a professional kitchen and what we can learn from it and use at home. History of Indian Restaurant style cooking and its history in the UK and around the world.
Health & Safety
How to safely cook, store and use the methods and ingredients. How to quickly chop and prepare different ingredients safely using things like graters or food processors rather than knives, just like the restaurants.
Equipment
What is needed, how to use it, what to buy (i.e. what is essential). From basic home oven to how to build and use a Tandoor oven in your own garden. Techniques for BBQ use and stove top cooking to achieve the restaurant quality and feel you crave.
Ingredients
What to buy, where from and how to store and use. What ingredients go in each curry (to highlight how few ingredients are needed) for quick reference, plus restaurant hacks and shortcuts used in the industry.
Using this book
How to use ‘mis en place’, how to use each recipe, how and when to use the techniques, and explanation of the overall method used in all the recipes. The recipes will not have more than 10 steps (often less), all written in a short, to the point, easy to read (even during cooking) style.
Pre-prepared Ingredients
Your house Garam Masala, base gravies, pastes, precooked meats and sauces
Starters
10-15 popular starters you would expect to find in Indian restaurants all around the world, made from scratch
eg. Chicken Pakora, Onion Bhaji, Samosa, Prawn Puri, seekh kebab,
Curries
40+ recipes tested and ready to print
e.g. Chicken Tikka Masala, Korma, Madras, Biriani, Lamb Pasanda, Goat staff curry, Chicken 65, Butter Chicken, Vindaloo, Ceylon, Mango Chicken Chutney, etc.
Side Dishes
All the favorites including breads, rice, and Dal
e.g. Naan (3 different techniques to achieve restaurant style Naan at home), perfect Pilar rice, Roti, Paratha, Poppadom, Tadka Dal, Bombay Potatoes, etc.
Dips, Chutneys and Drinks
Raita, Onion Tomato salsa, Mango Chutney, Brinjal, Blooming Indian Onion, Madras Coffee, Lassi, Masala Tea, Bombay mix, etc.
Fusion dishes
Kolkata Fried Chicken (Indian KFC), Tikka Hog Roast, Indian Christmas/Thanksgiving Turkey, Whole Tandoori fish, Keema Pie, Mumbai Pork Pie, Indian dry-roasted peanuts, Indian Pork Scratching’s, etc.

updates.update_content:
So unfortunately we didn't meet the funding goal! 
Lets face it, this was set very high in order to produce the book at the highest quality with all the bells and whistles. It was a dream to be able to produce the book in such a way that it had amazing photography with full page photos for every dish and an amazing design edited by one of the best cookbook publishers in the world - this isn't possible...BUT...
...all is not lost...

So with one month to go until the Kickstarter finishes we are 10% funded - thank you all so much for your support, it is truest humbling...BUT...a really big put for the next 4 weeks or we is essential if there is any small chance of getting this amazing project off the ground.
So I ask a small flavour, could you all please share the project far and wide? On your normal social media, at your dinner parties (if your allowed them), on your other Indian interest websites and pages...anywhere you can think of.

Hi everyone, 
thanks so far for all your support...remember a quick share with your friends on social media would be a wonderful help.
Delivery destinations: Canada added for all rewards.
Recipe update: This weeks recipe development has been centred around the Bangalore region. Rogan Josh may be the most famous dish from the region, but their are also lots of great curries and street foods...Sambhar, Bisi Bele Bath, and many more...however this week we have been developing a sweet curry which contains nuts, fruit, coconut and cream...but its not a Korma or Pasanda...

campaign.story:
Introducing the RPI-LED GPIO LED Indicator Board for the Raspberry Pi
 Special note: All early bird specials are in stock and will ship just after receiving the surveys containing shipping addresses. All early bird specials have limited rewards available. 
New video added below for the Orange Pi Lite running with the RPI-LED Board.
Introducing the new Micronatic RPI-LED board used for easy GPIO LED indication on the Raspberry Pi 4b, 3b, 2b, and Pi Zero and Zero W. Easy to plug in and remove so it can be switched between Raspberry Pi single board computers. Created for use with Raspberry Pi's with the 40-Pin header. Also great for creating spectacular light shows.

The story behind the Micronatic RPI-LED Raspberry Pi GPIO LED Indicator board. 
The RPI-LED Indicator board was originally designed to help test web pages running on the Raspberry Pi that allow port pins on the 40-Pin GPIO header to be turned on/off simply by clicking a web button. The board made testing the web pages much easier providing indication of the state of 24 GPIO pins. The web designs will be featured in a new book being released sometime next year. This LED indicator board seemed to spark a lot of interest when shared with friends and colleagues so I decided to release the new product using Kickstarter.    
PLAY

           - The RPI-LED LED Indicator board - 
Great for debugging the Raspberry Pi GPIO Pins
RPI-LED Plug-in LED Indicator Board Top Side
RPI-LED Plug-in LED Indicator Board Bottom Side
RPI-LED (Green) Raspberry Pi LED Indicator Board attached to a Raspberry Pi
RPI-LED (High Intensity Blue) with multiple LEDs lit
RPI-LED (High Intensity Red) Limited edition
RPI-LED Plug-in mounting - Easy to swap between Raspberry Pi Boards
 Each backer will receive a free RPI-LED Product Sticker for easy GPIO quick reference: 

RPI-LED Boards in operation:
PLAY


Raspberry Pi GPIO programming Tutorial:
RPI-LED PCB Pin-outs: 

RPI-LED Board running on an Orange Pi Lite
The port pins are defined differently so I had to redefine the I/O numbers in the light show source code for the Orange Pi, but it works! 


Great for new programmers and experts alike. Perfect for visual debugging of GPIO Pins:
PLAY

Early birds ready to ship!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge for this Campaign will be dealing with manufactures and international shipping due to the Covid-19 issues. Manufactures are taking longer to create product and shipping has been delayed or even halted to some countries. Extra steps have been taken and an extra month has been added for manufacturing time. Prototype units have been manufactured by two independent companies for backup in the event there are additional delays. All early bird specials are in-stock product that will ship just after the surveys are received. We hope to ship early if conditions allow but will keep you posted.

Note: For international shipping; backers will be responsible for any import taxes if any are required by your country when ordering outside of the United States. Please check with your countries rules to see if any import taxes will be required for your purchase amount.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
All rewards have been shipped except for one where we have not received the survey with shipping address information.
We thank you all for your support of this product. We hope to be starting our second Kickstarter next year once the Embedded Web Control Panels on the Raspberry Pi: Design Reference (ISBN: 978-0-9970222-7-8) book is completed. The book will make use of the RPI-LED boards in the examples.

I wish to thank all backers for making this product a reality! 50 Backers!
Feel free to visit http://www.Micronatic.com/rpi-led.html for product details, datasheet, and source code downloads.
There is a lot of interest in this product and we are excited about the future release of the book titled: , ISBN: 978-0-9970222-7-8, that will make reference to the when demonstrating GPIO control through a static web control panel. I expect to release the book in 2021.

78% funded!  We are almost there. 
New project update: Someone asked about the RPI-LED board running on an Orange Pi Lite, SBC. 
I set up an Orange Pi Lite board running the armbian OS and have the LED light show running. I had to remap the I/O in the source code to match the Orange Pi hardware but it works well. If anyone would like the source code modified for the Orange Pi just let me  know. The remapping was pretty easy so very little impact to the code to run on the Orange Pi.

Wow, we are at 60% funded already and are just past the half way point in the campaign! We want to thank everyone for their support. I am working on a Raspberry Pi Tutorial about programming the GPIO pins and it’s almost complete. The ‘C’ source code for the RPI-LED light show is available for download on the web site with instructions and details: http://www.micronatic.com/rpi-led.html
We sent a test shipment to England from the US and it took less than two weeks to arrive so shipping product should not be an issue. I will send an update and post a link to the Raspberry Pi Tutorial once it’s ready.

Thank you all so much! We are now 33% funded and things are moving forward very well. There has been a lot of interest in the RPI-LED product.
     Our dream is to one day have the RPI-LED board be so well-known that the statement “Customers who bought this item also bought the RPI-LED Indicator board” when purchasing a new Raspberry Pi.
     They say it’s the journey that counts and not the destination. This has been a fabulous journey and a lot of fun creating fun videos, designing web sites, and setting up social media for the product. As Doc Brown once said “if you’re going to build a time machine, why not do it with a little bit of style.” And don’t forget it’s the 1.21 Giga Watts of electricity that makes time travel possible.  Just a little bit of humor from the ‘Back to the Future’ movie!

updates.update_userinfo: 33% Funded – Things are moving along great!
updates.update_content:
Defiantly a great start! Thank you for your support of this cool project. We are well on our way to meeting our goal. :)
Special note: The light show source code is available for download on the project web: http://www.micronatic.com/rpi-led.html
The board can be used with any means to turn on/off the GPIO port pins but the light show looks pretty cool.

campaign.story:
Selecting a material for your 3D printing needs is critical to your success in the 3D printing world. Each design you make will have different requirements that you will need to consider. What materials work best for strength, color, surface finish, or cost? This course is designed to help you choose the right materials based on your 3D printing needs. This course covers it all with common desktop 3D printer materials like filaments and resins reviewed as well as industrial materials like nylons and metal powders. Let’s learn about what is all needed for each material and ways you can optimize each workflow.
What you will learn:
Choosing 3D Printing Materials
Your 3D Printing Material Needs
Filament vs. Resin Printing
Metal, SLS, and Color Printing
Designing Parts for Different Materials
Manufacturing Tools and Materials
Early Access Kickstarter Offer!!!
Get a great deal on this course and help bring it to life here on Kickstarter. With your help, I will be able to enable students to stream and download 1080p HD videos of my courses. Any help would be very much appreciated.
Sincerely, James Leiske

campaign.story:
Datilgator Seasoning Lineup
Thank You! - Updated 11/16/2020
If you are just now joining us, we are Zack and Lauren, creators behind Datilgator Seasonings. We have been blown away by the tremendous amount of support for our project! We are making tons (literally) of our seasoning and offering all flavors at a discounted rate through Kickstarter ahead of our e-commerce website launch. If you are on the fence, now is the time to order! 
Zack & Lauren at Co-Packer
 OUR LABELS ARE IN! 😍
About
Hi my name is Zack! Thank you for taking a few moments to check out my project and (hopefully!) supporting me. I am on a mission to bring seasonings made with the Datil Pepper to market. 
What is a Datil Pepper? A Datil Pepper is a very hot, but fruity pepper from Saint Augustine, Florida with an amazing flavor profile. There are countless hot sauces made from the Datil Pepper, but very few seasonings.
Datil Peppers
How it all started
Several years ago, I decided to start growing Datil Peppers in my backyard to experiment more with the peppers. Through the growing, harvesting, processing and dehydrating, I created dry datil pepper powder that was fantastic for mixing in with other spices.
The second part to this story came from my dad. My dad has been making this amazing Cajun shrimp dish for the past 20 years. I have taken his recipe and tweaked it over the years to make my own delicious version. One of the main ingredients in that dish is Cayenne Pepper which is there to add heat. One night while cooking, I decided to swap out the Cayenne Pepper with Datil Pepper. I was blown away by the flavor, it was so good! I kept working on the recipe, making small adjustments and working towards perfection.
Datilgator Cajun Seasoning in pan cooking, ready to add shrimp.
Once I had a desirable recipe down, I realized it was quite time consuming pulling all of the ingredients together to make it every time. What started out as batches, turned into giving small bags of it to friends and family who were blown away with the excellent flavor but tempered and enjoyable heat. 
Datilgator Cajun Seasoning in a bottle for the first time.
It's a hit!
Under Florida's Cottage Food Law, I was able to make a small, but large enough batch to bottle and sell, using my home kitchen and extremely limited resources. IT WAS A HIT, we sold out before we delivered the first one, and people were already asking for more and sending us photos of all the things they love it on. It was a watershed moment for us, giving us the confirmation and confidence to move forward with the ultimate goal of bringing Datilgator to grocery stores, restaurants, and consumers.
Datilgator Cajun Seasoning packaged and sold for the first time, December 2019.
Moving Forward
With the success of Datilgator Cajun Seasoning, and the amount of work required to bring it to market, we decided to add additional flavors that have been in the works. The road taking Datilgator from a literal hobby and turning it into a business has been quite the challenge. There are many, many steps to become a food manufacturer. From signing a lease at a commercial kitchen, to getting a Food Safe Serv Certifcate, and all the additional permitting and licensing. Some of the requirements aren't required until you cross a certain threshold in sales, however, many retailers and restaurants require all of these steps to be completed before you can sell, so we are doing it all the right way, first. 
We have completed many of the steps already, but we need YOUR help to seal the deal for us and put us over the top. We have some really amazing rewards for our backers and at a discount from our suggested retail as a thank you for supporting us.  

Rewards
Our Kickstarter closes right before Thanksgiving (finishes 11/19/20) and our goal is to have all rewards delivered for the holiday season.
Seasonings
We are offering all 6 of our seasonings, plus a seventh that is just Datil Pepper Powder. All of our seasonings come in a nice, large (8oz by volume), square, glass bottle. You can read more about them in the rewards section.
Datilgator Seasoning Line Up + Datil Pepper Powder
Datilgator VS. The Competition
Products
To make things interesting, we have added three additional, non-food products that we feel are a great fit with the Datilgator Seasoning line. See photos below and find more details in the reward section.
Hand made cutting board made from reclaimed standing Red Oak.
Tri-Blend soft fabric Datilgator T-Shirt
Datilgator Kitchen Apron
Extras
As an extra twist for local backers (Jacksonville/St. Augustine Florida) I am offering, as a reward, me coming to your home to cook some fantastic Datilgator recipes for your friends and family. I have happy hour and full dinner options available. More details in the rewards section.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Starting a food manufacturing company is hard, like really hard. As the saying goes, if it was easy, everyone would be doing it. The biggest risk is failing to meet our goal, and all of the legwork we have put in mapping out our plan comes to a screeching halt.
 
Other risks include:
Our suppliers not having all the ingredients we need.
Our bottle, label, and cap suppliers being out of stock with those parts.
Additional costs that weren't accounted for or accurately accounted for.
Bringing the seasonings to scale, and manufacturing on a larger level than we ever have before.

The great news is I have created, launched, and successfully grown businesses before and I am well aware of how to functionally run a business. This includes proper planning, procedures, strategy and all the parts that come with being a successful business owner and entrepreneur.

We are confident with your help, we can make our dream of Datilgator come true!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: To all of our backers: Wishing you and yours a very Merry Christmas! We are reminded today that the greatest gift is not the one we receive but the one we give...love. ❤️ We sure love y’all for showing us so much love for our launch of Datilgator!🔥 Sincerely, it means more than y’all will ever know. Our family was no stranger to the sadness and fear that 2020 brought and having this new business to look forward to each day, brought light into our dark little corner of 2020. Thank you for that! ❤️ We cannot wait to bring you more recipes (and maybe even some new flavors 🤫) in 2021. We hope you’ll follow along with us on social media and tag us in your Datilgator dish photos! Merry Christmas and happy holidays y’all!

We are excited to share that we have shipped over 97% of ALL of our Backer’s rewards! We have a handful of international shipments waiting to go out and we are still waiting on a few surveys.
We are thrilled with all of the feedback we have received thus far! We will be out of the office from Saturday, December 19, through Tuesday, December 29th. We will not be checking messages during this time, but please feel free to send us one so we can respond as soon as we are back from Christmas vacation.
We hope during all of the cooking for the holidays that Datilgator will spice up your meals! send us photos of you using Datilgator. We are starting a section on our website to share real stories about how our customers are using Datilgator in their own unique way! We would love to include you. You can email photos and notes to:

Exciting News!
We received our full Datilgator shipment from our co-packer and we're starting to get orders packed up and on the road, out to you. 

As you may have heard, shipping companies are experiencing challenges unlike any holiday season in the past. Your Datilgator may take longer to deliver but rest assured that it's on its way and will be worth the wait.
THANK YOU TEAM!!!! Please check out this short video for the next steps!
Cooking with extra magic this Halloween, Burger Magic that is!

We are coming up on the last 1/3 of our campaign and things are looking great!
IMPORTANT INFO:
This week we will start sending out surveys to every backer to collect important information for shipping and other logistics.
IF you selected the YOU PICK 3 Seasonings reward or combo reward:

Hey Everyone! 
We created this video a few weeks before our Kickstarter launch and posted it in a bunch of places as a pre-launch hype video. If you haven't seen it you should check it out! We shot it partly with the smallest, wide angle lens available to get some stunning shots, making the piles of spices look like mountains! Tell a friend about Datilgator Seasonings this week!


Pre-Launch Hype Video!

Happy Monday!
We are just over three weeks into our campaign and have some AWESOME updates!
1. We have crossed the 1,000 unit mark with bottles sold, in under 3 weeks! 🥳
2. We are now 235% funded! 🙌

Double Pepperoni, Double Cheese, Double Sauce, but not double crust because, well, that would just be silly! Why double everything tonight? We hit a HUGE milestone today! Just after midnight, we crossed the $10,000 mark which effectively DOUBLES our campaign goal, truly amazing! 🥳 Thank you everyone for your generous support! For the occasion, we broke out the Datil Pepper Powder, which is unique in our lineup. This powder is straight, dried, crushed, and ground Datil Pepper, nothing else. To enjoy the complexity and full body flavor of the Dati Pepper, this is truly the best way to experience it! Remember to tell a friend about Datilgator this weekend! 😎

campaign.story:
HOW ARE YOU, Typographic Postcard #30
HOW ARE YOU, Typographic Postcard #31
Hi my name is Harald Geisler, I am an artist working with typography. With an uncertain COVID-19 season ahead I like to offer a safe and fun way to participate in a global art project. Even though traveling is restricted, postcards allow our handwriting to travel physically. This campaign coincides with World Postcard Day on October 1st 📮🌍
In four Kickstarter campaigns (1, 2, 3, 4) with the help of 837 Backers from 45 countries, I created a series of 29 typographic postcards. Now I like to add postcard #30 & 31, and hopefully we can set a new record and bring together backers from 50 countries. 50 countries = 10 extra copies of HOW ARE YOU cards for each backer(of 5€ and more).
Participating is easy:
1. Choose a reward & pledge.
2. Leave a comment with the country, state your reward will ship to. 
3. If you like, share how you are!
Currently backers from 24 countries are supporting the campaign: 🇦🇷 🇦🇺 🇦🇹 🇨🇦 🇩🇰 🇫🇷 🇩🇪 🇭🇰 🇮🇱 🇱🇻 🇳🇦 🇳🇱 🇳🇿 🇵🇪 🇵🇷 🇷🇴 🇸🇬 🇿🇦 🇰🇷 🇪🇸 🇸🇪 🇨🇭 🇬🇧 🇺🇸 (see → S T R E T C H G O A L S below for more details)
Here you see the complete set:  
🌍 Global and Local  S T R E T C H G O A L S 
After you backed, leave a comment and let us know to which country your reward will ship, and if you like to: share how you are. 
The more people from different countries back the project = the more cards all backers will receive! 50 countries = 10 extra copies of HOW ARE YOU Postcard/Sticker for all backers (of 5€ or more).
Currently (31. Oct. 2020) backers from 24 countries are backing the campaign. Here in alphabetical order: Argentina, Australia, Austria, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Israel, Latvia, Namibia, Netherlands, New Zealand, Peru, Puerto Rico, Romania, Singapore, South Africa, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, UK, USA.

Following up to Victoria's comment from the Typographic Postcard #27 Kickstarter (almost 4 years ago):
…I thought it would be only fair and encouraging to add a stretchgoal for US-Backers. 
Kickstarter is a unique platform that enabled me to share my work with people all over the world. Although I say all over the world, but in past campaigns I noticed that about 40% of the pledges are coming from the US. On the other hand other areas are underrepresented. Past campaigns were backed from 2 African countries: Namibia and South Africa. Regarding the two most populous countries China and India, only few backers came from China and none from India. That is why I came up with L O C A L — S T R E T C H G O A L S: 
 Join the project and pick a reward: 
📮💯Complete Set
You will receive the complete set of 31 Typographic Postcards, all Stretchgoal-extras, and one WISH YOU WERE HERE Poster (backside tells the story how the series came to life and pictures of all postcards.)
WOULD YOU LIKE TO GET MORE THAN ONE SET OF CARDS? After the campaign ends you can add individual cards, additional sets etc.
🖼 Typographic Object, HOW ARE YOU.
You will receive one HOW ARE YOU object, framed (17,5cm x 17,5cm) ready to hang. And all perks of the "Complete Set" reward. Each object is unique, set in actual used keyboard keys. Select one of the below:
Typographic Object #0
Typographic Object #1
Typographic Object #2 (OREO Edition)
Typographic Object #3 (A1243)
The keys of ↑ Typographic Object #3 are entirely taken from used Apple A1243keyboards, which were introduced in 2007. On its back, one reads: Designed by Apple in California. Assembled in China Model No. A1243.
Some trivia: On the first day of January in 2002 the Euro currency was introduced. Around 1999 keyboard manufacturers started to print a € sign next to the E key. This makes it easy to spot the age of a European keyboard.
Typographic Object #4 (black keys II)
Typographic Object #5 (IBM Model M 1985)
The keys for Object #5 were taken from the legendary IBM Model M Series manufactured in the United Kingdom from 1984 and is still being manufacturing in Kentucky, USA. In PCWorld (Jul 8, 2008) Benj Edwards writes about the Model M: “Stung by the criticism, IBM assembled a ten-person task force to craft a new keyboard, according to David Bradley, a member of that task force and of the 5150’s design team. Their resulting 101-key design, 1984’s Model M, became the undisputed bellwether for the computer industry, with a layout that dominates desktops to this day. As we peek under the hood of this legend, you’ll soon see why many consider the Model M to be the greatest keyboard of all time.”
Typographic Object #6
Typographic Object #7
Typographic Object #8 (Tetris)

———————————
Quick Facts about Typographic Postcards:
———————————
 Size: 12cm x 17.5cm
 Material: 265gr cardboard or heavier.
Printed in Germany
 Printing: four color offset with different finishes (glossy UV sealing, matt laminate, glossy sticker)
Some postcards have rounded corners.
"AUTOBAHN" "OFFLINE" and "I WAS HERE" are stickers / postcards! The other cards are regular postcards.
The back of the cards are easy to write on with pen, biro, pencil, inkjet etc. The front works well with marker and typewriter:
The backside of a postcard is very important. Regular postcards have "address - lines", but I am not a fan of "address - lines". For me they are always too short, or missing a line. When it comes to world wide addresses one size does not fit all. I think everybody should be free to use the card horizontally, vertically or diagonally or upside down - right to left etc. So I leave as much space as possible for you to be creative.
But I put some tiny information on the back about the postcard. 
IMAGE
How will the funding be used?
Most of the funding goes to the artist (≈30%), then printing, packaging and shipping the cards, a bit to taxes (16% VAT + income taxes), a little bit to processing credit card payments (3%) and a tiny bit to Kickstarter for creating this awesome platform (5%).
Timeframe
All the artwork work is done. I have already printed a test batch of Postcards:
Now I just need to know how many postcards I should order for the final printrun, and how much shipping material. After the Kickstarter Campaign is over it takes about 14 days for the funding to arrive in my account. Then I will place the final order with the printer. Until it will arrives (about 7 days) I will prepare the shipping (printing shipping labels and order enough packaging material). It will take another 5 days to package everything and have it picked up by the postman. So 26 days after the campaign ends the rewards should be in transit to you!
14 days processing payment / collecting addresses from backers
7 days printing cards / preparing shipping (printing address labels)
+/- 5 days packaging rewards
📦 Shipping 
All Rewards ship with priority mail from Frankfurt am Main, Germany to any location in the world (including islands and outposts). Your reward will be carefully packaged in a protective and reusable envelop. From the last Typographic Postcard Campaigns I found these average shipping times:
Germany: 1-2 days
Europe: 2-7 days
U.S.A. / Canada: 7-21 days
Asia / Pacific / South America /Russia /Africa /Rest world: 7-28 days
Please keep in mind depending on lockdowns in different countries these times can be significantly longer (couple of weeks). 
📍Tracking: Framed object rewards include online tracking and insurance. Postcard rewards are send out with priority mail without tracking. Costs of tracking depend on the country you are're in and because of COVID-19 change from week to week. After the campaign ends, depending on the situation, you will have the opportunity to add online tracking to your reward.
You can read more about this the project's history on my website: haraldgeisler.com/postcards
→Kickstarter References 
If you like to see my other typography Kickstarter projects check out this list:
Fonts:
 Sigmund Freud Typeface • a letter to your shrink 2013   — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/201030759/sigmund-freud-typeface-a-letter-to-your-shrink 
 Albert Einstein Font 2015   — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1822548650/albert-einstein-font 
 Martin Luther Font 2017   — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/martin-luther-handwriting-font-here-i-write 
😭 Martin Luther King Font 2019 (…did not reach funding goal)  — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/martin-luther-king-font 
 2020 Font Collection 2020   —https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/2020-font-collection 
Writing Reenactment:
 Kickstarter Gold: Pen Pals—Einstein & Freud 2017 — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/kickstarter-gold-pen-palseinstein-and-freud-handwr 
Typographic Postcards:
 Typographic Postcards #14-26 2015 — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/typographic-postcards 
 Typographic Postcard #27 "I WAS HERE" 2016 — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/typographic-postcards-and-sticker-27-i-was-here 
 Typographic Postcard #28 "WISH YOU WERE HERE" 2018 —https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/typographic-postcard-28-wish-you-were-here  
 Typographic Postcard #29 "OFFLINE" 2019 —https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/offline 
Typographic Wall Calendar Series:
 Typographic Wall Calendar 2011 —https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/107717342/2011-typographic-wall-calendar 
 Typographic Wall Calendar 2012 —https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/107717342/2012-typographic-wall-calendar 
 Typographic Wall Calendar 2013 —https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/107717342/2013-typographic-wall-calendar 
 Typographic Wall Calendar 2014 —https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/107717342/2014-typographic-wall-calendar 
 Typographic Wall Calendar 2016 —https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/2016-typographic-wall-calendar 
Cancel / Save / OK:

Thanks for reading,
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every artistic project bears risks. Every project is new and brings up unforeseeable risks and challenges both technically and artistically. I have published four comparable projects (4 x Typographic Postcards, Typographic Wall Calendar 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2016) so I know about the artistic, logistical and technical pitfalls to avoid. The research and preparation that I already made for this project, assures me that I am able to complete this project within the projected timeframe.
 
 Thank you for your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Is it possible to depict attractive things in Art Nouveau aesthetics, to express the charm of shiny metal, to add movement of mechanisms, as if to weave in them echoes of radio waves from the past, and to make them bring back the joy of childhood? We are looking for a delicate balance of mechanisms and lines, materials and shapes, ease of assembly and complexity of functions. And when we find this balance, we show you the new wonder of Time for Machine. So, models that were previously unbelievable for us, but are available for you today:
Luxury Roadster
Inspired by the legendary Bentley Speed Six. Luxury sedan of its time, nicknamed "Blue Train Coupe” by the journalists, which was able to overtake the Blue Train (Le Train Bleu). The Blue Train Races were a series of record-breaking competitions between automobiles and trains in the late 1920s and early 1930s. It saw a number of motorists and their own or sponsored automobiles race against Le Train Bleu, a train that ran between Calais and the French Riviera.
For us, this model is also the pinnacle of what we are able to do at the moment. We have used rubber wheels for better traction. We have made inserts of high quality leatherette to highlight the historic character of the model. We have added the rich decor and new interesting features. There is a block with a spring and a handle for winding the mechanism on the side of the passenger seat on board the machine, in the drum of the spare wheel. In the opposite spare wheel on the driver's side there is a switch for autopilot steering. Due to this function, the machine can make wave-shaped turns while driving.
 The engine mechanism switch is under the footboard. On the opposite side of the door there is a switch, which turns on the reverse function. Inside the cabin there is another lever that frees the steering wheel if you turn off the autopilot mode. By activating this lever you can turn the front wheels using the steering wheel in the cab. 
The model can travel more than 5 meters at full spring power. We also redesigned the spring block itself. In this model, the spring is supplied in a preassembled closed drum for easier assembly. You can open the doors, hoods, pip into the small luggage compartment at the rear of the car. Also in this car we used delicate decors and semi-transparent grilles on the radiator, wheels, headlights and interior for the first time.
PLAY

Luxury Roadster in action.
PLAY

Starbreeze Explorer
Inspired by the Space Shuttle era. Space Shuttle is a space program in which shuttles have made more than a hundred trips into space and made many breakthroughs in the exploration of space.
The model consists of several parts. The spacecraft has swinging flaps in the cargo bay and it docks to the accelerator unit. The accelerator unit has a winding mechanism and is wound up with a special key. Once the model is mounted on the stand, you can press the trigger lever and observe the slow spinning of the spacecraft. The shuttle makes several spins around its axis. 
The base of the stand is engraved in the form of space center tracks and the edge of the stand is made in the form of Cape Canaveral shoreline. On the stand there is a place for storing the key, on which you can also install the spacecraft in an upright position. In this model, the spring is supplied in a preassembled closed drum for ease of assembly.
The space theme is perfectly matched with the shine of metal. This is a unique mechanical model from Time for Machine, which has no analogues in its design.


PLAY

Starbreeze Explorer in action. 
PLAY

Chrome Rider
Like a real motorcycle, this unique model holds its balance only while riding thanks to the massive flywheel mounted in its heart. For us, such construction of the mechanism was a challenge, we spent a year developing this model, a year of trial and error until we achieved good results and reliability. 
We mounted the flywheel and the rear wheel on bearings for smooth running. We also inserted rubber gaskets into the wheels for better grip. 
The model keeps its balance thanks to the flywheel, but also has a free steering wheel like in a real motorcycle. The free steering wheel helps to keep your bike in balance, and if it is locked in place the bike can actually fall. Thanks to the massive flywheel, the model can travel more than 10 meters on two wheels.
The model has no spring and can be assembled quite easily. An excellent and unique gift for  motorcycles and mechanics lovers.
PLAY

Chrome Rider in action. 
PLAY

Medieval Hockey
Medieval Hockey is our long-running design, but this model hasn't became a part of the series. We have thoroughly revised the size of the model, the format of the playing field, the mechanism of the figures, their uniforms and the way they are assembled. And now this model really brings joy and pleasure to the game. 
There are two people playing. Each person has three players. The active goalkeeper, the defender and the forward. The task is to move a small black hockey puck on the field and score a goal.

Despite the fact that the field is small and there are few players, scoring a goal is quite difficult. The game is well-balanced in terms of chances to win, so the fun goes on long enough. We have tested this statement many times. Hockey is called Medieval because it is actually medieval knights, playing a modern game, on some Greek field. This eclectic and non-standard game will attract the attention of anyone who sees this strange fun.
Here is an example of a video where mom and daughter suddenly got so excited while playing Medieval Hockey, that it was impossible to get them off the game.
PLAY

Medieval Hockey in action. 
PLAY

Delicate Casket
Delicate Casket is a cute mechanical box for lovers of refined and unusual interior items. By pressing the wide Push key, the mechanism will be set in motion, the wheels will spin and the lid will open.
If there are enough items in the box, it will close smoothly under its own weight. We tested many versions of the mechanism and decor while creating the model. As a result, we received a delicate, sophisticated thing that can be given as a gift or put in your interior for long-term use and storage of your favorite things.
PLAY

Delicate Casket in action. 
PLAY


Choose your reward
Complimentary gifts:
Cute Double Decker and Tiny Sportcar. They are 9 cm long little and simple inertial models.
Cute Double Decker has a special pedal, which opens the roof of top deck. There is a space to place a thumb drive or something similar. Front wheels of Tiny Sportcar turn and there is also a lever which helps to move the top forward and backward.
Tiny models in action.
PLAY

The Team
PLAY

Watch a short video about our friendly team of engineers, designers and programmers, who work to create different models from metal, plywood, and models with electronic components.
We are always looking forward to your reaction to our new developments, and we are very pleased when our designers bring you joy and you leave good feedback on websites. We try to improve new models and fix the defects of previous models that you found. Thanks to you, we've made adjustments to the instructions and changed some units and assembly methods in new developments. In all new models, the spring will be delivered in a ready-made closed drum for ease of assembly, and the same changes will be made in previous mechanisms.
We're introducing new components such as bearings, rubber, eco-leather parts, updated packaging, and updated, more user-friendly instructions with multi-language translations. We are also creating electronic models, some of which will be presented this year. During development, we keep thinking about whether you will like it and whether you will enjoy it.
Models in action. 

PLAY

Media about us

Interesting Engineering - facebook
https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=2438658863028610
https://www.facebook.com/timeformachine/posts/1268826756797364

Geniale Technik  - facebook
https://www.facebook.com/genialetechnik/posts/930643930728216
Pop mech https://www.popmech.ru/design/482551-samyy-krasivyy-konstruktor-v-mire-modeli-dlya-perfekcionista/

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges
While we realize the challenges associated with a Kickstarter campaign, we also possess all the necessary capabilities to produce and deliver our models. What we have:

1) Our own manufacturing facilities with increased output and many years of experience in business and project management. We are confident in our ability to produce these beautiful and unique model kits for everyone who supports us in the campaign

2) Experience in cross-border delivery and contracts with key parcel courier services to ship Time For Machine models anywhere in the world at declared shipping costs.

3) We have a detailed plan how to proceed after the end of the project.

4) Our company’s strategy is based on our long-lasting passion for designing unique, creative models and bringing joy to people all around the world. Time For Machine team is always engaged in developing natural innovative models with sound construction and engineering.

With the support of Kickstarter – your support – we can breathe life into these interactive models and bring joy and beauty to people all around the world!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We are always here for you
updates.update_content:
Hi!
Thank you very much for supporting our Kickstarter campaign.
We love and appreciate our backers. We have sent everything, but if you did not receive your parcels, contact us please in messages or at support@timeformachine.com
Thank you once more.

Dear community!

The shipment continues, but life has never been easy: we had to split some of the parcels due to their weight so later it turned out that we need to deliver way more packages.

Right now we are still working hard on delivering your mechanical marvels as quick as possible.

Also, there is no need for you to worry: these changes won’t affect the customs fee.

Anyway, we’re trying to make things more convenient for you, so now we cooperate not only with SF express but also with other delivery services: SZEUB, EMS, HKDHL, and Aramex Tracking. You can put everything under your control and track your parcel at .

Needless to say, we also cannot wait to deliver our love to you.
Thanks for being with us!

Forever yours,
Time for Machine

Hi guys! We are actively sending the remaining tracking numbers, but at the same time we are waiting for the additional information we have requested from some of you. Please, check the messages and get back to us asap, especially if your address is a PO box, or you have not left the mobile phone number.

While all of you are waiting for the models to arrive (or for tracking numbers) we would like to introduce you to 2 amazing projects

Hi all! We have received the remaining tracking numbers only today (Sunday November, 22). And we are sorry for this little delay. You will receive the tracking number in messenger in the next 1-3 business days.

Yours,
Time for Machine Team

Hi all! We would like to thank all of you once again for your incredible support. We have already started the shipment and moreover we have found a reliable company with a great price for express delivery https://packageradar.com/courier/sf-express. As for now we have shipped 236 out of 272 packages to the USA and 35 packages out of 118 to Europe. You will receive the tracking numbers in your Kickstarter messages by Monday. Remaining parcels to the USA, Asia and Europe will be sent in the coming week.
As usual, contact support@timeformachine.com in case of any questions or concerns.

Hi all! We just wanted to show you some production photos. Everything is on track and the production process is coming to the end. Thanks to all of you, who made this project come to live. And for those who managed to provide all the necessary information on time:-)

Hi guys! We are kindly asking all of you who have not completed the BackerKit survey to fill them in by 1 pm Standard Pacific Time tomorrow. Those of you who have already completed the surveys make changes to your addresses if you need to.
Thank you for making this project real!

Dear backers,

We are still waiting for the 84 people to fill in the survey. Our team is sending the links to every one of these backers to Kickstarter messages. Please, fill the surveys in by Monday. Thus, we will be able to lock the orders and addresses and proceed to final steps of fulfilling our obligations.

Hi all! 83% of surveys are already answered, and we are ahead of time in production. Thus, we kindly ask those of you who have not answered the survey to hurry up! If all the surveys are answered in the nearest time we will change the timeline and close the BackerKit one week earlier. Please, fill in the survey during this weekend.

If you do not have the survey link contact support in messenger or at support@timeformachine.com

It's more than 24 hours after we've launched the Smoke Test survey. 59% of backers from test group have already filled in their surveys and there were no issues, so we are ready to send all the surveys now. You will receive emails with a direct link you just need to click. You do not need to register in BackerKit. Please, feel free to contact our support team at support@timeformachine.com if you have any issues accessing your surveys. We do ask you to fill in the survey till November, 2. This will provide us with all the necessary information for fulfilling your pledges.
