campaign.story:
ATTACK SURFACE: the long-awaited third Little Brother book
In 2008, I published Little Brother, a New York Times bestselling YA novel of resistance to authoritarianism. it's been published in dozens of languages and, translated and distributed to underground resistance movements in Myanmar and Iran. It's been repeatedly adapted for the stage and optioned for film.
In 2013, I published Homeland, the New York Times bestselling sequel, a book that Edward Snowden took with him when he went into exile when he fled Hong Kong.
Both books are classics, part of the curriculum at West Point's cyber-institute and part of the origin story of countless independent security researchers and pro-privacy toolsmiths.
Those two books tell the story of Marcus Yallow, a young, gifted techie in San Francisco who refuses to accept the conversion of his hometown to a police-state after a terrorist attack that triggers a brutal DHS crackdown (yeah, I know). 
Now, seven years later, Tor Books (US/Canada) and Head of Zeus (UK/Aus/NZ/South Africa/India) are releasing a third Little Brother book, Attack Surface. It's a standalone novel aimed at adults, telling the story of Masha, the DHS surveillance operative who appears at the beginning and end of the first two novels. After spending a lifetime hunting the resistance in San Francisco, jihadi militias in Iraq, and the pro-democracy underground in the former USSR, Masha has to confront the moral dimension of her life's work. 
You see, her childhood best friend has grown up to be a Black Lives Matter activist in Oakland, and now the cyberweapons Masha developed for her private-sector "security contractors" are being used against the protesters in her hometown.
Like the first two Little Brother books, Attack Surface isn't a mere technothriller: it describes in rigorous detail the real, shadowy world of automated authoritarianism: the tools used by autocrats and other powerful people to neutralize popular opposition movements, and the countermeasures that movements can use to defend themselves.
It features two afterwords: 
The first is from Ron Diebert, founder of the University of Toronto's Citizen Lab, whose forensic efforts have outed countless state-sponsored cyberattacks on journalists, activists and civil society, from Chinese attacks on the Tibetan government in exile to the Saudi cyberattack that led to the grisly murder and dismemberment of Jamal Khashoggi;
The second is from Runa Sandvig, a cybersecurity expert and key contributor to the Tor Project; for many years, Runa was in charge of cybersecurity for the New York Times' newsroom, defending reporters from state-sponsored attacks.
Like Little Brother and Homeland, Attack Surface is a guide to the digital risks of our networked world, a call to arms to build a better one, and a self-defense manual for the struggle that will necessitate.
Publishers Weekly called it "a high stakes and believable world keep the pages turning" and Booklist said, "Highly recommended for those interested in near-future sf with a politically aware bent." 

Here's how Macmillan describes the book:
Most days, Masha Maximow was sure she'd chosen the winning side.
In her day job as a counterterrorism wizard for an transnational cybersecurity firm, she made the hacks that allowed repressive regimes to spy on dissidents, and manipulate their every move. The perks were fantastic, and the pay was obscene.
Just for fun, and to piss off her masters, Masha sometimes used her mad skills to help those same troublemakers evade detection, if their cause was just. It was a dangerous game and a hell of a rush. But seriously self-destructive. And unsustainable.
When her targets were strangers in faraway police states, it was easy to compartmentalize, to ignore the collateral damage of murder, rape, and torture. But when it hits close to home, and the hacks and exploits she’s devised are directed at her friends and family--including boy wonder Marcus Yallow, her old crush and archrival, and his entourage of naïve idealists--Masha realizes she has to choose.
And whatever choice she makes, someone is going to get hurt.
About me:
Author photo by Jonathan Worth, CC BY, https://jonathanworth.org/
I'm Cory Doctorow. I started selling science fiction stories when I was 17 years old, and today I've published more than 20 books: novels for adults and young adults, picture books for small children, middle-grades graphic novels, short story collections, essay collections, book-length nonfiction and more. I'm primarily published by Tor Books (US/Canada) and Head of Zeus (UK/Australia/NZ/India/South Africa). I've won lots of honors and had several New York Times bestsellers and this year, I was inducted into the Canadian Science Fiction and Fantasy Hall of Fame. 
For about 20 years, I've worked with the Electronic Frontier Foundation in various activist capacities, and I helped found a similar UK organization called the Open Rights Group. I'm one of the owners of Boing Boing and helped edit the site for 19 years; these days, you can read my daily blogging at Pluralistic.net. I hold an honourary PhD in Computer Science from the UK's Open University, where I'm a visiting professor; I'm also a visiting professor of practice of Library Science at the University of North Carolina (Chapel Hill) and a Research Affiliate at MIT's Media Lab. My journalism and columns have appeared in The Guardian, Popular Science, The New York Times, The Times of London, Publishers Weekly, Locus Magazine, Make Magazine, and many, many others.  
In 2008, I published Little Brother, my first-ever New York Times bestseller. In 2013, I published its sequel, Homeland, which was also a bestseller. Now, I'm returning to the world of Little Brother with Attack Surface, a standalone novel for adults.
Why I produce my own audiobooks (AKA "Fuck Audible")

Audiobooks are awesome. I love 'em! Unfortunately, audiobooks are also a monopoly: Audible, Amazon's audiobook division, controls 90% of the market. What's more, Audible won't allow you to sell your audiobooks through their store unless you allow them to wrap your books in their DRM, which cannot be removed without committing a felony under Section 1201 of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act. Every audiobook you buy from Audible is locked to Amazon's platform...forever. They can revoke access to the book (they've done this with Kindle ebooks, starting with -- I shit you not -- George Orwell's Nineteen Eighty-Four... You can't make this stuff up!). 
I really hate DRM. A lot. It's kind of my thing. I'm even involved in a lawsuit to invalidate Section 1201 of the DMCA, the law that bans removing DRM. The idea that a company gets to decide how you use your property, after you buy it from them? Fuck that. That's not property. That's feudalism. I mean, at least with the original feudal system, the aristocrats were (despicable, eminently guillotinable) human beings. With DRM, the only "people" that get to truly own property are the transhuman immortal colony-organisms we call "limited liability corporations" for whom we are little more than an inconvenient form of gut-flora. 
Which is why none of my audiobooks are available in Audible. Recall that Audible controls 90% of the market, which means that publishers would have to be crazy to buy my audio rights from me, since there's nowhere to sell the (incredibly expensive to produce) audiobooks when they're done.
The good news is that I get to retain my audiobook rights! That's pretty rare in publishing circles. And when life gives you SARS, well, you make sarsaparilla!
The Audiobook
Preview the audiobook here:  Chapter 1: Two hours and 44 minutes for free! 
Making an audiobook is expensive, but it's not difficult. Publishing is such an outsource-oriented business that you can hire exactly the same people to do exactly the same job in exactly the same studio that the audiobook would be made in if you'd sold your rights to a real publisher.
What's more, you can do better than a real publisher would -- it's your show, so you can cast the voice actors, sit in on the production, and make something really incredible. Which is what I did.
To narrate, I hired Amber Benson - author (Echo Park Coven and more), actor (Tara on Buffy the Vampire Slayer and more) and all round excellent human being, who previously performed on the audiobook for my 2017 novel Walkaway. 
To direct, I hired Cassandra de Cuir from Skyboat Media, who have produced many of my audiobooks with readers ranging from Tim Curry to Anne Hathaway.
And for mastering, I hired John Taylor Williams, the engineer who masters my weekly podcast - a polymath musician, sound engineer, brewer, carpenter and all-round brilliant fellow.
We were originally scheduled to record in person in March, but, well, you know. The plague. Instead, we linked up by (ugh) Zoom: me in my home office, Cassandra at her home office, and Amber in the studio she'd luckily just built in her basement. Over the course of a week, we recorded the audiobook -- Amber reading, me texting notes to Cassandra, Cassandra directing, and all of us taking breaks when the helicopters started to hover over Amber's house. The dailies, taken from Amber's studio mic, went to John, who mastered them.
Now we're ready to go, and that's where you come in.
Normally, I'd just put the audiobook on my site when I was done and let the interest from the print book publicity drive sales for the audio. As expensive as it is to pay pro rates for acting and directing and mastering, the audiobooks eventually earn out and pay a modest profit. 
But there's a pandemic on. Our family income is down by half (we're OK, but man, it's uggggly), and you're probably tightening your belt too. By preselling the audiobook on Kickstarter, I can generate some income up front and offer you a discount. The audiobook will sell for $25, but if you preorder now, you get it for $15 (or even cheaper in bundles with the other ebooks and audiobooks from the series). 
All of the audiobooks and ebooks in this Kickstarter are unique in the world of commercial electronic publishing: not only are they sold without DRM, they are also free of any terms of service or license "agreements." Here's the deal: you bought 'em, you own 'em. Whatever copyright permits you to do, you can do. Whatever copyright prohibits, you can't do. I don't expect you to read a sprawling garbage-novella of cod-legalese that confiscates your rights as a condition of doing business with me -- and neither should anyone else.
Week One Update 
In which I reveal my true plan for this Kickstarter!
 Week Two Update
A plague upon your book-tour!
PLAY
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The audiobook is already recorded and mastered. All I need to do is contract with a digital delivery to send out your files on release day. If the world doesn't end - or if I don't get horribly ill - between now and Oct 13, we're good. 

Note: there is a nonzero chance that the world will end or that I will get horribly ill between now and then.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Cryptographic signature
support.descp: Your chance to get a signed ebook of the first Little Brother book: I'll paste a copy of the text of the book into an email and send it to you, which will automatically cryptographically sign it with my private key, a fact you can verify with my public key!

support.title: Little Brother ebook
support.descp: The Little Brother ebook, as a .mobi and .epub.

support.title: Homeland ebook
support.descp: The ebook for Homeland, the sequel to Little Brother. Delivered as an .epub and .mobi.

support.title: Attack Surface ebook
support.descp: The ebook for Attack Surface, a standalone novel set in the Little Brother universe. Delivered as an .epub and .mobi.

support.title: Attack Surface audiobook only
support.descp: The audiobook for Attack Surface, read by Amber Benson. No DRM, no EULA. Delivered digitally as MP3s.

support.title: Audiobook and ebook bundle
support.descp: The Attack Surface audiobook (delivered as an MP3 download) and ebook (delivered as an EPUB and MOBI download). All files are DRM-free, and are unencumbered by any license or terms of service.

support.title: Three ebook bundle
support.descp: All three Little Brother books: Little Brother, Homeland and Attack Surface. Delivered as .mobis and .epubs.

support.title: Three audiobook bundle
support.descp: The audiobooks for Little Brother (read by Kirby Heybourne), Homeland (read by Wil Wheaton) and Attack Surface (read by Amber Benson). Delivered digitally as MP3s. No DRM and no terms of service or license agreement. You bought 'em, you own 'em.

support.title: Three audiobook and three ebook bundle
support.descp: The official ebooks and audiobook of all three Little Brother books: Little Brother, Homeland and Attack Surface. Ebooks are delivered digitally as MOBIs and EPUBs, audiobooks are delivered as MP3s. All are DRM-free and unencumbered by license agreements or terms of service. You bought 'em, you own 'em.

support.title: Commission a Little Brother story
support.descp: We come up with a mutually agreeable prompt for a story set in the Little Brother universe...I write it. Anywhere I publish it, it will have your name on it as the commissioner.

support.title: The original ending of Little Brother
support.descp: The first draft of Little Brother had a VERY different ending. No one except my editor and my agent have even seen it. I will hand-copy it for you in my atrocious handwriting and mail it to you to use as you see fit.

updates.update_userinfo: Winding down the project (AKA last call!)
updates.update_content:
Hey folks! Hope you had a happy and restful winter break - I sure did! 

As previously noted, I'm going to be instructing Backerkit to delete all records from the campaign (to preserve everyone's privacy). I've tentatively set the date for this for Feb 15. Please download your ebooks and audiobooks from Backerkit before that date! 
If you have problems with the downloads, email me (doctorow@craphound.com) - please don't post here, because resolving Backerkit errors involves sending you your private link to get into the system, and I need a private means of sending that link (not this public message board!).

updates.update_userinfo: The Attack Surface Lectures: complete and bingeable!

updates.update_content:
Hey folks! It's been a journey but we're at the point where things are nearly wound up.
FLAC download links have gone out
Low-rez download links have gone out
Cryptographically signed emails of Little Brother have gone out 

(If you're expecting any of the above and didn't get 'em, email me, doctorow@craphound.com)

Hey folks! A whopping 4,000 of you signed up to receive FLACs of the audiobook, which is frankly fascinating as I never guessed there'd be that much appetite for it! This is definitely something I'll factor into future audiobook distribution plans and let other people know about.
However, this has blown up my plan to have a modest Google Drive folder and share the link with the few people I anticipated wanting it. As I've discovered from tinkering with Drive yesterday, you can only share a Drive folder with ~200 people.

updates.update_userinfo: I tempted the fates and I lost
updates.update_content:
If I were to write a short story in which the protagonist's challenges are the result of his making the same mistake over and over again, it would be a bad story.
And yet, here we are.
Yesterday's update, "Attack Surface audiobook part 4 (really fixed)" was -- you guessed it -- broken.

updates.update_userinfo: In which I tempt the fates
updates.update_content:
I made yet another mistake and boy, am I hoping it's my last.
When I packaged the Attack Surface audiobook for distribution on Backerkit, I managed to omit Chapter 14. I am totally mystified as to how I accomplished this incredible feat of idiocy, but I did.
Attentive (and patient?) backers will know that the final Attack Surface audiobook file has been cursed from the start. Not only did I manage to intially package part two in the part 4 file, but the file I replaced it with (which, thanks to Backerkit oddities, was sorted to the bottom of the download list, beneath a file called "ARGH"*) was missing Chapter 14.

I just hit the button to send your Backerkit surveys! I'm sorry for the delay but I'm SO glad I'm able to send these out.
Thanks to the 500 or so of you who got early surveys this morning in the "smoke test" from Backerkit, and especially to Mike Masnick who alerted me that I'd messed up the configuration to offer original manuscripts ($1000) and short story commissions ($10000) for FREE (ulp). Thanks too to dozen or so of you who were gracious when I wrote to you to explain that this was an error and that I couldn't fulfil it.

As I'd feared, my use of Kickstarter's brand-new "Add Ons" feature has slowed up the delivery of your rewards. The issue is that I'm the first BackerKit customer to use Add Ons, and they're still trying to get their tool to correctly make these work. It was looking like this could take another week and that is clearly too long.
Instead: we're going to send out your surveys tomorrow, but there's a wrinkle. If you're one of the hundred-or-so people who bought an add-on, it's not going to show up automatically in your BackerKit account. Instead, you'll have a credit with BackerKit equal to your add-on, and you need to reselect your add-ons with BackerKit's system. I'm sorry about the extra clicks! But it was that or delay everyone by a week.

updates.update_userinfo: What's Next? AKA, where are my books?!
updates.update_content:
In all the heady chaos of completing the Kickstarter and getting ready for the book launch next Tuesday, I managed to fail to send out this very important piece of information: HOW WILL YOU GET YOUR BOOKS?!
Attack Surface's official release data is Oct 13 and my goal is to get you your books on that day. I'm working with Backerkit, a well-established fulfilment company with sophisticated, reliable infrastructure for delivering both digital and physical goods for crowdfunding campaigns.

project_data.project_name: Attack Surface: audiobook for the third Little Brother book

campaign.story:
UPDATE: We're looking at more commercial kitchens daily, and deciding what's best for us. We need to speed up our backing to make our goal in time - is there anyone you know of that might have a few spare dollars for contributions to this Kickstarter?
Crater Hot Sauce started when we were trying to figure out what to do with leftover peppers.  
Friends would often come over, and since we’re a spicy bunch, we would usually have leftover chipotles, jalapeños, and others.  I thought about what I could do with them so they wouldn’t go to waste, and I started by trying to make a sauce for my girlfriend. When she really enjoyed that, I made a larger batch. This changed EVERYTHING.
When people started trying out Crater sauces I got requests for sauces. Some wanted a gallon jug so they wouldn’t run out within a couple of days!
Our first 4 flavors
Fresh habaneros happily waiting to be processed
We don’t use anything but fresh ingredients. 
Also, if it doesn’t grow naturally, it doesn’t have any place on our table or yours. We wanted a set of sauces that weren’t just hot for the sake of being hot, but packed a ton of flavour. What we came up with is preservative free, additive free, and contains mostly organic produce. We use no fillers, thickeners, or other garbage. This allows us to bring you the highest quality product possible.
Aged jalapeños add a perfect zip to some of our sauces
OUR GOALS:
GOAL: $8,000
$8,000 will allow us to purchase new equipment, and pay for more time in a commercial kitchen. We can also produce larger batches to keep up with demand.
STRETCH GOAL 1: $15,000
$15,000 will allow us to hire someone for marketing, allowing us to expand the brand.
STRETCH GOAL 2: $25,000
$25,000 will allow us to purchase all permits to get into food/condiment distribution channels. I will have a vote on Facebook for which stores you’d like to see us in soon!
STRETCH GOAL 3: $35,000
$35,000 will allow us to make a recipe e-book for all backers to download!  These are all recipes that pair well with our sauces.
STRETCH GOAL 4: $50,000
$50,000 will allow us to send all backers of $35 and up an extra free 5 oz bottle of your choice.
STRETCH GOAL 5: $100,000
$100,000 will allow us to move into a production facility and have it certified to produce everything we need.
We have 4 flavours released, and a fifth in testing right now.
These include Zinger (a Louisiana/green salsa blend), Mango Love (mango habanero), Pineapple Heat (with roasted pineapple), and Sir Gotcha (a Thai chilli variety). They are all full-flavoured, and not just hot for the sake of being hot (although there are some much hotter ones planned).
Where are we now?
Our company is registered, and we've secured a commercial kitchen. We have a couple local Vancouver restaurants carrying our sauces. As well, we have two hot sauce specialty stores carrying our sauces.
What do we still need to do?
1 month goal:
Expand bottling capacity and production 5x from current amounts
3 month goal:
Gain shelf space in 25 retail locations and restaurants
12 month goals:
Expand bottling capacities and production 50x from current amounts
Submit sauces to competitions
Gain shelf space in 100+ retail locations and restaurants
Scorpion peppers ripening on the tree
What are people saying about Crater Hot Sauce?
“I like that it’s roasted pineapple, I find regular pineapple too acidic” - Judy, Vancouver
"The Zinger has a zip, but it's not overly hot. I'm not usually into hot sauce, but this one was quite nice." - Shawn, Vancouver
"When I open Pineapple Heat, it smells very strong like pineapple. When I eat it, it's surprisingly balanced. I love it." - Cassiano, Vancouver
"We had a couple of customers come in to the Cheese, and they obviously liked the sauce enough that it walked away with them when they left!" - Mike, Vancouver
“The flavour hits you right away when you get it in your mouth. I was hesitant because I’m not really a hot sauce guy, but the flavours are what changed my mind” - Rob, Vancouver
"The Zinger is AWESOME!" - Ashley, Aldergrove
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks we anticipate are minimal, and the business plan shows a lot of promise.

Marketability: 
After conducting samplings at Lucifer’s House of Heat, a hot sauce specialty store in Vancouver, we have gained confidence that all the amazing positive feedback we’ve received is not due to a personal relationship with friends and family. This was crucial to our plan to grow into a larger business. We went into this with the attitude that if strangers are willing to put their money in your hand, that’s when you know you have a great product.

Financial sense:
We have already taken many steps to reduce our costs, while never compromising on quality. This will allow for a large enough margin that the business makes sense.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Fourteen years ago our team had a grand vision for a global racing league that would pit multiple world-class athletes in head-to-head competitions, through complex, technical obstacle courses, wearing giant, powered mech suits. The technology did not exist. The sport did not exist. Many thought it was impossible. Our team, however, was determined to bring this dream to life!
 Our Vision For A Mech Racing League 
It didn’t happen overnight! For more than a decade, we’ve been building a community and gathering knowledge in the pursuit of this dream. Through perseverance, and with the generous support of a small army of volunteers, students and sponsors, we were able to complete our flagship prototype mech in 2017. This mech was called Prosthesis: The Anti-Robot and its creation marked the dawn of the era of the sports mech.
It took more than 3 years of grueling field trials, equal parts engineering and pilot training, to get this machine to where it is today. And today,  we can proudly say we’ve created a fully functional giant, all-terrain mech suit. 
A sport, however, requires more than just technology. True sport is born of the innate human drive to master a physical skill. With the technology now in place, we are in a unique position to be able to offer you, our future fans and athletes, the rare opportunity to strap in and pilot the mech yourself by joining our pioneering team as we embark on the next phase of our plan — creating the sport.
We call this the Alpha Mech Pilot Program (AMP). 
Through this crowdfunding campaign, we are offering one-on-one mech pilot training, live mech demos and exclusive Alpha Mech Pilot merchandise. No matter which reward you choose, you will be playing a pivotal role in helping us take the next step towards creating a full-blown mech racing league, while taking your place in the history books as one of the Alpha Team members.
True Exo-Skeletal Control 
Prosthesis has no joysticks, no steering wheel, no foot pedals. Just 100% limb-for-limb pilot control. That’s right. Prosthesis has no automation, no giros, no ability to walk or balance by itself. It relies solely on the pilot for all its movement. Your arm and leg movements are amplified to control the mech’s four giant, steel legs, move for move. That’s what makes it a sport.
This was not by accident. With the relentless and unchecked automation in nearly everything we do, Prosthesis reminds us that some of the most rewarding things in life are those that require effort, focus and training. This is the very essence of sport. Prosthesis is a celebration of the age-old pursuit of physical mastery and human skill, now brought to an entirely new level through advanced technology.
 Bring The Mech To You
If you can sign up 15 people or more in your city for the Alpha Mech Pilot Training reward, we’ll take our mobile field trials operation on the road to any city in Canada and deliver an exclusive pilot training program at a location within a 100km radius of your city. The timing and exact location would be planned in conjunction with the pilots, taking into account weather and travel time.
For our brothers and sisters in the USA, we can’t wait to come and share this experience with you as soon as travel restrictions allow. Drop us a line if you’d like to talk about planning a deployment to your area for a demo or training, or both.
$50,000 - More time
If we hit $50,000, we’ll give everyone who’s signed up for the Alpha Mech Pilot Training an additional 10 bonus minutes in the pilot’s seat. That may be just the extra time you need to nail that move you’ve been working to master.
$100,000 - More Pilots
$100,000 will enable us to upgrade our training infrastructure and expand our pilot training program — putting more pilots in the mech and accelerating the growth of the sport.
$250,000 - More Mech
$250,000 will allow us to substantially upgrade the mech power plant, pushing the envelope of performance even further. More power means more speed, bolder stunts, and more ability for pilots to push their skills to new levels.
$500,000 - More Mech Action
This level of support will allow for  major power upgrades that will enable us to travel to more locations, explore new terrains, set up more exciting challenges, and push both the limits of the machine and the growing community of mech pilots. 
$3 Million - Mech 2.0
That’s a lot of pilot training (a little more than 3 people a day for a year)! With this level of support, we can devote Prosthesis entirely to pilot training, including a dedicated support team, while continuing our journey as we work towards creating the next generation mech suit. We’ve learned a lot from this prototype and the next mech will be lighter, faster, stronger — truly mind blowing.
Solo Alpha Mech Pilot Training
Your dreams of becoming a mech pilot start right here! And not just any mech pilot, one of the world’s first mech pilots. This is a rare opportunity to participate in something that only happens a few times in a generation; the creation of an entirely new experience, made possible by the realization of an entirely new form of technology. Go down in history as a visionary pilot in the Alpha Mech Pilot Training Program.   
We teamed up with world-class athlete and former Team Canada National Champion skeleton racer turned pro-coach, Cassie Hawrysh, to help us better understand how people learn new skills, in our efforts to develop a pilot training program that will maximize every thrilling minute in the mech.
You’ll be visiting our picturesque “Mech Ranch,” nestled in the beautiful mountains of British Columbia, just an hour from downtown Vancouver! If you can’t make it to BC, see our Stretch Goals above for how we might bring our training operation to you.
Pilots will have exclusive access to the mech and support team. They’ll also receive one-on-one training from the creator of the mech and the undisputed, number one mech pilot in the world, Jonathan Tippett. The program includes a “ground school” safety primer and at least one full hour of seat time. You’ll be guided step-by-step through the drills and exercises developed by Jonathan and Cassie to help you learn how to earn your stripes as a mech pilot. Between training exercises, you’ll get to chat with the team, hang out in the pilot’s lounge, or chill by the river on the ranch #mechlife!
Becoming an Alpha Mech Pilot is more than just a one-off experience. It means joining a club of like minded pioneers. You’ll also receive lifetime access to our online Mech Pilot’s Lounge where you can swap tips, tricks and stories, and keep in touch with the only other people on the planet who will fully understand the rush you’ve experienced as a mech pilot.
All pilot trainees will receive a sticker, patch, t-shirt and hat in person at the time of training, so you’ll be able to rock the apparel for all the sweet photos you’ll have with the mech. You can also bring one item to crush with the mech using your new found pilot skills, at no extra charge (see Crush It! details below).
Some restrictions apply, see disclaimer at bottom of Section 3 for more information.

Group Pilot Training
Many things are better with friends, mech pilot training is one of them. With our group package, you and 3 friends will each receive the same one-on-one training as the solo pilot course, including a full hour of seat time each.The only difference is training will be staggered between you and your friends, giving you the opportunity to learn more (and laugh more) as you watch your friends experience having a 9,000lb, 200hp mech suit at their command. All attendees will receive the pilot training swag package and can bring one item each to crush with the mech, free of charge (see Crush It! details below).
Some restrictions apply, see disclaimer at bottom of Section 3 for more information.
Three Day Pilot Boot Camp
Looking for more mech time than an introductory course can offer? Do you aspire to flip a car with a 9,000lb mech suit someday? Then Alpha Mech Pilot Boot Camp is the place for you! This is the pinnacle of the Alpha Mech Pilot program. By the end of this intensive, 3-day training program, you’ll be amongst the top ranking mech pilots in the world. This is the only way to earn your “Mech Pilot’s Licence,” which only 5 other people on the planet currently possess. 
This program has been carefully designed with the right balance of intensity and down time to help you absorb what you’ve learned by getting a night's rest between training sessions — a proven formula for excellence. This is the same program that YouTube icon, James “The Hacksmith” Hobson, described as “The best experience I’ve had in my life.” You’ll also receive the pilot merch package, as well as the much coveted Mech Pilot’s Licence and the option to bring one item to crush, free of charge (see Crush It! details below).
Some restrictions apply, see disclaimer at bottom of Section 3 for more information.
Prosthesis Demos
Rapid Structural Testing Service Add-On (a.k.a  Crush It!)
Have you ever wanted a specific item of yours to be crushed by a giant 9,000lb mech? We can help. Few things are as satisfying as watching something be summarily flattened under the weight of a giant mech foot. If you bring a suitable object* to any of our Prosthesis Demo events, we will crush it under foot, film it, and post the video online for you to share with all your friends. $150 per item. Max 5 items per person, per event. Be sure to check out our Mech Mondays on Instagram for some past inspiration.
Prosthesis Live Demo Experience
If you think Prosthesis is impressive on your screen, you won’t believe the feeling you get when you experience it first hand. There is nothing quite like feeling the ground shake as a 4m tall mech stomps around, live, in front of you. Seeing this machine stand up, casually walk over and flip a car is a surreal experience. We’ll be returning to the scrap yard in Squamish British Columbia, where we learned to flip our very first car. They have a nearly endless supply of wrecks, slated for the crusher that we’ll be able to have our way with.
With crowd restrictions, seating is limited to 30 people, which means everyone gets a front row seat. It also means you’ll need to jump on this quickly if you don’t want to miss out!
Private Demo
Want a more intimate viewing experience? For $1,800 you and 7 friends can come to our private test site and see the mech up close and personal. You’ll get a tour of our engineering operation and you’ll be able to chat with FXB staff and test pilots.
Prosthesis Racing Team Gear
For those of you who want to help make this dream a reality, but may not be in a position to come and see a live show or participate in pilot training, we have lots of awesome swag for you to choose from. Repping genuine Alpha Mech Pilot merch will establish you as one of the early visionaries who brought mech sports to life.
 Limited Edition Mech Foot Print Tee
For those of you who want a truly unique item, look no further. We’re going to try our hand at some DIY designs - mech style. We’re going to do a limited run of shirts using the mech to stamp one-of-a-kind footprints on tee shirts. We’ll film the process and give each shirt a unique number so you’ll be able to point your friends to the exact moment your shirt was created. You’ll also find yourself listed on our thank you video.
----------------------------------------------------------
Disclaimers 
Prospective pilots must meet the following criteria:
Be 18 years of age or older.
Be between 5’-4” to 6’3” in height.
Weigh no more than 225lbs.
Have a basic level of fitness (i.e. can you climb a 4m tall jungle gym and do 5 push-ups?)
  Training and Demos:
Prosthesis and the Alpha Mech Pilot Program are currently located in Squamish, British Columbia, Canada. Our operation is fully mobile, notwithstanding travel restrictions. Backers are responsible for all travel, food and accommodation, but we can certainly help with recommendations (See the Risks & Challenges section for more information).
If you’re unsure about which program is right for you, get in contact with us and we’ll answer any questions you have about the experience.
*Suitable Object for Crushing:
Must be pre-cleared by the Prosthesis Team 48-hrs before scheduled crushing.
Must be owned by the backer who brings it.
Must fit inside a 1.0m x 1.0m x 1.0m volume.
Must not contain any flammable, explosive, pressurize, toxic or banned substances.
We reserve the right to refuse to crush any item on the basis of safety, legality or general sketchiness.
The money raised from this campaign will be allocated in the following order:
When new pilots get in the mech, something may break. We need funding to purchase spare parts to ensure minimal down time.
What we’ve learned so far is that learning to pilot a mech is a physically and mentally demanding experience. To ensure each pilot has the best opportunity to contribute valuable information, we will build out our infrastructure from an engineering R&D facility to something more hospitable.
Pilot comfort is important. Funding will allow us to make modifications to accommodate a wider range of physiques.
We’ll build an off-mech interface for the ground school, so that pilots can feel the motions they’ll be experiencing in the machine, while working to internalize some of the more unique motions that this particular 4 legged creature requires.
We’ll work with world-class athletes and trainers to develop a prep course that ensures pilots will arrive as prepared as possible to maximize their time in the machine.
Want to get involved in other ways?
Want to get involved?
What can I do? I'm just one humanoid?
First off (and easiest) — share our campaign via social media! Like us on Facebook, share our campaign post, retweet one of our tweets, or subscribe to our YouTube channel for video updates
But I Have So Much More To Give! 
We're always looking for material contributions. Do you work for a lithium-ion battery supplier, we want to talk! Are you a kick-ass web-developer, an amazing illustrator, a 3D modelling master, or a ninja in some other discipline and you think could be useful (or actual ninja)? Get in touch and we'll find a way to work together. 
Furrion Exo-Bionics™ was formed from a rich heritage of community and industry collaboration, reaching back nearly a decade prior to its formation in 2016. We are always looking to work with partners who share our values and our vision. Get in touch if you would like to learn more.
People have been dreaming of building giant powered exo-suits for generations. Previously only depicted in Sci-Fi films and video games, this is the first time a fully operational exo-suit of this size and power - and with this level of speed and agility - has ever been realized. And this is just the proof of concept. 
We are particularly excited by the fact that we have made this technology a reality in the form of a sports machine. Sport is the universal embodiment of the age old pursuit of physical mastery and a celebration of human skill. It is an affirmation of the value of striving for excellence and a positive way to harness the human competitive spirit for the betterment of all. 
By combining cutting edge mech technology and the long running practice of sports and competition, we are expanding the scope of human experience, and creating a context where both technology and human skill can compound on the strength of each other.
Our vision for mech racing is more than just mind blowing machines and world class athletes. It is a reminder that in a world increasingly dominated by automation and virtual experiences, there is still a place where humans are in control and our technology is simply there to help us reach new heights. 
Press
CNET Interview
Buzz Grows In US
Guinness World Records 2020
Maker Faire Bay Area
Amazon re:MARS
Alpha Leg Prototype (2:3 Scale)
Initial Crowd Funding Campaign
Completed Mech - Furrion Exo-Bionics
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge in the short term will be limitations to travel. We are currently located near Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, and current travel restrictions limit the live experiences to backers within Canadian borders. 
Our operation is fully self contained and mobile, and Governments on both sides of the border clearly have a vested interest in allowing travel as soon as it is considered safe. While we cannot predict the future, we hope to be able to visit our neighbours south of the border by spring 2021 to deliver concentrated training and demo experiences in 1-3 week spells. Our first, most likely US training destinations include the San Francisco Bay Area, the Los Angeles area, and the Mojave Desert near Las Vegas. Ultimately, we are set up to travel anywhere in North America or ship Prosthesis around the world should the right combination of prospective pilots and/or ancillary opportunities, and regulatory conditions present themselves.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Something else
Not only is Prosthesis itself an all electric machine, but one of the ancillary benefits of the mech racing league will be to serve as a technology incubation space for high performance mobile electric power systems.

support.title: Thank You
support.descp: With your support mech sports are one step closer to reality.

updates.update_userinfo: Prosthesis 2020 Recap - Year of the Pilot (Preview)
updates.update_content:
Hello Mech Fans
The following is a preview of our year end recap newsletter that we'll be sending out to our mailing list on Sunday, January 17th. We'd encourage you all to sign up here to receive it and future updates on Prosthesis, Furrion Exo-Bionics and Mech Racing as we build upon the Alpha Mech Pilot Program.
...
August-October 2020: Alpha Mech Pilot Program

Greetings Backers!
This update is a few weeks over due so we thank you for your patience. While working to fulfill all the rewards we’ve been tackling a backlog of engineering work. We’re trying to take full advantage of the remaining nice weather this fall before the winter rains start here on the West Coast. We have received the funds transfer from Kickstarter and now need to gather information from you to fulfill your rewards. We are excited to announce that we have transferred all Backer pledges to our pledge management tool, BackerKit. We know that we have a lot of backers who have not used Kickstarter or BackerKit before so we will be providing detailed instructions in our next update once the surveys are sent. In the meantime we've provided an overview of BackerKit at the end of this email.  But first some updates on what we got up to in October.

updates.update_userinfo: Alpha Mech Pilot Program - Survey Sent
updates.update_content:
Greetings valued backers, fans and allies,

We did it!

updates.update_userinfo: Next Steps For The Alpha Mech Pilot Program - Important Reward Survey Info
updates.update_content: Here we are in our last week of the campaign. Thank you for all the support and encouragement so far, its the inspiration we draw upon as we work to make this dream a reality. We are looking forward to all our new pilots joining the team. To celebrate we present to you another mech sports first; Mech Rodeo! Enjoy!

updates.update_userinfo: One giant step towards mech racing
updates.update_content:
Greetings Alpha Team
It was just over three weeks ago that we launched our campaign and we seem to have captured the imaginations of people around the world!

We're only in our second week of this campaign and we continue to be amazed by the support of the community. We are 70% of the way to our next stretch goal of $100k which will allow us to upgrade our training infrastructure and expand our pilot training program.
For this update we thought we'd provide a behind the scenes look at the development of one of our favourite offerings; the custom mech foot print t-shirt. We had some fun trying this out for this week's instalment of Mech Mondays aka stepping on things with a giant mech suit. Our first attempt came out surprisingly well and we will be refining the process further in time to stamp out the rewards. The reward tee's will also include the Prosthesis Mech Racing Alpha Mech Pilot Program insignia across the back and AMP mech logo on the breast.

updates.update_userinfo: Into the home stretch and the world is watching!
updates.update_content:
Greetings Alpha Team
We've broken through the $50k mark! Thank you so much for helping us surpass our first stretch goal!

campaign.story:
TrickyPaw is a feature-packed, intelligent toy that is designed around your feline's natural hunting instincts keeping them entertained and accompanied all day long.


TrickyPaw aims to stimulate your fluffy's hunting nature, bringing a New ALL-Round Hunting Experience to your cat through light, sound and touch. 





Interact with your cat in real-time through the app, allowing you to participate in the cat's hunting process. 
Customize the escape routes of the “prey” or select 9 programmed routes, switching different simulated sound effects to attract the cat's attention.

9 escape routes and 9 sounds are intelligently and randomly matched, keeping your fluffy entertain when you're away.

TrickyPaw simulates a hunting experience for your cat with LED light to chase. We've made sure LED lights are safe to your cat's eyes.  

9 realistic sounds familar to cats to attract cat's attention, creating a real hunting environment for the cat's to play.


Different routes make the cat unable to predict the escape route of the “prey”, keeping the cat's curiosity piqued.
The textured bumps imitate the design of a cat scratch board, giving a sense of hunting success.
Additional accessories add even more fun to the game for your fluffy. 

TrickyPaw doesn't make the annoying noises or destroy the furniture like other moving and rolling toys.






MayMaw is a pet tech company that focuses on developing, producing and selling pet-related innovative products, including pet intelligent electronic toys and other pet innovative products. MayMaw’s mission is to provide fun, affordable, and quality products to enhance the lives of pets and their families. While providing customers with high-quality, safe and innovative products, we will constantly provide pet owners and their pets with the best consumer experience and customer service. TrickyPaw is our first self-developed product.


 This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been designing the product for months and have already started production! Development of TrickyPaw is smooth and on schedule. In any case, we are confident of, and committed to, delivering a quality product on time. We promise to update you promptly and explain the nature and rationale behind any change. We don't believe there are significant risks, but when shipping over the holidays there may be fulfilment delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: All parcels will be delivered very soon.📦🥳
updates.update_content:
😺Greetings TrickyPaw backers,

Great NEWS! Most backers have received our packages and we got some great feedback from our amazing backers. THANKS for your great support. 

While, we also received messages recently from US backers about the delay of delivery. Since the shipment last November coincided with the peak logistics period, many goods had to queue up to be shipped out. Additionally, due to the Christmas holiday and COVID-19, the logistics is twice as slow as usual. We are so sorry for not getting the package to you in time. We have also been negotiating with the logistics company, so that packages can be delivered as soon as possible. Now the packages have been cleared and are being distributed to local service providers. You'll receive your packages soon.

updates.update_userinfo: All the parcels are on the way!📤🎊
updates.update_content:
Greetings cat parents😸,

We are pleased to tell you that your package is going to be shipped out from our shipping agent warehouse. 🥳🥳 In the meantime, we have already sent out all the tracking number via email. Please kindly check your mailbox.📩

updates.update_userinfo: Parcels have been sent to logistic agents.📦✈️
updates.update_content:
Hello cat parents,

Hope you have a nice weekend with your fluffy.😺

We have sent parcels to our logistic agents. Some of backers may received their tracking number via email.📩 Due to COVID-19 and Christmas, all the parcels need to wait for more time to ship out. So the logistics information will not be updated be quickly. We're so sorry about that. Hope you could understand.

Hello Cat parents,

Hope you and your fluffy are all doing well.🤗🐱

We're sorry for not updating the latest situation in time. In order to provide better product quality, we have been constantly upgrading the material and packaging of products during this period. Strive to provide you with a better experience.

campaign.story:
To honor Nichelle Nichols, whose retirement is fast approaching, we will be shooting a short film that will establish her Renegades character - Ominara.
The short will include scenes with the legendary Walter Koenig of Star Trek the Original Series and Babylon 5. With excitement from start to finish, this is going to be a project to remember. 
Walter & Nichelle in Renegades: The Requiem
The story will follow OMINARA, the queen of the galactic underworld as she recalls her past and the path she chose to become the woman she became.
This short film will lead into the Renegades reboot that will soon be a part of the AtomicTV original content lineup.
As the first test subject of the "link," Ominara (Nichelle Nichols) was exposed to myriad experiments that could be construed as torture. All for the advancement of technology and the "betterment" of mankind. Anton Steiner (Walter Koenig) knew that Ominara's escape would cause problems for both himself and his company in the future, but he had no idea how much. 
Enjoy the behind the scene footage from our previous films: Star Trek: Renegades and Renegades: Requiem, including interviews with the cast, specifically Walter Koenig and director- Tim Russ.
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

Nichelle with son, Kyle and George Takei


HOW TO INCREASE YOUR PLEDGE TO INCLUDE AN ADD-ON
1. Click the “manage your pledge” button on the project’s page.
2. Increase your pledge by the amount needed to claim the add-on(s). (May not include shipping.)
3. Save your pledge. Do not change the tier that you originally pledged at.
Our ultimate goal is to produce and release a broadcast-quality short film at a percentage of the budget of the major broadcast networks. This was proven with the low production cost of the other Renegades episodes.
Below is a basic list of costs we will incur while making the episode:
1. Pre-Production - Getting the script written, the sets designed and built, the budgets finalized, securing the permits, the rental of the studio space, the costumes designed and fabricated as well as the props, such as tricorders, phasers, computer screens, etc.
2. Production - Paying the Cast and Crew, the cost of the Lights, Cameras, Grip equipment, Monitors, Food/Meals, Makeup/Prosthetics and Sound Equipment, etc.
3. Post Production - Paying the Editing Team as well as the cost of the CGI Effects, Color Correction, Sound Mixing, and Musical Score. (For this Campaign, the CGI Effects will be marked as a Stretch Goal)
During both Pre-production and production, we'll be bringing the Donors updates on our progress as well as behind the scenes pictures so you can experience this amazing process first-hand from start to finish. You'll become acquainted with the talented members of the Renegades team and see the cast do what they do best. 
We have created an amazing team that will increase our production value. If all goes according to schedule, we hope to complete Renegades: Ominara by March of 2021.
The Renegades pilot was shot like a feature film with close to 700 effects shots. This film will have far fewer effects shots, but post-production will take some time nonetheless. Upon funding, we will immediately go into pre-production in the third quarter of 2020. 
 Stretch Goals are only available to non-digital perks that include shipping.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks in backing any company. Atomic Studios has released several productions, including Star Trek: Renegades, Renegades: Requiem, and Cozmo's.

We have run assorted Kickstarter campaigns and fulfilled them all successfully and on time, Including the aforementioned board game, novels, and comics.

Production delays may occur but we will do our best to deliver on time.
Some art may be altered upon further development.

Anyone supplying their name for the Thank you page and the on-screen extra pledge is giving us permission to print their name in the book.

Some elements may be beyond our control, such as printing or production delays as well as art taking longer than expected. We will communicate via updates if such delays occur.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Renegades: Ominara Production Update - Trailer is here.
updates.update_content:
HI, Ominara fans,
We have a few pieces of news.
Principal photography has been completed - YAY. This is a huge undertaking and an enormous step towards completion. We still have editing, music, sound effects, and, of course, CGI to complete.  This will take several months, but we are well on our way and the performances have been dazzling.  We may have to raise a bit more for post-production. We will know more in the coming weeks.

Renegades Fans-
This has been an incredible campaign. The outpour of support and well-wishes has been amazing. We've unlocked two Stretch Goals now and we're about to unlock a third.  With less than 24 hours to go, if you haven't jumped in now, this would be the perfect time to do so, especially now that there's free stuff included with every pledge.
This is truly a momentous occasion, as Nichelle and Walter join forces for the last time to tell the story of Ominara's rise to power in the galactic underworld and her lifelong conflict with Prof. Steiner (Koenig).

updates.update_userinfo: Less Than 24 hours Left to Jump In On Ominara Phase 2
updates.update_content:
Hi,  Renegades supporters,
If you've been following along, you've seen that not only are we now funded, but we are about to hit our first stretch goal, with hopefully more to come. We are only a little more than $3,000 away.  That's awesome progress in a week and we still have another week to go. Let's keep posting and pushing so we can get you all some FREE STUFF!
Below is a video that includes an interview with producer Frank Zanca about Renegades: Ominara and the making of the production. (Fast Forward to 1 hour in.)

updates.update_userinfo: Ominara About Hit its First Stretch Goal & Interview Video
updates.update_content:
Hello, Renegades Fans - 
Thanks to your continued support of the project the world has taken notice. Hundreds of great media outlets have picked up the story and ran our press release.  Everyone is really excited about the project that you're helping to create. Below are a couple of examples.  You can click on them to follow the links to the articles. 
We are now only $10k from the goal and shoot dates are being scheduled. Please keep sharing, posting, and tweeting for us. Just a few more pushes and we'll reach our goal.

updates.update_userinfo: Nichelle & Renegades: Ominara are In The News
updates.update_content:
Hi, Renegades & Nichelle Supporters.
Several of you have reached out to me about adding some perk levels that previous donors can get, since the perks are generally the same. There's only a limited amount of perks we can do for a film, but if anyone has any ideas for products, I'd be happy to consider them.
Below are autograph perks and the Nichelle autograph perk is for previous donors only as Nichelle's signature is selling for $100 plus each right now at conventions, etc.  We have discounted it 25% and it will also include 8x10s from the new cast.

Hi, Ominara Supporters,
This has been a very exciting project thus far. Despite the Governor of CA shutting down production, we were able to push some shooting days through. So we are just about halfway done with physical production. Of course, costumes, sets, props, etc. have taken up quite of time prior to actually shooting. The footage looks great and our actress playing the young Nichelle Nichols, as well as the rest of the cast has done an amazing job.  As you can see, actress Loren Lott (Young and Reckless, American Idol) looks a great deal like Nichelle and the original Ominara concept art.

We hope everyone had a great Thanksgiving despite being sequestered. We have been working diligently during pre-production to get everything ready for our shoot dates next month. COVID, of course, has us jumping through additional hoops in order to keep the sets safe and compliant. 
We are now almost fully cast with some amazingly talented people. 
Of course, we have Walter and Nichelle playing the catalyst roles as Prof. Steiner and Ominara. They are rivals, with Walter taking on the role of the villain.

Hi, Renegade,
Production is moving along. It seems that there are a bunch of productions happening in November here in Los Angeles, so we had to move production dates back to mid-December to get some of the locations we need. The good news is, even on this tiny budget, we are going to make a deal to have the Icarus interior in the production. I'm very excited to be back on that set at Laurel Canyon Studios.

updates.update_userinfo: Production Update & Limited Super Sale On Autographed Giclees

Here's a quick rundown:
You will be receiving a link to the pledge manager this week. We’ll send out a BackerKit survey to collect your shipping information, verify your pledge and allow you to add any additional products you would like.

campaign.story:
To our Canadian and other ROW fans: we're so sorry about the insane postal rates. The United States Postal Service is under attack. Unfortunately, that and the ongoing pandemic has resulted in the absurd rates you see reflected in the campaign. 
To our fans based in the USA: thousands of small businesses like ours depend on the Post Service everyday to stay in business.
Please consider signing this petition to save the United States Postal Service. 
Skies of Fire is a limited comic series by Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou, with art by Pablo Peppino and Bryan Valenza. Skies was launched in 2014 and has remained 100% independent through crowdfunding and the support of our fans. For the first time ever we're publishing two issues in one year!
This campaign's goal is to raise funds to print the seventh issue of Skies of Fire. Any additional funds will be funneled back directly into the production of future editions of the series.
Skies of Fire takes place in the Aquilan Empire, a kingdom where airship travel has become the dominant means of transportation, commerce, and war. In the center of the Empire lies a monstrous, never-ending storm called The Expanse.
In Issue One, the raider Delmonte orchestrates a surprise attack on the key trade outpost, Port Prince. His actions prompt Royal Guard Captain Helen Pierce to volunteer for an expedition to bring him to justice.
In Issue Two, Captain Pierce enlists the help of the elusive William.
Issue Three follows the pair as they recruit members for their mission in the bordertown of Copperhead.
In Issue Four, the crew of the Zephyr comes together despite their differences.
Issue Five follows the Zephyr as they embark into the Expanse.
Issue Six finds the Zephyr in enemy territory deep in the heart of the storm. 
In Issue Seven, the Zephyr attempts to complete the mission.
The creative minds behind Skies of Fire and Mythopoeia, Vincenzo Ferriero  and Ray Chou have been collaborating on creative projects since 2008 despite living 5,437 miles apart.
Pablo Peppino is a an illustrator from Argentina with a focus on sequential art.
Bryan Valenza is a prolific artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects from top publishers in the industry. 
---------------------------------
Born in Barcelona, Cristian Docolomansky Cerda (C.D.C.) is an inker and letterer based in Chile. He's worked with several publishers such as Alterna Comics, IDW, and Ariete Producciones. You can find him here.
Gregory Shipp and I am a freelance fantasy and historical cartographer based in the UK. He is the cartographer of issue #7's codex document. 
The majority of funds from this Kickstarter will go into covering the cost of printing issue #7 and fulfilling orders from this Kickstarter. Any remaining money will be put back into further production of Skies of Fire.
Skies of Fire Book I is a 8x11" clothbound hardcover with 120 pages including sequentials, codex documents, and variant covers.. The book features a new wraparound cover by Pablo de Bonis featuring the city of Monterey.
Like our previous single issues, Skies of Fire #7  will be an 8x11 saddle-stitched floppy comic with 38 pages of interiors.
The Variant for Issue #7 features an original front and back cover oil painting of the First Battle of Ryder's Peak by award winning aviation artist Keith Burns. The preview image does not do the illustration one bit of justice! 
Each physical copy of Skies of Fire #7 will also include an 8x11 print of the artwork packed in.
We're debuting a new set of Desertlands Postcards from Dimitris Martinos! 
Each physical copy of Skies #7 will come with a random postcard similar in style to his previous set, the Lowlands War:
We Own The Sky Badge
Add-Ons can be purchased during the time of our post campaign surveys via our fulfillment partners at BackerKit. If you'd like to purchase your add-ons during the campaign, please add the following to your pledge amount (S&H included):
Digital Posters - $15
Digital Art Prints - $20
Individual Issues - $15
Variant #7 - $25
Papercraft Model - $20
Set of Postcards - $10
Archival Art Print - $25
Poster - $30
Badge - $10
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 13th campaign and third of the year. We have a fairly well tread pipeline from production to publication at this point. The only risk is in delays - the book is completely finished, but we still need to print and ship them out. 

Last time around COVID19 slowed us down by an extra month. This time we'll try to close out the campaign once again within two months, which we've so far have managed in around three of our campaigns. The other ones have taken a little bit longer, but in general our arc is towards faster fulfillment and delivery rather than slower. 

The United States Postal Service is under threat by the current administration. We have witnessed firsthand massive delays and rapidly fluctuating shipping rates in the last three months as a result. All signs point to this instability in this vital service increasing as we get closer to the elections in Fall. Thousands of small businesses like ours that depend on USPS for service are at risk. Please consider signing the petition to save our Postal Service linked at the beginning of the campaign and make sure to vote this upcoming November. 

As always, we have a 100% satisfaction guaranteed policy with our backers. Please never hesitate to contact us with questions, comments, and critique. We take everything in mind and are always looking to improve.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
3D printing can be a complex process and a lot of things can go wrong. But if you’re armed with the right knowledge you can print high-quality parts every time. This course is designed to show you how to get quality prints every time you print something. We will explore some of the most common software out there used for filament-based printers. We will learn about the settings that have the largest impact on your prints quality. You can learn about the best adhesion methods, how to remove supports, and how to get your extrusion and retraction settings dialed in perfectly.
What you will learn:
An Overview of 3D Printing
Understanding Slicing and Host Software
How to Get the Best Quality Prints
Printing Hollow vs Solid Objects
Slicer Settings That Matter
How to Get Prints to Stick to the Bed
Understanding Wall Thickness
Overview of Auto-Leveling
Print Temperature and Speed Insights
Having Multiple Extruders
Working With G-Code
Sample Videos
PLAY
