campaign.story:
LATEST UPDATES
 Project Background
The Maker’s Field Guide has been written as the first and only resource of its kind — demystifying almost every single tool, technology, and process involved in the making, building, or manufacturing of professional quality prototypes for use in design, engineering, product development, special effects, and crowdfunded / Kickstarter projects. Written by acclaimed industrial designer Christopher Armstrong, this book is the by-product of over a decade of practical, hands-on experience honed directly in the field of advanced research & development. Relying on the latest scientific methods in STEM and cutting edge R&D (Research and Development) practices from around the world, it delivers a comprehensive understanding on the use of manual  "old-school" tools of the trade, as well as "new-school" state-of-the-art technologies; featuring real-world case studies by top industry professionals in all areas of design, engineering, and filmmaking today. 
After launching in late 2018, the book was met with critical acclaim within the industrial design industry, ranking as the #1 Industrial Design book and Top Design Books of All Time by BookAuthority, and was featured in Iron & Air, Urban Workshop, and The Entrepreneur Motivation Podcast.
Now for 2020, we need your help get this momentous book printed as a hardcover! Not only will this hardcover book have a beautifully updated black & gold foil cover design, it will also include 80 new pages of content as an updated & expanded GOLD edition. This is an absolutely essential resource for anyone wanting to achieve professional quality prototype results, with content that's accessible for everyone from beginner all the way to advanced / professional industry-level. 
 What is the Maker Movement?
The Maker Movement represents a dramatic shift towards the democratization of design, engineering,  education, jobs and manufacturing. Advancements in new technologies such as desktop 3d printing and CNC machining are now putting powerful tools that were once only available to large institutions like NASA in the hands of millions of creators worldwide. This rapid pace of disruption is creating a paradigm shift and playing-field leveler like no other in history, opening up many new opportunities for independent makers and entrepreneurs that were once thought to be unimaginable. As a result, this is leading to what's known as the small-batch or "lean manufacturing" revolution giving rise to the "maker" and maker culture — the repercussions of which are so monumental, in fact, that it's often been compared to the countercultural revolution that pervaded the West in the 1960's.
Put simply — the Maker Movement is a collective group of empowered individuals who are becoming much less dependent on large manufacturers for the production of their goods and services. Add to that an increasing level of interest and investment into corporate R&D (Research and Development) programs that are leveraging the use of new technologies as a way of gaining a competitive advantage in the marketplace. All of these combined factors have placed an emphasis on STEM and engineering educations or skill-sets as the path forward to success in this new era of uncertainty and globalization — with tens of thousands grade-schools worldwide now rushing to build their own Makerspace facilities (now becoming hot commodities) out of both a fear of missing out, and in an attempt to stay out in front of this lighting-fast pace of change in today's volatile jobs marketplace. 
This movement is also responsible for placing less emphasis on formal degrees, and more focus on practical problem-solving capabilities — that can be demonstrated through real life, project-based portfolios instead (or simply put, provability of results as evidenced by real-life examples and / or case studies; no complicated math formulae or academic theory needed). If you've seen Kickstarter (or similar crowdfunding platform) campaigns raise millions, or tens of millions of dollars on a relatively simple, scratch-built functional prototype alone — you've witnessed the full power of the Maker Movement firsthand.

 Updated & Expanded GOLD Edition Sneak Peek
 NEW 80+ pages of expanded content (290 pages in total), including content suited for those serious about pursuing a successful career in R&D (research and development) or who are looking to profit from a prototype to launch on Kickstarter. No stone has been left unturned, giving each individual maker or Startup entrepreneur the best chances of success and is easily comparable to tens of thousands of dollars worth of higher education costs in such industrial design, engineering, product development and model making fields:
NEW 2020 GOLD expanded Table of Contents
Chapter 02 - Machines (1st ed. paperback content)
Chapter 03 - Hand Tools (1st ed. paperback content)

Chapter 04 - Materials (1st ed. paperback content)
Chapter 05 - Application (1st ed. paperback content)

 Expanded Advanced Projects section, showing step-by-step behind the scenes process of professional project case studies.
 Expanded R&D industry & jobs section, giving a holistic overview on how multidisciplinary teams function to bring successful products to market.
 NEW Index section added, along with a NEW expanded glossary of critical R&D industry terminology.
 NEW added section on mass manufacturing, which peels back the hood on how to bring a conceptual prototype design or invention to market. 
 NEW color coded chapter section tabs and pro tips highlight boxes, to facilitate much easier reference & indexing:
 Expanded and massively updated 3d printing/additive manufacturing section, now featuring 30 new pages covering metal 3d printing, rubber polymers, HP Multijet Fusion, Polyjet and many others. This now makes The Maker's Field Guide the most comprehensive, exhaustively researched resource covering almost all of the different types of on 3d printing / additive manufacturing anywhere on the planet:
NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content
NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content
NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content

NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content

NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content
 NEW beautiful black/gold foil hardcover format (11" x 8.5"), for lasting durability & shelf life (just like a quality watch you'd want to pass on down to your grandkids!): 
 Current Project Status 
Where we are currently at: we've already negotiated pricing and delivery terms with our book printing factory. Because we are also the publisher on this title, we can assure that both quality and delivery will be accelerated, as we have eliminated the need to go through an intermediary to produce, market, and secure distribution of the book on our behalf. 
The book is complete and ready to go to production once funds are released from Kickstarter. In order to publish the book, we need to get at least 300 collective book pledges or the equivalent funds from other backer levels.
Once the campaign ends and our factory has the order, the books will take approximately 9 weeks from initial production until delivery. Shipping accounts for 5 weeks of that time.
 Use of Funds
By backing this campaign, you will help to give us the resources needed to finance an initial production large enough to meet our manufacturer's minimum requirement. The goal of funding is to finance an initial production run of printed hardcover books, which will be distributed directly through www.themakersfieldguide.com and also through Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and other major book retailers. An order must be placed that's a large enough satisfy the offset printer’s requirements in order to set up the large metal plates (dyes) used in the offset printing process — which is industry-standard for full color photography books like this one. Once the books have been printed, they will be shipped to our regional location in Southern California, where they will be made available for sale throughout the USA and Canada, with possible plans of international distribution in the future depending on the level of demand from other territories outside of North America. 
The higher the amount of total funding received also equates to a much larger printing quantity available for distribution, where the educational impact of the book will have the ability to spread across a much larger surface area both domestically and abroad.  
Stretch Goals: 
 **Please see Updates #11/#12 & updates at top of project page. Made in the USA production will be possible above $32,000 in funding. USA production will also shorten the overall production and shipping timelines, allowing backer deliveries to be processed much faster (by at least 2-4 weeks). 

Timing 
Make no mistake — while the timing of this Kickstarter campaign is a little "unique" given the COVID-19 situation worldwide, the hardcover edition of this book has been a a plan of mine even before the outbreak. Because over 10 million workers have been displaced in the USA alone, this is a time for people who may be struggling to find a source of income. Therefore, the Maker Movement represents is one possible solution of empowering a new wave of entrepreneurs and independent creators to rise up, weather the storm, and to produce new products, innovations or solutions to important problems — in ways that have never been seen before (which, society will be the ultimate beneficiary of). 
Optimistically, more than a few groups of open-sourced, decentralized maker communities have made headlines recently, by showcasing to the world their ability to quickly and adaptively contribute innovative solutions to the recent PPE shortages experienced by hospitals. The implications of this type of cross-collaboration on a design & manufacturing front reach far beyond the current situation we are facing. See this fantastic editorial by the NY Times:  Coronavirus is Straining Hospitals. Here's How Innovators Are Helping. | NYT News. 
Billionaire Shark Tank investor Mark Cuban is one of the voices of optimism, and has even publicly stated recently that the next 10, 15, or 25 companies that go on to change the world will be starting during these challenging times. In his mind, and in the minds of many other prominent business & investing thought leaders, it is the spirit of entrepreneurial problem solving, innovation, and a dogged persistence that remain the fundamental economic drivers of a nation like America — and will all be key factors in our ability to come out of this pandemic stronger than ever. And, because of the quarantine measures being implemented in many locations, what better opportunity than ever to spend this time reading and learning something new!
 About Christopher
Christopher Armstrong is an acclaimed industrial designer and product developer, having held senior leadership positions on multiple Advanced R&D / Special Projects teams. His work has been featured in Hypebeast, Digital Trends, Footwear News, TransWorld Motocross (TWMX), Red Bulletin Magazine, AOPA Pilot, Coroflot, RECOIL, Performance BMW, Octane, ImagineFX, and others.
After studying at The Art Center College of Design, he has since spent nearly a decade in the design industry working with over 30+ clients worldwide — everything from small business Startups to Fortune 500 companies — including the NFL, EVS Sports, LIFT Aviation, Hazard 4, Stanley Black & Decker, Sony Playstation, Hot Wheels, O'Neill, Gridiron Labs, Microsoft Xbox, Piloti, and others. He has lectured and given workshops at multiple art and design schools, including Art Center, Concept Design Academy, Red Engine School of Design, and Brainstorm.
He was born and raised in Houston, Texas and currently lives in Southern California. Check out his professional design work at www.behance.net/christopherarmstrong
Featured On
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The paperback has already been in print for well over a year without issue, and the expanded manuscript for the hardcover book is almost complete and ready to go to production once funds are released from Kickstarter — with only final proofreading, proofing, and QC (quality control) needed. All pricing and timeline needs have been thoroughly negotiated with and approved by our printing manufacturer, for both USA and international production.

That said, final timeline and backer deliveries may be slightly effected due to the current COVID-19 situation worldwide. Our manufacturer continues to remain fully operational (both domestically and internationally), and we have made our best estimates regarding the timing of fulfillment and shipping. USPS is running slower than usual, and it is possible that circumstances beyond our control could potentially effect and/or delay our production and shipping dates. Currently, the 9 week production + shipping timeline accounts for up to a few thousand units. However, if this blows way past these expectations (a welcomed problem), we will make all efforts to produce the orders in batched quantities, then mail them out as they are completed. We will make every effort to keep backers informed along at all steps along the way if any problems/delays were to arise.

In order to publish the book, we need to get at least 300 collective book pledges or the equivalent funds from other backer levels. Please note that there are a handful of countries that we are not able to ship to: Ascension; Bolivia; Falkland Islands; Republic of North Korea; and Somalia. Stay safe!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: FINAL UPDATE — All Orders Delivered + NEW Kickstarter Drop Coming in Q2/2021!
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers,
I've been meaning to get this final project update out since the beginning of the new year. 
There have been quite a few questions coming in, so here's a brief bulleted list that should answer most of your FAQ's I've been receiving over the last few weeks:
 All pledges have been fulfilled, with just a few international shipments being delayed due to regional tariffs or customs issues. Importation procedures/speeds vary from country to country. For instance, there were about five different backers who had not received their shipments in the Netherlands. In some cases, packages have taken over after Asendia (the 3rd party tracking aggregator assigned to most packages by my fulfillment partner) shows they arrived in-country or were marked as 'delivered.' Unfortunately, Asendia does not provide real-time updates like a first party shipper would. If you still have not received your package, my suggestion is to follow up with your local shipping authorities directly. You can do this by contacting the largest regional shipper in your select country and see if they can track it down. For everyone who sent messages about potentially lost items, all replacement copies have already been issued and you should be receiving those soon.

Backers, 
Just a very quick update to keep all of you informed. This will be one of the last and final updates before all orders have officially been fulfilled.
 All USA orders have already shipped. The USA shipments that have still not gone out are because either A) Backers did not answer post-campaign survey w/address information, or B) Backers pledged for tier labeled *International and therefore were mis-categorized. That said, we're working on getting the last and final books in in the mail by Tuesday Nov. 3rd (election day) of this week.

Backers, 
A few of you have been asking for an order update, so here it goes: ~900-1,000 USA backers' orders have already shipped this past week. Once mailed out, you will receive a tracking # (via PayPal in the USA, via KS direct message international). 
Because we have to go through a different shipping supplier (shipping aggregator) for international shipments to achieve the low S/H price transporting across waters, this requires an additional step, is much more complex on our end, and requires us to batch the orders separately. This is why USA orders have  been given priority over international backer orders. Good news is that all USA orders have been shipped, with the exception of a small percentage of backers who have not completed the address information requested in the post-campaign backer survey (50+ addresses have not been provided in total).

This week we started final assembly on 3,000 hardcover books. Shipping to you is on schedule to start next week, with most orders set to go out by month's end at the latest.
Here's a few shots from our Illinois, USA production line.

Hey All!
Just a quick update to show what the production cover will look like.  "Spot gloss" has been added to the tools, title text, and gold graphic areas (this is what the magenta overlay sheet was used to verify in the previous updates). This cover is made using the exact same process that will be used in the production books, which have already been printed and are undergoing final assembly. For demonstration purposes, I've wrapped the sample cover over one of the hard proof "book block" (or interior pages) provided by the factory. All that's needed now is for this flat printed cover sheet to be wrapped around a stiff backer board, which will eventually be bound to the rest of the book in the final assembly. There's nothing better than seeing the fruits of tedious product development work finally coming together — I'm quite happy with the results so far, and can't wait to send the final books out to all of you once they arrive in the next coming weeks! :)

Backers,
Hope you all are doing well. Chris here with a quick update — I've just received official word from our USA factory that the full print run of hardcover books is slated for a completion date of 9/15 or 9/16. 
Five additional days will be needed to bulk freight the stacked palettes from the factory to our physical HQ location (SoCal), where they will then be sorted, signed (select orders), packed and shipped out to backers immediately after. Therefore, expect the books to start going out in the mail somewhere around

project_data.project_name: The Maker's Field Guide: Expanded GOLD Edition Hardcover

campaign.story:
As a Chemistry teacher, I always think that it is a good idea to engrave the Periodic Table on a card.
This is a high-quality electroplated black SUS304 stainless steel card, engraved with the full Periodic Table of elements and some useful scientific data. It is manufactured by a reliable Taiwanese company, which has 15 years of experience of metal card production, as well as very advanced laser engraving techniques.
A Full Periodic Table is Engraved
The Periodic Table of the Elements is probably the most significant piece of information in Chemistry. The table on the card includes all 118 elements with the most updated symbols and relative atomic masses.
The most updated information is gathered. For example, the revised relative atomic mass of Hafnium (from 178.49 to 178.486) has been taken into account (Source: https://iupac.org/standard-atomic-weight-of-hafnium-revised/).
A Data Chart and a Unit Conversion Table are Engraved
At the back, there is a chart listing some common constants, with a unit conversion table below.
Remarkable Quality
Tons of time had been spent on the design process to create a perfect card.
The SUS304 stainless steel card is extremely durable and corrosion-resistant. The metallic lustre of the card gives you an ultra-luxurious feel. All information is laser engraved (but not printed) on the card, meaning that all words, symbols and numbers will not fade nor wear off.
Thickness is enhanced to 0.6 mm (normally 0.3 mm for most metal cards) to ensure high rigidity.
Challenging Manufacturing Process
The Periodic Table and data tables are very complicated, so it is very difficult and time-consuming to engrave them on a stainless steel card accurately and precisely. 
But with our experienced manufacturer in Taiwan, all problems have been solved. The final product is awesome. All words and numbers are very clear.
The Card is Pocket-Sized
Dimensions of the card: 85.5 mm x 54 mm (same as a credit card). It can be easily fitted into your wallet!
Made in Taiwan
A local Taiwanese factory is chosen to produce the Chemistry Card. The production cost is pretty high, but the quality is excellent.
A Handmade Card Sleeve is Included (Exclusively for Backers!)
A handmade card sleeve will be included for each backer purchasing the card.
The sleeve is handmade by a local artist in Hong Kong. It is free for backers who buy a card now. After the campaign, it will be sold at HK$35 separately with the card.
Discounted Price and Free Worldwide Shipping for Backers
A discounted price (HK$145 / card) is offered to all backers, with FREE worldwide delivery and a handmade card sleeve included. More discounted prices will be offered for larger orders. All cards and sleeves will be shipped via registered mail.
Future retail price will be HK$160 / card + shipping cost, excluding the card sleeve (retail price: HK$35).
This is a great chance for you to obtain an awesome card and a stunning handmade card sleeve, at a very discounted price.
Shipped in an "Envirolope"
Your cards and sleeves will be shipped in a padded envelope called the "Envirolope", which is much more expensive than a traditional packaging bag, but is plastic-free and advocating sustainable forests.
Details and Specifications of the Card
Dimensions: 85.5 mm x 54 mm (with rounded corners)
Thickness: 0.6 mm ± 0.03 mm
Material: stainless steel (SUS304)
Colour of the card: black
Colour of the engraved information: silvery
Place of origin: Taiwan
Details and Specifications of the Card Sleeve
Number of card slot: one
Colour: grey
Exterior: cotton fabric
Interior: synthetic fibre
Place of origin: Hong Kong
  A Few Points to Note...
In the Periodic Table, only the symbol, atomic number and relative atomic mass of each element are engraved. The element names are not included because there is not enough space. Besides, while I have tried my best to search for the most updated data, science is changing every day so the information on your card may not be valid forever...
I expect that the cards can be delivered to all backers by August 2020. Thank you very much!
Why Kickstarter?
Indeed, we have already produced some cards, as you may see in our photos. However, as we have only made a handful of them, their unit cost is very high. If we can raise a certain amount of fund, we can afford to produce the cards in bulk. As a result, the costs for material and manufacturing will be much lower, so we can sell the cards at a much more reasonable price. Therefore, we need your support!
Please follow us!
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/minuteobjects
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/minuteobjects
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/minuteobjects
Website: https://www.minuteobjects.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are numerous difficulties during the design and manufacturing process, but all of them have been solved. It is challenging to draw a small but clear Periodic Table, gather the most updated information, find the best manufacturer that can solve all technical problems... However, all issues have been perfectly overcome.

The only risk will be shipping. All orders will be sent from Hong Kong. Although the post offices here are still operating, registered airmail services are partly suspended due to the coronavirus, so it may take a longer time for your cards to arrive (depending on your location).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Ultra-high quality SUS304 stainless steel is chosen as the material of the cards. This material is very durable and corrosion-resistant. Also, all information is laser-engraved (but not printed), meaning that all words, symbols and numbers will not fade nor wear off.
Reusability and recyclability
Your cards and sleeves will be shipped in a padded "Envirolope", which is much more expensive than a traditional packaging bag, but is plastic-free and advocating sustainable forests.
Sustainable materials
The card is made of stainless steel, which is obviously recyclable.
Environmentally friendly factories
The metal cards are made in Taiwan and the card sleeves are handmade in Hong Kong. The project aims to support small local workshops and studios. No sweatshop nor polluting factory is involved during the manufacturing processes.

updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Again, thank you very much for your support.
We are very glad that many of you love the Chemistry Card. Some backers have told us that the engravings on our metal cards may be too small for them to read. After reviewing all your suggestions, we decided to offer a credit card-sized magnifier as an accessory.

updates.update_userinfo: New Metal Card Available Now - The Unit Conversion Card
updates.update_content:
Hello all,
Again, thank you very much for your support!
We would like to introduce our new metal card - the Unit Conversion Card: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/minuteobjects/the-unit-conversion-card

Hi all,
Hope you all safe and sound. Thank you very much again for your support and sorry again for the delay. In this post, we would like to share the latest information about the reward delivery.
As far as we know, 95% of packages have already been delivered. Sorry that we realize some backers in several countries have not yet received their rewards, including Italy, Belgium, Denmark, Norway, and part of the US. We are tightly following up with the post office and the packages should come very soon.

Hi all,
Hope you all safe and healthy. Very sorry about the delay in delivery. We would like to share some information with all of you.
According to what we observe, about 80% of backers have already received the cards and card sleeves. The remaining 20% are mainly in the US, France, Denmark and Norway. We are following up and they should come very soon.

Hi all,
Sorry again for the delay. Indeed, we just got the latest update from the post office.
In July and August, airmails from Hong Kong to most countries were suspended, so we could only ship out most packets via sea by surface mail. We now have the most updated information from the Hong Kong Post Office.

updates.update_userinfo: A Quick Update about the Shipping Delay
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Finally, we have time to write some updates.
We have already sent out 96% of the rewards last month. If your rewards have been shipped, you should have received a message containing a tracking code. For the remaining 4% which have not been shipped, we will explain this in a moment.
Sorry that we are currently unable to send things to a few countries, including Russia, Brazil, Kuwait, Iceland, Chile, Jamaica and Saudi Arabia, as mail services to these countries are temporarily suspended. We will send the rewards to backers there once the services resume and meanwhile look into other possible shipping methods.

Dear backers,
Here are some updates of the campaign:
We are indeed working around the clock to prepare the shipments. All cards are ready now and we are trying our best to deliver them as quick as possible.
The only problem now is the delay in shipping. Due to the recent coronavirus outbreak in Hong Kong, post offices here only provide limited services so we cannot post your rewards efficiently. Even worse, mail processing centres in Hong Kong and many other countries are seriously jammed with parcels. Therefore, sorry that there may be a delay in delivery of your rewards.

updates.update_userinfo: We are shipping the rewards to backers!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Thank you so much again for your support! We would like to post a quick update to show you our progress. Indeed, we are starting to ship out the cards and card sleeves.

Hi all,
Just want to give you some updates about our project.
We are trying our best to prepare your rewards as quick as possible, as we understand that most of you are excited.
We are launching another crowdfunding campaign for the cards on Indiegogo (campaign link: https://igg.me/at/the-chemistry-card). Same rewards and same prices are offered. If your friends want to pre-order the cards at a discounted price but had missed our previous Kickstarter campaign, they may consider backing us on Indiegogo. However, their rewards will be delivered much later (probably by December 2020) because we have to prepare all the rewards for Kickstarter backers first.

updates.update_userinfo: We have sent a survey to all backers!
updates.update_content:
Dear all backers,
Thank you so much again for supporting our project! Because of you, the cards can be brought to live.
As you may have already noticed, we have sent a survey to all backers, asking about your delivery address and the number of card sleeves that you would like to receive. Please kindly complete the survey so that we can send the rewards to you.

campaign.story:
Nexus, a novel
We are raising funds to publish a science fiction novel based on the popular Nexus comic book. I created Nexus with Steve Rude in 1981.
Nexus, the Cosmic Avenger, faces Gourmando, a vast, alien entity that consumes civilizations. Its herald Gnosis swoops the cosmos on a silver board seeding worlds to make them edible. While Gourmando threatens Nexus' home planet Ylum, Nexus is on Earth executing mass murderers. This is his job. Torn between his duties and the survival of his planet, Nexus must reach deep within himself to save Ylum. The novel is loosely based on a storyline I worked out with Steve Rude, which will be published next year by Dark Horse. The novel is different from the graphic novel, and covers Ylum and its colorful cast of characters in much greater depth. Years ago, Rude asked me what Nexus story I would most like to pursue. Nexus versus Galactus, I said. Marvel owns Galactus, so we created our own planet-devouring monster.
I am a two-time Eisner and Inkpot winner, creator of Nexus and Badger. I have written Punisher, Flash, and Star Wars. Ten years ago I began writing novels. Kevin J. Anderson, NYT best-selling science fiction author, has published four of my novels, including Whack Job, Helmet Head, Banshees, and Skorpio.
"Mike Baron's NEXUS may be one of the finest examples of galaxy-spanning worldbuilding in Science Fiction. Add to that a compelling cast of characters, a flawless ear for dialogue, and a genuinely thrilling story, and the result is a truly brilliant book, full stop." – James A. Owen, bestselling author of HERE, THERE BE DRAGONS
“Comic fans have long loved Nexus, and now Mike Baron's Nexus novel brings his award-winning superhero to life in ways we haven't seen before. Witty, profound, and deeply moving, this novel is serious science fiction.”—Kevin J. Anderson, New York Times bestselling coauthor of Dune: House Atreides

updates.update_content:
To our friends who backed the Nexus Novel: Thank you! We are encouraged! We will write another!  Ended at $16,665 with 394 Backers. 
Mike and Ann

Thank you to everyone. Now over $15,000.  
Mike and Ann Baron

Wow!  Now, we are over $14,000. Again, we are very thankful to each one of you.
Mike and Ann Baron

Again, thank you and we are grateful. Over the $13,000 mark and we stillhave over 2 weeks remaining.  
Mike and Ann Baron

We thank everyone and we hit the $12,000 mark on funding.  Wow. Now every backer will be emailed the first two chapters of the Nexus 2 book. Greatly appreciated. 
Mike and Ann Baron

Hi Everyone, 
We have hit over $10,000.  Wow. Greatly appreciate every one of you. 
The next Stretch goal is when we hit $12,000 then every Backer receives by email the first two chapter of the Nexus 2 novel.  Mike will write it and this will only be exclusively available by email to the Backers of this Kickstarter.

Hi Everyone, 
Thank you so much and we hit the $8,000 goal.  This means that every backer will be emailed the short story "Come to Papa." This is a short story which has never been published. Here is a little blurb on that short story:  "Come To Papa" is a science fiction story about an aerospace engineer working on a satellite. A lab explosion drives a fragment of the unique
metal into Carl Spaulding's skull. Carl's in the hospital for a month. Rather than acknowledge their failure and liability, Spaulding Aerospace fires Carl on trumped up charges of negligence and intellectual theft.
Carl never had a chance. Neither Carl nor Spaulding understand the implications of that metal fragment inside Carl's skull. Not until the day he returns to work with a gun."

We met our goal within less than 24 hours of launching the Kickstarter. We appreciate every one of you and we are so grateful.  
Once the Stretch Goal is met at the goal of $8,000 then every back will be emailed the short story "Come to Papa." It is not related to Nexus but a great short story which has never been published. 
Again, thank you to each backer.

campaign.story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT
This will be our 10th sketchbook.  We skipped the past 5 years due to a death in the family and our son, Brandon, spent over a year in and out of the hospital.  We're finally back and creating a sketchbook to span the missing 5 years.
To keep costs down and still bring in the high quality, we are starting with a page count of 128 pages.  For each $5,000 raised over our goal we will add 8 pages so the final page count is up to our supporters!
AFFORDABLE QUALITY
Anyone who has ever ordered from us knows we care about the quality.  This is not a "kinkos" handmade sketchbook.  All our books (and everything we do) is top quality, professionally printed, thick stock, archival safe and we spend thousands on sturdy shipping containers, mailers, tubes, and packing to get those items to you safely.  If something arrives damaged we will replace it on request.  Back us and support quality and high standards.  We also don't want to overprice anything.  Sure, we could price basic levels at $100, but we like to keep things affordable.
GET IN EARLY, SAVE MORE
In an effort to minimize cost we are rewarding our earliest backers with "at cost" pricing.  We don't scrimp on quality or packaging so you are paying for thicker stock, professionally printed items and sturdy packing to get your items to you safely.
 CURRENT CHALLENGES
 $40,000 for the Challenge Coin which is currently being designed.  
1,000 Backers - We will include a set of 10 5x7 postcards plus a large sticker FOR THE FIRST 1,000 BACKERS ONLY.  Steve will draw 10 sketches on a postcard that looks like the blank cover and they will randomly go out in postcard sets
EXTRA BIRTHDAY BONUS
We were asked to include the Nexus Family Portrait in a goal that's reachable!
SO....Everyone who backed by 11:59pm PST May 19th will receive a Nexus Family Portrait bonus print!  If you upgrade to 11x17 or poster print then your Nexus Family will also be that size.  If you missed out you will have an option to order 
NOTE: This will be included the sketchbook only levels (not digital).  
WHAT'S INCLUDED SO FAR...
 PRICE GOES UP WEEKLY!
MAY 8-10: FIRST RESPONDER LEVELS: First responders get the most amazing deal as a thanks for being the first to help us reach our goal!  These levels get in AT COST as our way of saying thanks to our biggest supporters!
MAY 11-17: CHALLENGE ACCEPTED LEVELS: You have accepted the challenge to help get to the challenge coin; our highest stretch goal.  
MAY 18-24: DEFENDER LEVELS: Everyone needs a superhero. Thanks for having our backs!  We appreciate every level and are showing it by keeping costs down!
MAY 25-31: NEVER TOO LATE LEVEL: We’re in the last week now and it’s not to late to get in on these amazing backer only packages!
We've designed several packages to suit every budget with lots of flexibility and the ability to order whatever quantity you want!  Basic packages are:
NO FRILLS: You'll receive a PDF of the Sketchbook with the Wonder Woman cover PLUS a PDF of the Spidey Book if we reach $30,000.
SKETCHBOOK ONLY: You'll receive the PDF of the book plus a mailed copy of the sketchbook with all the extra pages added as stretch goals, a bookmark, plus the Spidey Book if we get to $30k.  Customize your package to add on books or prints.  ADD $5 TO HAVE STEVE SIGN YOUR BOOKS 
SKETCHBOOK + EXTRAS: Everything from above PLUS print #1 and your choice T-Shirt design, plus the extras outlined in the stretch goals. ADD $5 TO HAVE STEVE SIGN YOUR BOOKS
ARTIST PACKAGE: ALL THREE COVERS (2015-20 Sketchbook PLUS the alternate AND blank covers) PLUS a PDF PLUS Steve’s Nexus Chronicles hardcover, PLUS everything signed AND T-Shirt PLUS all other extras!
SKETCH PACKAGE: ALL THREE COVERS (2015-20 Sketchbook PLUS the alternate AND blank covers) PLUS a PDF PLUS Steve’s Nexus Chronicles hardcover, PLUS everything signed AND T-Shirt PLUS all other extras!  PLUS Steve will draw a sketch for you on your blank cover!  Package comes with a black and white marker sketch.  Add $200 for color, or $500 for something really special!  LIMITED TO 10 (DISCLAIMER: STEVE HAS THE RIGHT TO REFUSE A CHARACTER SO PLEASE  CONTACT US FIRST IF YOUR CHOICE IS NOT FROM NEXUS OR A KIRBY CHARACTER).
I WANT IT ALL:  If you've missed past years and want the best price at catching up then this is the package for you.  You'll receive ALL THREE COVERS (2015-20 Sketchbook PLUS the alternate AND blank covers) PLUS a PDF PLUS Steve’s Nexus Chronicles hardcover, PLUS everything signed AND T-Shirt PLUS all other extras! plus a PDF of all past year books AND mailed copies of the in stock books. 
 SPIDEY BOOK IS A KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!
2015-20 SKETCHBOOK & COVERS
This year we will have 3 covers.  The main cover (Wonder Woman), Alternative Cover (Batman) and a Blank Cover.  We plan to print around 500 of the main cover and only enough alternative and blank covers to fulfill orders.
INTERIOR PAGES
We currently have a 126 page book that was compiled in 2015.  As mentioned earlier, to keep costs down we will start with this page count add 8 pages for every $5,000 raised over our $10,000 goal.  We would love to produce a 250 page book!  
Here is a sample of some of the already compiled pages going into this years' book.  Something for everyone - commission sketches, fine art projects, and pages from Steve's sketchbook!
COMMISSION SKETCHES
PAINTED WORKS
INSTRUCTIONAL PAGES
PAGES FROM HIS PERSONAL SKETCHBOOK
EXTRAS
Extras are the best part of the fundraiser.  For funding the sketchbook the first extra is a bookmark (with all mailed levels), + Print #1 and a T-Shirt (levels with extras).
Our most popular image, the NEXUS FACE T is 1 of the 2 options for shirts.
2 SHIRTS - 4 OPTIONS EACH - NO EXTRA CHARGE FOR LARGER SIZES
STRETCH GOAL ITEMS
 KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE EXTRA BOOKLET
SPIDEY BOOKLET IS A KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!
UPGRADING/ORDERING EXTRA
Thanks to BackerKit, upgrading and ordering extras is easy!  Each level has their own checkout and each item is given a value.  To upgrade you simply pay the difference (i.e., short sleeve is $20 and long sleeve is $30 - if you choose long sleeve during checkout you will be billed an extra $10.  If you choose short sleeve no payment is requested, we simply ask for your shipping information.)  Add extra funds to your pledge now and use them during checkout!
For more information, click on image to see in at www.SteveRude.com
 +$200 for quick "Artist Choice" sketch in Chronicles Book
CLICK HERE FOR MORE INFORMATION ON THEINDIVIDUAL SKETCHBOOKS
DON'T FORGET TO FORWARD, TWEET AND LIKE!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Biggest challenge is trying to keep International Shipping down. Even though we charge up to $60 for the larger packages those could easily cost us $100 to ship. 

Having so many books under our belt and with the book already nearly completed we are excited to fulfill the final product!

We are still sourcing printers for reasonable turn around times. With COVID-19 many printers are 10-12 weeks out so we pushed our fulfillment date out to September. We are attempting to source everything in the USA with materials made in the USA. 

This is our 10th book and fulfillment via BackerKit makes tracking upgrades and special requests a breeze.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Our 2021 Sketchbook is currently in review by Kickstarter, but here is an exclusive sneak peek at offers.  Kickstarter has approved the project and we will launch at noon, PST on Saturday, April 3rd, just 2 days!
LINK TO PROJECT: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/steverude/2021-steve-rude-the-dude-sketchbook?ref=4ojmj1&token=3a8b439c
NOTE: We are still adding all the reward levels and add ons so that's not finished yet!  We are also pulling artwork that is available for sale that was used in the book and will be adding those as extra add ons.

Thank you all for your support of the 2020 Sketchbook.  As we finally send off Nexus: Gourmando to the printers, we are also preparing the 2021 sketchbook and plan to launch it over the next few weeks.
We are trying to simplify our Kickstarter goals in order to both streamline the process and take out any confusion.
To best meet needs we would like to ask you to quickly reply to the below survey which should only take a few minutes.

If you missed the Gourmando Kickstarter, we have just launched a 2nd campaign at IndieGoGo.  Quantities are limited as the book is currently at the printer and the print run is set.
The TPB is being finalized Monday and should be in house by May.  The hardcover has been expanded to 320 pages and enlarged to 12x15" making it over double the typical "Artist Edition" size, but it's going to be gorgeous!   Prices are slightly higher than the Kickstarter run with limited options, but we are offering FREE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING on the Deluxe and Limited Edition sets.

I'm pleased to report that the missing Batman cover books have made their way over the border and should be in house by Saturday so we are hoping to get off all the remaining orders by Monday!  The orders are boxes up and just waiting for the Batman book to be added.
We have a few left that did not have Batman books that we are working to get out tomorrow.  Brandon's trip to the hospital for 2 days threw off my entire schedule (and sleep) so I'm just now feeling human again and back to work.

INTERNATIONAL ORDERS
I'm getting ready to ship out another round of international orders on Friday after the Thanksgiving holiday.  I'm just doing the customs forms now.  All the Canadian orders should be done unless you had a Batman book.
BATMAN BOOK UPDATE

updates.update_userinfo: Steve Rude Livestreaming to End off Gourmando Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
With about 30 minutes left we are $2,000 short of adding over 20 pages to the trade paperback version of Nexus: The Coming of Gourmando.  Steve is livestreaming - See one of the blank covers in progress.  This one a Superman color!
https://www.facebook.com/steverudethedude/videos/822373465180830/

We are down to about 250 US orders.  Steve just finished the last of his May Free Comic Book Day commissions and is moving onto getting those black covers finished and I'll be posting them here as they're finished!  He plans to do a few via LiveStream as well.
So far we've had to reorder shipping supplies twice (it's impossible to guess the size of the boxes with each order customized) and batching in groups of 30 orders at a time seems to be working great with zero errors so far.  The post office has destroyed a few packages which we have replaced at no charge (they're all insured!), but 99% of packages are arriving unharmed and perfect.

YAHOO!  Books are in house!  We are going to start shipping tomorrow.  We will send out shipping notifications the day before your item actually ships to give you time to make changes, so please watch for your confirmation. 

We are starting with the orders that had posters as those are forced through because we had to ship the prints.  The next group we've singled out is the one that only has the books.

project_data.project_name: 2015-2020 Steve Rude "The Dude" Sketchbook

campaign.story:
"I have waited 43 years to see Cerebus No.1 the way it was supposed to look. Thanks to Sean Michael Robinson and The Waverly Press that wait is now over." 
- Dave Sim, 2020 
Every legend has a beginning…
In December 1977, Deni Loubert published Cerebus No.1, Dave Sim's comic book that followed the adventures of a short-tempered, barbarian Aardvark. Originally conceived as a parody of Barry Windsor-Smith's masterfully illustrated Conan the Barbarian (which was a big hit for Marvel Comics in the 1970's), Sim quickly found his own voice as a storyteller and illustrator, abandoning the typical self-contained, single issue adventures in favor of elaborate story-arcs which would often span dozens of issues.  
Dave Sim at the Forest Heights College Comic Book Convention in Kitchener, Ontario, about a year before Cerebus No. 1 was published. Photo by Max Southall.
The dawn of the 1980's saw the popularity of Dave Sim's Cerebus explode, igniting a revolution among self-motivated artists and storytellers who were looking for ways to go it alone, outside of the corporate structure of the BIG TWO publishers at the time, Marvel and DC Comics. Dave Sim helped pave the way for countless other self-publishers of the day, including Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Bob Burden's Flaming Carrot, Jeff Smith's Bone, and Colleen Doran's A Distant Soil, to name a few... Along the way, Cerebus found its place as one of the most intelligently written, entertaining, and influential comic books of all time! Though the series ended in 2004 with issue No. 300 after more than 6,000 pages of story and art, Cerebus still enjoys an intense and loyal following to this day.  
Due to popularity of Cerebus, original copies of the first issue now command thousands of dollars, putting them out of reach for most collectors. 
The original Cerebus No.1 was printed on newsprint paper and after 43 years, most of the few examples that have survived are typically found in lower grades. This new edition is presented with fully remastered art, prepared by master digital restoration artist Sean Michael Robinson, and will be printed on premium paper for stunning crystal clarity! We are working with one of the best printers in North America to ensure the highest quality reproduction!
RED - 24 Page Standard Edition. The original 24 page comic as it was presented in 1977, with remastered art. It's like owning an original Cerebus No. 1, only cooler!
GOLD - 48 Page Expanded Edition. The original 24 page story with remastered art + 24 pages of Cerebus Archive rarities! Limited to the number of advance orders we receive.
PLATINUM - 48 Page Expanded Edition (Signed & Numbered). The original 24 page story with remastered art + 24 pages of Cerebus Archive rarities! Each PLATINUM copy is hand Signed & Numbered by Cerebus creator Dave Sim! Limited to the number of advance orders we receive. NOTE: Aardvark-Vanaheim "Cerebus Archive" patrons can specify their unique Cerebus Archive number for the Signed & Numbered platinum edition. 
PROOF EDITIONS - These are proof copies produced for final internal review by Dave Sim, Sean Michael Robinson and the Publisher. These final stage pre-production proofs that we are offering represent the culmination of all the work that went into developing the "Expanded Cerebus" No. 1. This is our way of sharing the experience of the final stage of production with Cerebus readers who will receive the exact same copies we will be reviewing before the book goes to press. 
RED (proof) - 24 Page standard Edition (50 Numbered Copies). The original 24 page story with remastered art, just like the original book as it was published in 1977, only better! NOTE: These 50 examples are the only 24 page "Standard Edition" remastered copies that will ever be offered with the original $1 cover price. The final production books will come with a $10 retail cover price! 
RED (proof) - 48 Page Expanded Edition (50 Numbered Copies). The original 24 page story with remastered art + 24 pages of Cerebus Archive rarities! NOTE: These 50 examples are the only 48 page "Expanded Edition" copies that will ever be offered with RED flames! 
 If you are already a collector of Cerebus, this edition will rank with the crown jewels of your collection. If you are new to Cerebus, this is the perfect way to get introduced to this classic series, from the moment where it all began... 
 MANY sincere thanks to everyone who has supported or will be supporting this project in it’s final week. We put our heads together with Dave Sim to offer all of you a wide range of exciting Cerebus No. 1 collectibles!
Everything below is available to all backers who pledged for the $10 physical book and up... The price of the first item includes any additional packing and shipping costs, with discounts on the 2nd item and up... Perhaps you own a comic shop, or you like to hoard for a rainy day, for those of you we are offering bundles of 10 of everything at a deep discount.
To add any of these items to your existing pledge, simply click the "manage your pledge" button at the top of this page and manually add the additional amount (on top of your existing pledge amount) based on the prices below. When you fill out your backer report at the end of the campaign, be sure to note what extras you added to your pledge.
You are free to add as many as you want of each item (unless noted otherwise). NOTE: The “Stretch Goal” items, Pins, and Posters are being produced exclusively for this Cerebus No. 1 project, based on the number of orders received. None of these items will be widely distributed or reprinted.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We completed all of our work ahead of time and have proofed everything in advance. Our primary challenge is the COVID-19 virus which has the potential to slow down or delay manufacturing and delivery chains. As of the launch our printer and postal service remain open and we expect to remain on schedule but will send out regular updates during production. We have listed a much longer shipping window just in case there are printing and shipping disruptions. However, we plan to go to print in June and get all orders shipped in July so long as everything remains open. NOTE: Orders shipping outside of the United States may see extended shipping delays. In the event that postal delivery services are temporarily halted in any country, we will hold your package until normal shipping resumes. Every person who pledges will receive their package!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: INSTANT ARCHIVE!
support.descp:
For the Cerebus collector who MUST have it all, here is the instant archive! You get all three editions, RED, GOLD and PLATINUM including all 3 trading cards + the BONUS trading card D! During the development of the remastered Cerebus No. 1 the publisher had samples printed to review the evolution of the project. In all, there are 4 different editions, each one much more developed than the last. Only a handful of each were printed for internal review by Dave Sim, Sean Michael Robinson, and the Publisher. Since they have been handled they are not in pristine condition, but they are ultra-rare and ultra-cool! Additionally, we will include some other sample material that was prototyped for this project! On top of it all, you will get a 30 minute phone call with Cerebus creator Dave Sim where you are free to discuss anything you like!
INCLUDES:
Red Standard Cerebus #1 + Card A
Gold Expanded Cerebus #1 + Card B
Platinum Expanded Cerebus #1 (Signed & Numbered) + Card C
All 4 prototype Cerebus No. 1's
BONUS Card D

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Just a quick note to let you all know that the Cerebus No. 1books are nearly finished and we expect them to arrive in less than 2 weeks!
Also, if you haven't seen it yet "You Don't Know Jack" is on it's last day on Kickstarter. It's a project Dave Sim worked on and looks like a cool book! They have a some great packages available as they enter the home stretch. Check it out and back them if you can!

project_data.project_name: Cerebus the Aardvark No.1

campaign.story:
For years, fans have been clamoring for David Sherman's TO HELL AND REGROUP, the epic conclusion to his original series The 18TH Race. This book has been long delayed due to health concerns and issues with the past publisher of the series. After long last, and thanks to the help of author Keith R.A. DeCandido, we bring you the final installment of this hard-core military science fiction novel where humanity fights for its very existence. (For those new to the series, books 1 and 2, ISSUE IN DOUBT and IN ALL DIRECTIONS, are available through the add-on section or via specific pledge reward levels.)
In addition, we also present a brand-new series by veteran Star-Trek author Christopher L. Bennett. ARACHNE'S CRIME--the first book in a planned duology set in in a universe of the author's original creation--sets out to explore deep space and ends up in a harrowing encounter with new races, in a twisted tale of blame and redemption where responsibility and motives are not as clear as they may seem.
Won't you help us make these books a reality?
The primary goal for this campaign will fund the production of both books and the fulfillment of pledge rewards. The authors receive an equal share of 50% of the profits raised thereafter, with 50% invested in the press to meet promotional and operational needs.
If science fiction isn't your thing, you can still help support us. You can choose the IMPARTIAL OBSERVER reward level and pledge a sufficient amount to claim the book or books you would like from our Add-Ons section below. There are plenty of fantasy and steampunk titles available, even a little bit of horror, if you're into zombies! If no...perhaps you could help us out by spreading the word! Thank you.
Campaign image art credit: 67698892 - SCIFI UFO © mik38, www.fotolia.com
DONE! FIRST 15 BACKER BONUS - The first 15 backers will receive a code for a free audiobook download of The Die Is Cast, a short story collection by Danielle Ackley-McPhail and Mike McPhail.
DONE! 50 BACKER BONUS - The first 50 backers will receive a DRM-free copy of Robert E. Water's Devil Dancers.
DONE! 100 BACKER BONUS - The first 100 backers will receive a DRM-free copy of Keith R.A. DeCandido's short story collection Without A License.
175 BACKER BONUS - The first 175 backers will receive a DRM-free copy of Keith R.A. DeCandido's Guilt in Innocence.
UNLOCKED! $1300 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of Keith R.A. DeCandido's short story "House Hunting".
UNLOCKED! $1600 -  All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of Christopher L. Bennett's short story, "Vein Glory".
UNLOCKED! $2000 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of John L. French's short story "Slow and Steady".
UNLOCKED! $2300 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of Jeff Young's short story "Child of the Wood".
UNLOCKED! $2700 - All backers at the $5 and higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of Keith R.A. DeCandido's short story "Alien Invasion of Earth!".
UNLOCKED! $3000 - We will produce ARACHNE'S EXILE, the second book in Christopher L. Bennett's duology and it will be added to the pledge rewards and add-on section.
UNLOCKED! $3300 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of our new flash fiction collection, In a Flash - Christopher Burke.
UNLOCKED! $3600 -  Christopher L. Bennett will write a brand new short story "Comfort Zones", a prequel to ARACHNE'S CRIME.
UNLOCKED! $3800 - We will republish in an updated edition the currently out-of-print lost DemonTech novella, Get Her Back!, by David Sherman.
UNLOCKED! $4000 - We will produce a new science fiction short story collection by Jeff Young. The ebook will be added to all pledge rewards of $15 or more and the ebook and print versions will be added to the pledge rewards and add-on section.
UNLOCKED! $4400 - We will produce a custom patch based on the icon representing David Sherman's 18th Race series and it will be added to the 18TH RACE physical pledge reward and add-on section.
UNLOCKED! $6000 - We will produce limited edition hardcover omnibus volumes of the 18TH RACE and the ARACHNE series and these options will be added to the pledge rewards and add-on section.
Example: if your current pledge amount is $10, and you want to add a $5 add-on, you would click into the "Pledge Amount" box and change the pledge amount to $15. At the end of the Kickstarter, we'll send out a questionnaire to find out what add-ons you contributed for.
NOTES: all ebooks listed available in .epub, mobi, or .pdf, unless indicated. Also, we can autograph a book to whomever you want and you can order more than one copy of the same book when doing an add-on.
$5 – Add a DRM-Free digital copy of Get Her Back!,To Hell and Regroup, Arachne's Crime, Arachne's Exile, or Jeff Young's new science fiction collectionto your existing pledge.
$5 – Add a custom color patch of the 18th Race squad icon to your pledge. 
$15 – Add a print copy of the revised edition David Sherman's lost DemonTech novel Get Her Back to your pledge.
$10 – Add DRM-Free digital copies of the Jeffrey Lyman eShorts collection: The Fall of Autumn, Lord of Fire, Lord of Wind, and The Troll King to your pledge.
$10 – Add DRM-Free digital copies of James Daniel Ross's five Radiation Angels short stories, Not One Word, Revestak, The Oath, The Nature of Mercy, and A Different Kind of Courage.
$20 – Add a print copy of To Hell and Regroup, Arachne's Crime, Arachne's Exile, or Jeff Young's new science fiction collectionto your existing pledge.
$25/$5 – Add a print or DRM-Free digital copy of the eSpec Books title of your choice to your pledge (titles in bold are new titles that were not funded through Kickstarter) The Dead Bear Witness (print only), Tears of Blood, The Dead in Their Masses, Death and the Crone, Saint Code: The Lost, Finder of the Lucky Devil, Dragon Precinct, Unicorn Precinct, Goblin Precinct, Gryphon Precinct, Mermaid Precinct, Tales from Dragon Precinct, Stories of Fremont's Children, Among the Wild Cybers, Shattered Dreams, Dogs of War, Man and Machine, The Die is Cast, In Harm's Way, The Best of Defending the Future, Devil Dancers, The Best of Bad-Ass Faeries, If We Had Known, Footprints in the Stars, POST, Sister Paradox, In the Lamplight, Clockwork Witch, Death's Embrace, Spirit Seeker, After Punk, Gaslight and Grimm, The Weird Wild West, The Society for the Preservation of CJ Henderson, Without a License, Awakened Modern, The Side of Good/The Side of Evil, Issue in Doubt, and In All Directions). Multiply by the number of titles desired if you want more than one. They make great gifts! (Includes domestic shipping. If you're a backer outside the U.S. who has backed at a level that does not include shipping, please add $30 for shipping.)
$25/$5 – Add a print or DRM-Free digital copy of the Paper Phoenix Press title of your choice to your pledge (Three Chords of Chaos, Baba Ali and the Clockwork Djinn, The Halfling's Court, The Redcaps' Queen, Eternal Wanderings, Yesterday's Dreams, The Ginger KICK! Cookbook, The Literary Handyman, LH: Build-A-Book Workshop,Transcendence, A Legacy of Stars, and Consigned to the Sea). Multiply by the number of titles desired if you want more than one. They make great gifts! (Includes domestic shipping. If you're a backer outside the U.S. who has backed at a level that does not include shipping, please add $30 for shipping.)
David Sherman is the author or co-author of some three dozen books, most of which are about Marines in combat. He has written about US Marines in Vietnam (the Night Fighters series and three other novels), and the DemonTechseries about Marines in a fantasy world. The 18th Race trilogy is military science fiction.
Other than military, he wrote a non-conventional vampire novel, The Hunt, and a mystery, Dead Man's Chest. He has also released a collection of short fiction and non-fiction from early in his writing career, Sherman's Shorts; the Beginnings.
With Dan Cragg he wrote the popular Starfist series and its spin-off series, Starfist: Force Recon—all about Marines in the Twenty-fifth Century.; and a Star Wars novel, Jedi Trial. His books have been translated into Czech, Polish, German, and Japanese.
After going to war as a U.S. Marine infantryman, and spending decades writing about young men at war, he's burnt out on the subject and has finally come home. Today he's writing short fiction, mostly steampunk, and farcical fantastic Westerns.
He lives in sunny South Florida, where he doesn't have to worry about hypothermia or snow-shoveling-induced heart attacks. He invites readers to visit his website, novelier.com.
Keith R.A. DeCandido is a writer and editor of more than three decades' standing (though he usually does them sitting down). He is the author of more than 50 novels, more than 100 short stories, around 75 comic books, and more nonfiction than he is really willing to count. Included in those credits is fiction in the worlds of Star Trek, Alien, Farscape, Doctor Who, Andromeda, BattleTech, and many other science fiction milieus, as well as in universes of his own creation (such as the "Precinct" series of fantasy police procedurals, also published by the fine folks at eSpec).As an editor, he has worked with dozens of authors, among them Mike W. Barr, Alfred Bester, Margaret Wander Bonanno, Adam-Troy Castro, Peter David, Diane Duane, Harlan Ellison, Tony Isabella, Stan Lee, Tanith Lee, David Mack, David Michelinie, Andre Norton, Robert Silverberg, Dean Wesley Smith, S.P. Somtow, Harry Turtledove, Chelsea Quinn Yarbro, and Roger Zelazny. Having edited David Sherman's first two 18th Race books, Issue in Doubt and In All Directions, he is honored to assist him in finishing the trilogy by coauthoring To Hell and Regroup with him. Keith is also a martial artist (he got his third-degree black belt in karate in 2017), a musician (currently with the parody band Boogie Knights), and a baseball fan (having avidly followed the New York Yankees since 1976). Find out less about Keith as his cheerfully retro web site at DeCandido.net.
Christopher L. Bennett is a lifelong resident of Cincinnati, Ohio, with a B.S. in Physics and a B.A. in History from the University of Cincinnati. A fan of science and science fiction since age five, he has spent the past two decades selling original short fiction to magazines such as Analog Science Fiction and Fact (home of his "Hub" series of comedy adventures), BuzzyMag, and Galaxy's Edge. Since 2003, he has been one of Pocket Books' most prolific and popular authors of Star Trek tie-in fiction, including the epic Next Generation prequel The Buried Age, the Enterprise -- Rise of the Federation series, and the Original Series prequel The Captain's Oath. He has also written two Marvel Comics novels, X-Men: Watchers on the Walls and Spider-Man: Drowned in Thunder. His original novel Only Superhuman, perhaps the first hard science fiction superhero novel, was voted Library Journal's SF/Fantasy Debut of the Month for October 2012. He has three collections reprinting his original short fiction, Among the Wild Cybers: Tales Beyond the Superhuman from eSpec Books (containing an original Only Superhuman prequel novelette) and Hub Space: Tales from the Greater Galaxy and Crimes of the Hub from Mystique Press.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of the books proposed in this campaign have already begun production. Baring situations outside of our control, the only risk is in schedule delays. However, we will always keep you updated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: So, all but two of the physical rewards have shipped or will ship on Monday, as the books I was waiting for arrived early. For those two that are not shipping, it is because you have not filled out your survey so I have no idea where to send the books. I have emailed the two individuals privately. Here's hoping they receive the emails. I don't want to say names in the update, but I will say that the two individuals in question, one of them this was the first Kickstarter campaign they backed. The other person, this was the second campaign they backed.

Wow, the holidays really do make difference. I received notification yesterday that both Arachne's Exile and The Arachne Omnibus have shipped!
Now...as is my luck, they printed in California...but I am expected to have them by Monday. I work Monday and Tuesday, but first thing on Wednesday, the final rewards will be shipping out! I am so excited to be able to say that. Thank you for your patience. I know we haven't hit our deadline yet, but I really do try to fill these as quickly as possible after the campaign and desperately want you to have your books. Soon! So soon! (Well...borked postal service aside...)

So I have never had this happen before...I received three printer's proofs in one day.
Now, you might be asking what that means for you...
Books! Both Arachne's Exile and The Arachne Omnibus have been ordered. Once I receive the stock I can start sending out the last of the rewards. The only thing outstanding at this point are DemonTech: The Last Campaigns (formerly Get Her Back!) and Jeff Young's science fiction collection. Both are awaiting covers, and the collection is still in editing, but as no one took physical rewards for either of those, the print portion of this campaign is done! The links to the ebooks will be distributed to those waiting once they are available.

Just wanted to let you know that I just ordered the copies of Arachne's Exile for the campaign. I expect they will take a week or two to get here.
I am waiting for the printer's proof for the Arachne Omnibus, then those will be ordered as well.
Best,

Hi Everyone!
The Happiest and Healthiest of New Years to you all.
I am delighted to say that we pulled off a miracle. The Arachne Omnibus went to press a mere half-hour before midnight. Here is the cover:

Hello, everyone!
Happiest of New Years to each and every one of you.
It has taken longer than I would like, but we have managed in the final hours of the year to wrap up another project. Arachne's Exile has been completed and uploaded to the print. Those awaiting the ebook version should have received a link to the digital files. If you miss the email, check the inbox on your Kickstarter account for the link.

Hello, everyone.
While I hope to have more news before the holidays hit, I am erring on the cautious side. I hope you and yours have a safe, healthy, and happy holiday!
Now...I wanted to share with you this pretty picture:

I wasn't expecting it this soon, but I am very thankful to say that we are going to print on Arachne's Crime. I am also thankful for all of you, both your support and the faith you show in us. You make it possible for us to do what we love.
Speaking of which, here is the finished cover!

Happy Thanksgiving, everyone.
Things I am thankful for, my family, my health, and the support and faith you place in us.
I am delighted to say we are very close to uploading Christopher L. Bennett's Arachne's Crime to the printer.
We are still working on the text treatment for the cover, but in the meantime, I wanted to share the cover art:

Hi everyone,
Hope you are doing well and have some room to breath after all the political excitement this week.
We are making strides on the covers for Christopher L. Bennett's Arachne novels. The cover is straight-forward, but requires some new programs to complete, which involves a learning curve. The primary figure that will be on the cover is nearly done and the artist will be playing with placement and filters next. Everything he is doing for the first cover will carry over to the second, so those should complete fairly quickly one after the other, including the Omnibus cover.

campaign.story:
WonderSense is the world-leading consumer sensor node, which including such features as tiny form factor, low-cost high-performance TDK InvenSence 9-axis IMU sensor, maximum 300Hz wireless sampling rate, original high-performance data processing algorithm, and easy to use API for the developers.  
With the provided data collection smartphone App, in no time, you can mount or wear the WonderSense on the limbs, trunk, or head,  collect and visualize the motion data, or storage the data into the database server for later analysis. 
WonderSenseは９軸センサーを搭載したウェアラブルモーショントラッカーです。
BLEを搭載しているためスマートフォンやPCと接続してリアルタイムに人やロボットなどの動きを記録することができます。また、Android端末では最大300Hzでのリアルタイムデータ送信が可能です。
Tiny Form-Factor to Fit with Any Applications
The size is like a wristwatch, and the weight is within 10grams including a 180mAh Li-Po rechargeable battery.
本体は腕時計ほどのサイズ、10グラム以下の重さでバッテリーを搭載しているため、腕や足など付ける場所を選びません。
Out of Box Application for Data Collection and Visualization
We provide a basic function application for WonderSense, you can use it without developing new applications easily and immediately.

基本的な機能を持ったアプリケーションが提供されるため、独自にアプリケーションの開発をしなくても簡単にすぐ使用することができます。

 SDK for Multiple Platforms 
We provide open-source SDK for WonderSense basic functions, you can focus on developing your applications. 
SDK supports iOS / Android / C# at the moment, it will support other platforms in the future.
https://github.com/wonder-wonder
このWonderSense用のオープンソースのSDKが提供されるため、自分のアプリケーション開発や実験に集中することができます。
また対応プラットフォームは現時点ではiOS/Android/C#に対応しており、今後更に追加されていくため、幅広い開発環境で使用できます。
Basic Function
You can connect it to a smartphone in just a few steps, and you can check collected data in Real-time.
接続にはほとんど時間がかかりません。また取得したデータを瞬時に確認することができます。 
Processing Sensor Data 
The orientation of the sensor in the absolute coordinate system is estimated at the same time as the data is collected.
データ収集と同時にセンサーの絶対座標系での向きが推定されます。
Some Demo Applications
Tracking of Motion Trajectory
Estimate the speed, direction, and translation based on the collected acceleration and angular data. 
搭載されている加速度とジャイロデータをもとに、移動した方向と量を推定することも可能です。また、推定したデータを利用して軌跡を描画することもできます。
Human Behavior Real-time Recognization
 You can use collected data for real-time data recognition using a classification algorithm. 
事前に教師データを取得しておけば、分類アルゴリズムを利用することでリアルタイム行動認識をすることも可能です。
 Real-time Activity Recognition 
Game Controller 
You can use hand gestures to interact with game characters intuitively. For example, you can create applications that operate in VR games without a controller.
ゲームキャラクターを手のジェスチャーで直感的に操作するようなことも可能です。例えば、VRゲーム内でコントローラを使わずに操作するようなアプリケーションも作ることができます。  
WonderWonder team started from CNLab at the University of Aizu. We focus on developing a motion-capture platform to bridge the gaps between the ideas and the innovations. In the past twelve years, we have successfully developed some novel applications like ring, toothbrush, schoolbag, gloves, and so on. As a general purpose sensor node, WonderSense has embodied the experience and know-how of our team. Therefore, we will consistently improve its functionality and usability.     
WonderWonderは会津大学のネットワーク研究室から始まったチームです。実用性と利便性のあるWonderSenseをもっと多くの人の研究やアプリケーション開発で使用してもらいたいという思いのもと活動しています。

Mass Production
Sharing the ideals of making for makers and enabling IoT solutions, WonderWonder has partnered with FusionPCB to roll out mass production of WonderSense.With Seeed taking care of production,  WonderWonder can focus their passion in developing WonderSense.
WonderSenseの生産プロセスは、我々と理想を共有するFusionPCBに委託しています。無料の製造資料審査や、迅速な問い合わせへの対応など大変お世話になっています。
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Designing and programming hardware also developing applications such an SDK takes a lot of time and effort, but, we believe that this project is the first step toward our challenge and growth, and we enjoy it with a sense of unity. We enter the production process in the future, we may experience unprecedented risks and difficulties, but, we will enjoy that whilst completing this project.

However, there will be delays in production. We also expect to spend a lot of time verifying hardware and developing SDKs. For this reason, we set a sufficient period of 6 months for the delivery of the reward. We know you'll have to wait a little longer, but we promise we'll deliver it in the best possible condition.

ハードウェアの設計やプログラム、SDK等のアプリケーション開発までは多くの時間と労力がかかります。しかし我々はこのプロジェクト自体を、自分の挑戦と成長への第一歩と確信し、楽しみ、チームの一体感を感じながら活動しています。今後生産過程に入った際には、今までにないリスクや難しさを感じることもあると思いますが、それでさえも楽しみながらこのプロジェクトを完遂していきます。

しかし生産における遅延は間違いなく発生します。またハードウェアプログラムの検証やSDKの開発等で多くの時間を消費することになると考えています。そのためこのプロジェクトではリワードの発送まで6ヶ月という十分な期間を設けさせていただきました。少しおまたせすることになるかと思いますが、最高の状態でお届けすることを約束します。
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
WonderSense can be used anywhere, so we choose materials that have a certain degree of strength and shock resistance for the exterior. If the case is broken or damaged, you can make your own case with your own 3D printer using 3D data that we provide.

WonderSenseはあらゆる場所につけられる可能性があるため、外装部分にはある程度強度と耐衝撃性のある素材を選びます。また、外装が壊れてしまった場合にも所有している3Dプリンター等でケースを自作できるように3Dデータを公開します。
