campaign.story:
Dear readers!
First of all, I would like to express my gratitude for your presence on my Kickstarter and for taking the time to read these lines. With all my heart, thank you! 
NEW ADDITION TO THE FIRST STRETCH GOAL (The Utility Pack):
ALSO, A big shout out to all of you supporting this project!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!
I am currently creating a set of printable 3D models (File format: STL).
This project will include a set of stackable Low Poly Animals that you will be able to pile vertically like a totem and make arrangements as you wish.
The Starter Pack will include:
A Pedestal Piece,
A Top Piece,
The 5 following animals : The Bear, The Fox, The Lynx, The Owl and The Wolf:
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

I am planning to play with these with my son. The goal of the game will be to try to pile the totem as high as possible without it falling of!
Also, for the 3D printing geeks, this is a nice way to finish the last bit of filament on a coil.
I am motivated to create more and more of these models. I think we will be able to reach the original goal so let's get crazy and continue with some extra goals!
The Utility Pack will include: An Adapter/Spacer, a Suspension System and a Lamp System.
This will make the totem possibilities even more flexible. You will be able to pile the heads of the totem in all the cardinal directions instead of just 6 directions.
In addition, there will be a blank hexagonal segment (with no head on it). You will be able to paint symbols, runes or whatever you want on it.
I will also add a version of the files with a suspension system in the back of the heads so you will be able to hang the totem on the wall as a decoration.
Plus! There will now be a system to transform any totem head into a lamp or a night light for your kid. You will just need to print the model with a translucent material (Per example translucent PLA filament).
PLAY

Stretch Goal: When we reach 200.00€ = GOAL ACHIEVED!! THANK YOU EVERYONE!!
The Earth Pack will include: 5 Land Animals
The Boar, The Buffalo, The Monkey, The Snake and The Stag.
Stretch Goal: When we reach 1000.00€
The Water Pack will include: 5 Aquatic Animals
The Beaver, The Dolphin, The Frog, The Otter and The Salmon.
Stretch Goal: When we reach 2000.00€
The Air Pack will include: 5 Air Animals
The 5 following animals: The Bat, The Crow, The Duck, The Eagle and The Falcon.
Stretch Goal: When we will reach 3000.00€
The Wing Pack will include: Wings!!!
New file versions for the Air Pack and the Owl. They will each have an insertion system and their respective wings.
Stretch Goal: When we will reach 5000.00€
The Fire Pack will include: 5 Magical Animals
The Cerberus, The Dragon, The Pegasus, The Phoenix and The Unicorn. The Dragon, The Pegasus and The Phoenix will each have an insertion system and their respective wings.
Stretch Goal: When we will reach 7500.00€ (Wings included)
The Body Pack will include: A new Adapter/Spacer Decorative Pack
There will be bodies created for all the animals from the previous Stretch Goals and from the Starter Pack. Even more totem possibilities!
Stretch Goal: When we will reach 10000.00€

The funds provided by my supporters will be used for supplies needed in developping my 3D modelling and printing business (PLA filament, printer and tech parts) any surplus will be used to open a savings fund for my son's education.
I have been a passionate graphic designer and photographer for over 20 years. What attracted me to the world of 3D is bringing to life what is in my mind. It has always been my childhood dream to invite people into my world and to share it with everyone.
3D modeling has been my main specialty for 12 years now and I have finally taken the leap of faith and started working on it full time. 3D printing has been a new emerging field for a few years now and I want to explore it more deeply. I am ready to dive into this new era with you. The ultimate achievement for a creator like me would be to be able to live from my passion. Therefore, since my work is without salary, I have decided to count on my potential supporters to generate enough income to live and support my small family.
For further information or to request my services, do not hesitate to contact me.
For whoever is interested, you can find all the crunchy details about my life on my Patreon page: https://www.patreon.com/stratationdesign3D
I would like to thank all the people who have supported me from the beginning: my dear mother, my sweetheart, my son, our families and friends.
I would also like to thank one of my Patrons, particularily Derek Thornton, for his participation in the creation process on my Patreon and for suggesting that I do this project!
And finally, thank you, dear readers, for reading this massive chunk of text!
Stratation
*** Version française ***
Chers lecteurs!
Tout d'abord, je tiens à vous exprimer ma gratitude pour votre présence sur mon Kickstarter et pour le temps que vous prenez pour lire ces lignes. De tout mon cœur, merci!
Les Animaux Totems LowPoly 3D Imprimables
Je suis en cours de création d'un ensemble de modèles 3D imprimables (format de fichier : STL).
Ce projet comprendra un ensemble d'animaux à faible polygones empilables que vous pourrez mettre les un par dessus les autres verticalement tel un totem et en faisant les arrangements que vous souhaitez.
Le Kit de Départ comprendra : Un Piédestal et Une Pièce de Dessus, L'Ours, Le Renard, Le Lynx, Le Hibou et Le Loup.
J'ai prévu de jouer avec ces animaux avec mon fils. Le but du jeu sera d'essayer d'empiler le totem aussi haut que possible sans qu'il ne tombe !
En plus, pour les geeks de l'impression 3D, c'est une belle façon de finir le dernier bout de filament sur une bobine.
Les Objectifs Supplémentaires
Je suis motivé à créer plus et plus encore de ces modèles. Je pense que nous devrions être en mesure d'atteindre l'objectif de bas fixé alors soyons fous et continuons avec quelques objectifs supplémentaires!
Le Kit Utilitaire : comprendra un Séparateur/Adaptateur, un Système de Suspension et un Système de Lampe
Ceci fera en sorte de rendre les possibilités du totem encore plus modulables. Vous pourrez empiler les têtes du totem dans toutes les directions cardinales au lieu de seulement 6 directions.
En supplément, il y aura un segment hexagonal neutre (sans tête dessus). Vous pourrez y peindre des symboles, des runes ou ce que vous voudrez.
J'ajouterai également une version des fichiers avec un système de suspension à l'arrière des têtes afin que vous puissiez accrocher le totem au mur en guise de décoration.
Et en plus ! Il y aura désormais un système permettant de transformer n’importe quelle tête du totem en lampe ou en veilleuse pour vos enfants. Il vous suffira d’imprimer le modèle avec un matériel translucide (par exemple un filament PLA translucide). Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 200.00€ = OBJECTIF ATTEINT!!! Merci à tous et à toutes!
Le Kit de la Terre : comprendra les 5 animaux terrestres suivants : Le Sanglier, Le Bison, Le Singe, Le Serpent et Le Cerf. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 1000.00€
Le Kit de l’Eau : comprendra es 5 animaux aquatiques suivants : Le Castor, Le Dauphin, La Grenouille, La Loutre et Le Saumon. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 2000.00€
Le Kit de l’Air : comprendra les 5 animaux aériens suivants : La Chauve-Souris, Le Corbeau, Le Canard, L’Aigle et Le Faucon. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 3000.00€
Le Kit des Ailes : comprendra de nouvelles versions de fichiers pour le Kit de l’Air et pour le Hibou. Ils auront un système d’insertion d’ailes et leurs ailes respectives. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 5000.00€
Le Kit du Feu : comprendra les 5 animaux magiques suivants : Le Cerbère, Le Dragon, Le Pégase, Le Phoenix et La Licorne. Le Dragon, Le Pégase et Le Phoenix auront un système d’insertion d’ailes et leurs ailes respectives. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 7500.00€ (Ailes incluses)
Le Kit des Corps : comprendra un nouveau Kit de Séparateurs/Adaptateurs Décoratifs. Il y aura des corps créés pour tous les animaux des Objectifs Supplémentaires et du Kit de Départ. Encore plus de possibilités de totems ! Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 10000.00€
À quoi serviront les fonds?
Les fonds obtenus seront utilisés pour les fournitures nécessaires au développement de mon entreprise de modélisation et d'impression 3D (Filament PLA, imprimante et pièces techniques). Tout excédent sera utilisé pour ouvrir un fonds d'épargne pour l'éducation de mon fils.
Qui suis-je?
Je suis infographiste et photographe passionné depuis plus de 20 ans. Ce qui m’a attire dans le monde de la 3D, c’est le fait de concrétiser ce qu’il y a dans mes pensées. Ça a toujours été mon rêve d’enfant d’inviter les gens dans mon monde et de le partager avec tous.
La modélisation en 3D est ma principale spécialité depuis 12 ans maintenant et j'ai finalement fait le saut et commencé à y travailler à plein temps. L'impression 3D est un nouveau domaine émergent depuis quelques années maintenant et je veux l'explorer plus en profondeur. Je suis prêt à plonger dans cette nouvelle ère avec vous.
L’aboutissement ultime d’un créateur comme moi serait de pouvoir vivre de ma passion. Donc, comme mon travail n'est pas rémunéré, j'ai décidé de compter sur mes supporteurs potentiels pour générer un revenu suffisant pour vivre et faire vivre ma petite famille.
Pour de plus amples informations ou pour demander mes services, n'hésitez pas à me contacter.
Biographie
Pour ceux que cela intéresse, vous pouvez trouver tous les détails croustillants de ma vie sur ma page Patreon : https://www.patreon.com/stratationdesign3D
Remerciements
Je voudrais remercier toutes les personnes qui me soutiennent depuis mes débuts : ma chère maman, ma douce moitié, mon fils, nos familles et nos amis.
Je tiens aussi à remercier mes mécènes sur Patreon, surtout Derek Thornton, pour sa participation au processus de création sur mon Patreon et pour m'avoir suggéré de réaliser ce projet!
Finalement, merci à vous chers lecteurs, d'avoir lu ce morceau de texte massif!
Stratation

updates.update_userinfo: Complications during the test phase / Complications durant la phase de test
updates.update_content:
Dear supporters!
I was hoping I'd be able to deliver the files today... I'm sorry it won't be the case. Nevertheless, I have some information to share. As this is my first Kickstarter, I wasn't quite sure how long it would take for the Kickstarter team to send me the funds and I misjudged how long it would take. Long story short, I still haven't received the funds from Kickstarter, so I had to take from my family budget to order the PLA to get it in time. And yet, I only just received it. I guess because of the lockdown and the measures related to CoVid-19, the delivery must have been delayed a bit, but here they are at last: the PLA coils are here!

updates.update_userinfo: It's almost the end... / C'est presque la fin...
updates.update_content:
I am currently waiting for the fund transfer to be able to order more PLA filament coils to proceed to the final tests and to take more pictures and videos. I used the few PLA I had left to test many of the options already and everything is working. There is only one thing left to test printing : the mural suspension option from the Utility Pack.
I'll keep you inform of the progress of course ;). If my estimates are correct, I should be proceeding with the delivery around the week of May 18th 2020.

updates.update_userinfo: The PLA coils are here / Les bobines de PLA sont arrivées
updates.update_content:
I am very grateful and sincerely touched by the generosity and the support from all my supporters during this campaign. With all my heart, thank you so very much!
Tons of love!!
Stratation
PS: If you liked my work and still want to support me behond this campaign, you can find me on Patreon.

campaign.story:
We used to spend thousands of dollars on 3D printers since 2012. At that time, 3D printer could only be used by the designers and makers. Yes, now is 2020, we found lots of team and company build different kinds of 3D printer. They all try their best to make 3D printers accessible to family and kids.
We believe 3DFORD is the most affordable 3D printer that can be used right out of the box. We made the UNI-BODY design, So it's perfect for beginners! 
No more assemble! 3DFORT is not that kind of 3D printer kits, 3DFORT comes ready out of the box. 
With toy bricks compatible, we’re making it more interesting than ever for beginners and children to get started with 3D printer! You could decorate the 3DFORT by toy bricks. Even you could 3D print some custom design blocks to mount it on.


Watch your custom creations form right before your eyes!
Kickstarter Standard Print printed by 3DFORT: 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lBLWuognxSR8DGp8524xLy2k9BJXEPGh/view?usp=sharing
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1esZCYeEB2uSS3jJYkp5wA7pWdlC37MfO/view?usp=sharing 
Mini-figure model:
PLAY

mini-figure model
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

Like we said, we try to make 3DFORT funny and easy to use. So we design this extruder with one -push insert function. Also, you could use it to remove the filament. So it could help you to print the multi-color creation easily.
Nozzle As Add-On: Extra One Nozzle  $0.6 USD (HK$ 4.7)
You can choose the Nozzle Size from: 0.1mm, 0.2mm, 0.3mm, 0.4mm.
How to add Nozzle as Add-Ons to pledge?
 Filament As Add-On: 500g $15USD (HK$ 116), one color (shipping included)
                                         1Kg    $20USD(HK$155), one color (shipping included)
1.75mm pla is recommended. Except pla, 1.75mm materials with working temperature less than 240℃ can also be used.
In fact, we will also randomly send some filaments for testing the printer.
How to add filaments as Add-Ons to pledge?
After collecting many kinds of 3D printer plate, we chose to design a new one. Perfect for PLA 3D printing. 

There are of things you can print out with 3DFORT 3D printer. The list goes on and on but some examples are toys, household items, replacement/spare parts, and more! 
PLAY

PLAY

There are plenty of free 3D modeling software out there such as; Google SketchUp, tinkercad.com. 3D Printer Beginners: Go to thingiverse.com. 
Check out all the different designs people have created. When you see something you like, It's as easy as power on 3DFORT, downloading that design, Slicing the 3D model and then let the printer do the work!
Meet The Team: Hi! We are 3DFORT 3D Printer Team, from Jinan Qingshan Plastic Industry Co., LTD. (济南青山塑业有限公司) Yes! The handsome man who designed the mold is also the legal representative of our company. Based on rich experience in production and processing of plastic products, we’ve gone one step further by developing this 3DFORT for you! Whether you are beginner or expert, we want everyone who has creative ideas could hold it in their hands!
Injection Molding Machine:
Mould Processing Machine:

 This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

project_data.project_name: 3DFORT 3D printer--Print anything you want

campaign.story:
👋 This is the Frame.IoT
The Frame.IoT is an Arduino-compatible board built for your Internet of Things projects and ships with the most popular components built-in — voted by the community. Now you can focus on building something awesome (instead of wiring up the basics). 
📶 It's the easiest way to connect Things
No matter what those Things are...
Frame.IoT integrates with IFTTT so you can stay in touch with your furry friends. Click to see how!
💪 Everything you need
Powered by the ESP-32, the Frame.IoT is Wi-Fi and Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) enabled. We packed it with all the plug-and-play utilities you've come to expect — USB-to-Serial converter, automatic bootloader reset and Lithium Ion/Polymer battery charging circuit. To make it project-ready, we gave the Frame.IoT a microSD card socket for all your data logging/storage needs, a super powerful digital audio amp to stream audio over the internet and blast notifications, a 16-pixel addressable RGB LED ring to light up your project, a toggle that lets you choose to power your peripherals over USB or battery, and an unencumbered momentary push-button to trigger any action you choose.  
Build awesome apps to connect to your Frame.IoT with Blynk
🙅‍♂️ No wasted pins
Not all projects are created equal. If your prototype doesn't need some of the components built-in to the Frame.IoT — no worries! Each component is connected via jumper pins. Simply remove the corresponding jumpers and you'll free up the I/O for anything you want!
👀 Easy on the eyes & wallet 💰
Stop wrestling with a rainbow of jumper wires and breadboards. Frames are designed to declutter your projects — making it faster to get your prototype working and easier to deploy your idea in its final form factor and enclosures.
The built-in components not only make building and troubleshooting easier but more affordable than sourcing them separately.
🛠 Crowd & open sourced
We've built a community of makers who collaborate and vote on each Frame, its purpose, and its components. We release all our fabrication files publicly so you can go from prototype to production.  Cast your first vote to see how it works! 
♾ Endless possibilities
The Frame.IoT is a platform for all your Internet of Things projects. Add sensors, relays, and any other component to build anything you can dream up:
A bluetooth, mobile app-controlled robotic car
A smart home-connected plant water level sensor
A real-time Bitcoin or stock ticker with LED indications
A weather logging sensor — using the ESP-32 deep sleep to log all year on a single charge
PLAY

Here's a few sketches we built using nothing more than the Frame.IoT, a speaker, battery, and existing Arduino libraries!
🚨 Using the NeoPixelBus library to show off our 16 addressable RGB LEDs:
🔊 Using the ESP8266Audio library to stream a live radio station off a battery: 
PLAY

  🔘 Using the built-in pushbutton to log presses: 
 🔋 Reading the voltage of the battery:
 🏆 Pledge tiers
No fancy graphics needed here. Every pledge tier (except the $1 tier) comes with one Frame.IoT and jumper pins. The Bundle also includes a 350mAh rechargeable battery, 2GB microSD card, 4 ohm 3W speaker, and USB cable.
If you'd like multiple Frame.IoTs, simply add an additional $39 (for just the board) or $59 USD (for The Bundle) to your pledge.
(Shipping will be collected after Kickstarter and is expected to average $10-$20 USD depending on location and pledge quantity.)
🥅 Stretch goals
If we're able to raise $30k, we'll make the Frame.IoT.Breadboard available to our backers — a prototyping shield for the Frame.IoT which makes it easier to add your own additional sensors and components.
Not convinced from this terrible drawing that we can execute on this idea if we hit the stretch goal? The Frame.IoT.Breadboard shield will consist of simple stacking headers and a breadboard (shaped in a way to give you access to your screw terminals and JST connectors).
* The Frame.IoT.Breadboard is an additional $15 and will be collected after Kickstarter for those who'd like to add one.
🤯 Get a free board with our referral program
We need all the help we can to get Frame.IoT into the workshops of makers around the world. Sign up to get your unique sharing link and get rewarded for each of your friends who pledge (any tier besides the $1 pledge).
 1 referral = Your name in the Superbacker Section of our Github repo
 3 referrals = You'll get The Frame.IoT.Breadboard ($15 value), a prototyping shield for the Frame.IoT
 5 referrals = You'll get The Frame.IoT ($39 value) for free
 7 referrals = You'll get The Frame.IoT and The Frame.IoT.Breadboard ($54 value) for free
 10 referrals = You'll get The Bundle ($59 value) for free
 15 referrals = You'll get The Bundle and The Frame.IoT.Breadboard ($74 value) for free
🤙 What about free stickers?
Are you easily pressured by small rewards? Are you one of the billions of people on social media? Do you like adhesives? If so, send us a screenshot of you sharing this project on two platforms and we'll add a limited edition Kickstarter sticker to your shipment (or put your name in the Superbacker section of our Github if you didn't back a tier that includes shipping).
Don't know what to say? Start here for Facebook and Twitter.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're several rounds into prototyping and feel confident we've de-risked this project from a functionality perspective. We have one last prototyping run (to validate small, mostly-aesthetic changes to the version of the board featured in this campaign).

One of the biggest potential challenges we have to face is the Coronavirus (COVID-19) and its affect on our supply chain. The last two prototyping runs we sent to manufacturing took nearly 3 months (as opposed to the typical 30-day lead time) due to factory closures amongst our component suppliers, PCB fabricator, and assembly partners. We've tried to overestimate lead times as delivering on (or before) our timeline is a top priority (second to delivering a high-quality product) and we'll communicate clearly (and with proof) if factory closures or delays prevent this from happening.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
We built the Frame.IoT to be more than just "another" board in your drawer. With a modular design, you'll be able to leverage the components that are important to you without wasting those that aren't.

Our designs are completely open source and can be forked on Github which lets future makers reuse our proven schematics (meaning less waste and prototyping when launching their own projects).

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Platyball® project has been 4 years in the making. The biggest hurdle was searching far and wide for the finest designers and engineers to help bring our dream to a reality. We have an amazing team assembled that was able to incorporate our requests and achieve a product that was previously thought to be impossible. Our prototypes work well, but we will continue over the next several months to tweak and refine the product so that when it goes into production it will be perfect. 
We have essentially invested everything we have earned from the past few years of Platypod® sales and more to bring the Platyball® dream to fruition. We now look to the generous support of our backers to help us move into the next phase.
We have applied very conservative projections for delivery dates because our plan includes extensive pre-production testing and room to make revisions as needed so that the product our backers receive will meet all expectations. 
Thank you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

If you haven't already done so, please read updates number 17, 18 & 19 to bring yourself up to speed. 
The good news is, three days after our last update, which coincided with Thanksgiving day here in the US, our factory in Taiwan began working on production molds for both Platyball Ergo and Elite. I just spoke with Von Davis, production engineer over at Amtech, and we are on track to receive our first production-level samples around April 15 as planned. We have ordered 40 units of each model. The vast majority of these will be kept in Taiwan for several weeks of vigorous testing. We will receive about six to ten of each for our own testing.

campaign.story:
CloverPI.com 
Ok we all like Pi.  Hey who doesn't.  But we most of all like Raspberry Pis.  They are such versatile little boards used by many project makers.  There are a TON of makers out there that have projects that involve multiple Raspberry Pis.  Anyone who makes these projects knows that for every Raspberry Pi you need a power supply and a network cable assuming you are going to network these bad boys together.  That means you need a switch and need to power that too.  So we thought wouldn't it be great if we can just plug these Raspberry Pis into a board and let that handle all that? 
Enter CLoverPI...

 So What does CloverPI actually do...
Well I'm glad you asked.  It takes Raspberry Pis, wired Ethernet, power supplies and put them all into 1 unit with just a single power supply and optionally external network connection

CloverPi features
Backplane compatible with any Raspberry Pis containing the standardized GPIO pins
 Integrated power for four raspberry pies
Individual power switches for each raspberry pi
Individually addressable RGB LED for each raspberry pi
Link light for Network for each raspberry pi
Network header for each raspberry pi
5 Port gigabit switch: four ports for raspberry Pi's one for uplink
Possible use cases(to name a few)
K8s
Docker swarm
Full stack development via openstack
Small office server stack
Open Flickr stack
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the main challenges have been having is the we keep wanting to add additional features to this board. So we have had to set a hard cutoff and stop trying to make changes to this project and just do it. We have decided to get input from our backers for possible updates and feature sets they might find most beneficial to a device like this.

Depending on the demand on this project we may need to look into alternative production methods. Currently we buy the individual components do the soldering/assembly ourselves. Purchasing the components in bulk would not be a problem but mass producing this could be one of our biggest challenges. Because of this we have kept the levels at a modest level that we are comfortable with. We also have been prepping additional resources should the interest level and response be better than expected.

We have been looking at ways to streamline the process and make the assembly of the boards more efficient.

We have undergone several design modifications through out the past year to bring to the KickStarter community a version we feel will meet the needs of the maker community and can reliably be produced with a minimal level of variations and defects.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
All,
There has been a temporary shipping delay on our CloverPI fulfillments due to our power supply supplier sending us a shipment of incorrect power supplies. We are having to sort through all our current stock of power supplies and all our CloverPi's that we have had packaged ready for shipment to sort out which are the incorrect ones and get replacements. Some backers have already received the incorrect power supplies and we are working with those backers to get them the correct ones.

Hello Backers!

It has been a while since our last update. We have a few things to
update you on.

We paused shipping out CloverPis for two reasons.  The first is we
have had 2 major hurricanes come through our area. Don't worry
operations were not harmed, just delayed.   Second was that we had a
couple reports of "fires" from the CloverPis.  We spent days trying to
replicate the issue using the CloverPi normally, We were only able to
replicate the issue when we shorted the positive to negative in
various ways.  We are updating our packaging and getting started guide
with the following to help avoid the issue.

Hello Backers!

We have a few things to update everyone about today.

Shipping Times
First the update everyone wants: Clovers are shipping out weekly.

Because of COVID-19, some of our suppliers were having issues
fulfilling orders, which delayed some backer rewards. However, we have
partnered with a manufacturer to streamline our fulfillment process,
and CloverPis are shipping weekly.

We’re fulfilling in the order stated in the rewards. All super early
birds have been shipped. We are currently working on double early
birds. All other doubles are on track to be shipped by the end of
August.

If you have any questions, you can always send me a message to


Backer Survey
For those that have already filled out the backer survey, thank you.
If you have not
filled out the survey, please check your email or your Kickstarter
profile for a link to it, This is where we get your information for
the reward shipment.


Web site and store
Our web site is being updated to include new tutorials.

The CloverPi store will soon offer preorders, which will be fulfilled
after all Kickstarter rewards are fulfilled.

In response to backer feedback, we have some new ideas in the works.
Stay turned for our add-on board, the CloverIO.

We read all your comments and questions here on the Kickstarter, but
we’re still having some issues with Kickstarter notifications. If you
have any questions, an email to will get the fastest
reply.


Thanks,
The CloverPi Team

Hey everyone,

   We haven't been getting notifications when comments are posted on
the Kickstarter page.

We've been communicating with folks and answering questions via email,
and we thought we were also getting notified whenever anyone posted
here.

You're also always welcome to contact us at .

Thanks,
The CloverPi Team

Hey everyone, 
CloverPis were mailed to super early bird backers last week. You may already have yours in hand, or it may arrive very soon. You can find assembly instructions and other info about getting started with your CloverPi at http://cloverpi.com/getting-started-with-the-cloverpi/"
Double Super Early Bird backers are being prepared and will begin shipping this week!!!

Hey everyone, We're excited to let you know that we've started shipping the first batch of CloverPis. If you were a super early bird backer, you should be receiving tracking info in an email by 07-20-2020.

updates.update_userinfo: Finally!!! Shipping is about to begin
updates.update_content:
My Apologies to all our backers.  The whole Covid-19 has been causing havoc with us all and unfortunately CloverPI was not immune.  
BUT...I am glad to say that we have finally received the last items we needed.  We are now able to begin shipping The CloverPi boards to our backers.  Strangely enough it was not even the parts we were ordering from overseas but the items from vendors here in the US that were causing the delays.

All,
I would like to thank all out backers and provide and update to our progress.  
We have received our kickstarter funds a little less than 2 weeks ago
We have our machines tooled and setup and soldering the components to the CloverPi Board
All parts have been received or in shipment to our locations

The entire CloverPi team would like to thank all our backers for their support.
Over the next 2 weeks we will be sending out surveys to gather additional information so that we can fulfill the rewards.  If any of our backers have any questions please message us and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
Please be patient.  Right now we are working diligently to get production and fulfillment underway

campaign.story:
The stars of this epic sci-fi adventure series.

SUCCESS!!! We hit our goal in less than a week!
Time for some STRETCH GOALS!
STRETCH GOAL #1 -- $55,000
 UNUSED PITCHES TO STAR TREK! Marc will open up and discuss his unused Star Trek pitches - that's The Next Generation, Deep Space Nine, Voyager, and Enterprise! ALL DONORS -- big and small -- will receive a PDF package of scripts and outlines of these wonderfully creative Star Trek ideas, as well as a video of Marc discussing them and the pitching process! 
STRETCH GOAL #2 -- coming soon!


Space Command is a science fiction series starring legends of sci-fi and the silver screen such as Doug Jones, Nichelle Nichols, Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Faran Tahir, James Hong, Bruce Boxleitner, John Harney, John Hennigan, Sean Kenney, and many more big names to be announced soon!
This epic series that transcends a decades-long story is through the lens of a hopeful vision of the future, written by Marc Scott Zicree who has writing credits on dozens of shows over the past 40 years -- Star Trek: The Next Generation, Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Babylon 5, Sliders, The Real Ghostbuster, Smurfs, He-Man, as well as the "Magic Time" series of novels and the definitive "Twilight Zone Companion" series of books.
Space Command Forgiveness part 2
"Space Command Forgiveness Part 2"  is the fourth one-hour episode in this epic science fiction adventure series. This campaign is to fund the production of Chapter 3 (our $48k goal), and then Chapter 4 (Stretch Goal), which are the two chapters within this one-hour fourth episode.* 
*To learn exactly what all this means, scroll down to the "where are we now?" section below.
WE HAVE REWARD ADD-ONS!! Scroll down to the PERKS/ADD-ONS section below.
Space Command Forgiveness, parts 1&2 movie poster

These are some of the science fiction icons that support Space Command
Recognize any of these names?
Space command stars many, many science fiction legends, past and present! We've still got a few more BIG casting announcements coming! When we cast more actors, we'll be adding them below! 
Big Trouble in Little China
WWE Wrestling, GLOW
Star Trek, Iron Man

ALSO IN THE SPACE COMMAND SERIES
Babylon 5, Lost
The Shape of Water, Star Trek: Discovery, Pan's Labyrinth, Falling Skies
Total Recall, Star Trek: Voyager, Stargate
Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Babylon 5, Lost in Space
Babylon 5, Tron
Orange is the New Black
New Additions:
We've just added SEAN KENNEY to the cast! He played Captain Pike in the original Star Trek series!
The Assassin's Apprentice, Star Trek
Additional stars
Space Command also has a group of incredible up-and-coming Hollywood actors in starring and supporting roles. Here they are:
Ethan McDowell, Sara Maraffino, Nathaniel Freeman, Victor Manso
Dallas Malloy, Bryan McClure, Barbara Lee Bragg, Ryan T. Husk
Coley Speaks, Elle Sonnet, Justin Sorvillo, Jelena Mrdja
Marc & Elaine Zicree have written and produced hundreds of hours of series TV, pilots and feature films for most of the major studios and networks, including Paramount, Universal, Disney, Sony/Columbia Tri-Star, MGM, Warners, Castle Rock, New Line, CBS, NBC, ABC, Fox, WB, UPN, Showtime, PBS, Turner, USA Networks, Syfy, Discovery, Nickelodeon, the BBC, Marvel, Scholastic, ITV and NPR. Among their credits are classic episodes of Star Trek – The Next Generation, Sliders, Babylon 5, Deep Space Nine, Friday the 13th – The Series, Smurfs, Superfriends, He-Man, Captain Power and the Soldiers of the Future, The Littles, Forever Knight, Liberty’s Kids and The Real Ghostbusters, among many others.
Marc and Elaine’s work has been nominated for the Hugo Award, American Book Award, Humanitas Prize, Nebula Award and Diane Thomas Award, and has won the prestigious Hamptons Prize, TV Guide Award, Rondo and Saturn Awards. In 2014, Marc was named a Writers Guild Diversity Honoree.
Marc and Elaine Zicree, co-directing on the set of Space Command.
A word from creator, Marc Zicree:
"As a kid I loved STAR TREK, TWILIGHT ZONE, OUTER LIMITS, FORBIDDEN PLANET and grew up to write for such great shows as STAR TREK – THE NEXT GENERATION, DEEP SPACE NINE, BABYLON 5, SLIDERS and more.
I often hear fans say, “Why are there so few good sci-fi shows on TV, and why do so many go south?” I can tell you – frankly, most of the network suits just don’t get it.
But you and I do.
So when I recently got the idea of creating a new show inspired by the sense of wonder and possibility science fiction gave me as a kid, I realized I didn’t need a network or studio to make my dream come true -- just Kickstarter and you.
Thanks for making it happen."

Where are we now?
This is the progress of the Space Command epic series. Episodes are coupled, into two-parters. For example, episodes one and two are coupled, three and four are coupled, etc.. Each episode is one hour, divided into two 30-minute chapters.
SPACE COMMAND: REDEMPTION part 1 (episode 1)
 Chapter 1 - filmed, completed, and released!
 Chapter 2 - filmed, completed, and released!
SPACE COMMAND: REDEMPTION part 2 (episode 2)
 Chapter 3 - filmed, postproduction is funded and nearly complete!
 Chapter 4 - filmed, postproduction is funded and nearly complete!
SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS part 1 (episode 3)
 Chapter 1 - filmed, postproduction, editing, VFX, are being completed
 Chapter 2 - filmed, postproduction, editing, VFX, are being completed
SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS part 2 (episode 4)
 Chapter 3 - in preproduction - our first goal is to fund this chapter 
 Chapter 4 - in preproduction - our stretch goal will be to fund this chapter 
SPACE COMMAND: GREAT SOLAR WAR (episodes 5&6)
coming soon...

Movie poster for episodes 5&6, "Great Solar War" parts 1 and 2.

Do you want to SAVE MONEY? Do you want screen credit and IMDb credit, but don't want DVDs? Do you prefer not to have more "stuff?" Do you want to avoid shipping costs? Well...
You can now add-on any credit (screen credit and IMDb) you'd like to you reward level! Here's how.
Choose the reward level that has the package you want. When you click on it, you will be given the option to ADJUST YOUR PLEDGE by typing in any number or dollar amount you'd like.  Simply add the amount that corresponds to the credit you want from the list below:
Thanks +40
Special Thanks +15
Very Special Thanks +15
Production Associate +100
Prod Executive +150
Contributing Producer +200
Associate Producer +200
Co-Producer +600
Producer +1700
CO-Executive Producer +1800
Executive Producer +2500

EXAMPLES: 
You can donate $1 and add $40 for a THANK credit. Total: $41.
If your reward level comes with a SPECIAL THANKS credit but you want a PRODUCTION ASSOCIATE credit, simply add $115 (15 to reach the very special thanks credit  + 100 to get the production associate credit).
If you don't want ANY perks and just want the contributing producer credit, just pledge at the $1 level and add all the add-on prices up to and including contributing producer (1+40+15+15+100+150+200) for a total of $521.
So now you can avoid getting things you don't want as well as incurring shipping costs for these items. You'll just GET WHAT YOU WANT and SAVE MONEY!!
We'll take care of the rest! (But if you'd like to shoot us a message to reconfirm or ask questions, once the campaign is over, feel free!)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Raising funds via crowd funding is very difficult. But we are confident in our product and confident in the support of the fantastic fans of the science fiction community. Together, we can make this series come to life!

updates.update_content:
We are pushing forward everyday with more and more visual effects shots completed and we can now say that Redemption Part 2 should be finished and ready to send out by Christmas of this year! That means if you ordered a digital download, a DVD or Bluray, or anything involving Redemption Part 2, we'll be delivering those by Christmas 2021.
If you haven't had a chance to order a DVD or Bluray yet, you're in luck! We recently sent an email with info on new DVD and Bluray perks that are now available in our current campaign. Here's a video about it:

Hello and thank you again to all of you who contributed to the Space Command Kickstarter campaign.
Here is an accounting of all the perks we have delivered for campaign 1
CAMPAIGN 5
TOTAL ELECTRONIC PERKS DELIVERED: 3,930

updates.update_userinfo: to all Space Command backers past and present
updates.update_content:
First, thank you all once again for showing interest in Space Command. This is for both our past backers and new ones looking to participate in this new, exciting and unique project.  No one has ever tried to fund an original series before, and we are getting there!
A note from the past: we have completed all the perks fulfillment possible for all our past campaigns up to this point. This represents several thousand  physical perks and many thousands of electronic ones (over 18,000). One of the most anticipated perks yet to come is the Redemption Psrts 1 and 2 DVD/Bluray combo packs (there are several different flavors of these.) These have been held up because the episodes need to be completed first. Who knew?! The great news is the first two episodes titled Redemption are nearly completed and will ship this summer! Combined they have over 1,900 visual effects. More than double any other sci-fi series out there. The campaign we are about to start is for completing the Forgiveness episodes (episodes 3 and 4), and that's where you come in. Your contribution to this upcoming campaign goes directly to the completion of the DVD/Blurays of the Forgiveness episodes. As soon as the COVID is over we will be shooting the remainder of episode 4, and the post has already been nearly completed on episode 3, so we should have episodes 3 and 4 shipped by the end of the year, if COVID allows.

updates.update_userinfo: Get Your Star Trek Crate Now! Incredible!
Here Are Your Four Episodes -- Thanks For Helping the New Campaign!
updates.update_content:
Hi, guys,
Thanks so much for all your help -- we're almost halfway to our goal!  But we need to keep raising at least $1,000 per day or we risk losing it all!
So if you can pledge to some of our larger perks -- or spread the word to those who can -- it will help us immensely!

Thanks, everyone, and onward to glory!

project_data.project_name: SPACE COMMAND FORGIVENESS - PART TWO

campaign.story:
Daisy is an embedded platform for music. It features everything you need for creating high fidelity audio hardware devices. Just plug in a USB cable and start making sound! No soldering required. 
Let's teach computers how to sing!
Here's a quick demo of where we're at today! In this video we show a generative synthesizer that was coded in C++, with a reverb send, and note trigger button. 
PLAY

The possibilities for Daisy are endless! Create ambient audio installations, sonify data from sensors, or even make an esoteric effects pedal, all with a single platform.
Audio and MIDI
Daisy features two channels of line level audio IO on-board, thanks to its high fidelity stereo audio codec(AKM) with up to 24-bit, 192kHz. Adding additional channels of audio is easy using standard digital audio protocols such as TDM, I2S, PDM, and S/PDIF which are broken out to the pin headers. 
There is full support for USB MIDI IN and OUT through its onboard micro USB port and the USB pins on the header bank. It also features UART pins for connecting MIDI through 5 pin DIN, or TRS cables.
CPU and Memory
The CPU is an STM32 ARM Cortex-M7 running at 480MHz, and features internal 32-bit floating point processing for optimized DSP instructions. There is 64MB of SDRAM on-board, which is enough for a 10 minute audio buffer. In addition, there is more than 8MB of flash memory for firmware, or permanent storage of audio files. 
USB and Connectivity
With full OTG-support as host and device on the built-in micro USB port, along with additional pins for a second port, the Daisy can become any USB device your heart desires. Build an audio interface, MIDI controller, or sample player! On top of that, the built-in micro USB can also be used for powering, programming and debugging the Daisy.
There are 32 total GPIO pins which can be configured as standard GPIO or one of several alternate functions including 16-bit Analog to Digital Converters(x12), 12-bit Digital to Analog Converters(x2), SD Card interfaces, PWM outputs, and various serial protocols for connecting to external sensors and devices including SPI, UART, I2S, and I2C. 
In addition to being powered through the onboard micro USB port, Daisy can be powered through a dedicated VIN pin on the header bank. It has an extremely wide input range of 4V to 17V and current consumption is low enough that you can even power it from a battery!
Evaluation Platforms 
To help you start making music immediately we've created several Daisy-Powered devices:
 Daisy Pod - Breakout Board
 Daisy Petal - Guitar Pedal
 Daisy Patch - Eurorack Module
 Daisy Field - Desktop Synthesizer
All four devices are available as rewards! Scroll to the Rewards section below to see product photos and details. 
Example Code
There will be example programs for each evaluation platform, and in each supported language. We will also be publishing full schematics and technical documents describing how the circuits work. Schematics will be released under a permissive open source license, allowing for modification, and reuse in personal and commercial projects.  
Tutorials and Learning Resources
We are working on video tutorials for everything from simple circuits and music theory, to DSP programming and PCB layout. We're striving to create a community of learning centered around hacking the Daisy to make fun and awesome audio projects!
Programming the Daisy is a breeze with support for a number of languages including Arduino, and Max/MSP Gen~. To get started, simply upload an example program over USB, and start tweaking!
Documentation, and examples will be hosted on our Github repository for easy download. All firmware that we develop will be released for free under a permissive open source license(MIT). Below are the languages and programming environments that will be supported:
We believe that music is an extremely powerful tool for teaching STEM education. Using the Daisy helps to connect the dots between various areas of learning:
Computer Science - Using programming languages to translate a concept of a sound, into something that a computer can understand. 
Test Equipment - Using tools such as an Oscilloscope, Multimeter, and Spectrum Analyzer is helpful for verifying signal integrity, measuring voltage levels, and observing noise.
Electrical Engineering - To connect Daisy to the outside world we need to use electrical circuits. Whether it's controlling a parameter with a knob, or running audio through speakers, we need to use wires and components to accomplish the task. 
Mathematics - Generating and processing audio signals includes many types of mathematics from basic arithmetic, all the way to advanced calculus. 
Here are the rewards that we're offering when you back the Daisy!
Get your very own "I Teach Computers How To Sing"bumper sticker and tell the world about your unique talent! Dimensions: 3" x 11"
Add $10 to a pledge in any other reward tier, and we will include a bumper sticker with that reward. 
Rep the Daisy cause in style with our "I Teach Computers How To Sing" T-Shirt! Sizes: Kids Small to Adult XXL
Add $20 to a pledge in any other reward tier, and we will include a T-Shirt with that reward.
 Get the Daisy and start building! Daisy is a full featured audio development board that can be used in a breadboard, inserted into any of the following rewards, or built into your own custom hardware! Comes with headers installed, no soldering necessary. 
Add $29 to a pledge in any other reward tier, and we will include an extra Daisy with that reward. You can also purchase any multiple of $29 with this reward tier, and we will include that many Daisy boards in your order. 
Start programming the Daisy without breadboarding! The Pod is a USB powered breakout board for the Daisy. With stereo line level I/O, MIDI input and headphone output with a dedicated volume control, this is the feature-packed, small-form breakout to get started with for development. Comes with Daisy installed. 
USB Powered
3.5mm stereo jacks for line level audio I/O, headphone output, and TRS MIDI input.
Built In headphone amplifier with dedicated volume control.
2 Buttons, 2 RGB LEDs, and rotary encoder with push button.
SD Card Slot, and secondary USB micro port
Create your own effects programs with the Petal! Simply download a working reverb, delay, or looper example, and start tweaking. Comes with Daisy installed and 9V power adapter. 
Instrument or Line Level Audio with Setting Switch
1/4” Jacks with two Channels of Audio I/O, and Expression Input
Rotary Encoder with Ring of 8 RGB LEDs
x4 Footswitches with Dedicated LEDs, x6 Knobs, and x3 Toggle Switches
SD Card Slot, and Secondary Micro USB Port
Take your sound design to the next level by creating your own module! Download an example granular effects processor, physical modeling voice, or sampler and start editing. Comes with Daisy installed. 
Quad Audio I/O at Modular Level
x4 Control Voltage Inputs, x2 Control Voltage Outputs, and TRS MIDI Input and Output
x4 Knobs, x2 Buttons, and x1 Toggle Switch
SD Card Slot, and Secondary USB Micro port
Create a mono-synth, drum machine, or MIDI sequencer with the Field! It works as a great development tool, or handy small-form synth to take with you on the go. Comes with Daisy installed and 9V power adapter. 
Control Voltage Interface Patch-Bay and TRS MIDI Input and Output
Built In Headphone Amplifier with Dedicated Volume Control.
1/4” Line Level Inputs and Outputs 
x8 Knobs, x2 Buttons, and x1 Toggle Switch
LED Push-Button Keyboard Interface
SD Card Slot, and Secondary Micro USB Port
Create your own orchestra of electronics with the Garden! It features one of each evaluation platform. All devices come with Daisy installed. 
Pod
Petal
Patch
Field
Add $10 to your pledge to add a bumper sticker, $20 to add a T-Shirt, or $30 for a bumper sticker and a T-Shirt.
We have been working on the Daisy project for more than three years. Over the course of the project, Daisy has seen many different forms. We have since gotten closer to our final product, and are well underway on the accompanying software.
v1 (2017)- On the first version, the only thing we knew for sure was that we wanted to use an ARM processor, and have audio on-board. Given the limited power of the M4 processors at the time, and our lack of additional RAM, we planned for a new version with newer, more powerful technology right away.
v2 (2018) - After about a year or so, the M7 processors began coming out, and we decided it was time to try one, alongside some 32MB of additional RAM. Despite a few hardware related issues that made troubleshooting difficult, we got most of the technologies working!
v3 (2019) - Still undecided on a final form-factor, this is a larger-credit card sized version of the board that had both 40-pins of connectors, and on-board peripherals like SD Cards, USB, and Audio Jacks.
v4 (2019-2020) - Well on our way to the final version, we decided that size would make this useful in many more places, and shrank everything down. The current Daisy alongside the Pod, are nearly identical to the v3, with the exception that the small form factor can be moved and embedded on even the smallest of projects.
But the journey from one prototype to the next wasn't always so smooth...
Sometimes, the first time you plug in a new prototype.....nothing happens, and that's worse than needing to use the fire extinguisher!
We are Electrosmith, a collective of musicians and makers dedicated to providing the parts, tools, and learning resources necessary for DIY music electronics. We were recently awarded "Best Newcomer" at NAMM 2020 (Sonic State). The products we sell range from breakout boards, to electronic components, to modular synthesizers. Our passion lies in helping people build their own audio devices and feeling the magic of discovery along the way. 
Learn more on our website: electro-smith.com
You can also connect with us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. 
Max Mathews is known as the father of computer music and was responsible for some of the first music ever played by a computer. In 1961 he became the first person to teach a computer how to sing when he programmed the song "Daisy Bell" on the IBM 7094. 
While a researcher at Bell Labs in the 1950s and 60s he created the family of MUSIC-N programming languages specifically designed for the creation of music. This laid the groundwork for modern audio programming environments such as Csound, Max/MSP, SuperCollider, etc. Today his legacy lives on not only through the music and instruments that he left behind, but the ones that he inspired others to create.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have learned a lot about electronics manufacturing and design with our existing products and have taken these lessons to mind when planning the Daisy project. We are currently performing pre-production small lot testing on the Daisy to ensure that the quality and reliability live up to our expectations. 

To overcome potential supply chain delays we have been in talks with manufacturers and distributors from the very beginning to guarantee that we will have the right parts on hand, at the right time.

In addition, each of our products are assembled in our shop, right here in Southern California. We will be documenting each step of the manufacturing process so that you can be a part of the journey with us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We are using BGA chip packages wherever possible to guarantee the long term integrity of our solder joints. This type of package is known for being not only extremely reliable, but also being impervious to damage from the outside since there are no leads exposed.
Environmentally friendly factories
Every PCB that is produced in our shop is 100% RoHS compliant. This means that the Daisy will conform to a lead free and mercury free manufacturing process.
Sustainable Distribution
There will be a minimal amount of packaging for the Daisy. We plan to use just a single ESD bag to protect the PCB from static during shipping. This helps eliminate waste from plastic, and printed corrugated materials.

Hello all!

First Steps

The Daisy EAGLE Device is live!

https://www.electro-smith.com/eagle-library
We have multiple footprint variants including SMT headers, locked headers, and more.

We have MIDI working on the Daisy!
In the following video we are using an Akai MPK controller to send MIDI information over a TRS cable to the Daisy Patch Eurorack module. The Daisy Patch is the only sound source in the video and is running a subtractive synth voice. The MPK is sending note information and controlling the filter cutoff via CC. 
(Also check out the super cool OLED display on the Patch!)

updates.update_userinfo: What could be next for PrintABlok
updates.update_content:
First of all of, thank you all. 
It's been a weird 365 days or so, hasn't it? And I know everyone says that. Talking about how weird the past year has been has kind of replaced talking about the weather. But it's true, and it's been weird for different people in different ways.
In fact it's kinda been a perfect storm to delay persuing something that I really thought I'd be tacking sooner. But, I think it's time that we start to think about:
PrintABlok Phase 2.

TL:DR - Share this link with your friends and family: https://www.myminifactory.com/object/3d-print-printablok-base-set-142140

Josh from Alien3D held a 24 hour live stream to raise money for the Extra Life Charity with many great people from the 3D printing community including yours truly at about the 3 and a half hour mark of the second consecutive stream. During my time on the stream, after putting them over the stretch goal where Josh got an extreme haircut, I made a proposition. If they raised $3000, 3x their intended goal, I would release a PrintABloks for all.

updates.update_userinfo: Makers and Minecraft Festival brought to you by PrintABlok
updates.update_content: If you play Minecraft, I'm putting together an online maker festival with Minecraft as the medium. And if you are inclined, you can be a part of the festivities. I'm looking for people to build 1 chunk builds as stand ins for booths. You can build whatever you want, promote whatever you want. All you need to do is sign up.
Watch video on YouTube

Are you into war gaming about skating modular sail barges on frozen seas in a post-apocalyptic wasteland? Who isn't, right? Well, a couple of the backers of PrintABlok:Mechs have made their own kickstarter which is all about that, and it's called "Frozen Winds".
Frozen Winds has a number of things going for it. First of all, it's entirely 3D printed, just like PrintABlok:Mechs. Secondly, due to the current situation in the world they've decided that whether you're backing at $1 or $25 your rewards are the same. No one, regardless of financial situation is barred entry. And third, it's PrintABlok compatible!

I hope you all are staying safe and staying well and I hope that PrintABloks are providing some relief while you do.
Some people have asked where they can post pictures of their PrintABlok:Mech builds. I love to see them. Many are already posting them on social media with the hashtag #PrintABlok, and I totally dig those. I also think it would be totally allowed to put your PrintABlock:Mech builds as a make on the PrintABlock source listing on Thingiverse, assuming thingiverse is working. Some think that a make on the thingiverse listing isn't exaclty accurate or appropriate, but it's my listing and I say it's okay.

updates.update_userinfo: Doing my part during the crisis
updates.update_content:
It's impossible for me to pretend everything is okay, and I know it had as lot of you worried and anxious. But I want everyone to just remember, Din Djarin's got the kid. Baby Yoda will be okay.
Kickstarter finally dispersed the funds to me, which means I can announce that if any of you realize that your pledge would help you during this time of crisis, just shoot me a message here and I will issue a no questions asked refund. There are a lot of people who have lost their jobs, there are a lot of people who are suffering financially in many ways, and I don't want that for anyone. There will be other opportunities to support what I do in the future. Right now, let's just get through this, and if what you pledged would help, please, reach out to me and let me know.

campaign.story:
What is make/100?
make/100 is a series of Kickstarter projects offering limited runs of 100 products. Since 2017, over 1000 creators have taken part so we felt it was time for us to join in with a small project offering limited editions of our extremely popular LokBuild surfaces.
Limited Edition LokBuild, pre-sized and produced in custom colours to suit the specific printer
Limited Edition LokBuild
These limited edition LokBuild surfaces are based on our original LokBuild 3D Print Build Surfaces. Since launching in 2017 LokBuild has became very popular and is now well known within the 3D printing community.
We will only manufacture 100 of each reward and they will be pre-sized and produced in custom colours to suit the specific printer. Each LokBuild will also feature a Limited Edition logo in silver.
If you are new to LokBuild, it is a great 3D printing surface for FDM 3D printers. The build surface is durable and stable, and can be easily attached to your existing print bed to help prevent model curling or warping.
LokBuild is clean to use, long lasting and superior to other solutions such as kapton, films, tapes, sprays and adhesives.
LokBuild is made from uniquely textured sheets that attach to your build plate easily with heat-resistant adhesive backing. You can also use LokBuild with many different types of filament without needing to change the printing surface.
Custom fit to suit the Original Prusa MK3S
LokBuild Features
Optimal 3D Printing Surface
Improves Model Adhesion
Reduces Warping
Easier Nozzle Height Calibration
Durable and Long Lasting
Protect your Build Plate
Easy Removal of Completed Prints
One Build Surface for most materials
Easy to Install

Print Materials
LokBuild works with ABS, PLA and many other filaments so you can switch between materials without the need to change the build surface between prints. When printing with PLA it is not necessary to use a heated bed so it can help save power and it is great for machines that do not feature a heated bed.
Although LokBuild works well with ABS and PLA it also works with other more exotic materials. Here is a list of just some materials that have been successfully printed on LokBuild: ABS, PLA, HIPS, PET, colorFabb_XT, colorFabb nGen, colorFabb_HT, colorFabb XT-CF20 (carbon fibre), Woodfill, Bronzefill, Copperfill, Brassfill, Polymaker PC-Plus (polycarbonate), Polymaker PC-Max (polycarbonate), Polymaker PolyFlex, Ninjaflex.
As new materials are developed the scope of LokBuild is constantly increasing.
Limited Edition LokBuild, pre-sized and produced in custom colours to suit the specific printer
Installing LokBuild
If you have ever used tape or films you will know that they are difficult to fit. LokBuild is more rigid and really easy to apply to your build plate. Also, it is almost impossible for air bubbles to get trapped beneath the LokBuild surface.
FORGIVING NOZZLE HEIGHT CALIBRATION
A common problem relating to some other similar solutions is the accuracy needed when setting the nozzle height from the bed. Too much distance and the print will peal away or warp easily. Too close and the print will be impossible to remove without damaging the print or build surface. However, LokBuild solves this problem. LokBuild is much more forgiving and does not require this level of accuracy making the calibration process much simpler and printing more enjoyable.
TIP: When setting the nozzle height start further away from the bed than with other surfaces such as tapes. LokBuild works better without squashing the filament too much on the first layer.
LokBuild can be fitted to flexible build plates (shown here on the Prusa MK3S)
Limited Edition Rewards
Choose a reward to suit your 3D printer. The Limited Edition LokBuild will be delivered pre-sized and in custom colours to suit the chosen machine.
If you don't see your printer listed, please send us a direct message as we might be able to add a reward for it if we get enough interest.
Reward (Main background colour)
6" (Black)
Ender 2 (Black)
8" (Black)
Ultimaker (White)
MakerGear (Black)
Prusa MK3 (Orange)
Prusa MK2 (Orange)
Ender 3 & 5 (Black)
12" (Black)
CR-10 & 10S (Black)
LulzBot (Green)
Raise3D (Red)
Note that some reward sizes will fit other printers and we have listed them on the reward details when known. All LokBuild can be easily cut to suit the exact shape and size of other 3D printer build surfaces.

MULTIPLE LOKBUILD
If you want more than one LokBuild simply multiply your pledge value by the number you would like to receive (we will contact you after the campaign to ensure you recieve the required reward).
Limited Edition with silver LokBuild branding
Share LokBuild with Friends
If you know someone who owns a 3D printer please share our campaign by clicking on the share buttons at the top of this page.

campaign.story:
Most cat lovers will agree that the existing litter box options are really bad. You usually get a simple but ugly plastic bin that looks like it came from a dollar store.  
Here is what most people's litter box looks like:
Our team is obsessed with design and cats. We just wanted a litter box that was simple, beautiful, and easy to clean. But nothing existed - so we designed one ourselves.  
Cove is a simple beautiful litter box that you don't need to hide.
Other litter boxes are either cheap and flimsy OR huge and cost hundreds of dollars. 
Cove is $99 and it's made by furniture designers - everything is high quality and we didn't skip out on any details. It's made with a thick, slightly textured, double-walled matte plastic.  It feels incredibly sturdy and is truly a beautiful object to have in your home.
Many companies view a litter box as the equivalent to a trash can, so they put out the cheapest, ugliest product possible. We view it as something important that will be displayed in your home and we designed it using that assumption.
One thing we found during our research was that the litterbox tools are as important to user satisfaction as the box itself. Yet, most litterboxes include, as an afterthought, a cheap flimsy scoop that ends up just being tossed on the floor beside the box. Another common user frustration is the litter scatter caused by a cat’s coming and going.
So we thought – why not engineer a litterbox with well-integrated tools that address the realities of maintaining a litterbox? The Cove includes a scoop, dustpan, and hand brush that fit perfectly into an accessible top compartment. 
If your cat is an active digger or pees standing up, we have developed an add-on  that will extend the walls vertically. The add-on will be available to backers at a deep discount after our campaign ends.
Sketch of our new wall extender add-on. Photos to follow at end of campaign.
After in depth user research, we discovered the most important feature of a litterbox is that it should be easy to clean. Yet many litterboxes have shapes and materials that don't align with this. Cove's shape is incredibly simple and open - there are no unnecessary bends or hard-to-get-to corners. For the material itself, we considered a variety of options, but ultimately landed on recycled plastic because it’s durable and especially easy to clean.
 And Cove is the perfect size.
The dimensions of the box are 22" x 16" x 6". The sizing will work for all except very large cats (i.e. Maine Coons or 20 pound+ cats).
The walls are 6" high - this is the height our cat behaviorist recommended because it allows for all cats to get in and out safely while being able to view potential threats (very important for cats). If you need a higher wall, we are offering an optional add-on at the end of the campaign that will increase the wall height to 14".
 Here is Cove beside a competitor litter box brand "Giant (XL)" and "Large" sizes. As you can see - the competitor's have a smaller base but slope outwards to appear larger. Cove actually holds more volume than their XL size, and our vertical walls are much better than sloping walls at preventing litter scatter from coming outside the box.
Cove's vertical walls are much better at preventing litter scatter than sloping walls.
Update: if we hit 250k, we will be launching a "Giant" size for 20 pound + cats (and larger spaces). The standard cove is equivalent to most "large" litter boxes you will find in pet stores - so for most cats, our standard size is perfect.
 Fancy litter box designers want to replace the scoop, but doing so introduces new complications. So we decided to make scooping faster. Our scoop is sturdy, and engineered with angled slots to make litter sifting as fast and minimal as possible. The handle and grip feel great in your hands, and it all slides easily back into the box for safe keeping.
The last thing we want to do is create more plastic waste - so we're using recycled plastic to make Cove - it is completely toxin-free so it’s good for our planet and our pets.
 Our design is made to be durable and long lasting. We chose plastic because it's easy to clean and lasts forever. It lasts so long, in fact, that we're using recycled plastics to build our litterbox. This is the only litterbox you'll ever need to purchase.
Being environmentally friendly is one of our core values. We're constantly working to create better designs that will last longer and have less impact by using eco-friendly materials. We participate in a carbon offset program where 100% of our emissions caused by transporting the product are offset by planting trees.
We've partnered with over 50 shelters across the US - if you ever need to get rid of your litter box, we'll happily pay to ship it to a shelter in need.  
 We’re obsessed with cats and we feel we’re the perfect team to launch this product. Over the past 18 months, we’ve developed countless iterations with constant improvements – we’ve explored a ton of options. Now we have the final product ready to go and we believe it’s the most beautiful litterbox in the world. 
If we're lucky enough to hit our stretch goal of 100k, we'll release 3 new colors: Sand, Seawash, and Salmon AND we'll offer an add-on shroud that can easily be added to Cove to extend the walls higher. If we hit our super stretch goal, we'll make a black Cove from 100% recycled ocean plastics AND we'll offer a GIANT version of Cove for those with larger cats (20 pounds +)
 Shroud add-on: design to be voted on next week by backers.
 We need your help Kickstarter – large scale production runs require us to pay for expensive tooling up front. Please help us make this project a reality. 
A special thanks to: 
 Catfe Vancouver
Michelle and the team at Catfe Vancouver - what you're doing to help the local cat community is inspiring!
Marci Koski for her endless and in depth knowledge about cat behavior and litter box habits.
Laiya and Octavia, Erin and Grubber for their incredible modeling and cat whispering abilities: 
Julian Kenchenten and Alex Waber for their amazing videography and photography:
Julian getting close to the action
A hard day at the office for Alex
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1000+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $430M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been working day and night over the last year to dial in the design, production, and logistics of the litterbox to ensure the experience is a smooth as possible. We've built our prototype, partnered with reputable manufacturers, and secured third party logistics for timely deliveries.

We've done our homework so that once we have the funding in place, we will immediately start creating the mold and move into production. Our team has lots of experience manufacturing products at scale so we're familiar with the issues that can arise. Delays are always a small possibility, and if we ever need to choose between quality and speed, we will choose quality every time. But what we can promise is 100% transparency and constant communication to keep our backers in the loop. We're in this together.

We are laser focused on making this the best litterbox you ever own.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Cats and Backers + Shipping Update for Canadians + International
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! Our team is thrilled to share that we’ve been inundated with positive feedback on Cove - it makes us so happy that cats and backers are loving the product and it’s definitely a big weight off our shoulders to hear from happy customers despite the long wait. We’ve shared some early testimonials at the bottom of this update.

Thank you so much for your patience. I know this project took a lot longer to complete than we originally anticipated but we are very proud of the final product, and we promise it’s worth the wait.

updates.update_userinfo: Final US Orders Shipping (& Canada Delay)
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! We've started getting great feedback from the backers who have received their Coves. A quick fulfilment update:

We've shipped 90% of US orders, the remaining 10% will be going out this week. We are shipping via UPS, all carriers are a bit overwhelmed at the moment but we are being quoted 5-10 business days  for delivery.
Unfortunately there was a delay at the Canadian port and our shipment is now set to arrive December 18th. We're going to figure out a creative way to get units delivered within Vancouver (and maybe BC) before Christmas, but outside of BC unfortunately is looking like it will be just after Christmas. If your plan was to give this as a gift, we've created a as a temporary stand in.

updates.update_userinfo: Litter boxes are en route to backers!
updates.update_content:
Thank you everyone for your patience. Litter boxes are officially on the way to backers! Here's the timeline depending on your location:

Orders outside of North America left our Asia factory last week and take 4-8 weeks to arrive. There is some additional uncertainty on timeline due to COVID, each country has specific (ever changing) procedures regarding large international shipments. 
US orders started leaving our US warehouse yesterday and will arrive in 5-10 business days. By the end of this week, we'll have shipped 75% of US backer orders. The remaining 25% will arrive on our next container (likely end of next week).

updates.update_userinfo: First units have left the factory!
updates.update_content: Just a quick update to let you all know the majority of units departed from our factory today.

updates.update_userinfo: First sample units coming off production + timeline update!
updates.update_content:
Hey to all our fellow cat people!
First - I want to apologize for the lack of communication. Over the last month, there have been so many little product updates and we just wanted to make sure we had all our facts, timelines, and details correct before giving this update. Small details have been changing every day, and I kept postponing the update by a few days thinking we were just about resolved, until I realized a month had passed.

Hey everyone! Just a quick update on timing - there has been quite a bit of back and forth between our engineers and the factory refining the details in the tooling to ensure a 10/10 product. Everything has been finalized, payment has been made for the molds, and we're in the process of creating the molds as we speak. We have not skipped on a single detail - even little things like "parting lines" (the small line where plastic pieces are joined) have been carefully considered to ensure we're delivering a truly beautiful product.
Cove ship date has been pushed from August to September 15th, which means backers will receive them by late October. I sincerely apologize for the delay but I can genuinely say that we are working as fast as possible without cutting any corners - as the founder, I felt like quality of product was well worth the delay.

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys are out + some countries excluded
updates.update_content:
Surveys have been sent out, it's super simple and only takes a minute because we just need to know your address. You can complete the survey here: https://cove.backerkit.com/
If you change your address at a later date, you can always go in and update the info in the above link.
Shipping fee increases due to COVID

Hey cat lovers! It's been a crazy couple months but we have some exciting updates to share with you. Thanks so much for bearing with us during these strange times.
1. Cove Size Increase. Due to popular backer demand mixed with some more cat behavior research, we've decided to extend the length of the cove basin by 3". From an aesthetics perspective, it won't have a major impact and it should also fit in similar spaces because we're not changing the width. However - it will give cats some extra room to take care of their business. The size is now comparable to most 'large' litter boxes you'd find in pet stores and the litter box is appropriate for all but very large cats.

updates.update_userinfo: COVID Update + Final design drawings handed off
updates.update_content:
Hey Cove fam! What a crazy month it's been - things really took a turn there. Wanted to give ya'll a quick update on where we're at.
WALL EXTENDER: We're still finalizing tiny details with the wall extender add-on. There are some subtleties we've needed to figure out in order to flat pack it which will greatly reduce shipping costs (i.e. will reduce overall cost we need to charge backers). We've been delaying sending out the survey until these details are finished so that we can charge the lowest possible cost for existing backers to add this item, and we can't do that until we know our costs. We're very close on this and will have a final version in April and it will look as beautiful as Cove.

updates.update_userinfo: Quick update on next steps and survey
updates.update_content:
Hey Cove fam! Thanks for bearing with us over the last couple weeks while we sort things out - here's a quick update:
1. We're in the final stages of our wall extender add-on. We're working on a way to flat pack it without requiring seams which would be a hassle to clean. I'm really excited to share the final design with you but it's going to take us a couple more weeks.
2. Once we have the wall extender add-on finalized, I will send out the backer survey where you will have the option to choose your color, confirm your shipping address, and decide if you'd like to purchase the wall extender add-on (final cost not determined yet, we're aiming for around $30).
