campaign.story:
Welcome to Science!, an 80 page middle-grade original graphic novel written by husband and wife team, Jason Inman and Ashley Victoria Robinson, who you've probably seen somewhere on the internet (Collider Heroes, DC All Access, Jawiin). This is their second co-created comic after their debut creator-owned series Jupiter Jet, published in 2017 by Action Lab Comics. This graphic novel will feature art by illustrator Dez Pittman, colour art by Gehenna: Death Valley creator Becka Kinzie, and letters by Ghost Glyph Studio’s Taylor Esposito, edited by Hope Nicholson (Angel Catbird, Moonshot) and will be published by the multi Eisner-nominated publisher Bedside Press (The Secret Loves of Geek Girls, Gothic Tales of Haunted Love). 
(If you're curious about Jason and Ashley's previous comic work, check out the IGN review!)
We successfully funded and reached our first stretch goal! Thank you! That means that not only is Science! happening, but it will be bigger and better. Check out the rewards section below to learn more about our next stretch goal!
Science! is the story of Tamsin Kuhn Trakroo, a fourteen-year-old girl who is already the smartest Theoretical and Applied Physicist in any room. Yeah, she’s that super smart! Tamsin has just started studying at The Prometheus Institute which is only the world's most famous and prestigious science school. The Institute is a futuristic wonderland filled with genius teachers (some who might not be of this world), and floating helper robots known as S.T.A.T.s.  
Our main characters (from left to right) Tamsin, AJ, Sally, Garyn and Headmaster Laveran
But Tamsin is stressed, and if your dead father talked to you through your super-cool science glasses, you’d be stressed out too. That's right, her father, the world-renowned Dr. Thomas Trakroo uploaded his consciousness before his death and now lives as a hologram stored in Tamsin's glasses.
Her father claims that Lucan Laveran, headmaster of The Prometheus Institute, is his murderer, and is on a mission to destroy the Institute! But Lucan just offered Tamsin a really cool position as his assistant. He can’t be a murderer, right? Can she trust her weird holographic Dad?  
Laveran and Tamsin strolling the grounds of the Prometheus Institute.
Tamsin's really cute roommate, Garyn, is the only one that she can trust right now. However, Garyn’s just discovered a dangerous energy source that could win her the Prometheus Institute Award for Superior Science, or it could tear a hole in the very space/time continuum!
Using all her skills, Tamsin will have to gather a group of super science friends to discover the secrets of Garyn's project. Confronting her ultimate goal: Will she destroy the school that her father claims terminated him or save it? (That's only if her rocket obsessed friend, AJ, doesn't burn it down first. )
Will Tamsin let the pretty girl she has a crush on push the boundaries of astrophysics too far? Probably. Will she try to stop the man who her father says killed him? Maybe. In the ultimate school of science it’s not your friends, your teachers, or your family that you can trust. You can only trust in SCIENCE! And it’s time for Tamsin True to grow up.  
This comic was created when Inman had an idea for a science-adventure story in the vein of Star Trek: the Original Series, that would read like the school-based stories he and Robinson enjoyed growing up (s/o to Harry Potter!). Pittman was a last-minute addition to the team after she met Inman and Robinson at Wizard World Portland earlier in 2018 and the team clicked so well they knew they had to collaborate on something. This is a further amping up of the science fiction tropes in storytelling that Inman and Robinson began exploring in Jupiter Jet!
But did you know? The first 10 pages of Science! are already COMPLETE! Story, art, colors, letters and experiments are complete and ready to go! This means the story is ⅛ complete and we are looking to fund the production and printing costs associated with creating the final 70 pages so that it can be a real-life book As Soon As Possible! Since this book is 100% creator-owned, there's no publisher financing. We, the creators, are responsible for all costs to make this SCIENCE! story come to life! Even our publisher, Bedside Press, isn't getting paid by this Kickstarter.
Our goal is just enough to bridge the gap to make SCIENCE! a real physical book. With that in mind, if you’ve enjoyed our previous comics work (Jupiter Jet, Captain Terrific stories in the IF Anthologies, Love is Love, The Red Shirt Diaries), please support our next step in the world of creator-owned comic books. SCIENCE! will become a reality with your support, we have some outstanding reward for you AND REMEMBER: you’re only charged if we make our funding goal. As of right now, this Kickstarter is the only way you can purchase the book. So don't miss out on these amazing SCIENCE! adventures. 
Now check out some pages…
SCIENCE! - Page 4 & 5
 WHERE THE FUNDS WILL GO -  
Money earned will go to covering fees, production, postage, and printing of the collection. The writers aren't even being paid for this book. All Kickstarter funds are to support our artist, colorist, letterer and more! Any leftover money will be used to pay for new artwork that will be used in the series...maybe some back-ups by other creators? A variant cover? All money will go back into the book, period. The first goal of this campaign is to give our readers a high-quality product. 
 Look, more art!  
STRETCH GOALS! Because our graphic novel is fully funded, we can add stretch goals! 
17k REACHED - Every backer at the $15 dollar level and up gets the digital download for the full graphic novel of Science!  Plus because we value and love our artist, Dez Pittman, we're going to pay her a higher page rate because she's worth it!
20K REACHED - Every backer at the $18 dollar level and up with receive an official PROMETHEUS INSTITUTE ID Card! Show it off to your friends and use it to access the Science! Cafeteria. 
If we hit 22K - we're going to add 10 pages to the story! So instead of 80 pages of SCIENCE adventures, you're going top get 90! More splash pages, more great moments and possibly some more robot diagrams.  
 THE GRAPHIC NOVEL! You can get SCIENCE! in both digital and physical softcover formats, with full color pages stuffed with gripping science adventures and facts for you to enjoy! All physical copies with come with signed bookplates. You slap them on the inside of your book and by the transitive property you got a signed book!
 EXCLUSIVE PRINTS! You can get PRINTS from amazing artists such as Ryan Sands (Geoffrey Wilder on Marvel's Runaways) and Brent Schoonover (Captain Marvel, Batman 66)!
ADVICE FROM A GHOSTBUSTER! You can have your comic script reviewed by writer Erik Burnham (Ghostbusters & Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)!  
ADVICE FROM A SUPERGIRL WRITER! You can have your 20 page comic script reviewed by writer Marc Andreyko (Wonder Woman 77 & Supergirl)! 
 ADVICE FROM A MIRACLE WORKER! You can have six pages of your artwork reviewed by Eisner Award winning artist Mitch Gerads (Mister Miracle & Batman)!
 ADVICE FROM THE WRITER OF BATMAN! You can have your 20 page comic script reviewed by Eisner Award winning writer Tom King (Batman & Heroes in Crisis)!
 ADVICE FROM AN X-MEN WRITER! You can have your 20 page comic script reviewed by writer Cullen Bunn (X-Men Blue & The Sixth Gun)! 
ADVICE FROM A WONDER WOMAN! You can have your 20 page comic script reviewed by writer Shea Fontana (DC Superhero Girls & Wonder Woman)!
ADVICE FROM A TV WRITER! You can have your 20 page comic script or 20 pages of your TV script reviewed by writer Joshua Hale Fialkov (The Bunker, Ultimate FF, CBS The Code)!
BE IN THE COMIC! You can see your likeness in an actual comic book! The Cameo in Our Comic Level offers an opportunity to be drawn into the comic book as attendee of the The Prometheus Institute! The Teacher Cameo in the Comic Level offers an opportunity to be drawn into the comic as of the SCIENCE! school teachers! Lastly, the Supporting Character in Our Comic level allows you to be drawn into the comic as a supporting character that will speak with one of our main characters! You could drastically affect the plot of the whole series at that level!
LUNCH WITH THE PRIDE! You can join actor Ryan Sands, Science creators Jason Inman and Ashley Victoria Robinson for a lunch in Sherman Oaks, CA. Ask Ryan what it's like to play a Marvel villain on Marvel's Runaways and how it felt to draw his first Marvel cover! (No Runaways Season 2 spoilers are guaranteed.)
ABOUT THE CREATORS
Jason Inman is a farm boy from Kansas, and since he now thrives in the superhero universe, it's no wonder why Jason Inman is often mistaken as the last son of Krypton. His comic book writing has been featured in projects published by DC Comics/IDW, Action Lab Comics, Alterna Comics, and Not Forgotten Comics. He just finished co-writing Jupiter Jet, a five issue mini-series published by Action Lab Entertainment. Plus, his podcast, Geek History Lesson, a weekly show that explores the secret histories of everyone's favorite pop culture characters, and various other weekly reaction and recap videos, can all be found on Jason's YouTube Channel, www.youtube.com/Jawiin which has over 13 million views.  
Jason is a frequent guest on Collider Movie Talk and hosted DC ALL ACCESS, the show that brings you all the latest announcements from the world of DC, for 4 years. Also, Jason hosted special features for Warner Bros on the Batman v Superman and Suicide Squad Blu-rays. 
Ashley Victoria Robinson is a Canadian hobbit now living in the United States. Her comic book writings have been published through DC Comics/IDW, Top Cow, Action Lab Comics, Alterna Comics, Not Forgotten Comics and Colonial Comics. She is the host of the Geek History Lesson podcast (alongside Jason), any number of shows for the youtube channels including: Jawiin, Nerd Alert, Geek Bomb, Collider, Screen Junkies, DC All-Access, Comicbook.com, Geek & Sundry, Hyper RPG, Major Spoilers and many more. She is the co-creator of Jupiter Jet and The Red Shirt Diaries and has been featured in several international commercial campaigns including Intel alongside The Big Bang Theory's Jim Parsons. Follow her antics on Twitter & Instagram @AshleyVRobinson
Together, Jason and Ashley have co-written Jupiter Jet (Action Lab), The Red Shirt Diaries (and tie-in webcomic), Town Hall (stage play), Terrific & Thief (featured in Alterna Comics’ IF Anthology), Swan Story (featured in DC Comics/IDW’s Love is Love Anthology), as well as several projects yet to be announced.
Dez Pittman Hello there!  My  name is Desiree' Pittman, Dez for short.  Growing up, I just wanted to create art all the time.  In 2001, I attended the School of Visual Arts in Manhattan where I studied cartooning and illustration and later graduated in 2005 with a BFA.  
I  currently reside in Portland, Oregon with my amazing husband, Jason, who is also a very talented artist.  On top of doing my own projects, I enjoy commission work and collaborations. You're most likely to see me at a Convention drawing Zombie Portraits and  selling prints of my illustration work.  
And  just in case you wanted to know, I love food.  Food is pretty awesome. And ice-cream, MAN do I love ice-cream.
Becka Kinzie is a freelance  artist and colorist from Ontario, Canada. Some of her coloring work has been featured in comics such as Hacktivist (vol. 2), and the Gothic Tales of Haunted Love anthology. When not coloring, she's drawing her own horror/darkly inclined comics and art.  She's currently working on her horror/sci-fi webcomic, which can be found on her website at thebecka.com.
Taylor Esposito is a comic book lettering professional and owner of Ghost Glyph Studios. As a staff letterer at DC, he lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws, Constantine, Bodies, CMYK, The New 52: Future’s End, and New Suicide Squad. Prior to this, Taylor was credited on numerous titles for Marvel as a production artist. He is currently working on a new batch of creator-owned titles, such as The Paybacks and Interceptor (Heavy Metal Comics), Heroine Chic, Dents, Mirror, and Finality (Line Webtoon). Other publishers he has worked with include Rosy Press, Zenescope, Valiant, and Dynamite. He can be reached at @TaylorEspo or @GhostGlyph on Twitter and taylor@ghostglyphstudios.com
Hope Nicholson is a Winnipeg based publisher, and the owner of Bedside Press. I am also a historian, an editor, a writer, and an events organizer. She wrote The Spectacular Sisterhood of Superwomen for Quirk Books, a light-hearted history book showcasing the changing role of women characters in comics. Plus she was the curator and editor of The Secret Loves of Geeks series, which began with the Bedside Press published The Secret Loves of Geek Girls, later re-published by Dark Horse Comics, and followed up by The Secret Loves of Geek Girls: Redux, and the all-gender The Secret Loves of Geeks. To date, she has ran 7 successful Kickstarter campaigns, and have been a co-organizer on 3 more (Enough Space for Everyone Else, Habibi, and Prairie Comics Zine 2017).
A huge thank you for all your support and special kudos if you read this far. You're a superstar. 
 Email us at sciencecomicbook@gmail.com for any questions or inquiries.  
NOTE: If you contribute to this project you acknowledge that the comic and any other perks you receive come "as is", and may not look exactly as presented here as some designs may change over the due course of production. 
Here's a SNEAK PEEK of the first 5 pages of SCIENCE! to give you a taste of the science adventures to come! We hope you enjoy it, and thanks for supporting independent comics!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of the creators involved in this project are professionals with years of experience and excellent records in making tough deadlines. Even better -- the first issue has already been written and drawn! All that remains is to finish the other 70 pages and to prepare it for actual physical printing. Of course, unavoidable personal mishaps, acts of God, global disruption, or alien invasions could throw us off schedule, and we will keep Kickstarter backers updated if we do encounter any delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We've received a lot of positive feedback to build an ecosystem around the Pico. We've thought about this and have decided to release the following shields during this campaign.
UNLOCKED
Proto Shield - £1
Pico Proto Shield
The proto shield is a compact prototyping board that stacks on top of the Pico and can be used to add custom circuitry to it.
LED Matrix Shield - £3
A tiny shield that contains 24 (3x8) green 0603 LEDs that can be used to create patterns.
LED Matrix Shield
It has 3 LED columns, each containing 8 rows of LEDs. Two 74HC595 shift registers are used to address the LEDs. One shift register is responsible for activating the rows, while the other activates the columns.
D1 Mini Adapter - £3
A shield that lets you use the Pico with existing D1 Mini shields. At least 50 of these will have to be ordered or else we will not be able to manufacture these.
D1 Mini Adapter Shield (design in progress)
It features a 3.3V linear regulator to power the shields and also contains 10 3.3/5V bi-directional level translators for interfacing. The analog line has not been level translated.
LOCKED
LiPo Shield & microSD Shield - £7,000
DC Motor Shield & Accelerometer Shield - £9,000
***The D1 mini adapter makes the Pico compatible with existing D1 mini shields. It consists of an onboard 3.3V regulator and 10 5V-3.3V bidirectional level translators allowing you to safely operate the shields. The analog pin (A0) has not been translated. This is a perfect solution if you already own the D1 mini shields. Here's a link to the D1 mini shield wiki for reference:
https://wiki.wemos.cc/products:d1_mini_shields
HOW TO ORDER SHIELDS?
Please read the multi-pledge section below and get in touch with us to add shields to your existing pledge. Each shield is considered to be a single board for shiping purposes. If you've ordered 4 or more boards (Picos + Nanos + Shields), then you will qualify for combined shipping as mentioned in the shipping section below.
Many of our backers have expressed interest in obtaining multiple boards. If you would like to do the same, then simply follow the steps below or get in touch with us directly - either through a private message or email (team@piksey.com).
Here's what you need to do if you want to get more boards (pledge multiple times):
Select the suitable reward and pledge the corresponding amount which covers the total amount for the boards + shipping.
Send us a message or email (team@piksey.com) and mention the number of boards you would like along with your pledge amount. We will check to make sure everything is correct and will give you a written confirmation. We will also make a note of this and adjust the available rewards accordingly.
Many of you have already sent us a message/email and if you have received a response from us, then you do not need to do anything further.
We will also get in touch with all backers to confirm their pledge towards the end of the campaign. This will allow any final tweaks/modifications. 
The new rewards do not include shipping charges, so please read the following and determine the applicable shipping amount or leave a comment if you need assistance.
1. Count the total number of boards you would like to order.
2. For 1-3 boards, shipping is £1 for UK and £4 for all other destinations.
3. For 4 or more boards, shipping is £2 for UK and £6 for all other destinations.
4. Please add the shipping amount to your pledge.
We will also get in touch with you closer to the end of the campaign to confirm your pledge.
Piksey Pico
Piksey Nano
Arduino Nano vs Piksey Pico & Nano
Comparison with a standard glass bottle crown (cap)
The Piksey Pico is really tiny compared to several other boards including the Raspberry Pi Zero and the Arduino Uno - which have been used for reference. 
Comparison with popular boards and modules
There's no point in having a compact board with only a handful of I/O pins as that severely limits the capabilities and projects that it can be used in.
That's why the Piksey Pico and Nano have several user-accessible pins making them compatible with your existing Arduino Uno and Arduino Nano sketches.
Piksey Pico - Pinout Top
Piksey Pico - Pinout Bottom
Piksey Nano - Pinout
Battery operated GPS tracker with OLED display
Temperature monitor with OLED display
6 RGB LED strip using 1 data line
We at BitsNBlobs Electronics (BnBe), believe that the best way to learn electronics is to start working on projects. Our aim is to build a community and design products to help you learn electronics no matter what your age or skill level.
We are currently working on some exciting projects that will help us on our mission. Please follow us on Kickstarter or social media to stay updated.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

There's always an element of risk when it comes to a hardware project and most projects develop issues in one of the following areas - design, manufacturing, fulfillment.

Design:
The design process for Piksey Pico & Nano has been very straightforward. We've already successfully tested the pre-production prototype as can be seen in the promotional video.

We will have one final iteration of the board which will incorporate any feedback that will be obtained through this campaign. Orders will be fulfilled in 2 phases as outlined in the pledges - December 2018 and January 2019.

Manufacturing
Our technology partners work closely with multiple electronic suppliers and contract manufacturers. We've worked with two of our leading suppliers/manufacturers to obtain estimates for both the boards and we also have a 3rd manufacturer on standby to handle any surge in demand.

Fulfillment
Postage is perhaps the biggest variable and we will be fulfilling all orders through (UK) Royal Mail.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
It has been a while. This is an update to let you know that we have released a new board called Piksey Atto, which has a lot more use cases while also being smaller than the Piksey Pico. 
Atto uses the exact same micro-controller (ATmega32u4) contained in the Arduino Leonardo and is a fraction of its size as can be seen in the following image. The early adopter price is £6 or $8 and we cover shipping along with customs/import duty to the US for just £2 ($2.5).

Hi everyone,

Pending Rewards:
We are yet to dispatch rewards to 7 backers as we have not received their address details. We have emailed them and are still waiting for a response.

campaign.story:
We are raising funds for YOUTH v GOV, a feature documentary following the UPCOMING #TrialOfTheCentury, where 21 brave youth plaintiffs will take on the U.S. government in court over their constitutional rights to a healthy climate. 
THE TRIAL STARTS OCTOBER 29TH, 2018 and we need to be there to film! We've been shooting background footage with the plaintiffs for the past two years at home and in the courts. WE ARE ASKING FOR YOUR SUPPORT NOW so we can document this fast-approaching history-making trial.
Our Story
YOUTH v GOV is the story of America’s youth taking on the world’s most powerful government. In 2015, 21 young plaintiffs, ages 8 to 19, filed suit against the U.S. government asserting a willful violation of their constitutional rights. YOUTH v GOV follows this legal battle as the government takes extraordinary measures to get the case dismissed. Legal experts call this case the “most important lawsuit on the planet," but it's more than just a legal battle.
The heart of this film lies in the young plaintiffs’ personal stories as they find their footing as leaders and come to know their power as citizens in our democracy. YOUTH v GOV highlights and explores youth activism, government responsibility, our constitutional rights, and the importance of citizen democracy. It’s about the hope and action that our youngest generation is bringing to the forefront as they realize the power in their experiences and voices. Their story will resonate with audiences of all ages with the unexpected result that we will all be learning from our youngest how to be active, engaged democratic citizens once again.
Our Heroes
The 21 plaintiffs of Juliana v United State of America represent of a diverse sample of our American youth impacted by the climate crisis. They hail from 10 states, including Florida, Alaska, Hawaii, Colorado, Oregon, Washington, Pennsylvania, Arizona, Louisiana, and New York. They are activists, artists, musicians, and farmers. And they are each facing the effects of the climate crisis in their own unique ways. Here are a few of these brave youth...   
Kelsey Juliana is the named plaintiff on this landmark case: Juliana v the United States of America. No pressure. Kelsey is used to epic battles. She comes from a family of environmental activists who staunchly protected Pacific Northwest old-growth forests. But this is not her parents’ fight – Kelsey launched this lawsuit on her own.
Kelsey, 21 - Eugene, Oregon
Levi, 11, lives at the heart of climate change impacts on a barrier island in Florida. The sea turtles that Levi loves to watch are in decline, he can no longer swim in the sea due to toxins and bacteria, and sea level rise threatens to displace his family.
Levi, 11, Indialantic, Florida
Through music and dance, Xiuhtezcatl Martinez empowers youth across the world to take part in environmental justice. His speeches at the UN and other notable venues have brought attention to the strength of the youth voice and their right to a sustainable future. Xiuhtezcatl’s deep roots in the Aztec culture are an important part of his identity and his spiritual connection to the Earth.
Xiuhtezcatl, 18 - Boulder, Colorado
Jayden, 14, lives in a Louisiana community in the heart of the oil industry. As she works with her mother to resist the Bayou Bridge Pipeline, vast swaths of marshland continue to be devastated by tens of thousands of miles of oil pipelines. In 2016, her home flooded and as she said, “This morning I stepped out of my bed, and right into climate change.”
Jayden, 14 - Rayne, Louisiana
The legal team and plaintiffs have given us exclusive access to tell their story and Director Christi Cooper has worked with many of the plaintiffs since 2011, earning the trust of not only the youth and their families, but also the legal team. This is not just a lawsuit or a documentary, but also an extended family that reaches across the country.
Lead Counsel Julia Olsen with some of the plaintiffs
Our Motivation 
Climate change is the greatest threat to human rights in the 21st century. It is causing the displacement of millions of people worldwide and climate-induced food insecurity fuels more conflicts every day. Not only is our youngest generation most vulnerable, they will be disproportionately affected, especially those from disenfranchised and underrepresented communities. But this is not the typical climate change warning film. 
YOUTH v GOV is about the hope the youngest generation brings and the power of their voice. Throughout history, some of the most meaningful social changes were sparked by the actions of young people - from children coal miners in the early 1900’s to the civil rights movement in the 1960's. Youth are once again rising up and demanding change, from gun reform to climate justice. 
Our Audience & Impact
YOUTH v GOV is aimed at empowering more young citizens to take action. We want this film and movement to reach as many youth across the country as possible and you can join us with your support. 
YOUTH v GOV will speak not only to the adults in the room, but also to the over 70 million young people in the US under 18, who will be this nation’s future leaders and primary voting population. We plan to screen YOUTH v GOV at film festivals, in theaters, and through a video-on-demand and/or broadcast platform to reach as many viewers as possible.
Through our community screenings and workshops, we will bring the film to youth-centered events, to the plaintiffs’ hometowns, and to disenfranchised communities disproportionately affected by the climate crisis. These community screenings will provide our most important viewers with information to take actions, as well as opportunities for trainings, connections, and participation in direct local action.
At the Environmental Youth Forum/DOCLands Film Festival, 2018
We are already leading climate justice workshops with youth around the country using existing YOUTH v GOV footage. We will be working with non-profit and social justice partners, such as Rock the Vote, to create as much on-the-ground impact as possible with YOUTH v GOV.
Our Budget 
Our budget includes four years (2016-2019) of documentary production to cover the plaintiff’s stories from filing the lawsuit, through the full trial starting October 29, 2019, up to post-trial interviews with the plaintiffs and key witnesses in early 2019. The budget also includes plus post-production taking place from Fall 2018 to Fall 2019.
Our minimum raise for this Kickstarter of $30,000 is set to get us to the trial only, and is just a small fraction of our full film budget. We are hoping to raise much more than that during this crowdfund and you can help us reach our stretch goals by sharing the project widely. 
We believe in the power of grassroots organizing and that every voice matters. That’s why your pledged support is appreciated and valuable whether you can contribute $5 or $1,000. We want to gather and inspire as many engaged supporters as possible for YOUTH v GOV and the stories of these incredible youth. 
*Note on Carbon-Friendly Filmmaking: Because we care deeply about the climate crisis and are cognizant of our impacts while filmmaking, we prefer to work with a small production crew to reduce costs and our carbon footprint. We are always actively working to find a balance between nimble, efficient, low-carbon production, while also making sure we cover key events to properly tell this story. We are also seeking additional funders to cover the cost of a full carbon offset for the production.
Our Film Team
Why YOU Should Join Us! 
YOUTH v GOV is an opportunity for you to support a positive story about the good guys. This is a story that will have real impact on the ground for the younger generations who are inheriting our mess.
Contributing to YOUTH v GOV is about more than giving money. It’s about participating and taking action. It’s about supporting our youth and supporting those most affected by the climate crisis. And it’s about standing up for our constitutional rights.
Come be a part of our extended family, and join us in doing our part for climate justice. YOUTH v GOV has become about so much more than a documentary; and the lawsuit is about so much more than a legal battle. Our future is a constitutional right. 
You can also follow us online via: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. And sign up for our mailing list! We are also looking for ambassadors to help spread the word about this project. Please let us know if you’re interested! 
Our Kickstarter Rewards 
We’ve actively tried to balance our desire to thank you for your pledge with a reward, while also seeking to limit our carbon footprint on this project. The Kickstarter reward we’re mailing to every supporter who contributes $25 or more is a pocket copy of the United States Constitution. Our constitutional rights are at the heart of this film and paramount to every citizen. We want you all to have a copy in your pocket! 
We're also grateful to so many of the YOUTH v GOV plaintiffs who have offered to share their music, writing, and artwork with us so that we may offer it you as a Kickstarter reward. We are in awe every day at the talent, passion, and generosity of these youth. Please support these plaintiffs' creative passion and artworks by joining us at YOUTH v GOV FILM.
In the end, the greatest reward of YOUTH v GOV is the empowerment of these youth as they seek support for a national climate recovery plan based on the best available science.
Last, But Not Least... 
THANK YOU FOR JOINING US AND THESE INCREDIBLE YOUTH! 
Photos courtesy of Robin Loznak. 
Special thanks to Andrew Tumason with Woven Talon for generously allowing us to use his music for our Kickstarter campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest obstacles with completion is not whether we will complete the film, but when. Multiple federal administrations have tried to delay the case since 2015 and we now have a trial date for October 2018. We can’t account for extensions or changes to the trial start and end dates, but we are dedicated to telling the YOUTH v GOV story and the feature documentary will go into final post-production once the trial is completed. 

Director Christi Cooper has been working with some of these youth plaintiffs since 2011, and has already invested more than two years and significant personal funding into YOUTH v GOV production. As an experienced and professional team, we are confident that we will be able to complete a meaningful and impactful film and deliver it to a wide audience.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
As we near the trail date set for October 29, 2018, things are really starting to heat up.
The Trump administration is yet AGAIN trying to delay the #youthvgov trial, this time with the Ninth Circuit.
Today, the Trump administration filed a third writ of mandamus petition with the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals in the constitutional climate lawsuit Juliana v. United States. The administration is seeking an unprecedented and extraordinarily rare third request that the Court issue a writ of mandamus to stay district court proceedings pending the resolution of the administration’s forthcoming petition to the United States Supreme Court. The Department of Justice plans to file a second writ of mandamus petition with the Supreme Court on Wednesday, October 17.

Today the Trump administration filed another motion with the US District Court for the District of Oregon to stay discovery and trial in the case. They are asking to Supreme Court (once again) to dismiss the case. While that petition is before the Supreme Court they are requesting that the District Court put a stay on all trial proceedings. The attorneys and pre-trial judge just had a status conference yesterday to discuss this motion for stay, where Judge Coffin said the following:
"...it doesn’t seem to me, looking at the landscape here, that very much has changed since the last motion to stay was filed...and the only ‘change’ is that the Court hasn’t ruled on the dispositive motions that have been filed…I would just urge everybody to keep on track for trial.”

Dear YOUTH v GOV Film supporters!
Thanks to ALL of you, we met our goal. It's truly heart-warming that all of you took the time out of your day and contributed your hard-earned money to support the work that we are doing. Your support will allow us to get our production team to Eugene, Oregon to document this historic trial, which is an important component of the feature film we are producing about these amazing youth. Please know that the contributions you have made are going towards supporting a film with a powerful message.

updates.update_userinfo: FINAL 12 HOURS TO GO - LET'S LIGHT IT UP!
updates.update_content:
All of you amazing backers helped us yesterday to meet our minimum goal of $30,000. THANK YOU SO MUCH for being a part of this important and historic movement.
We have 12 MORE HOURS to LIGHT UP THIS PROJECT and elevate the voices of these youth, who are fighting for their constitutional rights to life, liberty, and property, which is in jeopardy through our government's actions in contributing to and perpetuating climate change.

updates.update_userinfo: We did it!! Let's take it to the next level and LIGHT UP this story!
updates.update_content:
Dear YOUTH v GOV supporters,
THANK YOU SO MUCH for being a part of this amazing moment. We did it!! Each and every one of you are helping us to make this documentary possible. We couldn't have done this without you!
In these last TWO DAYS, if you believe that this film has the potential to create change and that these youth voices deserve to be heart, please help us tip this project over the edge! We need to reach more backers so that we can and amplify these youth stories. Every dollar over our $30,000 goal will go towards the production expenses to make this film a success. We not only have 12 weeks of trial, but a long road of post-production and editing ahead of us.

updates.update_userinfo: Getting down to the FINAL 48 HOURS!
updates.update_content:
Hello friends and backers! 
Thank you so much for your support of YOUTH v GOV throughout our month-long Kickstarter fundraise. We are raising these funds so we can be on the ground for this landmark trial, which starts NEXT MONTH on October 29th in Eugene, Oregon. We are SO CLOSE to raising our initial goal of $30,000, but we still need your help to get over the finish line. 
Watch below to hear from Xiuhtezcatl why THIS IS SO IMPORTANT...

updates.update_userinfo: Final 5 days to contribute! Ask a friend to match your contribution!
updates.update_content:
One of the biggest reasons behind our dedication to making the YOUTH v GOV feature documentary is our deep-held belief that climate rights are human rights. While the climate crisis is causing heart-breaking environmental devastation, it's also displacing millions of people and causing draught and war around the globe - and most of those directly affected are disenfranchised. They did not cause this crisis, nor do they have the power to mitigate it. 
It's OUR responsibility to create solutions.

project_data.project_name: YOUTH v GOV FILM

campaign.story:
Set aside the dice bags and wizard hats, my dorks—we're going to SPACE! A new novel from Matt Vancil, author of Hopjockey and creator of The Gamers and JourneyQuest.  
In a distinctly Trekkian universe, mankind has finally reached the stars! But we never shed capitalism along the way, and that lerd’s only gotten worse. 
This future is no utopia. Forget diplomacy—humanity’s presence in space is focused solely on seizing exoplants and extracting their resources. The ships of the Coalition are interstellar company towns, run by indifferent AIs and designed to keep their crews in constant debt. Inequality is rampant—if you’re wearing a red crew shirt, life sucks: you’re overworked in hazardous conditions while under constant surveillance and living on top of one another. And you have to pay for your own health care. And the whole time, the smirking officers are telling you the only reason you’re not enjoying the good life is because you’ve chosen to stay poor. So, nothing at all like the world today.
After surviving fifteen years in a red shirt, Webb is nearly burned out. She joined up like any starry-eyed kid did: to get her own ship. But that’s never going to happen—not now that the officers loathe her for being the crew’s elected (and powerless) representative, even as she’s trying to break out of the enlisted ranks herself. But rank has little to do with leadership, and hers will be put to the test when the starship Independence collides saucer-first with with a threat they’re completely unprepared for: aliens that don’t look like us.* When the ship’s social order breaks down from a truly alien threat, it’s falls to Webb to save the crew, the ship—and herself.
*You can have sex with most aliens. A lot of recruits (and backers) sign up for that. 
 Read a preview chapter from The Fatal Frontier: 
 download - ePub 
 download - MOBI 
 download - PDF 
 read online 
Matt Vancil, a writer, filmmaker, and narrative designer from Tacoma. I wrote and directed the Gamers movies and created the web series JourneyQuest with Zombie Orpheus Entertainment and Dead Gentlemen Productions. I wrote video games for mobile giant King, and my work has been featured on Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime. I’ve written three other books and I currently teach filmmaking at DigiPen, aka “Nintendo University.” I may have totally lifted this from my bio. 
The novel isn’t written yet, and I’d like to change that. The rest of it is mapped out and ready to go—I just need the funds to finish and publish it.
This is where I could use your help. I’m sure you’re familiar with crowdfunding by now, so I’ll just stick to the highlights. 
You can pledge for a copy of the novel as a print, electronic, or audio book. Or all three. 
You can also—and this is pretty cool—have a canon effect on the narrative. Every backer will have the name they give me listed by rank in the crew manifest at the back of the book. Those of you receiving death certificates get to specify how you died in the line of duty. And some of you will get to name red shirts and officers who will die horribly (or have their horrible deaths referenced) in the novel. 
Uh… spoilers, I guess.
 The artwork we commissioned for the pins is in! These could be yours!
Red Shirt motto: "Another Shall Rise"
Officer motto: "To the Stars, Our Birthright"
$15,000 – Brian S. Lewis records audio book
If we hit this goal, everyone's favorite undead clerical power gamer will record the audio book for The Fatal Frontier. Don't we all need more Mr. Lewis in our ears?
If the campaign is successful, our target month for delivery will be December 2019. If you’ve backed one of my campaigns before, you may have noticed a little… unintentional flexibility with the delivery dates. That’s why this one’s projected so far out.
Shipping will be handled after the campaign through BackerKit, where you can pick up additional copies and other works. Estimated shipping costs are: 
$3.99 – United States
$6.99 – Canada
$12.99 – Everywhere else
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any creative project, unforeseen circumstances can arise. The main challenge with this novel will be hitting the projected release date. I will keep backers updated if and when the delivery timeline changes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We have proof(s)!
Behold! The proofs for The Fatal Frontier have successfully rematerialized after their journey through space. The editing team and I are giving them a final once over for glitches before we put the order in. Don't worry, yours won't have that obtrusive stripe across the middle. Unless you want one, in which case... email me, I guess? Actually, no, don't do that.

Everyone out of cryostasis? Okay, good. Got a big update for you tod— oh, some of you are still a bit frosted. Eesh. You should go get a coffee or a blanket or something. I'll wait.
Okay! Nice and toasty? No? Well, keep sipping. Maybe do some jumping jacks. Here we go!
Editing is complete

Well, it's taken longer than I'd hoped, and longer than I think anyone expected, but I have finally completed a working draft of the manuscript. We have reached the summit, and all that's left is to tumble bone-crunchingly down the rocky slopes.
There's still work ahead, of course. I'll be bouncing off of rewrites and careening through the valley of editing as we pick up momentum ahead of the cliffs of fulfillment. Not really sure where this mountainfail imagery came from, but I'm sticking with it.

Greetings, loyal crew! 
It's been a while since I've tossed an update your way, so here's what's been happening with the goings of the on.
The long and short of it: progress continues, albeit at a less than optimal pace. While we are blessedly free from the health crisis that ground the project to a halt last year, it's had some lingering effects. Namely, when I put this campaign together, I budgeted out a solid block of time where I could work exclusively on the novel. Unfortunately, that time got reallocated to the aforementioned health crisis last. So instead of having one big stretch of time where this would have been the only project I was working on, I've had to attack it it in bits and pieces as I'm able to free up time from other obligations. The end result: progress has been slower than anticipated.

Hi! Hello! Just ducking my head out of the cockpit to give you a quick status update.
That status is: good. Five chapters have been written, which represent about a third to a quarter of the total book depending on how messy the climax gets. I could have phrased that better. Momentum is steady, and we remain on course to meet our predicted launch date of December, 2019.
In the coming days, you should receive an email from BackerKit. That's where shipping is being handled and you can pick up add-ons a la carte. We’ll have a more accurate estimation of shipping costs by then—having just completed fulfillment of our previous campaign, we’ve seen some prices go up (mainly international shipping), so we’re working on ways to keep those down. Ish. Some zones are just costlier to ship to. Dang Australia being all the way over there…

Just a quick update today to let you know where the project stands. The writing is well underway. In fact, on that front we are slightly ahead of schedule. On the subject of fulfillment, BackerKit surveys will be sent out once the initial draft is complete, as that’s when we’ll have a more concrete sense of when the project will be done.
If you were one of our higher-level backers, please keep an eye out for some incoming emails. If you have a doomed red shirt to name or a senior officer to design, I’ll be contacting you privately. Ditto for the folks on the Captain’s Council.

project_data.project_name: The Fatal Frontier

campaign.story:
Cayrels Ring is a science fiction comic influenced by Seventies Euro comics and artists such as Moebius among others. Each issue features short stories telling tales of inhabitants of the ringed galaxy known as Cayrels Ring.
You can find information on the first two issues below.
Cayrels Ring #1
Cayrels Ring #2
Cayrels Ring continues to grow with this, the third issue in the series. I have amassed another tremendous team of collaborators and this issue will be the last in this format, which is a collection of short stories.
The seeds planted in this final 48 page issue will lay the ground work for what's next, a full blown, epic story arc set in this galaxy you have helped create.
NOTE: Please contact me if you wish to combine rewards. We can make them add-ons.
As with the first two issues of Cayrels Ring, this issue will be made up of 6 short, 8 page stories. Each story will be illustrated by a different artist collaborator.
Story 1. A young colony on a distant planet, on the edge of the explored space. It’s the first colony established since KLARA was retired almost 40 years ago but It’s not an officially sanctioned colony. As the colony grows and becomes more comfortable, they send out a team to explore their new home world. What they find is more than unexpected. This story is illustrated by John Le and 5 pages of preview art can be seen below.
Story 2 - The story of Nella, the young mother from Issue 1. This is what happened to her between being rescued from Edoran and her being found living on the outskirts of P’Baali with her baby.
Story 3 - Sori Val is a Tromi Veri woman seeking revenge for the death of her husband and child who died due to faulty life support equipment in their settlement. Sori spends the next two years in mourning before experiencing a revengeful awakening. She tracks down the manufacturer of the equipment and then goes after the CEO of the company whom she now holds responsible for their death. Her "death trip" takes to her Kui-Xing to confront none other than Garrett, the man Jamitch would kill for his own personal revenge in issue 1.
Story 4 - A woman who works on a merchant vessel falls in love with a colonial settler. Their love is forbidden and must be kept secret. As we learned from issue 2, deserting your colony will result in death and maybe a run in with Varlo Das. They hatch and enact a plan to smuggle the man off world with the goal of making a home for themselves on the outpost world of Edoran. Will the couple succeed or simply become another paycheque for Varlo Das?
Story 5 - Archaeologists travel to the barrens of Kui-Xing. They are looking for the remnants of the original generation ships that brought humans from earth. It's been centuries since they arrived on Kui-Xing and records of the ships landing landing locations are non-existent. What they find will rewrite human history in Cayrels Ring. 
Story 6 -  Manda Pery lost her baby during childbirth under mysterious circumstances. Pery and her husband were not allowed to see their deceased child, he was simply gone. More than a decade later she meets another woman with an eerily similar story. This leads her on the hunt for other women who experienced the same loss. What comes next will set up Cayrels Ring's next big story arch.
Here is a peek at Story 1 from the upcoming third issue of Cayrels Ring. Art, including colours are by John Le.
Due to a hectic schedule, we were unable to get Cassie Kelly to continue working on colours for Cayrels Ring. In this issue, each artist will colour there own work.
Shannon Lentz
I wrote and created CAYRELS RING which was brought to life thanks to an amazing team of collaborators. I also wrote and illustrated another self published series called Horror of the Khor. The forth and final issue of HotK was successfully funded on Kickstarter earlier this year.. I also wrote a backup story which appeared in Prophet Earth Wars #2, published by Image Comics.
Dustin Weaver
Dustin Weaver began his career in comics as an intern at WildStorm Studios in 2003, where he was held to an unreasonable standard by his idol. Since then, he's illustrated the NY Times bestselling novel The Tenth Circle, had a fruitful relationship with Dark Horse Comics where he made significant contributions to the Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic series, and worked for several years exclusively at Marvel where, most notably, he co-created the acclaimed series S.H.I.E.L.D: Architects of Forever with writer Jonathan Hickman.
In recent years, Dustin has moved into the writing side of comics. He helped define IDW's approach to Rocksteady and Bebop in their Ninja Turtles.
Check out his fantastic series Paklis, published by Image Comics.
John Le
John Le has only been at the illustrating game for something like 6 years but his work is awesome. A perfect fit in the Cayrels Ring galaxy. He has previously had work published in Ken Garing's Planetoid Praxis mini series, published by Image. It's John's pages for which I'm lucky to share on this Kickstarter.
 François Vigneault
François Vigneault a cartoonist, illustrator, and graphic designer (not necessarily in that order) living in Montréal, Québec. His graphic novel TITAN was published in 2017 by Éditions Pow Pow and has garnered multiple award nominations including "Best Cartoonist" from the Joe Schuster Awards. He is currently d rawing 13e Avenue, a YA series written by Geneviève Pettersen and published by Éditions de la Pastèque.
Simon Roy
Simon's has been making comics since 2009 - books like Prophet, Jan's Atomic Heart, The Field, Tiger Lung, and Habitat (as well as smaller stuff here and there - Star Trek, 2000AD, etc). Simon contributed to the first issue of Cayrels Ring and I'm super happy to work with him again.
Simon's also running a killer Patreon. Give it a visit!
 Alchemichael
Alchemichael has been making a name for himself through his fantastic art posted online as well as his work on HEART OF WEIRDNESS. You've seen his work featured in Image comics ISLAND Magazine and the previous two issues of Cayrels Ring. In fact, he did all the art in issue 2.
Pablo Clark
Pablo Clark is a storyboard and comic book artist based in Scotland. His work has been featured Netflix shows, video games, award winning cinema ads and animated shorts. His comic book work has been published by BOOM! and Dark Horse.
SCREEN TIME ($6)  
You'll get a digital copy of issue 3. 48 pages of fantastic over-sized colour.  
TRIPLE SCREEN TIME ($15)
You missed the boat but it's not too late. Jump on board with digital copies of Cayrels Ring #1, 2 and 3. That's 112 pages of Indie Sci-Fi greatness! 
CAYRELS RING #3 ($20 + shipping)  
Get yourself a 48 page, full colour, Golden Aged Sized ( 7.5 x 10.375") edition of Cayrels Ring #3. Comes with a PDF copy too.
CAYRELS RING BUNDLE ($35 + shipping)  
Catch up with whats happening in Cayrels Ring with all three issues. That's a total of 112 pages, Golden Aged Sized ( 7.5 x 10.375"), fully coloured. You missed it once, don't miss it again! Comes with PDF copies of all three issues too.
STOKOE PRINT + CAYRELS RING #3 ($30 + shipping).
A limited edition 8.5 x 11 inch print of James Stoke's cover for Cayrels Ring #1 plus the newest issue of Cayrels Ring. Also available as part of a 3 issue bundle.
Poster design may change to make it more awesome but Stokoes art will remain the same.
 Horror of the Khor Bundle + Cayrels Ring #3 ($40 + $10 shipping)
This is your chance to pick up all 4 issues of Horror of the Khor, the sci-fi epic I wrote and illustrated, along with the newest issue of Cayrels Ring. Print runs for HotK were between 50-150 copies of each issue. Each issue is between 24-28 pages long and full colour.
Horror of the Khor issues 1-4
Sample page from Horror of the Khor #4
John Le's cover to Issue 3 ($300)
This is your chance to own the original art of John's upcoming cover for Cayrels Ring 3 plus the newest issue of Cayrels Ring.
Original Art from the collaborators
We will be offering reward levels that feature pages of original art from Cayrels Ring as well as fantastic character sketches.
Character sketch by Alchemichael
 If we hit $13,000 CDN, I will include a Lonely Planet style guidebook to Cayrels Ring. It will be 8 pages and measure around 5" x 7". This fun little book will feature articles and pictures of the different worlds and alien species that inhabit the ring galaxy.
A guide to Cayrels Ring. Not final design.
 Cost Breakdown
Where is your money going? One thing many people don't realize is that the money you pledge for shipping goes towards our goal. That means we need to include the estimated shipping into the goal. Otherwise that would be coming out of my pocket.  
As you know, the book will be 48 pages of full coloured art. As the writer and producer of this book, I'll likely not see much if any money from this project. It's been that way for all previous Kickstarters. The goal of these campaigns is to make sure all the incredibly talented artists involved, get a decent page rate.
Allocation of funds for Cayrels Ring #3
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my fifth Kickstarter and all previous Kickstarters have been successfully delivered and were of high quality.

That being said, delays can happen, especially when it comes to printing. I will be communicating with all backers very frequently and will be transparent with the process.

Know this, you will get your copy of Cayrels Ring #3!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Final hours and we need you all back
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone,
We are only a few hours away from the end of the relaunched campaign. We are a few hundred dollars away from our goal.
If you backed this original campaign, we could use your help. I've added value to your pledge by giving everyone a copy of the Lonely Planet style guide to the Cayrels Ring galaxy. This will be a mini comic that details all the known planets, cities and alien species that inhabit the ring galaxy.

Hey all,
Lets keep this simple. Cayrels Ring #3 Redux has launched.  
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1616453141/cayrels-ring-3-redux-the-final-48pg-issue

Hey Everyone,
Wanted to give you all a heads up. The next campaign goes live at 2:30 pm PST. Only 6 days. I hope to have your support once again.
Make sure you back earlier if you wanted to get your hands on one of the limited rewards.
Best Regards,

Hey Everyone,
We are entering the final minutes of the campaign and it's obvious that we will not reach our goal. We are still $3615 short of our $12K goal but overall have raised $8385 and that's pretty awesome! 
I want to thank everyone for the support they gave, from backing the book to spreading the word however they could. It all goes a long way. The simple fact is that seeking funding on Kickstarter is a niche market. It's compiled of people that are passionate about what they love, and just like people like me, trying to create something special.

Hey Everyone,
We are down to the last 71 hours and our final Artist in Depth is Simon Roy.
I met Simon shortly after the relaunch of Prophet. He struck me as such a young, talented and hairy man. 
Simon's got a very unique style and is brings science and anthropology into his work, which I love. A well read dude with an appreciation for Soviet aesthetics and a fantastically creative person. His is definitely worth subscribing to.  I'm very happy to be collaborating with him again.

updates.update_userinfo: Cayrels Ring at Vancouver Comicon - Sept 9...tomorrow!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone,
I'm gonna be a guest at the Vancouver Comicon tomorrow, Sept 9th. I'll be sharing air with some friends and fantastic creators including Brandon Graham, James Stoke, Marley Zarcone and Alejandra Gutierrez.
If you're in Vancouver, come by and say hi. I'd love to chat about Cayrels Ring, Star Wars or the new Interpol album.

Good evening Ringettes,
Anyone who's already familiar with Cayrels Ring is well aware of Alchemichael and his stellar artwork. This man makes everything look so effortless. Something that stands out for me with Alchemichael's work is what he chooses to not include.
I'm super fortunate to have been able to have so many collaborations with the guy and I'm looking forward to many more along with all the solo work he's got planned.

Greetings Ringers,
It's back to school week, at least here in Canada, and we are siting at 51%. I know, not much movement but I remain optimistic. It's always the first and last week that see the most activity. Maybe a two week campaign would be just as effective (and less stressful)?
The next Artist in Depth focuses on François Vigneault. Today he posted a sketch of Sori Val, a Q'soni woman who will be the focus of his chapter.

Hey Ring Heads,
I'm back in the city, just not my own. In Victoria, the provincial capital for one night before moving on to another island. This means I have reliable internet again. We've cracked the 50% mark which is awesome but it also means we're still only half way there. I am optimistic though and think we can make it.
I'm gonna take this moment of internetedness (WTF?) to share another Artist in Depth, this time around it's Dustin Weaver.

campaign.story:
What would you do if a time machine hurled you thousands of years into the past… and then broke? Could you survive? Maybe. But could you, acting alone and stranded at any point period in Earth's history, reinvent our modern world from scratch? Probably not.
Not unless you took this book and bandana back in time with you, that is.
Look how pretty!
Over the course of the past few years, I've collected all the science, engineering, mathematics, art, music, philosophy, facts, and figures you'd need for even the most clueless time traveler to build a civilization from the ground up, and I've put it all into this book / extremely fashionable accessory. Your new world will be one in which humanity matured quickly and efficiently, instead of doing what we did (which, to be specific, was spending 200,000 years stumbling around without language, thinking disease was caused by weird smells, and living completely oblivious to the fact that tying a rock to a string would unlock navigating the entire world). It's a deeply researched guide and ridiculously funny history of the key technologies and innovations that made each stage of human civilization possible (from writing and farming to buttons and birth control), and it will make you smarter, more competent, and completely prepared to thrive – at any point in history.
And if you don't have room for a whole book in your temporal carry-on, you can still carry the highlights with your new attractively-designed and information-dense time travel bandana - enough to create a technological civilization from first principles. It's chock full of civilization-building information that's great to keep around in your back pocket...or wrapped around the top of your head. 
And if you want some beautiful art to show off the time periods you'll visit... keep reading for the postcard stretch goal. :)
Tell me about this book.
Happy to! It measures 6x9, and it's a really attractive hardcover, and inside are 464 pages of text and pictures, illustrated by the amazing Lucy Bellwood. The premise of the book is just like in the video above: in the future time travel is being practiced routinely, and this is a guide meant for the passengers in those time machines - in this case the FC3000™ - to consult should anything go wrong. It's a time machine repair guide, but then it turns out time machines are the most complicated machines humans have ever made, and there's no user serviceable parts inside, and it's actually easier to explain how to rebuild civilization from scratch in any period of Earth's history! So that's what this book does, promising that instead of going back to the future... you can now bring the future back to you.
Here's the table of contents, showing off the sort of things you can find in this book!
This is a non-fiction work of popular science wrapped in a delightful fictional candy coating.
All the information in the book is real, and despite the fact that time travel isn't real (YET?? SO FAR AS WE KNOW??), it is a sincere, honest, funny, and deeply-researched attempt to prepare you for the eventuality of being stranded in the past.
The time-travel conceit keeps things light, and lets me work in lots of jokes so that the book isn't a dry list of facts and figures: instead it's as exciting - and funny - as a really good time travel novel. Imagine if the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy was real, but focused entirely on time travel - it might look something like this. The book begins with a flowchart that lets you determine what period in history you're stranded in, all the way back to the Big Bang. In the middle, the book does things like explain how to forge iron while also reinventing art and philosophy. By the end, you are actually for-real prepared to rebuild civilization, all on your own.
Here's what some people are saying about advance copies I gave them!
"A dazzling piece of work that's also genuinely hilarious." - Elan Mastai: All Our Wrong Todays
"Such a cool book. It's essential reading for anyone who needs to duplicate an industrial civilization quickly" - Randall Munroe: xkcd, What If?
"Technically, we are all time travelers and we are all trapped. So, even if you happen to be scanning this blurb in what you perceive to be a 'normal' timeline, I heartily recommend you read this book cover to cover." - Zach Weinersmith: Saturday Morning Breakfast Cereal, Soonish
"A witty pop science guide intended for those demanding times when one needs to create a civilization from scratch... a fun, thoughtful, and thoroughly accessible reference for curious readers, students, and world-builders, as well as wayward time travelers." - Publisher's Weekly (starred review!)
"Packed with cool, fun, and useful stuff... a friendly and thought-provoking reference, just the thing for the bright kid in the family, to say nothing of the neighborhood time traveler." - Kirkus Reviews
Okay, now tell me about this bandana!
The book is inspired by a shirt I designed back in 2012 - after finishing the shirt, I still hadn't scratched that itch, and began to wonder if you really could condense all of civilization down to 450 or so pages. So I started researching. And once I'd written the book, I thought, wouldn't it be nice to take this full circle and bring this back to textiles with a Temporal Survival Bandana? The bandana itself is 22 inches square has more information than the shirt did - including instructions on how to use the bandana itself to invent other technologies like the water filter, the bandage, and the sexy adult handcuff! And if you do ever find yourself stranded in the past, it will be the single most valuable - and most dangerous - piece of fabric in human history.
You can get one exclusively with this Kickstarter!
That shape in the middle is the template for building a unit cube - whose weight, when filled with water, will be the basis of the measurements you need to build the other technologies explained on the bandana, up to and including telescopes, microscopes, smelters, electrical generators, and penicillin. At the top there's instructions for testing if unknown foods are safe to eat - a useful thing to know if you're stranded before the invention of domestication. Those pictures you see in the at the bottom are ways to transform the rotational motion of a water wheel into more useful motions, like the up-down motion of a hammer or the back-and-forth motion of a saw. Seems pretty straightforward, but it still took humans thousands of years to figure this stuff out!!
Or rather, it DID take us that long, until you and your brilliant bandana showed up in the past.
Why are the bandana and book together?
Well, here's the thing. This book is already being printed, and it'll be available in bookstores on September 18th... but these days most book orders happen online. That's great, but it would be MORE great if you could support independent booksellers! That's where this Kickstarter comes in: all the books ordered through this Kickstarter will be funneled through indie bookstores.
By buying the book through this Kickstarter, you not only get the exact same book you'd get from a giant online bookstore, but you also get it signed by the author (that's me!), PLUS you get the time traveler's bandana, PLUS the stretch goals we unlock (see below) - all for the same price you'd pay at retail. It'll be shipped direct to your door on the release day, and you'll get to feel good about supporting cool indie bookstores like:
The Strand in NY
BookPeople in Texas
Watermark Books & Cafe in Kansas
Tattered Cover Book Store in Denver
Joseph-Beth Booksellers in Ohio
Vroman's Bookstore in California
The Beguiling in Toronto, Canada
It's thanks to these amazing booksellers that we can offer the book at a price low enough to give you all these exclusive goodies on top!
Can we use stretch goals to make this Kickstarter even more awesome?
Well heck, why not! Here's what I've got planned: every threshold we unlock will result in a new update, in which I (RYAN) will get stranded, Carmen Sandiego / Where's Waldo style, in a different period in time. While I'm there I'll source a postcard showing off that time, and everyone who backs will get one of each. These are actual postcards, suitable to send in the mail to your pals and say "wish you were here", only instead of promoting boring old places in the present, they're encouraging temporal tourism at various highlights in Earth's past. They'll be drawn by a variety of super awesome artists!  We'll unlock more soon as we fund!
$10,000 = UNLOCKED: 1492 CE, with art by Alex Thomas!
$20,000 = UNLOCKED: 1912 CE, with art by Bill Mudron!
$30,000 = UNLOCKED: 2041 CE, with art by Anthony Clark!
 $40,000 = UNLOCKED: 650 BCE, with art by Shelli Paroline and Braden Lamb!
$50,000 = UNLOCKED: 65,000 BCE, with art by John Allison!
$60,000 = UNLOCKED: a postcard by David Malki!
$70,000 AND $80,000 = UNLOCKED: a Chrononaut's Choice time travel pamphlet giving you a curated adventure in time, going to everyone at the book tier or above!
$90,000 = UNLOCKED: a postcard by Rahzzah!
$100,000 = UNLOCKED: an excerpt from the book!
$150,000 = UNLOCKED: a postcard by David Hellman!
$200,000 = one last postcard from Ben Hatke!! That's NINE POSTCARDS in total going to everyone who's getting anything physical!
The back of each postcard has an exclusive temporal survival tip tailored to each specific time period. They're going to be AWESOME.
So now with you're not just getting the signed book and bandana: you're also getting temporal tourism postcards, and as the Kickstarter continues, more and more cards will get added to that pack.
What tiers do we have?
We've kept it pretty simple: there's a tier to get the postcards ($10), a tier to get the postcards and bandana ($20), and a really attractive tier that gets you the postcards, the bandana, and a SIGNED copy of the book all for $27 - the same price an unsigned book alone costs in a store! After that there's some tiers for those who want more than one book (you can get two or three), and finally a single-edition $1000 tier in which I hand-build you a time travel survival kit - which includes the book, bandana, and postcards too, of course.
Each tier has a US and Canadian edition - besides the countries they're shipping to, they're otherwise identical.  That's right, Canadians: by teaming up with The Beguiling, we've managed to keep shipping costs identical!  Plus, the books will ship out of Toronto, so you don't need to worry about any customs costs at the border.  THIS WAS A LOT OF WORK BUT IT'S GOING TO BE AWESOME. <3
NOTE: the last time I did a Kickstarter with signed books was for To Be or Not To Be, and there I ended up signing 15,000 books in five days, during which I accidentally broke the world record for most books signed in a single day in the process. I have only gotten better at signing my own name since then.
This sounds great, but who are you and what else have you done?
Hi, I'm Ryan North! You may know me as the author of Dinosaur Comics, or The Unbeatable Squirrel Girl for Marvel Comics, or from my illustrated choosable-path adventure books like William Shakespeare Punches A Friggin' Shark and/or To Be or Not To Be - both of which were launched here on Kickstarter (and To Be or Not To Be became the most-funded publishing project ever on Kickstarter at the time!) I've also done writing for Bungie and once got stuck in a hole with my dog. You can read more about me here to assure yourself that I'm not one of those fly-by-night science writers!
I want to ship outside the US and Canada - can I back this Kickstarter?
Unfortunately we can't ship these books everywhere - the numbers simply don't work out (and also there's weird legal issues, since book rights are different in different countries). If you're outside the US and Canada, you may want to wait until the book comes out for real in your region - translated versions will shortly be available in:
Russia
Poland
China
Korea
...and MORE??
And if you're in the UK - great news: the book is already available for pre-order there! 
Thank you! <3
I'm really excited to soon be able to share this book with you - it's the longest book project I've ever worked on! - and I really think it's the best, too. Hopefully what I've said in this Kickstarter intrigues you! Drop me a line if you've got any questions, and if you choose to back this campaign, thank you! I really think you'll have a good... time.
(sorry about the pun, no regrets)
(Oh also! Thanks to my friend Jennifer Ward for her voiceover work, Jason Shaw for the music used in the video (Thingamajig), AR Sound Effects for the time machine SFX, and Freqman for the "time machine just broke" SFX. All music and SFX are used under a CC-BY license!)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book itself is done and already being printed (yay, publishing!). The bandana design is ready to go, and we've got a printer who can turn an order around in 15 days, which gives us plenty of time to get them - and the books - shipped to Make That Thing, who I've partnered with to help fulfill this project. I'll visit their warehouse to sign all the books for you, we'll put them in envelopes, and then we'll ship them off your homes. 

All books are being shipped to a single warehouse, which will make things simpler. I've run two successfully completed Kickstarters in the past, and I feel really confident about this one, since unlike the others, the book is already being printed! That's how come we can ship so quickly after the campaign closes.

The main risk is unexpected shipping delays causing the book to arrive in some places after its release date on the 18th of September, but we're going to do all in our power to prevent that: we want you to read this book as soon as possible!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Warped Factor Four!
You Can't Have Your Fate and Edith, Too!
Without question, my favorite episode of the original series is "The City on the Edge of Forever." An episode that often makes the top of the list of people's favorite episodes and it's generally regarded as a great episode.
What better episode to lampoon?
A few of you might remember "Stalled Trek: Amutt Time," my first Animated Puppet Parody that I made in 2012 and are thinking, why is it taking you six and a half years to make another one? Well, remember the first one took 16 years to make.
It ain't called "Stalled Trek" for nothing!
"Stalled Trek: The City on the Edge of Forever" was a parody I first started in comic-book form in 2001, shortly after finishing a comic book version of "Amutt Time," but it was left by the wayside.
Last year, I pulled out the script and started re-writing it and was going to make it as a series of webcomics, but after a trip to the Star Trek Set Tour in Ticonderoga, NY, I really wanted to rebuild the bridge set and update the characters.
After a long side tour, I started modeling last month. 
New Character Puppet Models
The film should be around 15 minutes long. I find that parodies work better in the short format. 
I'm hoping to have it finished before the end of the year, but I'm giving myself some breathing space and setting the deadline for having everything finished (including bonus material!) and shipped by the beginning of April ...just in time for the anniversary of the original episode's airdate (April 6, 1967.)
Rewards
I'm limiting the number of blu-rays to 250. 
That might not seem like very many, but I'm still tripping over boxes of "Amutt Time" DVDs. If they do run out, you can still get the digital copy. It just won't come with the bonus material.
Recreation of some of the RKO 40-Acres Backlot used in Trek, The Andy Griffith Show and many others.
Making these cartoons has been a great fulfillment of my life's ambition. I can't thank you enough for helping me to make them real!
Live Long and Prosper!

campaign.story:
What is the Tachyon?
The Tachyon is a lightning-fast open-source Arduino Zero compatible, featuring a 32-bit ARM M4F processor running at 120MHz, and boasting 128K of RAM!
The Tachyon!
Compatibility
The Tachyon's pinout is nearly identical to both the Neutrino and Arduino Zero, making it a drop-in replacement for virtually any project using either one.
This is made possible because the SAMD51 is a close relative of the SAMD21. So close in fact, that to create the Tachyon I needed to make only a few minor tweaks to the Neutrino's layout to get the new chip to work with it!
Specifically, the values of two capacitors were changed, and one pin, which the Zero broke out for an RX LED, but which was not broken out on the Neutrino, was re-purposed for the chip's internal switching regulator.
And, to enable you to make use of this switching regulator for low-power applications, I've added pads to the underside of the board where you can optionally mount the required 10uH inductor.
Finally, because the SAMD51 is so similar to the SAMD21, most libraries written for the Zero should work on the Tachyon without modification!
The Tachyon - Front
Open Hardware
Like all my Kickstarter projects, the Tachyon is open source! And like my other Kickstarter campaigns, once the campaign is successfully funded, I'll provide you with the Eagle cad files and schematics which you're free to modify as you wish and integrate it into your own designs, without ever paying royalties or licensing fees!
Tachyon PCB
Technical Specs
Microcontroller: Microchip ATSAMD51G18A ARM Cortex M4F
Clock speed: 120 MHz
Operating voltage: 3.3V
I/O pin limits: 3.3V, 7 mA
Digital I/O pins: 14 w/ 12 PWM
Analog input pins: 6 12-bit ADC channels
Analog output pins: 2 10-bit DACs
Flash memory: 256 KB
SRAM: 128 KB
Voltage regulator: 3.7-5.5V input / 3.3V, 300mA output
Dimensions: 1.4 x 0.7" (36mm x 18mm)   
[Pinout coming soon!]
Programming
Programming is easy! Like most Arduinos, you simply plug the board into your PC using a micro USB cable, select the board you want to program, and hit the upload button in the IDE when you're ready. The Tachyon ships with the Zero bootloader installed, and most of the time it will auto-reset when the USB serial port is opened by the IDE, but in the event that this fails, you can always hit the reset button on the board to force it to enter bootloader mode after your program finishes compiling.
Programming is easy with the Arduino IDE!
The Atmel ICE can be used to update the fuses and bootloader, but is NOT required for programming the board normally!
Other Features
Status LED
The Tachyon features a red status LED you can control in your program. This LED is connected to the same pin the Zero uses for its TX LED.
Power LED
The Tachyon also features a green LED to indicate when it is receiving power. Both power and status LEDs are located to either side of the reset switch.
10-bit DACs
Say goodbye to the Tone() command forever! Turn your Tachyon into a virtuoso by connecting an amplifier to pins A0 and A4 and using the Audio library to play .WAV files in stereo with the built-in DACs!
Reset Switch
The Tachyon also features a reset switch. Normally you won't need it, but if your sketch ever locks up and you can't seem to upload a new one to the board, you can press that magic button twice to force the bootloader to stay on!
Inductor Pads
On the back of the Tachyon are pads for an optional 1210 10uH inductor. This inductor is necessary should you desire to use the internal switching regulator of the Tachyon for low-power applications. Advanced users only!
The Tachyon - Back
