campaign.story:
What is Digital Design?
Digital design refers to creating digital circuits. Digital circuits are in basically everything today and range from something as simple as a circuit that turns an LED on when a button is pressed to the complex processor in the device you are reading this on. Traditionally, these circuits are built by making ASICs (Application Specific Integrated Circuits) out of silicon wafers. This process is incredibly expensive and complex.
FPGAs, or Field Programmable Gate Arrays, are a way to create digital circuits without these barriers. FPGAs are part of a class of devices known as programmable hardware. This means that you can design a digital circuit and program the FPGA to become that circuit. You can reconfigure the FPGA as many times as you want allowing you to create circuit after circuit without having to physically change a thing!
Background
Back in 2013, the Mojo was launched here on Kickstarter. The goal of this campaign was to bring digital design to hobbyists with a low cost board and plenty of tutorials.
The campaign was a success and in the five years since then I've written many tutorials guiding a beginner from blinking LEDs to creating a basic CPU. Development on the Mojo continued in ways that were outside the scope of the original campaign with the creation of the Mojo IDE and a custom easier to use language, Lucid. There is now even a book that supports all this.
Alchitry is the next step into simplified digital design. These new boards will bring all the goodies of the Mojo, simplicity, tutorials, an IDE, and Lucid. However, they are much more.
About the Boards
This time around, there are two FPGA boards! These are the Alchity Au (gold) and the Alchitry Cu (copper).
Alchitry Au
Artix 7 XC7A35T-1C - 33,280 logic cells (approx. 4x the capacity of the Mojo)
256MB DDR3 RAM
102 IO pins (3.3V logic level, 20 of then can be switched to 1.8V for LVDS)
9 differential analog inputs (1 dedicated, 8 mixed with digital IO)
USB C to configure and power the board
8 general purpose LEDs
1 button (typically used as a reset)
100 MHz on-board clock (can be multiplied internally by the FPGA)
Powered with 5V through USB C port, 0.1" holes, or headers
USB to serial interface for data transfer (up to 12Mbaud)
Dimensions of 65mm x 45mm
The Alchitry Au is the workhorse of the two boards. It features an Artix 7 FPGA which means no more dealing with Xilinx's antiquated ISE tool. This board also has 256MB of DDR3 RAM while still having 102 IO pins available for your projects!
Alchitry Cu
iCE40-HX8K FPGA - 7680 logic elements (approx. 0.8x the capacity of the Mojo)
79 IO pins (3.3V logic level)
USB C to configure and power the board
8 general purpose LEDs
1 button (typically used as a reset)
100 MHz on-board clock (can be multiplied internally by the FPGA)
Powered with 5V through USB C port, 0.1" holes, or headers
USB to serial interface for data transfer (up to 12Mbaud)
Dimensions of 65mm x 45mm
The Cu board is the lighter version of the two but offers something completely unique. The Cu uses a Lattice iCE40 HX FPGA that is supported by the open source tool chain Project IceStorm. The Mojo IDE will be transformed into Alchitry Labs to support the new boards. Alchitry Labs will be open source meaning that the Alchitry Cu can be developed for using entirely open source tools!
Alchitry Breakout
The connectors on the Alchitry boards have been changed to surface mount. This allows for much cheaper assembly of elements (expansion boards). The Alchitry Breakout allows you to easily connect whatever you want to your board through 0.1" holes!
Alchitry IO
4 7-segment LED digits
5 momentary push buttons
24 LEDs
24 DIP switches
The Alchitry IO is the perfect way to get your feet wet with digital design. The plethora of buttons and LEDs lend themselves to fantastic beginner tutorials that will walk you through all the basics!
The different elements (expansion boards) simply stack on top of one another! They also have cut outs so that the LEDs and button on the main board are still accessible.
FPGAs vs Microcontrollers
FPGAs and microcontrollers, like the Arduino, are very different devices. With a microcontroller you write software. That software gives you control of the built-in peripherals, like IO pins, serial ports, or analog to digital converters. The biggest limitation of software is that you can only do one thing at a time!
With FPGAs you are not creating software. You are designing the hardware! Instead of writing code to run on a fixed processor with fixed peripherals, you get to design your own circuit. If you really want to you can even create your very own processor and write software to run on it!
A huge benefit of working with FPGAs is that every element of your design runs independently of each other. That means one part of your design can be reading in some serial data, while another part is controlling a servo, while another is reading some sensors, and yet another is controlling a display.
With a microcontroller you can often be limited by the built in peripherals. There is a set number of serial ports, PWM pins, or maybe you can't use some components, like a camera, because you can't interface with them fast enough. With FPGAs every pin has the potential to become whatever you need it to be. Do you need 70 PWM signals to control a lot of servos? Alchitry has you covered. What about a bunch of serial ports or controlling a big LED display? You're covered there too. Since you are designing the hardware, you are deciding what each pin will do!
GPU Example Project
So what's something crazy you can do with an FPGA that a microcontroller could never do? Make your own GPU!
GPU Demo rendering Suzanne, the Blender monkey
This demo is running on the Alchitry Au. The FPGA is driving the display and generating every frame from scratch! The model is stored in a ROM and it consists of nearly 1000 triangles. Each triangle is transformed (rotated in this case), lighting calculated, projected onto the 2D space of the screen, rasterized, and checked against a z-buffer (so triangles in the front block triangles in the back).
This will be one of the first demo projects to be detailed after the campaign is over. It will cover everything from how all the rendering works to more common design elements like a cache for the RAM (the DDR3 on the Alchitry Au acts as a frame buffer).
It will be detailed through written tutorials as well as a video series.
How does this all work?
Digital circuits are not usually designed by drawing out a circuit. You don't sit down and wire up logic gates individually. That would make designing anything but very basic circuits very difficult and tedious. Instead, you use things called HDLs, or Hardware Description Languages, to design the circuits. These languages are almost like writing code, as you are basically just creating text files, except that you are actually describing a digital circuit that will get synthesized into hardware.
You can use whatever method you'd like that is supported by Xilinx's or Lattice's tools to work with the Alchitry boards. This includes Verilog and VHDL, the two industry standard HDLs. You will also be able to use Alchitry Labs to create designs in the much simpler Lucid HDL.
Once you have created a design, it is loaded onto the board over USB from your computer. The FPGA then becomes the circuit you made! The boards have on board memory that stores your design between power cycles.
If you would like to check out some of the existing tutorials for the Mojo click here.
Alchitry Labs
The Mojo IDE is changing into Alchitry Labs. This means that the Alchitry boards have full Lucid support, a built in library of useful components to use in your project, and a debugger!
Alchitry Labs will be open source and support Project IceStorm. This means you can work with the Alchitry Cu using completely open source code! It will also integrate with Vivado and iCEcube2 allowing you to work with the Au and choose between proprietary or open tool chains for the Cu.
Debugger in the Mojo IDE
The debugger in the Mojo IDE is currently pretty limited and a bit of a hassle to setup. This is largely due to how the USB interface was designed. The Alchitry boards are different and allow for a more seamless debugger. You'll be able to simply select the signals in your design you'd like to inspect and the tools will build a version of your project to inspect these!
If you haven't used the Mojo IDE before, here are some of the awesome features you can look forward to!
Real time error checking for Lucid
Auto-complete for Lucid
A large library of components
Example projects
The Future of Alchitry
This isn't a one-off Kickstarter project and development will continue far into the future. The near term effort will be focused on updating the software to support Alchitry. Once there is a solid working base, existing tutorials will be ported to the new platform. New elements (expansion boards) will be created (HDMI, camera, and sensors are on the short list).
I am also planning to augment the written tutorials with video tutorials.
I will also continue to expand the list of tutorials into more advanced subjects likely through example projects. Send me your ideas!
Stretch Goals
To make the campaign a little more exciting, let me introduce some stretch goals! If the campaign makes it to these higher benchmarks the rewards will be unlocked for everyone!
$50K: Every reward will come with stickers!
$75K: Every Au and Cu board will come with standoff screws!
$100K: Every Au and Cu board will come with a USB C to USB A cable!
Compatibility
The tools from Xilinx and Lattice only support Windows and Linux (sorry OSX users). These are required for building your projects. Many people have had success using a virtual machine running Linux on Macs to get around this.
However, the Alchitry Cu can be developed for natively on OSX using the open source tools, Project IceStorm. These tools are pretty new and may not be fully functional.
Alchitry Labs will initially only support Windows and Linux but support for OSX will be added if Project IceStorm turns out to be a fully viable alternative.

updates.update_content:
Today we dropped all the orders off! Your order is on its way to your door!
Thank you all so much for your patience. It has been quite a journey! And while I can finally breath a sigh of relief, this is really just the beginning.
What's Next?

We were planning to start shipping out most of the boards today but a small issue just came to our attention.
Both the Au and Cu use the FTDI chip FT2232H. This chip can have an external EEPROM connected to it to store configuration data. This data is used to customize how the board shows up over USB.
The wrong EEPROM was used during assembly. We accidentally ordered 93C56BT-I/OT, when we really needed 93LC56BT-I/OT. The difference is the L version can operate at 3.3V instead of a minimum of 4.5V. We didn't catch this sooner since most of the boards were working fine.

We are currently assembling the backside of the Cu boards.
The pick and place is humming along. Here's a video of it in action!
Our new pick and place machine is here and we are now able to start production of all the boards once it is setup!

campaign.story:
Lemon Preserved Cornish Hen
When I think of food or talk about food, it brings memories of people I love and miss. When I cook something that my grandmother used to cook when I was a little girl, I kind of bring her back a little. I get a sense of the flavors she loved, the spices she had in her kitchen and somehow pass them on to my children and grandchildren to get a sense of someone long gone. I’ve always loved cooking, I just can't stop thinking about food and what I can cook next. I just find myself always talking about food. Came the time when I decided I was going to write and turn my passion into a cookbook.
Throughout my life I have turned to cooking to find comfort, celebrate life, or simply to enjoy and share really good food. At a very young age I lost my mother and found comfort in cooking side by side with my loving and nurturing grandmother. At the age of 5 I was given a smaller replica of my grandmother’s traditional clay pot and discovered the joy that learning, mimicking, preparing and savoring her recipes gave me.
I immigrated to Montreal as a teenager where I  faced the challenges of adapting to a drastically new culture, by learning new recipes and reinventing myself. I adapted to my new life through my connection with food. 
Spiced Oranges with Orange Blossom Water
I have since lived in many places including Venezuela, Haiti, the United States, Israel, France where I have shared my cooking. I have also cooked on private yachts off the coast of Spain, always perfecting my craft, creating elegant dishes, and memorable events. I was fortunate that my attention to incorporating spices, healthy ingredients and cooking techniques were harnessed by organic food company Cedar Lane to enhance their organic prepared foods line available in supermarkets around the world.
I like to call myself a  cultural creative. I am now based in Montreal, but can usually be found traveling the world, experiencing other cultures, and sharing what I find most interesting. 
At the top of my food passion is my attraction for spices, their benefits and the distinctive flavor they bring to all dishes. I am always proactively seeking ways to evolve my consciousness, through experiences as diverse as attending Woodstock or meditating with Kabbalists in Israel, because that a also contributes to the food you eat. Through my travels across the world, I have created a style of cooking that reflects the savory influences of all the wonderful places I have  lived, the people I have learned from, and my own personal evolution. 
You will find in this book of treasured recipes all the detailed step by step info and tips I have  gathered and that will greatly benefit you when entertaining for a wide variety of occasions that represent many of life’s special moments, ranging from what to cook for a crowd, what to cook with friends, what to prepare for occasions as diverse as an intimate lunch or a formal party. In these recipes, you will also find options that can be suited for a very diverse crowd ranging from vegetarian to vegan to gluten free, non- dairy or kosher.
I hope you will enjoy all these recipes that have been created around my Love of Spices. It is this love that has made me wish to share.
I am so eager to share so here is a little tantalizing glimpse from my book.
Grilled Artichoke Saffron and Lavender Sauce
Recipe
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have cooked all my life but putting together a cookbook was a challenge that I was not prepared for.
For the last two years I have been writing recipes. Indeed I always knew how to cook but in an instinctive way without measures. I had to cook all of my recipes over again for this book taking note of processes and quantities.
Once that was done I had to solicit a photographer. This was a trial and error experience because it is one thing to cook all the recipes you have cooked all your life but another thing to make them photo ready. I also had a vision of what I wanted them to look like. So here I had to solicit the help of a food stylist. I never even knew such a thing existed before!
When the photographer and food stylist would come I had to make sure beforehand that I had enough recipes prepared for the photo shoot.The details I had to think of were insane : from the props, to dishes,to backgrounds to getting together all the ingredients for several recipes at a time. I also learned that timing was of the utmost importance because for the pictures to be appetizing, the food must be half cooked...so I had to readapt even my cooking times, my methods and the way the final product should look like. 
After the cropping of the pictures sometimes disappointed me so I worked with the graphic artist on the layout and design of my book.
If I did not want to share my Love & Spices so much I would have never seen this through!
But now that it is nearing completion I am thrilled that I did it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
All of the money raised in this campaign will be used to finish post-production for Space Command: Redemption - that's stunning visual effects, editing, sound, music, and everything else that goes into the highest quality film production. 
Now that we've surpassed our initial goal of $45,000 to complete Chapter Three, here are the next, big goals ahead that lead us into completing the fourth and final chapter! 
(More Stretch Goals will be added very shortly!)
ARMIN SHIMERMAN (Quark in Deep Space Nine) joins the cast!
...
ETHAN PHILLIPS (Neelix in Voyager) joins the cast!
...
Gigi Edgley (Chiana in Farscape) joins the cast!
...
Doug Tait (featured in Star Trek 2009) has joined the cast!
...
If we hit $100,000, you won't only get Chapter 3, but Chapter 4 as well! That's double the Space Command!
...
Space Command is a bold, retro science fiction series with all the hope and optimism of yesteryear combined with the eye-popping visual effects of today, as well as past and present superstar sci-fi actors.
It is the passion and vision of creator Marc Scott Zicree who has amassed countless writing credits in shows such as Star Trek: The Next Generation and Deep Space Nine, Sliders, Babylon 5, Friday the 13th, The Real Ghostbuster, Smurfs, He-Man, and Superfriends.
Marc Zicree, Doug Jones, Mira Furlan, Robert Ricardo, Bill Mumy, and many others on the set of Space Command
...
PLAY

...
THE ALL-STAR SCI-FI CAST OF THIS EPIC SERIES
 ADDITIONAL CAST MEMBERS
Some of the up-and-coming sci-fi stars of Space Command!
Ethan McDowell, Sara Maraffino, Nathaniel Freeman, Victor Manso
Coley Speaks, Elle Sonnet, Justin Sorvillo, Jelena Mrdja
Dallas Malloy, Bryan McClure, Barbara Lee Bragg, Ryan T. Husk
These are some of the science fiction icons that support Space Command
Marc & Elaine Zicree have written and produced hundreds of hours of series TV, pilots and feature films for most of the major studios and networks, including Paramount, Universal, Disney, Sony/Columbia Tri-Star, MGM, Warners, Castle Rock, New Line, CBS, NBC, ABC, Fox, WB, UPN, Showtime, PBS, Turner, USA Networks, Syfy, Discovery, Nickelodeon, the BBC, Marvel, Scholastic, ITV and NPR. Among their credits are classic episodes of Star Trek – The Next Generation, Sliders, Babylon 5, Deep Space Nine, Friday the 13th – The Series, Smurfs, Superfriends, He-Man, Captain Power and the Soldiers of the Future, The Littles, Forever Knight, Liberty’s Kids and The Real Ghostbusters, among many others.
Marc and Elaine’s work has been nominated for the Hugo Award, American Book Award, Humanitas Prize, Nebula Award and Diane Thomas Award, and has won the prestigious Hamptons Prize, TV Guide Award, Rondo and Saturn Awards. In 2014, Marc was named a Writers Guild Diversity Honoree.
Marc and Elaine Zicree, co-directing on the set of Space Command.
Where are we now?
This is the progress of the Space Command epic series. Each title is two hours, divided into two one-hour episodes or four half-hour "chapters". (See the title posters below.)
SPACE COMMAND: REDEMPTION
Chapter 1 - filmed, postproduction funded, postproduction complete!
Chapter 2 - filmed, postproduction funded, currently in postproduction!
Chapter 3 - filmed, this campaign is to fund postproduction 
Chapter 4 - filmed, this campaign is to fund postproduction
SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS
Chapter 1 - filmed!
Chapter 2-4 - preproduction
SPACE COMMAND: GREAT SOLAR WAR
coming soon...
Poster for Space Command: Redemption
Poster for Space Command: Forgiveness
Poster for Space Command: Great Solar War
We cannot do this without you. You can support us financially, or just by helping us spread the word. Here are additional ways you can help:
Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or any social media 
Emailing the campaign to your friends 
Follow us on social media and keep the positivity going on our pages 
But rest assured, every dollar secured will go to completing Space Command! We've already got the first TWO HOURS shot - that's all of Space Command Redemption! And now we need a bit more to finish all of the incredible visual effects and release it to you, the public!
Goals
Our first goal of $45,000 is to complete postproduction on Chapter Three of Space Command: Redemption. Once that is achieved, we will move on to postproduction of Chapter Four. And after that will be Space Command: Forgiveness!
When we raise enough to complete visual effects and post-production on Redemption, Chapters Three and Four, any and all remaining funds will go to completing the next episodes, Space Command Forgiveness- much of which has already been shot and looks amazing!
A word from creator, Marc Zicree:
"As a kid I loved STAR TREK, TWILIGHT ZONE, OUTER LIMITS, FORBIDDEN PLANET and grew up to write for such great shows as STAR TREK – THE NEXT GENERATION, DEEP SPACE NINE, BABYLON 5, SLIDERS and more.
I often hear fans say, “Why are there so few good sci-fi shows on TV, and why do so many go south?” I can tell you – frankly, most of the network suits just don’t get it.
But you and I do.
So when I recently got the idea of creating a new show inspired by the sense of wonder and possibility science fiction gave me as a kid, I realized I didn’t need a network or studio to make my dream come true -- just Kickstarter and you.
Thanks for making it happen."
Marc Zicree and iconic writer/director, Guillermo del Toro
Bruce Boxleitner, Ethan McDowell, Marc Zicree, and Bill Mumy, on the set of Space Command: Redemption
Doug Jones and Bill Mumy, on the set of Space Command: Redemption
Doug Jones electrifies in a powerful scene
Marc Zicree and editor David Edison on the set of Space Command
Ethan McDowell as Captain Jack Kemmer on the bridge
Bridge viewscreen
Paladin with Space Command logo
Space Command official logo

support.title: MR. SCI-FI SUPER PACKAGE
support.descp:
Everything at the "Ultimate Sci-Fi Package" ($750), PLUS the Mr. Sci-Fi Super-Package!
Marc Zicree will send you ten of his favorite science fiction books in vintage editions, some even signed! PLUS you’ll get a personally conducted all-day SCIENCE FICTION TOUR of Los Angeles conducted by Marc Zicree, in which you’ll see places where Blade Runner and Star Trek were shot, where Ray Bradbury, Ray Harryhausen and Forrest Ackerman hung out, where Rod Serling lived, and much more! Or you can have a long-distance chat with Marc about any science fiction topic of your choice!
(Travel and lodging not provided.)

support.title: SPECIAL VFX MASTER PACKAGE
support.descp:
Everything at the "I Want My Space Command" ($180) reward level, PLUS the Special VFX Master Perk!
You get a drive with all the VFX shots used in Space Command -- along with all VFX shots that were works-in-progress -- AND an in-person or Skype meeting with Marc Zicree and members of the VFX team to ask questions and learn the secrets of how they did it!
We will also include a special "post-production executive" credit on IMDB and in the end credits!
(If you don't have an IMDB page, we'll create one for you!)

support.title: THE EXCLUSIVE WRITER'S PACKAGE

Top it all off with an EXCLUSIVE SESSION with Marc and Maya to answer all your questions about writing!

updates.update_content:
We are pushing forward everyday with more and more visual effects shots completed and we can now say that Redemption Part 2 should be finished and ready to send out by Christmas of this year! That means if you ordered a digital download, a DVD or Bluray, or anything involving Redemption Part 2, we'll be delivering those by Christmas 2021.
If you haven't had a chance to order a DVD or Bluray yet, you're in luck! We recently sent an email with info on new DVD and Bluray perks that are now available in our current campaign. Here's a video about it:

Hello and thank you again to all of you who contributed to the Space Command Kickstarter campaign.
Here is an accounting of all the perks we have delivered for campaign 1
CAMPAIGN 3
TOTAL ELECTRONIC PERKS DELIVERED: 5,536

Thanks for asking!  The first hour is completed and you can watch it on Mr. Sci-Fi.  We're currently working on finishing the VFX and post on the second hour and hope to have that out in the next three months!  But of course, the more money we can raise on Kickstarter, the faster we can go!
All good thoughts your way,
Marc

project_data.project_name: Space Command: Redemption, post-production!

campaign.story:
PocketRule is your reference card that sits always available in your wallet. Whether you are a designer, maker, engineer, or anyone else, having a stencil, ruler, protractor, or design reference information is useful to have on hand, but the full-size versions of these tools are far too inconvenient to carry daily. AG Studios presents a solution with a sleek, lightweight, durable card to keep with you.
Each PocketRule is identical in size to a standard credit card, and is made of fiberglass and copper to provide an elegant surface and appealing feel in your hand. In this small size, PocketRule delivers a broad array of tools and references for drawing and sketching, circuit design, and measurement.
Even the simplest functions of a ruler and protractor are useful to always have on hand for day-to-day tasks. With your help, AG Studios can launch its debut product and provide a tool for thinkers and makers of all kinds.
Design Principles
PocketRule is designed to be versatile and applicable across disciplines. When designing a circuit board, it is valuable to have a visual reference of circuit component sizes and common amplifier designs. When sketching, PocketRule is designed to provide a simple, yet effective, set of tools for producing common forms. As an engineer or designer, a reference of common physics and unit conversions allows you to not rely on memory.
The shape of a PocketRule is an elegant combination of convenience and functionality. Its dimensions are identical to a standard credit card, but only two of the corners are rounded. This design allows easy placement into a wallet while retaining one fully straight edge for a ruler. All references are drawn or cut out of the inside of the card, maintaining this streamlined shape.
Three versions are available, with features selected for each PocketRule's user. The three versions are geared for use in graphic design, engineering, and circuit work; each is versatile enough for day-to-day use.
Features
Electrical is the PocketRule packed with reference information for the circuit designer. When designing a circuit board, it is valuable to have a physical size guide on hand to refer to in your work. The electrical PocketRule features a ruler, an AWG measurement tool, common amplifiers, and size guides for a variety of circuit board features. The ruler and size guides provide both metric and imperial reference.
Engineer features a ruler, table of unit conversions, and common equations for the designer to think on the go. Equations featured range in depth from translational mechanics to modern physics, and include a reference for common statistics.
Designer focuses on simplicity and elegance in functionality. This PocketRule includes a millimeter ruler and a protractor, and also provides stencils for drawing circles and polygons from a triangle to a decagon.
The polygon tool manifests within the spiral. Each corner of the spiral subtends the appropriate angle to draw its corresponding polygon, enabling versatile drawing abilities in a small space.
Materials
Every PocketRule is made of copper-clad fiberglass, the same material used to make circuit boards. This choice of material makes the card lightweight and durable, and provides an elegant aesthetic and satisfying feel in your hand. Each card is 0.8 millimeters thick and weighs 7 grams.
The metallic inscriptions in each PocketRule are made of finished copper, and have the option to be gold-plated. The surface finish is glossy and can be made black, white, blue, purple, or green. Black and green colors can also be made matte rather than glossy.
Timeline
This project has undergone five tested prototypes to optimize the design, improve aesthetics, and ensure production quality. The history and anticipated timeline of the project completes in several months:
April 2018 - Initial ideas and designing
May 2018 - First round of prototyping
June 2018 - Final preparations and campaign launch
July 2018 - PocketRule arrives at your door
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a debut product, and the designer's first Kickstarter project. The extensive prototyping, testing, and logistics navigation in preparing this project have ensured that production should be a breeze. All distribution should be done in July. If very many creators pledge, distribution may be delayed by as much as a week or two.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thanks to all your tremendous support, we have launched our studio as a small business and are now selling PocketRules on Amazon! Initially, we're just selling the most popular models - the black Designer, Machinist, Engineer, and Electrical, and as demand calls it we will expand to more colors in the near future.
Find our listing at tinyurl.com/PocketRuleAmazon

Hello backers! First run of shipments is out today, with about half of the pledges shipped. Thank you again for your patience in getting all these PocketRules out - the campaign certainly turned out a lot bigger than we expected.
We are still working on getting everyone's PocketRules into envelopes and out the door. Half of them are already out, and we expect getting the rest out within the next two days. May you find them at your doorstep soon!
AG Studios

Hello everyone! Due to the tremendous amount of pledges we received, filling all the rewards is taking longer than expected. Please expect a delay of several days while we get all the orders sorted through.
With all the incredible support getting so close to filling the stretch goal, and as a token of appreciation for your patience with minor delays, we have decided to go through with making the Machinist PocketRule! Every backer will receive a complimentary black and gold Machinist PocketRule with their order.
First off, we would like to send a huge Thank You to all our backers so far for helping build such a successful campaign! Before we end in half an hour, here are some final details.

campaign.story:
The Ziflex is a flexible and magnetic build plate, at an affordable price. The printing surface is designed to ensure strong adherence to any material, and thanks to its flexibility, prints removal is easier than ever. Our magnetic positioning technology allows you to remove and reposition your Ziflex in a few seconds and ensures a perfect alignment to your printer’s bed while maintaining a strong grip.
Version française 
Removing 3D printed parts from a build plate is often a real pain. Using a spatula to remove a print can damage your printer, your print, or even yourself. It’s not a safe option: we all have already faced this struggle with this tool...
Making a part stick to the platform isn’t easy, and removing it is even more difficult. We usually use a lot of different tools and products to succeed in both print adherence and removal. It's over now. All these dangerous and unpractical tools are things of the past now. Ziflex replaces them all! 
Removing a print is now easier than ever, no matter the size or shape of your print. Just remove the Ziflex off of your printer and flex it.
Ziflex is a thin, flexible and heat resistant build surface, and features a coating that can handle any material. Thanks to its magnetic technology, Ziflex will be strongly attached to your printer and will be perfectly placed every time.
Our magnetic positioning technology is strong and also directional. It guides your Ziflex in a single direction and ensures a perfect alignment to your printer’s bed while maintaining a strong grip.
Its incredible flexibility will allow you to easily remove any print, even the smallest one, without damaging your new build surface.
The Ziflex comes in two parts, with strong directional magnetic sheets on both parts. Just stick the one with 3M adhesive to your original bed, and then place Ziflex on it. Calibrate your printer, and you're good to go for easy 3D printing!  
The Ziflex can heat up to 90°C. As you can see from the thermal picture above, the Ziflex provides an effective heat transmission. 
We can produce the Ziflex in any size and any shape (round or rectangular). From 10 square centimetres to 1 square metre build area, we can make a Ziflex for you ;) We can adjust the Ziflex to the exact dimensions of your print bed. We are going to open a Discord to talk with you to find out the best dimensions for each of you. 
These printers aren’t the only ones, we can make any size you need. 
We are providing you the Ziflex in the exact size of your build bed. The size above is just the price range.
Doing a bigger size isn't a problem for us (up to 1000mm*1000mm). Just pledge to the 30cm* 30cm, and you will be able to upgrade your pledge to a bigger size in the final survey, once the campaign is over. 
Nicolas : “We’ve founded Zimple almost two years ago with Antoine. Like many of you guys, I enjoy doing a lot of personal electronic and mechanical projects during my spare time. After 3 years using different 3D printers, I realized this wonderful machine needed a few additions to what came in the box: some upgrades to make them easier and safer to use. I’ve come up with a few improvements for my printers, and after a while, I realized it could interest other folks who enjoy 3D printing! That’s why we are here today, to bring to you another product that we think fits any maker’s needs.”
Anthony, Partner, Graphic & digital manager, founder of TheCreativeLab,
Nicolas, Founder, CEO, Electronic Engineer,  3D Designer, Maker,
Antoine, Co founder, COO, Machine learning Engineer, Web developer.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While developing Ziflex, we've tried many different solutions, using different components. We've now found all the final components, and our supplier can provide them to us in large quantities. 
Managing production is not an issue for us, Ziflex assembly, packaging and shipping will be handled by ourselves, in our factory located in Sollies Pont, France. 
We have already managed the sourcing, production, packaging and shipping in our previous Kickstarter projects. These previous experiences and facility installations make us confident about this upcoming exciting new product! 
We will keep you updated on the advancement of the project all the way, from production to shipping, by email and social media. 
It's now time to take part in the Ziflex project and community :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: One year later, we made the New Ziflex!
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,

      Thanks to you, last year, we successfully launched, produced and shipped the Ziflex. We are very grateful for this! After a year of feedback and experience in the 3D Printing build plate manufacturing, we’ve improved the Ziflex.
We’ve worked hard on the magnets: we needed to get stronger magnets that will not easily be damaged when you remove a part from the surface.

Hi everyone, 
I hope you’re all doing well and have a good 3D Printing time with your Ziflex! We didn’t publish a lot of updates on Kickstarter these last weeks, but we didn’t forget you! As most of you know, we’re easily reachable on other channels, and always willing to help or just get a nice talk with you. 😊 
Entrepreneurship is a journey full of surprises, good and bad, and a small company like ours does probably not handle everything in the best way. But trust me, we’re doing our best and we try to improve ourselves every day. Today, we’ve shipped over 4000 Ziflex and we’ve learned a lot along this production and shipping experience.

Hi everyone!

We hope you’re all doing well! Sorry for the lack of news these last weeks. We were focused on producing the Ziflex and as usual, we were very busy!
We’re so sorry about the delay. We had to deal with unplanned things, but now all is rectified and we’re working hard to send all of your orders.

updates.update_userinfo: 🌠 We have been selected to exhibit at CES Eureka Park! 😃

updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
You’re about to receive your Ziflex and to provide you the best first-time experience, we’ve made a summary of the questions you could have while installing it. Please, check them in order to avoid damaging your Ziflex the first time. Of course, there is a documentation with your Ziflex, but the information here is more detailed.

updates.update_userinfo: Your Ziflex is on its way 🚀
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! 
We’ve shipped a new batch of Ziflex today, and almost all the Ziflex smaller than 220*200mm are on their way 😊 Only a few exceptions aren’t shipped yet, but more than 90% of these Ziflex are now shipped. You should have received a tracking number via email, it will arrive at your door next week! 
30*30 cm Ziflex will be shipped next week, and then the bigger one (400 & 500 mm) and those of round shape will be shipped.

Dear backers,
 We shipped the second batch of Ziflex today! All of you who are concerned should have received a DHL tracking number. 🛫🤗 
The printers that have been shipped so far are: 
In the 150*150 category: Kodama Trinus & Obsidian, M3D Micro, SnapMaker, Ultimaker 2 GO, Alta, Sparmaker.

Hi everyone!  
We hope you’re all doing well! Sorry for the lack of news these last weeks, we were focus on producing the Ziflex and as usual, we were very very busy! 
   But good news! We’ve started to staff our start-up: our first employee will start working next week, and she will help us on backers’ support and communication. 😊  Another exciting news: the production is now fully set up, and we’re ready to ship some of the Ziflex! 😍

updates.update_userinfo: We did it! Thanks for your amazing support during the campaign! ❤️
updates.update_content:
Dear beloved backers,

We are so grateful to all of you! This campaign was amazing: talking with you about Ziflex and 3D printing, your support all the way until the final days, your help choosing all the best sizes for every printer... thank you so much everyone ❤️.  
So what happens now: 
In the upcoming days, you will receive a link to the BackerKit survey by email. That’s where you will fill out your delivery address, you will choose the exact size you want for your Ziflex, and where you will be able to add extra Ziflex to your order.

campaign.story:
Skies of Fire is a limited comic series by Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou, with art by Pablo Peppino and Bryan Valenza. Skies was launched in 2014 has remained 100% independent through crowdfunding and the support of our fans.
This campaign's goal is to raise funds for a high quality, clothbound first volume of Skies of Fire, collecting the first four issues. The book is the first trade collection we've produced and represents a huge milestone for Mythopoeia. 
We're creating a collected trade because we're sold out of our floppy comics. Thanks our fans we've sold over 15,000 copies of Skies of Fire to date!  Though we've thought about just continuing on with floppies, a trade allows us to better streamline our inventory and opens up distribution channels for Mythopoeia, and is imperative for the continuation of Skies of Fire. 
Skies of Fire takes place in the Aquilan Empire, a kingdom where airship travel has become the dominant means of transportation, commerce, and war. In the center of the Empire lies a monstrous, never-ending storm called The Expanse.  
In Issue One, the raider Delmonte orchestrates a surprise attack on the key trade outpost, Port Prince. His actions prompt Royal Guard Captain Helen Pierce to volunteer for an expedition to bring him to justice.  
In Issue Two, Captain Pierce enlists the help of the elusive William.  
Issue Three follows the pair as they recruit members for their mission in the bordertown of Copperhead. 
In Issue Four, the crew of the Zephyr must come together despite their differences. 
Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou have been creating stories together since 2008. They met in college and continue to collaborate despite being 5,437 miles apart.
Pablo Peppino is a an illustrator from Argentina with a focus on sequential art. 
Bryan Valenza is a prolific artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects from top publishers in the industry. 
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army.     
Josephe Vandel is a German cartographer and graphic designer with a love for RPGs and creating fictional worlds.
The majority of funds from this Kickstarter will go into covering the cost of printing the book and fulfilling orders from this Kickstarter. Any remaining money will be put back into further production of Skies of Fire. 
Skies of Fire Volume I is 8x11" clothbound hardcover with 120 pages including sequentials, codex documents, and variant covers.. The book features a new wraparound cover by Pablo de Bonis featuring the city of Monterey. 
Actual copies of the book shown.
An interior from issue #4.
Collector's Edition Book Plate
The prints have been carefully selected from some of the most iconic scenes in Skies of Fire using the highest quality archival paper.
Issue #1 Variant Poster. 19 x 13"
Recruitment Poster from Issue #3.
Ships of the World Poster. 19 x 13"
 This campaign we're introducing two new poster prints:
Zephyr Cutaway Poster. 19 x 13"
$15,000 - Digital Making Of (Updated) - Because we hit $15,000, we'll release our digital deluxe files to all backers! This includes an extensive Making Of, the inks of all of the issues, comic scripts, wallpapers, and more. All told, it should be about 100+ pages of bonus content. We'll also do our best to update the content and add a couple of new things for long time fans! 
$20,000 - Digital Issue #5 - We'll also be including a digital copy of Skies of Fire #5 free of charge to backers of this campaign when it's ready later this summer! This will coincide with the launch of the next Kickstarter campaign.
$30,000 - New Landscape Illustration - If we reach $30,000 we'll be commissioning and packing in a new art print featuring Lutan, the city of opportunity in every physical package of Skies of Fire: Book I. 
$35,000 - Printable Zephyr Papercraft PDF   - Should we reach  $35,000, we'll include a PDF of a printable, low poly version papercraft model of the Zephyr!
$40,000 - Skies of Fire RPG Alpha - If we reach $40k, we'll invite all members of this Kickstarter to the Skies of Fire RPG Alpha when it's ready to launch!
$45,000 - Zephyr Papercraft Pack-In - If we reach $45k, we'll pack in a pre-printed version of the Zephyr Papercraft with every shipment of Skies of Fire: Book I!
$50,000 - "100" Ships -Finally, if we reach $50k, we'll commission our resident ship designer Alex Bucur for a boatload more ship designs! We'll include the digital prints of these ships to our backers as well! 
Add-Ons will be handled post campaign by our partners at Backerkit. You will be able to select additional a la carte items for purchase after you confirm your shipping information. Funds in excess of your chosen reward tier can also be used to purchase add-ons in Backerkit. If you have a specific question about an add-on, please don't hesitate to directly message us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 7th (!) campaign so crowdfunding is an old hat for us. For this campaign, the creators have financially assumed most of the risk in this campaign by advancing the cash necessary to print the book. In other words, so long as we get the money, we'll be able to quickly fulfill the campaign. 

Otherwise, the biggest risk is in timely fulfillment. Last campaign we wrapped up two months after the closing day ended. Just like last time, we'll do our best to close the campaign as soon as we can. Everything is in place for this to happen - all items are in stock and ready to be shipped out. 

If we don't succeed in this campaign, Vince and I are out about $10,000. That would not be good for our creative endeavors - not necessarily stop them, but severely slow us down. So please help us make sure that doesn't happen!

Things can and do happen throughout the course of a campaign, but we've always made it a policy to be transparent and update our backers frequently. If you have any issues, please don't hesitate to contact us - we do our best to make sure everyone is 100% satisfied.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Overall Fulfillment

I packed about 200 boxes yesterday. Europe / Rest of the World will soon follow. Next week we're expected to get the Collector's Edition Book Plates so many, many more shipments will go out then.

campaign.story:
DeDe MAKES DEBUGGING & LEARNING QUICKER & EASIER!
Quickly see the logic state of any GPIO pin with bright red and green LEDs - even pulses as short as 1mS can be seen!
Rapidly prototype with the included breadboard!
Easily dig deeper by connecting test equipment to any GPIO pin, the breakout headers make it easy!  You can connect:
    A DMM to measure voltages
    An oscilloscope to view waveforms
    A protocol analyzer to decode SPI/I2C/UART communications
    A function generator to drive signals into the circuit
    A counter/timer to measure timing
DeDe FEATURES:
UPDATE:  NOW WITH A BREADBOARD!
DeDe with the green breadboard & headers
Closeup of the breadboard and headers
DeDe now comes with a breadboard and an extra 40-pin header for populating the signal pads surrounding the prototyping area, making it easy to try out new circuits!  Why green?  Green seems appropriate since they make DeDe more reusable!
Compatible with nearly ANY board having Arduino UNO compatible headers.  Some boards may have clearance issues. Adding a "dummy" prototyping shield as a spacer in between usually solves the problem.
Works with both 5V and 3.3V boards!
Individual pairs of red and green LEDs with on-board drivers for displaying high/low status for each of the port pins, all located along one edge and extended out beyond the standard Arduino shield for easy viewing of all pins - even when placed in the middle of a shield sandwich!
Virtually no loading on the GPIO pins, only 100Kohm pull-up resistors to keep the buffer inputs from floating - the LEDs are NOT driven directly by the GPIOs!
3 user signal inputs with LEDs available to the user for probing other signals
One channel dedicated to the RESET signal helps catch those unexpected resets!
A 6-position DIP switch for connecting/disconnecting the board's input buffers and 100Kohm pull-ups from the analog inputs (A0-A5) for sensitive applications that might be affected by the pull-up resistors
Probe pins on 0.1" male headers adjacent to the shield sockets are for external probing with oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, protocol analyzers and DMMs. They also make it easy to connect to boards that aren't shield compatible!
Two GND posts for grounding test equipment
A prototyping area with all shield signals and power brought out for creating your own circuits and is also compatible with 170 tie-point breadboards (now included), just drop it in place!
A 2-pin disable jumper (marked "DIS") is provided for disabling the LED circuits lets you conserve power when they're not needed, or wire it to a GPIO pin and control it from a sketch to build some creative LED patterns!
A reset push button located for easy access!
PLAY

24 STATUS LEDs
STATUS LEDs
  The status LEDs show the current state of all 20 GPIO pins at a glance...you don't have to turn the board around or try to peer around other shields to see what's happening on the other side of the board like some other designs.  The standard Arduino naming convention for the GPIOs are clearly shown adjacent to the LEDs along the edge of the board, plus their Microchip (formerly Atmel) PORT pin designations (PORT B, PORT C & PORT D) just above the row of green LEDs.
  Three USER inputs (U1-U3) are provided to enable you to probe other parts of your circuits (the signals can be either 3.3V or 5V) that aren't connected to a GPIO pin.
  The RESET signal has its own pair of LEDs to enable you to see if the reset line is being asserted.
DEBUG HEADERS
DEBUG HEADERS
   The debug headers make it easy to probe the GPIOs and power supply circuits with a DMM, oscilloscope, or logic analyzer.  Easily connect an I2C or SPI protocol analyzer and start decoding those pesky communications!  If you're unable to decode the I2C or SPI interfaces, connect an oscilloscope probe to them and verify that the waveforms look right or possibly swapped!
  The debug headers can also be used to connect other boards like sensor evaluation boards that aren't shield-compatible...just use jumper wires to patch it in!
  A pair of GND posts make it easy to ground test equipment such as oscilloscope probes.
ANALOG DISCONNECT SWITCHES
A0-A5 DISCONNECT SWITCHES
   When using A0-A5 as analog inputs, you might not want a 100Kohm pull-up resistor affecting your circuit...turn off the corresponding DIP switch to electrically isolate it!
PROTOTYPING AREA
PROTOTYPING AREA
   The 252-hole prototyping area is surrounded by all of the GPIO signals and power supply pins, making it easy to wire in your own custom electronics.  The pads are laid out in 18 columns of a 3-3-2-3-3 layout for maximum flexibility.  For maximum flexibility, place a 170 tie-point breadboard (not included) on top of the prototyping area, solder male or female headers into the GPIO and power supply holes (whichever suits you, a 40-pin stick is all it takes) and now you have a reusable rapid prototyping area!

RESET & LED DISABLE
RESET PUSHBUTTON AND LED DISABLE JUMPER
   A reset pushbutton that protrudes beyond the standard shield size makes it easier to reset your system!
  The board consumes as much as 125mA from the Vcc rail.  Maybe your design needs that extra power...just place a jumper across the pair of male header pins marked "DIS" to disable the power supply feeding the LEDs and their drivers, dropping the current consumption to below 2mA! 

ARDUINO UNO COMPATIBLE HEADERS
STANDARD ARDUINO UNO HEADER FOOTPRINT
  The standard Arduino UNO compatible shield headers are right where they should be, allowing the board to sit in the middle of a "shield sandwich" nicely while the status LEDs extend out for easy at-a-glance viewing.
WHAT'S INCLUDED WITH THE KIT
PCBA with all of the surface mount components pre-soldered
170 tie-point breadboard w/double-stick tape on the back
Shield headers
1 yellow 40-pin header strip
1 green 40-pin header strip
2 ground posts
3 M/M and 3 M/F jumper wires for the user inputs
Kit Contents
WHO CAN DeDe BENEFIT?
Individuals getting started with Arduinos & compatibles
Makers building electronics for a project
Engineers designing a proof-of-concept for a product
STEM & STEAM camps
Robotics clubs
High school, tech school and university labs
Perfect for educators to teach electronics and programming!  Better than blinking a single LED, the quintessential "Hello World" for electronics.  Take control of 20 pairs of LEDs and build creative light shows!
Recreate the Cylon eyes from Battlestar Galactica or KITT from Knight Rider
Demonstrate what a shift register does
Build a VU meter by reading an analog input driven by an audio source
Use the serial port to control the LEDs
Develop a class around an Arduino and DeDe...PERFECT!!

USES FOR THE BOARD
Use the debug features to narrow down where the problem lies - is it a hardware or a software problem?
Prototype circuits easily in the prototyping area, either permanently or use attach the breadboard to make it reusable!
252-hole general-purpose prototyping area All GPIO, power supply and other ancillary pins brought out for making easy connections Make the board more flexible and reusable by adding a 170 tie-point breadboard (not included) and solder standard header pins on 0.1" centers to the GPIO and power supply pins!
Use it as a demonstration tool to visually show what's actually happening!
Use it as an adapter for other boards such as the Arduino Nano so you can use standard shields!  Just solder the board to the prototyping area and wire it's pins to the signal pads!
Create your own Arduino UNO compatible board using your favorite processor!
SOME EXAMPLES
PLAY

PARTNERS ARE KEY TO SUCCESS!
DeDe, and I believe the same can be said of any project, wouldn't have been possible without the help of friends, family, and coworkers both past and present.

My thanks and appreciation go out to my parents for providing for me and encouraging my interest in computers and electronics at an early age.  Had it not been for that, I would've been a starving actor, as evidenced by that 30 seconds of OMG video above!  :D  (In grade school, I thought everyone grew up to be on TV or in the movies...the  naivety of youth!)

I would also like to thank some of the players in industry, without some of whom, we wouldn't have Arduinos!

Arduino
Seeed Fusion PCB & PCB Assembly Services
Atmel, now part of Microchip
WHY KICKSTARTER?
Most of the hard work has already been done. A lot of time and money have already been invested in the development of DeDe, and it's all but done...just a minor artwork tweak to the silk screen layer. The design is already proven and it works beautifully!  (It's fun to watch too!)  The next step involves designing and building a test jig to verify functionality of the boards before they ship out.
The monies raised during this campaign will go towards ordering everything needed to fulfill orders, such as boards, components, packaging, etc.  Depending on the success of the campaign, and more to the point, the number of rewards, I may or may not build the boards in-house.  I've been hand-stuffing prototypes with tweezers and a microscope, but that doesn't scale very well!  :^)  A pick and place machine for automating the placement of the surface mount components is a necessity for any quantity over 10-20 boards.  I would like to purchase a pick-and-place machine (likely the NeoDen3V) along with a manual stencil printer for applying the solder paste.  If the number of awards goes well above expectations, the plan is to farm out production to a third party, although I would still like to build the first 900 or so boards in-house to use up much of the inventory I've already purchased and to gain experience with the Neoden3V.


TIMELINE
DeDe Timeline

DeDe Unpacking and Assembly

DeDe - Manual SMD Assembly Process
Blinky Lights!!

updates.update_content: Hello backers!! As promised, the shipments have begun! They actually started shipping on Wednesday, and it looks like the first ones should be showing up as soon as Monday. So far, just over half of the boards have shipped. I’m waiting on the shipping/postage labels for the Student/Hobbyist/Maker tier, as well as the international Pro Developer 3-packs (for which I’m waiting on boxes as well). All of the remaining boards are packaged and ready for shipping, and are expected to ship by the end of next week.

Hello backers!
   The surveys went out a couple of weeks ago. For those of you that haven't filled it out, please do so soon so I can get these puppies shipped out! :)
  The test jig is done and I've tested it on a batch of 12 boards from the CM with no failures, so the production boards are looking good! I used some of the boards that I ran on my mini-production setup before I went with a CM, and it's easy to see the failures.
   Basically, the test jig sits in an infinite loop checking the 100Kohm pullups that are on each Arduino port pin, which will fail if no board is inserted. When a board is inserted, the red row of LEDs will come on if there are any failed pullups, and it's easy to see (much easier after I updated the FW after I shot the video below) which pullup(s) are open. If the pullup test passes, then it flashes all of the green LEDs for a second and then proceeds with a walking 0 and a walking 1 test. It's a visual test for now, so I have to watch it for errors. The jig has the capability to tell whether the LEDs are good and look for shorted pairs of signals, but I decided that it was going to be quicker to do a visual test for now than to code up the ADC logic (I run an ADC channel in between each pair of LEDs, and based on voltage it call tell which LEDs are on and if there's an open based on the voltage).

Hi Kickstarters!
  I hope everyone has had a great Thanksgiving holiday!  I ate so much at dinner that I couldn't finish my dessert (death by chocolate cake)...and I love my chocolate, so that's saying a lot! :D
  I'll keep this brief, unless you count pictures as being worth a thousand words!  ;)

Happy Monday everyone, and thank you to all of our veterans and those that are still serving, I greatly appreciate it!!!
  Another quick update on my progress...
  I've managed to label and stuff 400 antistatic bags in preparation for the boards which I will need to place in the bags along with some instructions prior to zipping them up for shipping! My fingers are a bit sore, mostly from opening the ziploc bags (OMG), but I survived. :D  My learnings from this, besides realizing (and no real surprise here!) that I wouldn't want to do this for a living, is for a batch this size, do some test runs first on smaller quantities to make sure that the order in which you do things makes it easy for you. In this case...labels first! They are much easier to attach when the bag is still flat! I had pre-stuffed 35 bags w/components some time ago, and adding the labels to them wasn't so easy. Also, the index card idea looks like it will work great...I placed all of the loose components on the back side of the index card, and the front side will be where I place the PCBs and the instructions, both at the same time. I adjusted the order in which I added the loose components a few times to get all of the parts to go in as easy as possible. The six wires were the last to go in because putting them in early made it hard to get the 40-pin headers in without them getting snagged in the wires. You get the idea...do some test cases before doing all 400 and then finding out you made things harder on yourself! :)

Hello Kickstarters and happy November!
  Just a quick update (I promise!) :D
  I ordered and received some extra components that were needed for the CM to account for extras (they request 5% more than what is needed) and because I ordered 504 boards (the Kickstarter quantity is about 380 boards). I kitted them up, which entails bundling each of the components and marking them with their manufacturer part number and DeDe’s reference designators. I dropped everything off at the CM along with one of the boards I had built with the Neoden 3V, a set of Arduino headers, and an Arduino programmed with a test pattern for them to compare the first boards off of the line to prior to ramping up production. Testing the first articles is really a necessary step, as I found out when I went to assemble the board that I was going to deliver to them…I found that the 3V LDO voltage regulator was placed 180 degrees out of place…doh! An easy fix, but I only had to fix one…imagine reworking 504!

Hi Kickstarters!
  I hope everyone had a nice weekend!
  The DIY build has turned into a bit of a disappointment, I'm sorry to say. The short version of this story is that I’m going to have a CM (Contract Manufacturer) do the build of the boards…the fallout was just too high at less than 50% due to misplaced components, misaligned solder stencil, and not-so-tight control over the thickness of the paste…getting only two of the three right is a failure. On the plus side, the boards will probably look at least a little better than what I can produce (although they look perfect w/my setup when I get everything right), but the down side is lead time which is looking to be 3-4 weeks to hit my dock, so shipping of all boards likely won’t occur until mid-November. I apologize for the delay, but I assure you that it will be worth a little extra wait. Shipping should occur soon after receipt of the boards as I plan to have everything else ready to go w/respect to shipping; I’ll have all of the anti-static bags of parts pre-made and the padded envelopes pre-labeled. All I’ll have to do is test the boards when they arrive and stuff them in the bags.

Hi everyone!
  Just a quick (and long overdue) update with a somewhat lengthy video (and rather large at 1.67GB!) 
  First, my apologies for the month+ that has passed since my last update.  I picked up a new client just after the KS completed and they had plenty for me to do.  I also had to order a larger nozzle for the 3V that took a few weeks to arrive (compared to the 3 days it took for the machine, go figure...).  Anyway, I've been able to put more time into DeDe the past couple of weeks, mainly getting production up and running.

Hi!
  I hope you had a great weekend!
  Things are progressing quicker than I had planned, and that's a good thing as that means I'm on track for delivery!
  First off, I managed to squeeze the Neoden3V pick-and-place (PnP) machine onto my credit card.  I made an offer on one the Saturday after the campaign ended.  They accepted and I placed the order for it the next day from the manufacturer in Hangzhou, China.  It arrived last Wednesday morning...in only 3 days!  The deal included a basic stencil printer for laying down the solder paste with a stainless steel stencil.

With time to spare too!  There was an extra hour due to me not knowing the difference between MST and MDT, sooo...we got some extra breathing room (which it turned out wasn't needed) and gave some late-comers a chance to still get a board.
  Thank you to all of my supporters/believers/backers around the WORLD!  This would not have happened with all of you backing this project, and I GREATLY appreciate it!  There were many of you that bumped up their pledges over the last few days, and that was HUGE!  I've been watching the trend line on backerkit.com (https://www.backerkit.com/projects/ellutions/dede-debug-and-development-shield-for-arduinos-and) for DeDe and other projects, and they almost always show an upward trend the last 2-3 days.  My guess that part of the reason is the upgrades, and part is what a friend of mine called FOMO, Fear Of Missing Out.  I suppose another reason is that campaigns such as this, where it's getting close, the creator or someone they know (in my case, I know her and her husband very well...you know who you are! ;) ) makes an investment in the project, just because.  :)

campaign.story:
Welcome to Lowpolysaurus park. Kid friendly, whimsical, low-poly dinosaur models for your 3D printer. Designed to print without supports and print with low or no infill. Perfect as a test print or just for fun with gentle angles to minimize sharp edges so they're suitable for all ages. 
Help build the whole set and print your own dinosaur park!
The Plan
How many 3D models will be included in this kickstarter? It depends on how much it raises.
There are two tiers of rewards that will grow as the campaign does. The Triassic tier gets a limited set of 3D models of dinosaurs and accessories, as voted on by the community. The Jurassic tier receives every dinosaur and accessories models created in this kickstarter.
The success of this campaign will determine how many dinosaurs will be modeled. The more it raises, the larger the rewards will be. For your support you will not only receive the 3D dinosaur models developed in this campaign, but you will have a vote in what the next dinosaur will be as the campaign progresses.
Meet the Dinos
As the campaign raises more, there will be more dinos added to the park. So far there there is already:
Egg
Tyrannosaurs Rex
Triceratops
Dipolaucus/Brontosaurs
Stegasaurus
Feathered raptor / velocaraptor
Ankylosaur
Spinosaur
Megalodon
Pterodactyl
Stygimoloch
Archelon
Elaphrosaurus
Woolly Mastodon
Saber Tooth Tiger
Trees
...and, many more.
The Cause
This project is brought to you by the 3D Printing Professor and combines my passion for 3D design, drive for education, and excitement when interacting with my audience.
My YouTube channel is in need of a major infusion to stay up-to-date, which is what this kickstarter is raising funds for. Funds raised in this campaign will go towards:
Upgraded AV equipment
Better lighting in current recording area
Upgrade to current recording area
Rebuilding recording area into a high tech mini recording studio
Taking it off the grid with solar power
Aperture panels for instant reconfiguration
Disco ball
etc
To what degree these upgrades will be acted upon will depend on what this campaign raises. So whether you just like awesome 3D models or want to support what I do on YouTube, your contribution to this kickstarter will be greatly appreciated.

campaign.story:
Sichuan Chili Crisp is the first 100% all natural Sichuan chili sauce packed with complex umami flavors, proudly crafted in Chengdu. After two years of obsessive cooking and development in our private kitchen, Sichuan Chili Crisp is finally ready to make its debut outside of China with your help. 
Our goal is to harness Sichuan's legendary canon of flavors through our sauces and share them with the world, showcasing the cuisine's complexity beyond just 'spicy and numbing' and that "Made in China"can mean the highest quality products with no artificial flavors and preservatives.  
  New York Magazine - A Chinese-Food Authority Is Bringing Her Chengdu-Made Chili Sauce to America 
Saveur - You Need This New High-end Chinese Chile Crisp 
Download our press pack here 
    At the base of a great sauce lies 鲜 xian, a.k.a. umami, or, the fifth taste.  Instead of using MSG as a shortcut, we draw it out naturally using the finest ingredients available.
Flavor and function belong together
We believe that flavor and function should not be mutually exclusive.  
So our flavorful sauces are built with a blend of adaptogenic mushrooms, seaweeds and spices long known in China to have both flavor-building and healing properties. 
This allows us to build deep umami flavors that are good for you as well, boosting immunity, energy, and longevity.
It's all about the ingredients
Tribute Pepper
At the heart of Sichuan Chili Crisp is Sichuan pepper, an ancient spice that has been cultivated in China for thousands of years that is responsible for the cuisine’s unique tongue-tingling sensation. 
We use a special variety called 贡椒 Gongjiao, also known as 'Tribute pepper', so prized it was once given exclusively as a tribute to the emperor, with a truly transformational smell and taste. They are painstakingly hand-harvested just once a year- and sell out immediately-, rarely making their way to the West.
Proudly crafted in Sichuan
We work with our co-packing partner in Sichuan to process our ingredients and craft our sauces, ensuring the highest quality control standards, food safety management, and strict compliance with FDA regulations.  We only source 100% all natural ingredients, and do not use any artificial flavor additives or preservatives. 
Together, we're changing the notion of what "Made in China" can mean.
The result is a chili sauce that delivers the perfect level of spice and deep flavor that you can use the same way you would any other hot sauce.  It's spicy, numbing, crispy, and deliciously savory. How you eat it is completely up to you. 
We dare you not to put it on everything.
Read More About Us
1.  SICHUAN CHILI CRISP
"Fly By Jing sauces are a game-changer – and not just for your food, but for the global image of Sichuan food as a whole. So much of Chinese cuisine is misunderstood in the Western world, but I believe we are on the cusp of a renaissance for its appreciation, starting with Sichuan cooking. Sichuan Chili Crisp is the perfect antidote to gloopy, artificial headaches like 'Szechuan Sauce;' it's made with authentic, natural ingredients hailing from the heart of the region, and will awaken your senses to real Chinese food."
- Betty Richardson, Former Food Editor, That's Shanghai Magazine
“Sichuan Chili Crisp is absolutely delicious, unique and versatile. I’ve enjoyed it on everything from noodles to eggs, soups to veggies. Jenny is an incredibly knowledgeable and passionate expert on her home province’s cuisine and she’s brought the best ingredients and authentic depth of flavor to her sauces.
- Crystyl Mo, Food Writer, World's 50 Best Restaurants Academy Chair
"My husband woke me up in the middle of the night to ask what would happen if we ran out of Sichuan Chili Crisp. Not even kidding."
- Janice Leung Hayes, Food Writer, Founder of Honestly Green
2. JINGTHEORY GUIDE TO CHENGDU + SICHUAN RECIPE BOOK
Fly By Jing founder Jenny Gao's meticulously researched and designed 30+ page guide to Chengdu. A curated look at the best of eating, drinking, and exploring in China's most leisurely city. Also receive a digital recipe booklet full of Sichuan favorites like mapo tofu, sweet water noodles, and twice cooked pork.
3. 2018 New Harvest Tribute Pepper + Erjingtiao Chili
We have secured our reserve of the 2018 new season harvest of 贡椒 gongjiao (tribute pepper) from Qingxi village, along the mountainous Tea Horse Road, an ancient trading route dedicated to the transport of tea and spices from China to the West. Be one of the first to get your hands on new season Tribute Pepper (painstakingly hand-harvested by farmers this August in the mountains of Sichuan), the smell and taste of which is transformational. Read our Sichuan Primer in Anthony Bourdain's Parts Unknown to learn why it is exceptionally rare to find fresh and high quality Sichuan pepper outside of China.
  二荆条 Erjingtiao, the most popular variety of chili in Sichuan, is known for its mild spice but intense fragrance. It doesn’t overwhelm the taste of a dish but instead heightens sensations and awakens the palate to deeper flavors. Its uses are varied and inventive: dry-fried in oil for a scorched-chili flavor; ground up and combined with aromatics to create the canvas for the most fragrant chili oils; and mixed with various other spices to make dozens of Sichuan flavor profiles.
4. FLY BY JING x SINMEI TEA "CHENGDU CHAI"
Sinmei Tea has been a pioneer in the creative tea arts since establishing itself as a modern tea institution in Hong Kong, Shanghai, and Brisbane since its founding in 2008. We have worked with Sinmei to create the "Chengdu Chai", a uniquely delicious and warming blend of Sichuan spices and premium Australian black tea, a perfect pairing with frothed almond milk.
5. THREE YEAR AGED PIXIAN DOUBANJIANG
Often called the ‘soul’ of Sichuan cooking, doubanjiang, or fermented fava bean paste, is at the heart of many of the province’s signature dishes. The best doubanjiang comes from a county called Pixian just outside of Chengdu. Here, factories have been fermenting their paste for hundreds of years, traditionally in large clay pots that are left out under the sun and mixed by hand daily to evenly distribute its exposure to the elements.  The longer they are aged, the darker and more complex in flavor they become. Our 3 year doubanjiang is one of the best in existence, with deep umami flavors slowly built over time, completely natural with no additives, and largely unavailable outside of China.  
6. MR. CHEN'S HANDMADE CLEAVERS
Mr. Chen has been a metalsmith for the last thirty years in the old village of Pengzhen outside of Chengdu. He makes a selection of cooking equipment and tools including woks, cleavers, pots and scissors.  Of these, our favorite is his carbon steel Chinese cleaver, one of the best multipurpose tools in the kitchen. Chinese cooks have traditionally used a single cleaver for every task in the kitchen from dicing, deboning, butchering to julienning. These measure about 170mm with a 105mm wooden handle. 
7. PRIVATE SICHUAN COOKING WORKSHOP
I will conduct a half-day Sichuan food culture and cooking workshop for your friends/organization anywhere you are in the world. Learn the foundations of Sichuan cooking, pickling, chili sauce making and much more. You will also receive a case of 12 jars of Sichuan Chili Crisp, premium Sichuan ingredients and limited edition print copies of the Sichuan Recipe Book and Jingtheory Guide to Chengdu.
*Travel expenses not included, event to be arranged within a year of Kickstarter campaign closing.
8. PRIVATE SICHUAN SOUL FOOD FEAST
Feast your senses on a multi-course Sichuan dinner by Fly By Jing in your space for up to ten of your best food friends. Experience the many other flavor sensations that go far beyond the 'spicy' and 'numbing' the cuisine is famous for. You will also receive a case of 12 jars of Sichuan Chili Crisp, premium Sichuan ingredients and limited edition print copies of the Sichuan Recipe Book and Jingtheory Guide to Chengdu.  Read more about our Private Kitchen and global pop ups on Munchies: "Meet the Woman Who is Redefining Modern Sichuanese Cuisine"
*Travel expenses not included, event to be arranged within a year of Kickstarter campaign closing.
9. SEVEN DAY CHINA CULINARY ADVENTURE
Savor the best of what Chinese cuisine has to offer with Jenny, and see why top chefs around the world like Andrew Zimmern, Eddie Huang, Ken Hom and Emeril call on her to be their guide.
A guided 7 day food adventure of the best of Chengdu and Shanghai, inclusive of accommodations, attractions and food. Indulge in the world's best xiaolongbao in Shanghai and experience for yourself why Sichuan has one of the world's greatest food cultures by visiting spice markets, its famous fly restaurants, and enjoying everything from banquet cuisine to country cooking.  You will also receive a case of 12 jars of Sichuan Chili Crisp, premium Sichuan ingredients and limited edition print copies of the Sichuan Recipe Book and Jingtheory Guide to Chengdu.
*International and domestic flights not included ** Twin share add-on available (see reward for details)
10. GIFT OF SAUCE GIVING
I will work with your organization/brand to create 300 bottles of a limited edition Sichuan sauce with custom labels to add a personal touch to your holiday corporate gift basket. You will also receive limited edition print copies of the Sichuan Recipe Book and Jingtheory Guide to Chengdu.
NEW REWARDS FOR STRETCH GOALS!
We are floored by the incredible support from the Fly By Jing and Kickstarter community. Thanks for helping us get fully funded in just 2 days! Now we’re dreaming bigger with some new stretch goals!
60K - Have you always wanted to have chili sauce in your bag (swag)? Dream no more. If we hit $60k we will produce boxed sets of single-serve  Sichuan Chili Crisp packets so you can carry deep flavor to power your food anywhere.
100K - Welcome to the family, Mala Spice Mix and Zhong Dumpling Sauce, our two other current best sellers in China.  Reaching our stretch goal will allow us to bring these to the international market sooner than planned.
Zhong Dumplings, the beloved legendary street food, is known for its perfect balance of sweet, savoury, spicy and garlic-y flavors. We blend fragrant erjingtiao chili oil with 'fuzhi' soy sauce, slow-brewed with brown sugar, spices and 'komo' extract, a rare wild mushroom from the Mongolian highlands known for its health benefits and departing a wondrously deep umami for this unique sauce that lends itself perfectly not just to dumplings and noodles, but dipping any variety of your favorite foods.  
Mala Spice Mix is a powerful blend of nine herbs and spices including erjingtiao chili and prized tribute pepper from the Qingxi mountains to give your food dimension, depth, and the essence of Sichuan soul. Use as a rub or finishing spice on grilled and fried food. 
150K - I will add a new tier for you to join me on a 3-day trip to Qingxi village in the mountains of Sichuan to take part in the 2018 season Tribute Pepper harvest in August. We will take part in the process of picking and sorting with local farmers and hike along the historic Tea Horse Road where the village is located, once an important trading route bringing teas and spices from China into the West. Experience the intoxication of just-harvested Tribute Pepper and try the popular local dish of Sichuan pepper leaf tempura, a light, citrusy and delicious snack.
200K - I will develop and bring to market the first all natural, flavor packed, authentically Sichuan hot pot soup base with no artificial additives.
250K - I will offer a 3-day cooking workshop in the Sichuan countryside, showcasing its incredible produce and why it is known as the Land of Plenty. We will experience both rustic country b&bs, known to exemplify the best of Sichuan home cooking, as well as indulge in the sustainable luxury of Six Senses resort in Qingcheng Mountains. Days will start with early morning taichi, followed by foraging, visits to a local bee keeper, cold-pressed rapeseed oil producer, organic mushroom farm, and a local caviar farm, learning the basics of Sichuan cooking with our bounty. 
FOLLOW OUR JOURNEY ON INSTAGRAM AND FACEBOOK @FLYBYJING !
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have worked tirelessly for over a year to perfect the process of scaling and manufacturing our sauces, overcoming many obstacles and setbacks along the way. We have waited until we have absolutely secured the right facilities and ingredients before we committed to launching Sichuan Chili Crisp internationally via this Kickstarter campaign. We have already produced several large batches of our sauce with our co-packing partner in Sichuan, achieving a level of quality and consistency that satisfies our extremely high standards.

As we are importing the sauce into the US, there may be unforeseeable delays at customs, although we have already worked some buffer into our timeline. We will work with a bottling facility in the US to package our sauces and our fulfillment partner to ship the products once they are ready. 

As we are shipping some of our products to customers internationally, there may be delays and customs fees that we cannot control, please keep that in mind when placing orders outside of the United States.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
