updates.update_content:
Wow. It's been a long road to get here. 
But I'm so happy to share that we're finally starting to ship! Thank you for your patience thus far, and I pray the mail gods will deliver your goods to you as quickly as possible.
The holiday season may add some delays, but domestic US orders should arrive within 3-4 business days and I'm not as clear for international orders, though there will be tracking numbers that we can follow up on.  As the fulfillment company is dealing with a large number of orders (over 2000+), it will take at least a couple days to get through them all.

Hi guys,
For a detailed production update, please see my most recent post in the Project Comments section.
Just a quick note to let those of you in NYC know that I'll be cooking a Sichuan Soul Food dinner on Sept 29th hosted by the Urban Outfitters concept store Space Ninety 8 in Williamsburg.  You'll be able to to try all of our sauces along with a 10+ course tasting menu with artisanal baijiu by Ming River and natural wines by Wölffer Estates.  Seats are very limited, RSVP details below.

We did it guys! Thanks to all of you, we unlocked our $100k stretch reward yesterday. Which means more flavors for everyone! 
Welcome to the family, Mala Spice Mix and Zhong Dumpling Sauce, our two other current best sellers in China. Now we can bring these to the international market sooner than planned! (After our campaign ends, you will receive a link to a storefront where you can add on items to your pledges and confirm your order before checking out.)

campaign.story:
Courtesy of Simplify3d.com & Eurekadrytech.com
The water content in a filament can cause various 3D printing problems, from the print being partially failed to the filament completely unprintable. Leaving your filament spools unprotected will make it absorb moisture in the air and reduce its printability. This happens to almost all the filaments. Therefore, it is very important to store your filaments in a dry environment to ensure a longer shelf life. After 2 successful Kickstarter campaigns in 2016 for our filament dryer and in 2017 for our filament container. We are now glad to introduce the PrintDry Vacuum Sealed Filament Container. 
Featured on 
Features 
1) Vacuum valve and pump: A special valve and a pump are used to suck the air out to create a vacuum seal and this will prevent the moisture in the air from getting into the container.    
2) Stronger structure: In order to hold a strong vacuum seal, both the lid and the container itself have been specially designed. 
3)  Vacuum indicator: when completely vacuum sealed, the center of the vacuum valve will collapse inward from its original dome shape.   
Testing   
The vacuum filament container has been tested with a 750g filament spool inside for 30 days. The graph below shows the changes of the relative humidity (grey line) inside the container and the ambient humidity (red line) as the storage time increases. Five pouches of 15g desiccant are included in the container.
How to use 
 Our new vacuum sealed containers are super easy to use.  
1) Place your filament spool inside the container with some desiccant pouches, put on the lid and align the tabs of the lid and the container, engage the 4 strong clamps.  
PLAY

2) Take the hand plunger and line up the bottom of the hand plunger with the center vacuum valve on the container lid.  Pressing down gently on the hand plunger, simply lift the plunger handle slowly until it reaches the top of the pump, and then push down on the plunger until it reaches the bottom of the pump. Repeat this up and down motion for 5-10 times.  
PLAY

3) To release the vacuum seal, place your index finger on the outside rim of the valve, and press it towards the center. 
PLAY

Please be aware that too many pumps will end up putting too much pressure on the container walls and lids and will lead to damage of your containers. 
Specification  
Container overall size: 255(OD) x 115(H) mm (10.5"OD x 4.5"H)
Filament spool size (max): 205(OD) x 85(H) mm (8"OD x 3.3"H)  
Design improvements
1) A thicker durable plastic to withstand the extreme pressure of on the walls and lid of the containers when vacuum seal is achieved.  
2) Accept taller spools of filament than our original container. 
Special UPGRADE package for our previous backer:  
UPGRADE Package A: 6 vacuum sealed lids and 1 pump
UPGRADE Package B: 12 vacuum sealed lids and 2 pumps
Reward Tiers
Timeline 
International backer  
 The PrintDry filament containers will be shipped worldwide! However, please be aware that for some countries VAT/duties may incur upon receipt of your unit. These fees are the responsibility of each international backer.   
Distributors:  If you would like to work with us to distribute PrintDry products around the world, please contact us at info@printdry.com  
Media kit:  Please click the link here for our Media Kit
You already know how well our original containers work and with this UPGRADE PACKAGE you can still use the original container bottoms with the new vacuum lids. This way you get to see how the vacuum sealed container works, without having to pay the cost for a whole new set of containers.  
Thanks
All of us at PrintDry would like to thank those who have supported us with our past Kickstarter campaigns and to all of you who will be supporting this 2018 Kickstarter campaign. We sincerely appreciate your support and look forward to bringing you more 3D printing accessories in the future.
Keywords: 3d, printing, 3d printing, 3d printer, filament, container, filament container, storage, filament storage, moisture, dry, dryer, printdry, nylon, pla, abs, petg, filament, vacuum sealed, taulman, taulaman3d, nylon 680, nylon 645, pctpe, nylon bridge, nylon 618, nylon 230, alloy 910, breathe-3dp, phoenix nylon

campaign.story:
*** This campaign page will be closed. Check out our restarted campaign page at http://www.neonious.com/Funding ! ***
.
.
Introduced Technology Preview @ JSConf EU on June 2nd, 2018 (see differences to final Kickstarter version below). Reactions:
@tobmaster: Nicest conference swag I ever got. At @jsconfeu by @neonious 
@lucasrecknagel: @jsconfeu i got a amazing nodejs compatible microcontroller from @neonious THANKS SO MUCH!
@phjardes: If you're a JS developer and like tinkering, please do support @neonious - an astonishing and affordable IoT device running JS natively.
@doramilitaru: This is amazing and I can’t believe I’m getting one (thanks @neonious @jsconfeu) — #ES6 #TypeScript #microcontroller board
The neonious one is a microcontroller board, programmable and debuggable out of the box in an on-board web-based IDE, combining JavaScript ES 6, TypeScript, Node.JS API and the whole npm repository with Internet directly on the board via WiFi or Ethernet and with all the other interfaces a microcontroller board usually provides.
On-board web-based IDE with full-featured debugger gives you the best programming experience possible. Includes a graphical package manager for npm, the largest software repository in the world!
Programmable in JavaScript ES 6 and/or TypeScript, both with 100 % Node.JS API support. Enough resources to run sophisticated npm software libraries.
58 mm x 27 mm (2.28 inch x 1.06 inch), tightest posible design with chips mounted on top and bottom. Breadboard compatible!
Only 2-3 secs boot time (no Linux), fast byte code execution. Energy-efficient CPU. Multiple power modes and code hibernation allow for ultra-low energy usage.
27 I/O pins, 11 of these pins usable as ADC (provided by accurate LPC822, not ESP32), 2 pins are 20 mA 5 V-tolerant open drain pins, 2 pins usable as touch sensor. 23 pins can be used freely for SPI, I2C, I2S or UART!
Custom protocols, easily going into Mhz range, possible thanks to on-board I/O controller programmable through an easy to learn abstraction language. RGB LED protocols is just one example of what you can do!
150-Mbit WiFi (2,4 GHz, 802.11 b/g/n), 10/100-Mbit Ethernet, Bluetooth Classic + Low Energy, USB 2.0 Full Speed
240 Mhz, 4 MB RAM, 12 MB Flash dedicated to your application, with all files being compressed on the fly. System + IDE use separate dedicated CPU core, RAM and Flash.
  Ready, set, go!
Attach power supply. A USB cable or any power source with 3.3 V or 4.5 to 50 V works
Connect to the WiFi access point "neonious one" (default password on sticker) or connect network cable
Point browser to 192.168.0.1 and log in to enter the IDE
Enter your JavaScript code into the index.js file, upload static files, add external modules, all from the IDE
Click "Run" and / or enable auto-run on power-up for long-term fun!

Programming Experience with the On-Board IDE
The on-board IDE is sophisticated:
Full debugger including breakpoints, step through program, show and edit variables and more
Full code editor with syntax highlighting, auto completion, and more
Full file manager with on-the-fly compression while uploading
Shows syntax errors in realtime
CPU, RAM, flash statistic graphs
Graphical package manager for npm repository
Check out the following video to get an understanding on how direct the programming experience is with the IDE.
PLAY

Web Server As A Starting Point For IoT Project
... in only 5 minutes! Just install the npm modules express and compression through some clicks in the IDE and enter the following code into your index.js file:
You now have your web server serving your static pages up and running, including gzip compression!  
Where to Continue from Here
With addition of motors and sensors a great IoT project can be realized, fusioning both electronics and web development.
As an example, take a look at the table radar in the video below. You can find the code for this example here: https://github.com/neoniousTR/table_radar
PLAY

Connecting To Sensors, Motors And Other Electronics
We give you many pins to connect your electronics, and thanks to the LPC822 switch matrix, you can choose the pins quite freely.
 Apart from the standard protocols, neonious one allows you to implement custom protocols from your JavaScript program using an easy to understand abstraction language. Thanks to the LPC822 state-configured timer custom protocols way up into Mhz range are possible.

This allows you to interface RGB LED protocols and almost anything else you can imagine.  
The software
ECMASCRIPT 6 / TYPESCRIPT 
Use ES 6 modules, let, async/await, classes, typed array, you name it. For larger projects you might even want to use TypeScript, supported seamlessly on neonious one, to get rid of programming errors by introducing static typing.
NODE.JS API 
neonious one provides the Node.JS API which brings its event-driven, non blocking I/O model to the embedded world. You can now write large embedded projects without having to think about realtime operating systems, synchronisation issues and deadlocks.
NPM MODULES 
neonious one allows you to install modules from the largest software library in the world, the npm repository, from within its on-board graphical package manager.
The hardware
CPU, RAM, STORAGE
neonious one is based on the dual-core ESP32 microcontroller, running at 240 Mhz and providing up to 600 MIPS. One core is dedicated to your JavaScript program, run by a fast byte code based engine, and one core is dedicated to everything else, including things such as Wi-Fi, file compression, http or https handling. Your application has access to 4 MB of RAM, plenty to support all JavaScript features. System + IDE run in their own RAM space. 12 MB of data storage dedicated to your application is provided by an Flash chip connected via 4x80 Mhz dedicated SPI lines, giving you plenty of space for most embedded applications, especially thanks to an on-the-fly compression of all files.
POWER CONSUMPTION AND MODES
Even though the highly efficient step-down regulator of neonious one allows you to connect any voltage between 4.5 V and 50 V (bypass if you want to use 3.3 V directly) and provides 1000 mA of current with ease, neonious one only uses around 160-240 mA with WiFi transmitting, and without WiFi just a fraction of that. You can let neonious one save your program to Flash and enter one of the sleep modes, reducing power consumption greatly (deep sleep mode under 50 µA). On the requested event your program gets reactivated and continues where it left. This allows battery powered installations to run for months or even years.
neonious one Technology Preview
Before starting the Kickstarter, we already developed the neonious one Technology Preview. Buy it through our Kickstarter and get it shipped immediately!
Will be shipped immediately!
Modern JavaScript ES 6
Modern IDE with debugger and graphical package manager
GPIO, external packages to test, such as lodash, async, moment, uuid, underscore or rxjs
However...
All software features of the final version will be added in the months to come via software updates
Only 4 MB storage dedicated to user programs, compressed on the fly
Only support for USB as power source
Absolutly all features will then be supported in the final version, which you get for free as soon as it is done, if you buy and pay the Technology Preview!
neonious IoT Electronics Kit
If you are a great JavaScript developer without experience in electronics, this is for you: The all-in-one package to get you a full IoT electronics education.
Includes a 100+ page book, educating you about the basics of electronics, using microcontrollers and interfacing both sensors and motors of any kind. With many examples tailored to the neonious one.
Also includes over 150 large and small pieces, everything to try the examples yourself. We currently plan with:

neonious 1800x RGB-LED Kit  
Allows you to control 1800 ultra-bright RGB-LEDs with JavaScript in 30 FPS.
This sign is made of only 120 RGB-LEDs. Imagine what 1800 can do!
All you need for the brightest, most original Christmas house decoration ever! Or add in a few sensors and have the side walk at your house illuminated while people walk by.
For some cool ideas on what you can do with smooth LED animations, take a look at the installations of Ian Brill, for example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uv3Ohf355os
Kit includes:
neonious one
Shield board to interface 8 WS2812B strips (slide directly on to neonious one, no breadboard necessary)
6 x 5 m high quality WS2812B IP67 RGB-LED strips with 60 LEDs/m = 1800 LEDs
5 V, 500 W power suppy for 110-240 V input
User manual with example code for great animations

neonious Automatic Lawn Mower
Available approximately end of 2019! We will start a new Kickstarter for this!

support.title: neonious 1800x RGB-LED Kit
support.descp:
All your need for the brightest, most original Christmas house decoration ever (as an example). See text left for example video.
Contents:
- neonious one
- shield board to interface 8 WS2812B strips (slide directly on to neonious one, no breadboard necessary)
- 6 x 5m high quality WS2812B IP67 RGB-LED strips with 60 LEDs/m = 1800 LEDs
- a 5V, 500 W power supply for 110-240 V input
- user manual with example code for great animations

updates.update_userinfo: Restart of campaign. Better now than later1
updates.update_content:
Dear backer,
We need to share with you important news:
We are restarting our crowd-funding campaign. We really want your support and would love you to take part in the new campaign at http://www.neonious.com/Funding
We had to do this step because we set the funding goal too high, and we do not want to risk the campaign on this. Well, what shall we say, it is our first crowd-funding campaign and so we were a bit naive.

Hi everyone,
thank you for your support so far! You are definitely helping us getting the feet of the ground. We think we can make the goal, but the work just started.
So still, we need every help we can get:
(1) There are virtually no news of our microcontroller board out there. So we are working on this.

campaign.story:
From the creators of
Engineer "Excuse" Dice  and
Software "Status" Dice
We bring you the latest in the Series:
IT "Issue" Dice
As an IT professional you are way to busy to worry about the minutia of writing reports, and helping the ID 10 T people of the world. 
Let our IT Issue dice do the hard work for you. 
How They Work
Simply roll the 3 19 mm dice.
The Red die gives you the problem. (This may not be necessary as the one complaining may provide this. But you know half the time they don't know what they are talking about.)
The Green die gives you the solution for the problem. Yes, I know that 99% of the time the solution is "turn it off and on again". But you can't write that every time. Your boss will think he can do your work.
The Blue die gives you the Why of what caused the problem.
Write these down on your report and you are good to go!!
Stretch Goals
$2500 - Funded
$20,000 - Free Dice Bag (1 per backer)
$100,000 - ???
Add Ons
We will be using Backerkit to get addresses after the campaign, and you will have an opportunity there to add on more sets, more dice bags and other New Comet Games products such as Engineering Dice and Software Dice.
Shipping
All shipping will be added in when you pledge. And this is EU Friendly.
There will be no shipping charges added later except for add ons during Backerkit.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There is almost no risk at all to this Kickstarter. We have completed the dice designs, we have a supplier ready to start manufacturing right away. 
We have produced 4 other sets of dice, Engineering Excuse Dice, Software Status Dice, Cthulhu Insanity Dice, and Crit-Fumble Dice before this campaign, and are very familiar with the process.
 
New Comet Games has run a dozen successful Kickstarters before this one (between Dark Cult Games and New Comet Games). All have either delivered on time or are currently on schedule to be delivered on time. Several of my Kickstarters have even delivered early.

We look forward to completing this project with the same efficiency and quality that we put forward with all our projects.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We sent one final reminder for Backerkit for you to complete your survey so we can send you your dice.
In a couple days we will be closing down the backerkit.  After that you will need to contact us directly with your address to receive your rewards. 
Have a great holiday,

If you haven't checked out New Comet Games Latest Kickstarter it ends tonight at 9 PM CST. 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/newcometgames/apocalypse-action-dice-the-ultimate-survival-tool

I know a day early, but we wanted to get everyone caught up with where we are at:
US / Canada
If you fall into this group, you should already have your dice in hand. If you do NOT, please contact me right away.
Everyone Else

updates.update_userinfo: IT Issue Dice: Shipping ALMOST Done!!
updates.update_content:
Great news, as the damn finally broke and our diligence paid off.
US & Canada:
If you don't have your dice yet, contact us.
EU

We've been holding off waiting for information that should be coming any day, but we always try to respond when asked, so here is the update as of today.
US/Canada
If you don't have your dice, please contact me.
EU/UK

Woohoo!!
We found out today our shipment to Hong Kong was finally delivered to our distributors. At the point, we have to wait for them to move the dice from the boxes and check them into their system. 
Once that is done, we can upload the orders and they can begin delivery.  This shouldn't take more than a week.

updates.update_userinfo: IT Issue Dice - International Shipping Sept Update
updates.update_content:
EU
The Dice have arrived at our distributor in England!!!  After 3 weeks of sitting in customs, they finally assessed the taxes and delivered the dice. They have been checked in and I'll be sending them the orders today or tomorrow to begin final shipments to you. 
This has been crazy, but so glad we are almost to the end for you backers.
Rest of the World

I'm saying first as we are hoping to have better ones soon. 
This weekend I got sever requests for updates, despite it being less than 2 weeks since the last update.
Unfortunately, Nothing has changed.
US & Canada: If you do not have your dice yet, let us know so we can track them down.

We have been holding off doing an update waiting for good news, but have not received it yet, so we want to catch you up on all that is going on.
EU
Normally with the EU it takes longer than normal to go through customs and this shipment is no different. The package made it to the EU on the 23rd and is still in status "Held in Customs."  As soon as it is out of customs I can upload the orders and get the rewards heading your way.
ROW

campaign.story:
This is my 7th enamel pin set on kickstarter. I made 2 science pin sets last year and I had a lot of fun doing it. So now I'm making a periodic element enamel pin set. 
 I designed these periodic element enamel pins for people to show their love of science. I have set the first goal at one hundred dollars and then each stretch goal at an additional one hundred dollars.
 Specs
The pins are soft enamel with silver plating. All of the pins have 2 clasps on the back. 
The Nerdy and Bacon pins are 1 1/2 inches wide (38.1 mm). The other three pins are 2 inches wide (50.8 mm).  
 Stretch Goals
The pins unlock at every $100.
 Timeline
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
These designs are mock ups, so the finished product may look a little different. I have produced pins for six previous kickstarters and had no problems. I know what to expect, and I'm certain everything will go smoothly. I have everything setup with the manufacturer and I have had pins made by them before.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What is the Firecricket XL?
The Firecricket XL is an Arduino compatible light, sound, and motion controller featuring a 48MHz 32-bit ARM Cortex M0+ microcontroller w/ 32K of RAM, a MicroSD slot so you can store sound effects, bitmaps, and configuration files, a 2W stereo audio amplifier*, and an N-FET w/ flyback diode for driving high current inductive loads, like vibration motors or high power LEDs, and a 5V logic buffer for controlling strings of WS2812 Neopixel LEDs!
Firecricket XL
(* Both channels of the amplifier are connected to the same DAC, so the output is still mono, but two speakers gives you twice the volume!)
What can I do with it?
The Firecricket XL is designed to add light, sound, and motion to replica props from your favorite movies, video games, TV shows, and comics. It's a must have for any cosplayer or anyone who wants to add some extra flair to their Halloween costume or decorations! Use it to add lights and sounds to a toy car or space ship. Or, make a favorite stuffed animal talk and "purr" with a vibration motor. Or, place it in a chest with a limit switch on the lid and a high power LED and have it play the fanfare from the Legend of Zelda whenever it's opened. The only limit is your imagination. The possibilities are endless!
Original Firecricket fully loaded!
How do I program it?
Programming is easy! Like all Arduino compatibles you simply download the Arduino IDE, install the configuration files through the board manager, select the Arduino Zero, plug the Firecricket XL into your PC using a MicroUSB cable, compose your sketch, and hit the upload button in the IDE when you're ready!
A sample sketch that performs all the functions seen in the demo will also be provided so you'll have a solid starting point to build upon!
Programming is easy with the Arduino IDE!
Technical Specs
Microcontroller: Atmel ATSAMD21G18A ARM Cortex M0+
Clock speed: 48 MHz
Operating voltage: 3.3V
I/O pin limits: 3.3V, 3 mA (7mA w/ strong drive enabled)
Digital I/O pins: 14 w/ 12 PWM channels + I2C (SDA/SCL) + UART (RX/TX)
Analog inputs: 5 12-bit ADC channels
Analog outputs: 1 10-bit DAC
Flash (program) memory: 256K
RAM: 32K
Voltage regulator: TLV702, 3.5V - 5.5V input / 3.3V, 300mA output
PCB Dimensions: 2.0" x 1.1" (51 x 28mm)
Amplifier: TPA2012D2, 2W into 4Ω x 2 w/ 5V supply
N-FET + Flyback diode: FDN337N + SS24FL, 30V 2A max
Buffer: SN74LV1T125SC70
Open Source Hardware
The Firecricket XL, like most of the boards I offer, will be open source. This means you'll have access to the Eagle CAD files and schematics, and the ability to modify and reuse the design as you see fit!
Firecricket XL PCB Layout
Pin Functions
Pinout Diagram
Pin A0 / DAC + Volume
Pin A0 is the output for the DAC. Typically you'd just ignore it as it can't be used if you're going to be playing sound effects, but if you'd like to add a volume control to your project, there's a trace on the underside of the board between A0 and the pad in the middle that goes to the amplifier. If you cut that trace, you can connect a potentiometer with the wiper on the center pad, and the ends attached to A0 and GND, and voila, instant volume knob!
Pins A1..A5 / Analog + Digital IO
These pins serve as both analog and digital inputs, or digital outputs. Want to connect a potentiometer to adjust the speed of your animated LED display? These pins are just what the doctor ordered! In my demo you'll noticed I've attached these pins to switches and used them as digital inputs. You could also attach LEDs to them and use them as outputs. The possibilities are endless!
AREF / Analog Reference
You can just ignore this pin. If you ever need this, you'll know!
Pins 0..6 / Digital IO
These pins serve as digital inputs and outputs. That means you can connect LEDs (Don't forget the resistors!), switches, or a multitude of other things!
Pins 0 + 1 are special in that they do double duty as the RX/TX pins if you ever need to do serial communication that doesn't involve debugging, which takes place over the USB port. If you wish to connect a Bluetooth module for example, this is where you'd do so!
SPKRS L + R / Speakers
These pins connect to the built-in TPA2012D2 stereo amplifier. Simply attach a 4 ohm speaker or two, and the amplifier will supply up to 2.1W of audio power per channel. That's twice as loud as the original Firecricket!
(Please note: Both channels of the amplifier are connected to the single DAC, so even though the amp itself is stereo, the output will be mono!)
If you don't have 4 ohm speakers, 8 ohm speakers will work as well, but be only half as loud.
And speaking of loudness... For maximum volume, choose a speaker that is as big as you can fit in your enclosure* and with the highest sensitivity rating and widest frequency range you can get. A larger speaker will reproduce lower frequencies making it seem louder and of course the audio quality will be improved.
(* Within reason. A 2W amplifier probably won't be able to take advantage of a speaker much larger than 4".)
Pins 7..13 / Servos and Relays
These pins are designed with servos and relays in mind. They have VIN on the center pad instead of 3.3V so if you connect a 5V supply you will have that available to power them. And even if you don't have a 5V supply you may find that 3.7V will be sufficient. In my demo for instance, you can see that I am driving a typical servo rated for 4.5-5V from a 3.7V supply when I have the LiPo battery connected.
A word of warning! The IO pins of the Firecricket XL are not 5V tolerant, so if you're going to use these pins as inputs, for example, to connect switches as I have in the demo, make sure you either connect the switch to ground and enable the internal pull up, or do as I did in the demo and connect it to one of the spare 3V3 pads on the board and enable the internal pull down.
SPI Header
These are the pins for the SPI bus, and they connect to the SD card. You can use them to connect other breakout boards which require SPI communication, but this is discouraged as the SPI bus will be in constant use whenever audio is playing. If you want to connect LED drivers or other modules it is suggested you use...
SCL + SDA / I2C Bus
The I2C pins are your best bet for connecting breakouts to the Firecricket XL. These pins have built-in 4.7K pull ups and are conveniently located next to 3V3, GND, and VIN, with three sets of pads available for you to use!
Pin 11B / 5V Logic Buffer for Neopixels
This pin is the output of a logic buffer, connected to pin 11, which converts 3.3V logic to 5V logic.. or whatever VIN happens to be.
I chose pin 11 for a very specific reason: it supports DMA!
What's the big deal about DMA you ask?
DMA enables the processor to drive a strip of Neopixels in the background while other tasks are being performed without interruption in your main loop!
Pin 26N / N-FET + Diode for High Power LEDs and Inductive Loads
Pin 26N is designed for connecting devices like vibration motors, solenoids, or high power LEDs that require more current and voltage than a normal pin can supply.
The two pairs of pads for this pin are tied together with an N-FET on the - side, VIN on the + side, and a flyback diode wired in reverse between them to protect against high voltage spikes when driving inductive loads.
Note: This pin is connected to the red status LED so when you trigger it the LED will also light.
Optional Add-on: The TLC59116 LED Module
The TLC59116 LED module is a constant-current 16 LED driver which works via the I2C bus!
TLC59116 LED Module
When driving LEDs with this module, you won't need to wire resistors to all your LEDs... and you can control the brightness of them in software!
You also won't be limited to 3mA per LED as you would be if you were attempting to drive LEDs directly from the microcontroller's pins. With this module you can supply each LED with a full 20mA, which is especially handy with those dim rectangular LEDs that are often used for ammo counters!
TLC59116 LED Module PCB Layout
And, if you need more than 16 LEDs, you can chain multiple modules together or wire them in parallel. Each module has a set of pads on the bottom which you can bridge with solder to set that module's I2C address!

updates.update_content:
Hey guys!
I'd like to announce the launch of my latest Kickstarter campaign: The Tachyon!
It's a microcontroller based on Microchip's new SAMD51, and it's over 3x as fast as the Neutrino, with 4x the RAM!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/rabidprototypes/tachyon-the-lightning-fast-120mhz-arduino-compatib

Hey guys,
The schematics, Eagle CAD files, and demo code for the Firecricket XL and TLC59116 LED driver are now up on my website, and the boards are now available for purchase there as well!
http://rabidprototypes.com/product/firecricket-xl/
http://rabidprototypes.com/product/tlc59116-led-driver/
Also, I just put all the boards in the mail for those who didn't get their backer survey in before the batch I mailed out on Saturday, so if you were a little late in replying to that, your rewards are now on the way!

Hey guys,
I received the Firecrickets from Macrofab on Thursday, and as you might have guessed from the surveys you received, the Firecrickets and LED modules are now shipping!

Hey guys,
Just wanted to let you know Macrofab completed assembly of the LED modules late last week, but due to a delay on the part of Microchip getting the programmed SAMD21 chips in the mail, Macrofab won't be able to assemble the Firecricket XLs until Thursday at the earliest.
I'll post another update as soon as I have the boards in hand! Or whenever Macrofab finishes assembly. One of the two!

Hey guys,
Just a quick update to let you know I placed the order for the Firecrickets and LED modules yesterday. 
Macrofab estimates manufacturing will be complete on July 17th for both boards, and this time around I'll be shipping them pre-programmed chips, so there won't be any delays associated with programming and assuming they're shipped to me on time, the rewards should begin shipping the following week.

Hey guys,
We did it! Thank you!
I don't have a whole lot to fill this update with, but just to let those new to the whole process know how it works, It'll take two weeks for Kickstarter to transfer the funds to me, and I'll put in the order for the boards at that time. It will then take around a month for Macrofab to manufacture them.

Hey guys,
In order to boost the campaign some more, I've decided to add a stretch goal:
If we reach $5,000 before the end of the campaign, every backer at the $95 level or higher will receive a free Tau with their order... a $15 value!

Hey guys,
I've got a new demo video ready for you, which shows off the board's ability to drive Neopixels, along with the TLC96116 LED driver module!

campaign.story:
Our campaign was a success!
Order a Fipsy FPGA
More details about the Fipsy FPGA are on our website.

Advantages
A very low price point for an introductory FPGA board. Other boards are closer to $60, which is too much of a price barrier for beginners. We are closer to $10.
Designed for rapid prototyping – with a breadboard-compatible design
Only uses free or open source design tools
Supported by numerous examples and guides from a DIY community
FPGAs fundamentally allow for ongoing, and adaptable hardware configurations and control, even once embedded
Unlike other FPGAs, this model does not lose is configuration on reboot
FPGAs, or Field Programmable Gate Arrays allow a designer to program logic circuits at the hardware level, on the fly. This can greatly speed up processing or allow for massively parallel operations. FGPAs are described as a system designers ‘magical black bag’, in that they can be dynamically reconfigured to do any arbitrary type of digital processing.
Sadly, FPGAs are a mysterious topic to most DIY tech-types. Specifically, the barriers to entry are the large learning curves, high costs, and limited open source examples.
Our Fipsy FPGA device and learning material solves this issue head on!
Background
In 2016, our group was shocked to find that no cheap alternatives have existed since 2015 when the DISPY FPGA project was a finalist for 2015 Product of the Year. This project was inactive, so we revived it under the banner ‘Fipsy’. Now we have created numerous instruction guides, sample projects, and a commitment to on-going support and production.
We are building exactly the board we wished we had when we were learning about FPGAs.
The Kickstarter will launch a supply of DIY-friendly FPGA boards. Funding will be reinvested in purchasing additional boards so that cheap FPGAs will be available to all future makers. MoCo Makers supports the learning process with guides published on our website.
The Fipsy Development Timeline
What will we do with the money?
With a the funds from this Kickstarter we will place a first batch order of Fipsy FGPAs. A successful campaign will allow future batches to be ordered as well, meaning we will have a perpetual stock of FPGAs to supply the hobbyist market!
We have a working prototype sponsored by our manufacturer, Allied Component Works.
Revenues will go towards the purchase of further batch orders, so that Makers everywhere can leverage the enormous benefits of FPGAs..
Imagine the possibilities FPGAs can offer:
Learn about FGPA/systems design
I/O Port extender
Glue between different embedded systems
Software-based circuit conﬁguration
Simpliﬁed prototype boards, e.g. to wire up microcontrollers and periphery electronics on the ﬂy
Digital bus controller
PWM controller, e.g. for huge LED panels
Frequency generation
Real-time modification of signal streams, such as HDMI
Create neural network analogues
Learning about FPGAs
All you need is the FGPA device, and you can learn from our guides
Wiki
Chatroom
Set-up guide and instructions
External Learning References
Get the Fipsy device, and you can apply an amazing and powerful electronics tool to your future projects!

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! Here is a status update on the Fipsy FPGA project:
Our manufacturer delivered our full supply of Fipsy devices to us in a timely manner.
With this being the largest Kickstarter that MoCo Makers has done so far, there have been some growing pains that have put us back a few days. Specifically, working out kinks with our shipping supplies and dealing with international shipping for so many orders has been a learning curve.
We got a tour of the Fipsy FPGA being made during a manufacturing run:

Heads up, Backer Surveys are sent for the Fipsy FPGA project. Check your e-mail and fill out this survey so we know where to ship rewards!
Fipsy devices will be hand tested!
Our great manufacturing partner - Allied Component Works has custom crafted a testing rig for easy testing of our device.

We did the thing!
We have had enormous success so far! We are over 600% funded. Stay tuned for updates regarding manufacturing and shipping! We are committed to distributing high quality boards.
Stay in touch with our community via the chatroom, wiki, and forum on mocomakers.com

updates.update_userinfo: Announcing Support for an Arduino Programmer
updates.update_content:
Great news everybody! We now officially support programming the Fipsy using an Arduino, as well as the Raspberry Pi.
Check out your programming options here:
https://www.mocomakers.com/fipsy-fpga/programmers/
The BackHauler is a Windows-only USB cable and programmer that you can try out as well.

updates.update_userinfo: Continued Success and a Focus on Quality
updates.update_content:
Again, we continue to have amazing success on Kickstarter, so thank you!
Here is an update. I was invited to meet with the manufacturer at his facilities in Gaithersburg, Maryland. We discussed some details about getting ready for the upcoming manufacturing run.
Mark, the manufacturer, has placed an initial order on a small number of parts for us. He is getting just enough parts for us to streamline the manufacturing process for this device.

Amazing, we have gone beyond our minimum funding level - in only six day. Fipsy will be a success! People can still place orders for as long as they want.
This validates the idea that large numbers of people are interested in learning about FGPAs.
We want to take this momentum and help develop a community for those new to FPGAs. We want the Learning Annex on mocomakers.com to be a place where users can share projects, examples, and tips. We have a wiki, forum, and chatroom set up for us FGPA folks – sign up today.

project_data.project_name: Fipsy - The FPGA Breakout Board for Beginners

campaign.story:
Every day we encounter computer windows that demand to be read. But these windows have no physical presence. With this project I want these windows to become a physical presence, so that you can write on them and make them pop up everywhere…
…for example in your fridge.
Hi, my name is Harald — I'm bringing handwriting to the digital world…
As typographer I am interested in everything that relates to reading and writing. In other Kickstarter campaigns I created digital typefaces (fonts) based on historic handwriting (Sigmund Freud typeface a letter to your shrink, Albert Einstein font, Martin Luther font) which enable you to write like another person on your computer or mobile device. 
…and the digital world to writing with the hand.
To me this project is a counterbalance to my activities in font making. It is the follow-up project to the Cancel / Save Notepad (also on Kickstarter) where I wanted to create a notepad that accompanies my daily work and activities (which are a lot on screen), the design is inspired by the typography and design of the classic Mac OS user interface:
"Cancel / Save Notepad" kickstarted in 2016/2017. Simple block with 50 sheets of recycled paper (210mm x 148mm)
Why Kickstarter?
It is far more expensive than I thought to produce sticky notes - and that is why I am here on Kickstarter: to get your support to upfront the initial production costs of the work. In return you will receive these exclusive notes first and at a much cheaper price…honestly I am not sure if I am going to sell them later anywhere at all. So this Kickstarter might be the only way to get your hands on the design. If this interests you, pick one of the following rewards:
One • 3€ • receive 1 Cancel / OK Sticky Notes block with 100 sheets. 
Three • 9€ • receive 3 Cancel / OK Sticky Notes blocks. 
Six • 15€ • receive 6 Cancel / OK Sticky Notes blocks.
Office Supply • 25€ • receive 3 Cancel / Save Notepads and 6 Cancel / OK Sticky Notes blocks 
Big Supply • 45€ • receive 6 Cancel / Save Notepads and 10 Cacel / OK Sticky Notes blocks 
Digital & Analog • 50€ • Recieve the Office Supply Reward and a Font of your choice from my library (e.g. Freud, Einstein…)
T-Shirt • 80€ • receive a Cancel / Save / OK Shirt of your choice and content of the Office Supply reward 
OK Fanny Pack • 99€ • receive an OK Fanny Pack and the content of the Big Supply reward
Sticky Notes Specifications
5inch (125mm) width 
3inch (75mm) height 
100 sheets per block 
offset printed in Germany
Research
Windows on a screen have no size reference in real world and can vary from machine to machine. I tried out many different sizes and slightly different positions to match the look and feel of a pop-up-notification with the printed design:
Research process
About Chicago Typography
Chicago was a typeface used throughout the classic Mac OS system in buttons, menus and dialogs up until Mac OS 7.6 (1984 - 1997). The font and most of the other, now iconic imagery was designed by Susan Kare in the 1980’s. 
In an article regarding Macintosh typefaces published 1991 in Electronic Publishing, type designers Charles A. Bigelow and Kris Holmes note:
"Macintosh Chicago is a distinctive design. There are few faces quite like it in traditional typography, even among so-called “display” faces, used for headlines and titling. Because Chicago is deeply integrated into the Macintosh System, used in menus, titles, etc., it is a fundamental part of the look of the Macintosh."
Bigelow and Holmes were contracted to update the Chicago typeface. Personally I prefer the original design by Kare. 
Project Budget
381€ Minimum Printing Costs (250 pcs)
208€ Shipping (based on shipping 140 single rewards)
24€ Packaging Material
30€ Payment Processing Fees & dropped pledges
30€ Kickstarter Fees
0€ 3 days Research / Setting up Kickstarter Site
0€ 2 days Packaging and shipping rewards
673€ Minimum Budget 
Stretchgoal:
2000 pcs. - Recycled paper instead of new paper
The Sticky Notes are produced in high quality offset print in Germany. The product of the forerunner campaign the Cancel / Save Notepad was printed on recycled paper. Unfortunately it is far more expensive to print on recycled paper than on new paper. A higher print-run lowers the costs — if the production run crosses 2000 pieces It would be possible to produce the Cancel / OK Sticky notes on recycled paper and climate neutral. 
Shipping
All rewards ship from Germany in a protective envelop or cardboard box. Shipping varies based on the weight of your reward. Please note that only the higher reward tiers ship with registered mail and are online trackable. If not noted in the reward description items will ship with regular mail that is not trackable — if your shipment is lost, it is lost. If tracking is important to you write me up before the campaign ends and I can add tracking to your shipment which is usually about 7-9€ for international and 2-4€ for national shipments. From the past campaigns I know that in average 1 of 200 shipments get lost with unregistered mail.
Local pickup in my studio in Frankfurt (60311 near Hauptwache) is also possible, you will then receive one extra Cancel / OK Sticky Note block for saving shipping and packaging costs :-)
Schedule
The design is ready, so basically I just need to know how many I should order - which will be clear by the end of the campaign. 
Campaign phase: 60 days
Production phase: After the campaign ends it takes up to two weeks until the funds arrive in my account. Then I can place the order, production time is 2-3 weeks. During that time I can prepare the shipments (order packaging material, print address labels). 
Packaging and Shipping: Once the order arrives (and the prints are as expected) I can start packaging and schedule a pickup for the rewards. 
Delivery: All rewards will be delivered through your national post service (USPS in the US, AUSPOST in Australia, Deutsche Post in Germany and so on…) Depending on your distance to Germany you can expect your reward between: 2-21 days. If your reward includes tracking you will be able to track your reward online.
Contact
You have a question about the project, found a typo, like to share a thought or idea with me? Please contact me through Kickstarter or my website haraldgeisler.com/contact, where you can also find out about the other things that I do.
Thank you,
Kickstarter References:
If you like to see my other typography Kickstarter campaigns check out this list:
This Series:
Cancel / Save Notepad
Fonts: 
Sigmund Freud Typeface • a letter to your shrink 
Albert Einstein font 
Martin Luther font
Typographic Wall Calendar Series: 
Typographic Wall Calendar 2011 
Typographic Wall Calendar 2012 
Typographic Wall Calendar 2013
Typographic Wall Calendar 2014 
Typographic Wall Calendar 2016 
Typographic Postcards: 
Typographic Postcards #14-26
Typographic Postcard #27
Historic Letter Exchange:
Kickstarter Gold: Pen Pals—Einstein & Freud
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every artistic project bears risks. Every project is new and brings up unforeseeable risks and challenges both technically and artistically. I have published eight comparable projects (Cancel/ Save Notepad, Typographic Postcards I + II, Typographic Wall Calendar 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2016) which involved design and production, packaging and shipping of printed goods, so I know about the artistic, logistical and technical pitfalls to avoid. The research and preparation that I already made for this project assures me that I am able of complete this project within the projected timeframe.

Thank you for your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
OUR BACKERS GOT US ACROSS THE FINISH LINE ! NOW WE HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO REACH FOR OUR STRETCH GOALS:  
Latest Addition to the REWARDS!
• ALL DONORS at the $45 level and higher get a digital download of ALL 6 ISSUES! AND a Special Edition DVD of issues 1-4 Motion Comic!
PLUS ANY BACKER OR INCREASED PLEDGE IN THESE LAST 12 HOURS WILL RANK UP AND RECEIVE A CUSTOM ORDERED PATCH - JUST LIKE THE ONES WORN BY THE OMEGA 1 SUPERHERO SQUAD. 
Custom Ordered OMEGA 1 Alpha Courier Alliance Officer Uniform Arm Patches
Over the course of the campaign we've added additional value to the rewards - and added rewards! Here's how all of those break out:
ALL DONORS above the $650 Voice Over Level and above will have the option to do a voice over and get "lead character" IMDB Credit/status as outlined in the $650 level reward. (SOLD OUT)
ALL DONORS above the $400 and higher AUTOMATICALLY will become Associate Producers (and get the IMDB Associate Producer Credit outlined in the $400 level) 
ALL DONORS above the $175 Background Voice Over Level to the $500 Level will have the option to do a voice over and get the IMDB credit/status as outlined in the $175 level reward. 
ALL DONORS at the $45 level and higher get a digital download of ALL 6 ISSUES and the SPECIAL EDITION DVD of issues 1-4 Motion Comic. 
ALL DONORS from the $25 level and higher get a digital download of the Big Chris variant cover.
OMEGA 1 fans have waited long enough...
OMEGA 1 fans have patiently waited for issues 5 & 6 and the completion of the entire first chapter (issues 1-6). Your donations will fund the artwork, printing, and publication of the trade paper back, already written and adapted for artwork, plus a companion section of ancillary content!
At it's core Omega 1 | The Hacker Wars is about the basic human struggles of identity, loyalty, and belonging, told from an empowered female perspective as she faces the challenges to find her true family. All in an action packed, hand drawn, made-for-TV style comicbook.  
But why try to explain, when we can show you...
Thanks to the success of our "RACE TO 50 BACKERS" campaign event last week we have SECURED an award winning director to come on for the motion comic of Issues 5 & 6. [See Rewards for Voice Over and Associate Producer IMdB Credit] 
Two Time Emmy Award Winning Director SIGNED ON to Motion Comics 5 & 6
     2023 saw the advent of World War III, but it was a war of information: the Hacker War. Now, the only way to securely transmit data is hand-delivery via highly skilled couriers. Working for the premiere courier company is OMEGA 1, a genetically enhanced she-weapon who is deadly with a sword, fist fights with firearms and can draw metal to herself. She searches for her lost identity while trying to keep herself and her clients' data in tact. Along with her extraordinarily gifted friends in the company, she must piece together her past to uncover a conspiracy for global control and Aryan genocide. But when she discovers the people responsible for the Hacker War are family, Omega quickly finds herself in ongoing dilemma that juxtaposes her incredible ability to kill and destroy against her heart for love and care.
The first Four Issues
                                                        • • •
Don't Watch This Next Video...Whatever You Do.
OMEGA 1 brings together the talents of Hollywood veteran Mark Edward Lewis, with DC, Boom, and Dark Horse artist Emmanuel Xerx Javier, and dynamite Hollywood actress Alina Andrei. Together, they span franchises like Marvel's Avengers S.T.A.T.I.O.N., Star Trek: New Voyages, Knight Rider, The Orville, Fear the Walking Dead and comics such as Doppleganger, Executive Outcomes, The Rest of Heaven was Blue and Nightbreed.
Mark Edward Lewis has been writing music and directing film and television for nearly 30 years in Hollywood. He's also worked as a post-production supervisor for several beloved sci-fi productions including Blade of Honor, Marvel's Avengers S.T.A.T.I.O.N, Star Trek: New Voyages and others. He also produced and directed the Omega 1 Motion Comic which is now sold all around the world in multiple languages.
Emmanuel Xerx Javier is an independent artist who calls the Philippine islands home. His old-skool meets über modern stylings have been seen in many comic book franchises including those distributed by BOOM!, DC Studios and more. Emmanuel is no stranger to science fiction artwork, and he pencilled and penned all 4 of the Omega 1 comic books including those books original covers.
Cody Reynolds is a super-fan of independent comic book creators. Originally connecting with the Omega 1 franchise at "Amazing Arizona Comic Con" in 2012, he brought is powerful understanding of comic book lore, business and knowledge of what fans want to the Omega 1 team. He also has the distinction of being the only person on the planet with acclaimed artists' Jamie Tyndal and Nei Ruffino's only collaboration tattooed on his leg: Omega 1. Cody is Co-Owner of the Omega 1 comic franchise.
Elle Sonnet is an award winning filmmaker, producer, actress, cosplayer and body builder. She brings her unique talents as a spokesmodel to Omega 1. After connecting with the Omega 1 team in 2012 where she was the host of the show "The Chicly Geek," she went on to produce multiple short films with her convincing cosplays including "Harley Quinn" and "Lady Deadpool."
Rebecca Larken is a long-time member of the science fiction community and has produced all manner of fan film series including Dr. Who, Star Trek: New Voyages, and more. She's a regular and coveted attendee at all comic cons on the Eastern United States, and she brings a powerful understanding of what comic fans are looking for in both multimedia and comic books.
Tom Richard is the original West Coast Omega 1 super fan. He's a regular attendee of all South Western states comic cons, and he's an avid supporter of independently created comic book franchises. Tom is also a photographer and is an expert in creating great imagining of promotional content and graphic art content.
The minimum we need is $18,000. We are confident however, that with this small amount of money, we can make one heck of an impressive finish to an already powerful and loved chapter of OMEGA 1. Your donations will fund the artwork and printing of Issues 5 & 6 (they are already written and adapted for artwork) and their publishing into a trade paper back.
PLEASE, Join The Revolution, choose an amazing reward package, donate, and help us SPREAD the word! Every time you share this campaign with someone, you bring us closer to our goal.
Of course, we could produce this series two comics and one Kickstarter at-a-time, but wouldn’t you rather binge read your favorite sci-fi comic to the tune of 10 comics at a time than wait 6 months for the next gripping episode?
Thanks to you and the success of this campaign we will be able to pitch OMEGA 1 to distributors so that additional chapters can be created and OMEGA 1 can receive an even wider audience. From there, our plan is to bring you as many action packed sci-fi issues of OMEGA 1 as we can!
We truly appreciate your support.
Thank You! We thank you for your time. We thank you for your support. We thank you for your donations, big or small.
We thank you for posting, sharing, emailing, and spreading the word as well. Every time you tweet, blog, post, or tell a friend you are helping us to grow our network and get this campaign and the Omega 1 Saga into the hands and hearts of new fans.  Spreading the word helps us immensely, and is just as important as donating.  
Above all, we hope to thank you by showing you an incredible product in a few months.
-The Omega 1 Team.
ADDITIONS TO THE REWARDS! 
Over the course of the campaign we've added additional value to the rewards - and added rewards! Here's how all of those break out:
ALL DONORS above the $650 Voice Over Level and above will have the option to do a voice over and get "lead character" IMDB Credit/status as outlined in the $650 level reward.
ALL DONORS above the $400 and higher AUTOMATICALLY will become Associate Producers (and get the IMDB Associate Producer Credit outlined in the $400 level)
ALL DONORS above the $175 Background Voice Over Level to the $500 Level will have the option to do a voice over and get the IMDB credit/status as outlined in the $175 level reward.
ALL DONORS at the $45 level and higher get a digital download of ALL 6 ISSUES and the SPECIAL EDITION DVD of issues 1-4 Motion Comic.
ALL DONORS from the $25 level and higher get a digital download of the Big Chris variant cover.
The BIG CHRIS HACK Reward
 For our Special Cover Reward [Backer Level $125 -"THE BIG CHRIS HACK"/$24 Big Chris Variant Poster], world famous "Big Chris" will be doing his amazing artistry to adorn the cover of the Trade Paperback edition, and we'll also get a Trade Paperback cover from our artist Emmanuel Xerx Javier.
PENCILS, INKS, and COLORS Example
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks and challenges when making a comic book and especially a trade paperback. It's not easy making the story, adapting it to a comic book script, getting artwork, color, pencils, lettering and final prints done, getting them printed to a high degree of quality, shipped to all our great donors, and pitching the comic to more distributors. It's A LOT of work, and a lot of things can go wrong. But we want to note is that we've done all of this before. 4 times before. And we'll do it again with this campaign. To be clear, some of these challenges include unforeseen delays, cancellations and rescheduling, delivery issues, equipment issues etc. However, we have a professional and experienced crew who have faced these challenges before. 

This successful campaign will allow us to leverage the completed Omega 1, Chapter 1 into more issues and ultimately a television series. And while there are certainly risks and challenges with getting a television series made, we've successfully created television pilots in the past and delivered what we promised both in rewards and product. 

While we can never predict what the future holds, we are a uniquely skilled team who can tackle whatever comes our way whether it’s a network television deal, or a 40 book comic series. It is our intent to build and hone the skills of this team so that the other television series we will be bringing to you can be done even more efficiently and with even greater value to our donors.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Searching for Skylab
Launch of SL-1
We are a fully independent project, born out of passion, expert knowledge and great interest in sharing knowledge with others. Over the years, the story of Skylab has been relegated to space experts and enthusiasts and our goal is to bring the importance of its missions back to the forefront of public memory.
Writer & Film Director
Dwight Steven-Boniecki - Photo by Robert Enneper
Award-winning author of Live TV from the Moon, Live TV from Orbit, and editor of Skylab 1 & 2: The NASA Mission Reports, Skylab 3: The NASA Mission Reports, and Skylab 4: The NASA Mission Reports, Dwight returns to the art of film making. Armed with an in-depth knowledge of Skylab, he presents the largely forgotten Skylab Program in a detail on film not seen since 1973.
Dwight was born in Sydney, Australia and became an international broadcasting professional. After studying television theory at North Sydney Technical College he moved to San Diego, USA. He returned to Australia and worked in TV before heading back to university where he majored in Psychology. Following his studies he decided that television was where he truly wanted to be and returned to the TV industry. From there he heard about the expansion on satellite TV in Eastern Europe and jumped on a plane to work in Europe: first in Great Britain, and then in Germany - where he still works today as a transmission engineer.
Your Support
From left: Dwight Steven-Boniecki, Owen K. Garriott, David Hitt
Today, we are relying on your help to promote our film of this incredible American achievement and keep it alive in memory of the human race worldwide! Why? Because like experts agree: "It changed the way we live on this planet!"  - Glen Nagle, CSIRO Astronomy and Space Science, Canberra Deep Space Communication Complex
Your donation supports our post-production, our licensing, marketing, and the publicity expenses needed to make the film an undeniable success. We need your help to achieve our absolute bare minimum of £15,000.
America's Forgotten Triumph
Skylab 2 in orbit
Searching for Skylab is the first ever feature-length documentary about this forgotten era of NASA’s space program, which falls under the immediate shadow of the historic Apollo missions.
We have interviewed many people involved in the outstanding Skylab program, including most of the original astronauts who flew the missions.
On every significant Skylab Anniversary the Team of Searching for Skylab made video files available in their entirety for you to enjoy. Our audio requests to JSC have resulted in comprehensive PAO Audio files from each of the 3 missions being made available on the Internet Archive. In many cases these tapes have gone through a process called “baking” in order to bring them to an acceptable level of quality. In the majority of cases these tapes have not been played since 1973/4! With your help, we are looking to make Skylab a household name again.
SL-4 Crew post flight
Indeed, we are well on our way as information about Skylab is now more available to the general public than ever before.
The Post-Production
Editing the movie
No further filming is required, but we need to still complete the post-production.
The colour grading and final edit are the crucial phase in the film-making process. We require the expertise of an experienced colour grader to ease the burden of getting the film ready for its July 2018 launch date at the Spacefest in Arizona.
Acquisition of the 16mm footage
We need to acquire archival NASA footage. We are working from watermarked screeners, but will need to pay the costs of getting the clean footage delivered to us for use in the film, once the rough cut is completed.
Marketing & Promoting of the Film
Filming Bernard Smith, USB & Data Section, Honeysuckle Creek Tracking Station, AU
Being independent, we need a strong and robust marketing and promotion campaign to make sure our potential audience knows about the film and sees/purchases it. We already have a solid social media base, but good publicity will help people learn about Skylab.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest challenge would be not achieving the much needed public support. Nevertheless, we are determined to make this film a success and will continue to do our absolute best with what is available to us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear friends,
We are sending you our best wishes for a Merry Christmas and a very Happy New Year 2020!

Thank you so much for being there with us when we celebrated the highs and the lows of this action packed 2019. We are sure, like us, you are also asking where did the time fly away to?

2020 is set to be a great start to a great new decade. We wish you all good fortune, health and happiness!

All our best, Dwight and Alexandra Steven-Boniecki

Thank you to all those who responded to the DVD reward survey asking for your shipping address. The DVDs are on the way to you. Please allow 2 weeks for them to arrive. Those of you waiting for Blurays, we have started shipping. The second big batch is scheduled to go out tomorrow.
Thank you to everyone for your patience. We are certain the wait will have been worth it. We just reviewed the very first version of the film we did for the Spacefest sneak peek. We've come a long way, and the film is all the better for it!

updates.update_userinfo: Second Batch now on the way
updates.update_content: As you can tell, we have started moving our Blurays and DVDs. The survey for our DVD recipients has just been sent out. Please be advised that those that donated 59 will receive a DVD only. Depending on your address you will either get an NTSC compatoble or PAL compatibale region free disc. Sorry if there was any confusion.

At the beginning of the project our "Holy Grail" was to find the missing audio of Al Shepard reprimanding the SL-4 crew on the open channel. We looked everywhere, to no avail. We accessed private collections, TV reports and JSC PAO tapes. Nothing.
We had resigned ourselves to the fact that this audio went missing, and even suspected it was hidden away. The Bluray and DVD authoring was completed and ready to go.
And then last week, guess what? We found that tape! The "Holy Grail" has been found and has been integrated into the redux version of the film! It has NOT been heard since November 17, 1973!

An update on the bluray creation. The test moeg2 file is rendering. Tomorrow I will create the discreet 5.1 mix and then, providing the test file checks out, we are good to go.
Thank you again for your patience. The rendering took a few days longer than expected due to a hard disk crash which I had to restore from a backup drive. I was swear]ting there for a while, but it is all good.

Dear Kickstarter supporters, an update to the long awaited DVDs and Blurays. The new cut of the film is awaiting additional voice-over files to arrive from Lucas in the USA. Once we have them, they will be integrated into the film.
A superb interview from a resident of Esperance who witnessed the debris flying over his head and impacting was filmed and has also been implemented into the film. A test file of the new audio tracks and new edit of the film will be made and then we will finally send you the discs to those of you who qualified for them.

Hi everyone,
You may, or may not have heard that we're launching "Searching for Skylab" in Australia on the 11th July at the Esperance Museum. We are expecting even bigger crowds than at the U.S. Space and Rocket Center in Huntsville, AL and have interviews scheduled to record the stories of the people from Esperance who remember the night Skylab crushed on their land. We invite you to check out how remote this town is on the map of Australia...

Hello all "Searching for Skylab" backers!
To those of you who qualified for a free download, we've sent out the codes to the Vimeo platform. We hope that after watching the movie you feel proud to seeing your name forever associated with it. 
It is a unique documentary not only because it is entertaining and fun to watch, but because it is at the same time a historical and factual account of the Skylab program. In short, you can base research papers upon it. Something you cannot say about many documentaries,

Dear Kickstarter supporters, because of you we have been able to complete the film and have secured the premiere this coming February 8th at the U.S. Space & Rocket Center!
We will begin arranging for the film you have been long awaiting ASAP after the 8th of February to be available to you.
In the meantime, if you are in the area, we would love to see you there! We will have 5 astronauts participating in the post film panel, with Ed Gibson, Jack Lousma, Sue and Amy Bean being in Huntsville for the event.

campaign.story:
Petpresso helps you take care of your cat
What is Petpresso? 
Petpresso is the first Smart Cat Care Device, designed and created to help you take care of your cat's health and wellness.
Petpresso Features
How does Petpresso work? 
You may think that Petpresso is just another automatic feeder reaching the market:
Petpresso is a Smart Device that uses technology to help you notice when your cat's not feeling well by monitoring his eating and drinking habits.
Petpresso uses a microcontroller and WIFI module that connects to a cloud server and an App from where you can manage your Petpresso device, and monitor your cat.
Petpresso's patented system is unique: it's the only device with weighting sensors under the feeding and drinking plates.
Thanks to these sensors, Petpresso monitors what your cat eats and drinks in real time. Using the feeding and drinking data, Petpresso establishes a statistical model about your cat habits, and provides notifications and alerts when it detects some unusual feeding or drinking behaviour, allowing you to check if there is any problem with your cat's health in time.
Device and App
Petpresso helps you take care of your cat 
Create a regular feeding schedule and regulate food and water intake. 
Monitor how much your cat eats and drinks. 
Monitor how much your cat eats and drinks helps you detect symptoms and take your cat to the vet in time. 
Recommendable for all cats, and a must for cats with health conditions. 
Food is kept fresh thanks to airtight seal, keeping the aroma and consistency.
Petpresso is VET APPROVED! 
We work together with Germán Muñoz, from Kato Feline Clinic, and other feline experts, to help us develop the best equipment and monitor features for your cat's health and wellness!
Cats are very special creatures!
When your cat doesn’t eat or drink for a couple of days, it’s time to go to the vet! But you can’t always be sure of how much food or water she has had a day.
Petpresso helps you manage, control, monitor and track food and water intakes, and most important: Petpresso will send you notifications and alerts if something’s not right so you can take your cat to the vet in time!
Main features
Control and monitor how much your cat eats and drinks per day
Set how frequently to feed  your cat and regulate food intake per day
Set feeding time 
See at a glance if all the food and water is consumed 
Get instant alerts and notifications  
Schedule the number of meals your cat eats per day 
Program the amount per dose or day
Graphic and History will allow you to keep track of your cat and share it with your vet
Get notifications if you are running out of food or water
Get an alert if the unit loses communication
Plug your unit, download the App and once you connected both devices, you can start customizing your Petpresso! 
Everything from Petpresso App!
New design for even better user experience, coming soon!
iOs and Android. 
Meet Puki and Nala, the kitties who inspired Petpresso!
When Javi (inventor and founder) found the two stray kittens and decided to adopt them and take care of them, he knew he needed something else to take care of Puki, since he started gaining a lot of weight. He found many food feeders, but none of them was exactly what he needed to make sure he could really take good care of his kitties! And that's how the idea of Petpresso begun!
PLAY

Our Team
Our Team is 100% devoted catlovers; it is formed by professionals in engineering, advertising, communication, graphic design, veterinary and programming, always eager and willing to give the best of them to meet your expectations. 
The Beta Testers Experience!
For 3 weeks, our beta testers Brittany, Javier, María Jesús, Rocío, Germán, Bárbara and Rubén, had the chance to try be the first ones to test Petpresso. They tested the device and app, and we had awesome useful feed back from them! 
Meet the kitties!
And some of their humans with our team!
Thank you all so much for being part of Petpresso and helping us making it an even better device!
Petpresso Specs
Timeline 
As Featured In
International shipment and taxes
Petpresso offers FREE SHIPPING & HANDLING to USA, European Union and Canada.
We ship also for the rest of the world. However, for the non above mentioned countries we add 40 EUR for shipping, and you will be responsible for any customs fees, duties, VAT, import taxes, special delivery fees administered by your government, and brokerage fees. These are not included in the cost of shipping or handling of your order, and we are unable to estimate those fees for you.
Privacy police
Our privacy policy is available at http://www.pet-presso.com/en/legal-policy/ 
Warranty
We offer 2 year limited warranty with a simple return policy should there be a manufacturing defect. 
Friendly Customer Support 24/7 If you have questions, our customer support team is here to help. You can reach us at info@pet-presso.com

campaign.story:
We are a team based in Hong Kong, we present you the Easy-Peelzy flexible 3D printing platform creator team.
To stick, or not to stick: that is the question.
As a matter of fact we makers want both: when the printer is printing, we wish the print sticks to platform as firm as possible to ensure a 100% success rate; but when the printer finishes its job, now it's your time to pry that part from the print bed ---- see the problem here?
Makers more or less have some kind of battle wounds during their campaign with their beloved 3D printers, yes, the scar you are looking at right now my friend, is what I’m talking about.
But... is it even possible to have a build platform that both sticks AND not?
Lift, and peel off the print
With our patent pending Easy-Peelzy platform design, you can in fact get the best of both worlds. The Easy-Peelzy platform includes two parts: the base layer that sticks to your existing 3D printer bed, and a top layer that snaps to the base layer. The top layer has a polymer sticker on the top so all your PLA and PLA-based (e.g. Laybrick, Laywood, Metal-fill, etc.) filaments would bond really well onto it.
Easy to cut
Don't worry if your printer is a Delta-type 3D printer that uses round print bed, or maybe your printer comes with an odd dimension, because Easy-Peelzy is soft enough so that it can be cut to shape easily with ordinary scissors - no special process or tools required.
After printing you can simply grab a corner or edge of Easy-Peelzy, and lift it up, then hold the platform in both hand and bend it upward a bit, your print should pop right off. In rare case the print refuses to just pop off, just peel the soft and flexible platform off the print, don’t worry about damaging the platform, it is made out of durable materials.
Removal process
Removal process 2 (super thin 3D print -- 1 layer on edge, 3 layers in center)
Bottom of a removed print (left) and print surface (right)
In case something covering big portion of print surface might make it difficult to grab the top layer corners (imagine a huge 20x20x20cm cube occupying entire plate), so in stead of prying the corners you can grab the print it self and give it a horizontal twist, this can break the magnetic alignment between top and bottom layer, weakening and eventually reverse the attraction force between the two, ensuring a successful, easy removal.
Please notice that the Easy-Peelzy platform utilizes magnetic materials to hold top and bottom layers together, and this material can only operate in low heat (below 80 degrees Celsius or 176 degrees Fahrenheit), otherwise the material would demagnetize thus cannot hold those two parts together. Also because of the platform’s magnetic nature, it may interfere with inductive sensor type bed leveling mechanism.
Backer reward packages are Easy-Peelzy platform sets (a set includes 1 top layer and 1 bottom layer) of 8x8 inches, or approximately 20x20 cm.
Easy-Peelzy platform set: 8x8 inches or 20x20 cm
Update #1:
Backer reward now includes Easy-Peelzy XL platform sets! They are aboit 30x30 cm or 12x12 inches! They are perfect for for your large format FDM printer, such as CR-10.
Easy-Peelzy XL platform set: 12x12 inches or 30x30 cm

updates.update_content:
We are excited to announce: we've just launched our web store!
Now both Easy-Peelzy and Easy-Peelzy XL are available for purchase: http://www.3d-easy.xyz
Easy-Peelzy and its XL model will be on launch sale at Kickstarter unit price for a short period of time to celebrate our successful Kickstarter campaign. If you would like to grab some extra plates, or if your friend missed the campaign, this is the perfect chance!

Good news, everyone!
Easy-Peelzy plates are ready for shipping! We've got bubble mailers to cushion the bumps along the road, and they are much easier to open. The mailers did take two extra days to arrive, but now since we've finished packing, we are starting to ship out today!
The plates should take 7-14 days on its way, so if you've selected an early-bird reward tier, your reward should be arriving at doorstep no later than mid-June.

We've just received the funds of our campaign!(Minus Kickstarter and Stripe fees, of course)
For next step we'll be putting this money into good use, purchasing materials, expanding our production scale, and try to ship out the promised rewards to our backers as soon as possible! So please stay tuned for more upcoming updates.
Also please remember to finish your backer survey should you haven't done it already, so that we can ship out your rewards!

Our campaign is a success! Thanks to all the support from our amazing backers! 
After reviewing all backer rewards and recieving funds from Kickstarter, we'll be collecting shipping addresses through Reward survey system. So please remember to reply that email!
Please note if you have made custom pledges (for example pledged a double amount for 3 Easy-Peelzy XL and would like revieve 6 XLs), send us a message to us for your custom reward preference and we'll register it.

Hooray!
Our funding goal is fulfilled on the 8th day of campaign! Thanks to the support of our dearest backers!
Reaching set goal is not the end of the campaign, we are currently working on setting a series of stretch goals to further facilitate our backer reward tiers. Also we are working on more detailed images and a FAQ to present our product in a higher resolution.

We are proud to announce that the big brother of Easy-Peelzy is now available as backer rewards! 
The Easy-Peelzy XL is 30x30cm or 12x12 inches in size, it's a perfect fit for your large format printers!
